Summary: I would give 2 stars but the view is amazing. From the start booking is confusing. Even the front desk understands this. Is it a bait & switch or honest mistake? There is a Pacific Edge Beachfront listing (which I booked on) and a regular Pacific Edge Hotel. I wanted a beach front room and upon checking in received a really tacky room above the office that didn't even look like ANY pic on the site. The front desk understood how confusing this is and gave me the last room in the beach-front area. Still, this room is in dire need of TLC and attention to detail. The beds are comfy and so are the pillows. That is where it stops. Floors and furnishings are coming apart and the stark white paint with tiny bath is very Motel 6. Website pics maybe showed some newer rooms? We could hear
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and I decided to take a little anniversary staycation in Laguna Beach and the Pacific Edge truly went above and beyond to make our stay such a memorable one!  Kris at the front desk went out of her way to get us early check in and the hotel manager Ryan even sent us some complimentary champagne! Such a cute gesture! Highly recommend this quaint and inviting hotel for your next stay in Laguna! We‚Äôll be back for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review and feedback, ittoksd!  We're so glad you enjoyed your anniversary staycation and we will definitely pass your kind words along to Kris and Ryan! Summary: Booked a 2 bedroom suite for 4 nights. We couldn't believe what we saw and the room smelled bad. We went back to the receptionist and explained the situation and she moved us to another room which was not a suite but it was okay cause my niece wasn't arriving till the next day. The only nice thing about the room she put us in was that it had an ocean view, I felt bad for her cause she really tried her best to accommodate us. The room wasn't much better. The room didn't have the normal things, hotels provide. Like a clock, full size mirror, comfortable chair (had a small hard plastic chair).and a small heater on the wall and it was very cold that night, so we decided to leave the next day. Mind you it was $339.01 and that was with a discount. Oh and parking $39.00.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our puppy loved the balcony overlooking the beach, just a few steps to get our toes into the sand. The pool was warm and protected from the wind, hot tub steaming, and we were walking distance from everything we could possibly want to do! Parking is valet only so we did some hunting around to find street parking, which was not easy at all. Front desk handled a busy check-in beautifully. Would definitely stay here again.
Room tip: It was absolutely worth paying extra to have a beachfront balcony. This is not a fancy place, but...
Manager Response: none

Summary: Photos online did not match the room we stayed in. Finishes were worn out. Cheaply furnished. Broken blinds, side table falling off the wall. Summary Heading: I would never use this hotel again

The front desk manager is the one who said in my face ( all rooms are the same. No need to pick a specific one). I asked to talk to a manager and gave my phone number to the front desk staff, and no one bothered calling me. So disappointed.

We had small children with us, all I can say is thank you Chuck for your kindness, and for making sure that my kids and I arrived safe, had a good nights rest I will never forget how personable yet professional you were. Summary: Directions & signage to room across the alley from the main building were terrible.  Directions to the ice machine were non-existent.  Calling it a hotel is a bit of a stretch.  More of a glorified motel.  $38 per day for valet parking, and they wanted $50 charge for early check-in.  The porch lights from adjacent building lit up my room all night.  No blackout shades.  Other better choices are available in laguna beach

The manager at the end was being very rude to my boyfriend, he had to ask him to come to the room and look at the lock of the room, there was no way to enter the rooms because the keys wouldn't work. The last day we stayed in the lobby for 4 hours before they gave us the 4th room. While waiting there people came in with the same issues, and other issues. This hotel is going through renovations sometime next year, they don't tell anyone this, they accept new people there, take their money, and put them in a bad room.   The only person that was really nice is Keona, excellent customer service, and was so

Summary: If you want an ocean front room by the water, at a reasonable rate, this is your perfect destination.  Manny the hotel manager is kind, professional, and does anything to make the stay comfortable. For an additional fee, Eireen afforded me an oceanfront room upgrade right above the surf. Please understand I checked in on Jan. 2, 2023, typically, after Christmas in the USA, this month in many hotels, is low season & hotel rates are reduced. The room I stayed in doubles in cost by April. The hotel is old, and not in a ‚Äúcharming‚Äù way. However, my room had updated faux wood floor. Updated big screen tv. However it was not a smart tv, so if you watch Netflix, or YouTube channels, those must be watched on personal devices. The wifi is adequate. The dated wall heaters don‚Äôt  work;
Manager Response: Thanks for the review, Becky. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us at Pacific Edge Hotel. The staff was nice for the most part and was good at suggesting eating places. But, in all I would never go back... Location was the only positive and there are plenty of better places to stay.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the pictures
Summary: One star for the bed which is all they really invested in to upgrade this place from a serious dive beach motel. Probably had more charm when it was pretending less.  1. We actually could not get our own room key because their machine was broken, so we essentially could never leave our room without calling someone from the front desk to come and let us back in when the door locked behind us.  2. Our room had a constant smell of sewage which created a gag reflex. Impossible to enjoy oneself.  3. The shower which was the only form of bathing was broken believe it or not!  4. After all of this, they couldn't see the incredible lapses in the hospitality ethic and their customer service was unable to handle what should've been a complete comp situation. They offered us $50 off!

Summary Heading: My fav place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: It‚Äôs rare to get an oceanfront room that‚Äôs available and affordable - I felt blessed. While it was not one of their renovated rooms in the other building it definitely felt renovated - also closer to the ocean ! Room was gloriously spacious with a terrific plush king bed. The best part was the deck which was literally ON THE OCEAN. This is the only hotel in Laguna that I am aware of that you can get a room on the ocean. The service is so generously kind and readily available. Even though the Pacific Edge is a remodeled motel it definitely feels luxe due to the room size, view, amenities, service. Location is fab as everything you need is within walking distance. It was a perfect pit stop to get some major computer work done. This is the my dedicated place to stay in Laguna Beach
Manager Response: Thanks for the glowing rating, roset640!  We're delighted you had such a fantastic experience at Pacific Edge Hotel and that our staff took such good care of you! Summary: Traveling from nyc with my girlfriend I decided to book a trip to Laguna beach to escape the fringed winter. As I entered the pacific edge I was met with nice decor surrounding the  lobby and had a nice conversation with Ryan who just happens to be from nyc as well .. he was very helpful and I would like to thank him for helping me with the upgrade to the beautiful oceanfront room the hotel Offers. Already planning a following trip to the west coast and might stay with you guys again.

Now for the staff, they are extremely professional and competent. But more than that they are kind, considerate and always ready and eager to help. Best of all they do it with a smile on their face. I‚Äôm grateful to have found the Pacific Edge and have been coming here for over a decade. Thanks Manny and staff.

It‚Äôs basically a place appropriate for teenaged to young adult partying not a comfortable nights stay.   Staff was ok - most were very friendly surprisingly.  It‚Äôs smelly, lopsided and old and they charge a $25 fee for ‚Äúamenities‚Äù to which there were none.  Look elsewhere - drive from Irvine do what you can to stay far away from this hotel.

Well, the rooms right over the lobby are not only next to PCH ( very loud ), but have not been updated for many years. The room feel like a dungeon with narrow walls. Barely enough room to get by the bed. No room to put your suitcases anywhere except on the credenza. The bathroom was barely the size of a closet with not enough light for the mirror. The air conditioner was coming out of the wall and was very noisy. The table and chairs looked like

My friend and I went for a nice walk on the beach and about 2:00 came back and our room was not still ready. 10 minutes later they said the room is ready, gave us the key and we went to our room. We found that there is a peekaboo view of the water and there is no balcony. The balcony

Summary: Stayed in  Bahia building, room 14. It was like we were in a time machine! The cabinets in kitchen and bathroom were from the 60s, popcorn ceiling, old broken furniture, and no smart tv‚Äôs.  The view was nothing like it was portrayed on the website. Couldn‚Äôt see the beautiful view unless you were standing up. AC unit was filthy and broken, remote control in bedroom needed batteries. No TV or climate control in the 2nd bedroom for the kids, just an old fashion box fan. It was generally very noisy. Drunk neighbors woke us at 3am and the hotel leaf blower, the traffic and garbage trucks in the alley between our room and the beach, started at 7am every morning. No nice greeting, no one at front of hotel to park car or help with bags and no hope your stay was nice on the way out.

Summary: So happy we chose the Pacific Edge Hotel for our last minute weekend stay in Laguna Beach!  The ocean front king room with a private balcony was amazing.  Spacious, modern and full of light and sounds of the crashing waves below!  The Hotel is in a great location - a short walk to the restaurants and shops of downtown Laguna.   Our favorite part of the Hotel is the Deck beachfront bar and restaurant - clearly the place to be in Laguna for sunset!   And popular with the Housewives of Orange County - which was filming there during our stay.  Martin and the other staff did a great job of taking care of us from check in to check out.  Everyone was friendly and made our short stay special!

The staff is wonderful specially the lady working in our building Graciela she was so adorable and careful our room was impeccable, the front desk manager Ryan Betances went the extra mile to help with concierge services from dinner recommendations to tips to visit around. Summary: Very misleading and total rip off. The rooms look nothing like the ones online and this is the dirtiest hotel room I‚Äôve ever stayed in. There are stains on the floors, stains on the walls, stains on the curtains, stains on the lamps, towels, and bed sheets. Two lightbulbs don‚Äôt work and gnats flying everywhere. I went to the lobby to say our room looks nothing like the pictures online and they did nothing about it. Never staying here again!

Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: First time I‚Äôve ever stayed in a hotel that you need to book housekeeping 24 hours in advance! Shameful for a supposedly 3 star hotel. Room had a musty smell. Looked very dated and needs investment, the bathroom had mould and the tv was small and old and the cables were untidily hanging from it. Bed had huge dip in the middle, making us roll together leading to very poor sleep. This was exacerbated by the complete lack of sound proofing between rooms. There was a dividing door to our neighbours room, meaning we could hear EVERYTHING - especially their 2 dogs barking through the night. We were charged $25 per night for facilities we never used. We were charged $38 for 7 nights valet parking even though we checked our car out after 4. We‚Äôve stayed in a few places in Laguna and
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, Cmt347.  We regret that your time with us was less than ideal as providing our guests with a pleasant experience is very important to us. We hold ourselves to a higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our management team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: My friends from out of the country and I were passing through Laguna and wanted to find a spot to stay the night that was centrally located and beachfront, so we ended up choosing Pacific Edge Hotel.  We did not intend to spend a lot of time at the hotel, so figured this was a good choice.  When I was a child, the hotel was known as "Vacation Village" and I had fond memories there.  While the first room we were placed in was terrible and not up to our standards, it was the service and the way Ryan handled our disappointment that was wonderful and resulted in a nice stay.  He had a great attitude, understood what we were looking for, and immediately placed us in a nice room that was very close to the water and renovated.  I appreciated his responsiveness, great attitude, and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us, joellek447. Summary: Hot tub ice cold. Hole in bathroom door with hair sticking out of it. Pictures looked nothing like our room. Mold on the sink. The electric lock to the door to pool was exposed and the other pools didn‚Äôt even work. The sheets were dirty. Rust on the curtains

Summary: We were disappointed overall.  The elevator was broken and it was so busy it was either get our luggage up on our own or wait for quite a while.  We had high hopes for the "beach service" which turned out to be a person that would take your beach chair and set it in the sand for you. You could not have food or drinks from the restaurant/bar on the beach and if you left your beach chair for more than 20 minutes, you may lose your spot so we had to chance it or take turns going to get something to eat. The pool and "hot tub" were DISGUSTING.  There were feathers, bugs, and trash floating in both. Even after using the net to clean it ourselves, we discovered a milky, foamy substance floating in the hot tub, which was barely even warm. The ice machine was broken. The room was clean

Summary: If I could I would give it a minus 10. They charged us 650.00 for an oceanfront room that was completely horrible and filthy. The bathroom in the restaurant had cock roaches running all around!! It is a complete hole to stay at! Run from here!!!

Ryan Betances greeted us and made us feel welcomed, safe and like we were VIP! The view from our room wow! And going to sleep with the sound of the ocean was just incredible. The entire staff from front desk to valet to cleaning service, were friendly and polite .Thank you again Ryan for being so kind and thank you Pacific Edge, we will be back!

Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We booked two nights here and I thought it would be a great place to stay and celebrate a big event birthday. So expensive for what we got and so disappointed.  We stayed in Bahia 14, fronts onto the highway and backs onto an alley. Room was old and tired. It looks like an old (and I mean old) apartment that has been painted.  Cupboards are probably from the 60s, futon type couches in the living room were broken - couldn't sit up straight and couldn't lay down flat.  This was just a pig with lipstick.  The view from the balcony towards the ocean was nice (if you overlooked the alley) and the linens were good.  Other than that, nothing good to say about this place.  I would never stay here again. No response necessary from management, they say the same thing to all the guests who
Manager Response: none

Manager Response: Thanks for the glowing rating, soldbysmuk!  We're delighted you had such a fantastic experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! Summary Heading: Excellent Service and Upgrade for The McGee Family
Summary: Irene was a very good salesperson and customer service representative. She sold us on a room upgrade as well as valet parking for our entire stay, which we NEVER do. Both upgrades were well worth it and she made sure we had a very nice and easily accessible room, which we loved. The valet parking was well worth it and all the drivers were very polite, helpful, and fast. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was clean and had a beautiful view, with fast access to the beach and downtown.  Five stars for Irene and the entire stay!!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review, McGeeRoadTripping! Summary: Total rip. The room we paid for was not what was advertised and in fact was ghetto. We were promised a premium ocean view king bed. What we got was a side view of the beach, a very short king, a dirty, tired, old, broken closet, slippery bath tub/shower room. The kitchen was nicely updated. There are many fine hotels in Laguna Beach. This is not one of them. The valets were excellent though.

Don‚Äôt come for the room but for the ocean front magical experience  Initially I had an issue with with another room but Kiora from front desk was very helpful to accommodate us in this room despite the night manager said they don‚Äôt have anything else. The extra care from Kiora was much appreciated.   The next day manager Ryan was also very helpful.

He even had Nathan show us our options that fit our expectations even further by giving us a tour to each room. We ended up like both options and when we were waiting at the front desk, another couple was wanting to change there room as well.   Ryan really does tries his best to make everyone happy and my best friend and I decided to give our first option to another guest so that they were happy as well.   We all know,

Summary Heading: Most romantic place on one of the most beautiful beaches in Southern California!
Summary: My husband and I celebrated a milestone birthday at the Pacific Edge Hotel! Our stay couldn't have been more romantic and perfect! The hotel is situated on one of the best beaches in California and in the heart of Laguna Beach. We loved our ocean view king bedroom which was very spacious, clean, and beautifully furnished. We couldn't get over the incredible view of the ocean from the spacious balcony. The hotel houses two separate restaurants which we enjoyed for dinner and breakfast. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. The hotel is one of the few hotels which offers private chase lounges and umbrellas in the sand. Most of all, the staff was attentive and warm, making our stay a wonderful memory. I would like to especially thank one staff member, Mark Johnson,
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review, AngelikaBelle!  It's wonderful you and your husband had an outstanding time at Pacific Edge Hotel ! We're thrilled you enjoyed our beautiful decor and lovely ambiance. It's great you felt so welcome and relaxed during your time with us and that you were able to take advantage of our hotel's convenient location and stellar views! It's nice to see you thought your accommodations were properly refreshed and very spacious. We'll also make sure to share your kind words with Mark and our food and beverage team. We have some truly wonderful individuals that work here. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! Summary Heading: A great place to stay at.
Summary: If you ever visit Laguna Beach, I highly recommend this place. Came in for a weekend getaway and really enjoyed the ocean front rooms next to the water. Service was also top notch. If you are ever here, ask for Ryan. He'll take good care of you.
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review!  We're delighted to hear that you had an amazing experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! The staff was attentive and helpful. One gentleman named  Mark Johnston, even provided suggestions for activities and walks. Thank you for the wonderful stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely review, Martin!  It's excellent your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so fantastic! We're thrilled our team took such wonderful care of you. We can't wait until your next visit so we can share another amazing experience with you, Martin! Have a splendid day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: This is a complex of new and old buildings.  The new ones are in all the pictures.  My room, which I payed extra for, was in the old.  Incredibly bad.  I paid for an ocean front room and got an ocean view.  It was between two buildings about a block from the beach.  The door lock didn't work.  Repair men tried twice to fix it but said it needed replacement.  It was difficult to get into the room for me but if you pushed the door hard enough it opened up for anyone.  The room was dank and dark.  I've stayed in many hotels, more than 1000 nights in my career and this was likely the worst I have ever been in.  I changed rooms with a significant uncharge and got on to the beach.  Beware.  One of the repairmen told me there hadn't been an update to the building I was in in 22 years.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We were disappointed to learn that the quality and condition of our hotel did not meet your expectations. Please be assured that this is not the standard that we aspire to and we will share your concerns with the appropriate members of our team so that we may improve moving forward.  We hope you allow us the chance to share a more positive experience with you soon.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Pacific Edge Hotel was exactly what I needed for my solo getaway!  I checked in last minute, after a VERY, failed Air BNB nearby, and was so happy to find a beautiful, calm, clean room. Ryan was beyond gracious with local recommendations, and an extra little welcome for my birthday. I was checked in on daily, and made to feel completely at home! I will definitely stay here again!!  The views were gorgeous, and beach access was easy, with chairs and an umbrella ready for me, anytime. The on property bar and restaurant were great as well. Thank you for saving my trip!!

Summary Heading: What happened to our favorite staycation hotel?

We decided that we could not let our 20th wedding anniversary get away from us. We were unable to travel an extended time, so we decided to go to our old faithful‚Ä¶Pacific Edge. We booked 2 nights at $800/night for a Oceanfront room.  I mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and they said they will put a note on our account. We are all about ‚Äúyou get what you pay for‚Äù and we are well aware of the high cost to stay coastal in California. We were thoroughly disappointed this

Summary: Absolutely DO NOT stay at this hotel.  The rooms look nothing like what they post on their website.  The whole place seems very run down.  While the staff was friendly, it did not make up for the dark and dated rooms.  I had to switch rooms because the first one was so bad (literally a small dingy white room right off a busy hallway with almost no sunlight) to a room that a tiny bit nicer, however the bathrooms have motion sensor lights. That means that every time you take a shower, you have to get out of the shower to turn the lights back on‚Ä¶.it was a horrible stay!!  Please take my advice and book elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Would Reccomend asking for a better room before
Summary: Me and my boyfriend expected to be in a room that the pictures show‚Ä¶ pictures are definitely deceiving because our room didn‚Äôt have that ocean view, nor was it clean at all. The carpets and furniture look so old. the shower was not enjoyable. bathroom was tiny. no ice no waters, place looks like a motel. Smells so bad outside, pool isnt clean. for that amount of money we expected much more. The location is the only thing that I would say was great. Coffee machine didnt work. it was honestly gross there. It is unfair they put photos up of the room when it doesnt look like that

Summary: As far as customer service goes, our experience was a 10/10. There was a room mixup at check-in, and we were able to request cancellation of reserved room and book the correct room onsite at counter. However, this resulted in the billing of 1x incorrect booking and 1x overcharged re-booking, and someone accidentally checked us into both rooms (though we only stayed in re-booked room).  Kiora - not responsible for mix ups - was able to work with their supervisor and refund both bookings to charge us the actual, correct amount for room we stayed in - they were super helpful and made this correction totally seamless at check out.   The room itself (2 bedroom junior suite) was a bit sandy upon arrival and in need of TLC/updates, though it was very large and comfortably accommodated
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review, gretamartin!  We're delighted your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so wonderful! Summary: The newly updated room was beautiful, and the views were stunning. The balcony was very large and direct access to the beach. Our A/C did not work, but the direct oceanfront, location,  and updated room were worth it.

Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: The room was so dirty our feet got black from the carpet, the curtain covers the AC and was dirty I am sure there is black mold because we both got sinus issues after staying. The furniture was chipped and dirty, the lamp had so much dust when you touched it the dust wiped off on your finger. The beach access was nice, but there were no towels, or anything if you didn't get there at 7 am. and they still charge a resort fee for nothing, the staff tried to make up for the best they could, but it's bad don't stay here if you value your health. The Drift had great food, but better to stay somewhere else and eat there.

Summary: We were very disappointed in our suite. The kitchenette is very, very dated. The oven was sticky. The room is not designed to accommodate a relaxing beach experience. There is only one tiny nightstand for a king sized bed. My phone, water, and other things one would typically have on a nightstand had to be placed on the floor. The bathroom was not cleaned well and there were no face cloths. I had to call and request those. There are cracks and stains in the paint. The TV had a big crack in it. The property is dated and needs a very deep cleaning. The only pleasant thing was the ocean view, but aside from that, this experience was very unpleasant. I have stayed at many Holiday Inn Express and Comfort Suites that were cleaner and more comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We come here every summer and my daughter and I met the sweetest lady, Andrea. She went above and beyond to help us get what we needed. She is so nice, kind, and thoughtful; and we looked forward to her smile and hugs every day!  Over the years of visiting here you come across the sweetest housekeepers and maintenance employees. I hope to see her when we come back next summer! Thanks Andrea!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and for your continuous patronage, Stephoshag!  We're delighted to hear that you had such an outstanding experience with our team at Pacific Edge Hotel! Thanks for sharing and have a terrific day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Excellent stay. We stayed in two rooms during our 6 night stay. The beds are comfortable, the views spectacular and the location 10 out of 10.   We did upgrade the room for a premium because our first room was too dated for us. The front desk was super accommodating and so was reservations when we had to change our dates from the original reservation.   We will be back. Had a great time. Thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review, Glober40!  We're delighted to hear that you had a wonderful stay at Pacific Edge Hotel. Summary Heading: Excellent Location, Nice Rooms, Friendly and helpful staff - On Beach!!
Summary: I have stayed at other properties in Laguna Beach and I chose this one due to its location. Not just on the beach, but closer to Festival of Arts as we had tickets to Pageant of the Masters. Arrival is a little tricky but not unusual for a beach town - you must pull into a one-way parking lot that can be busy with arrivals. The staff makes quick work of it - just be aware that parking is tight and people are standing around - unaware in typical vacation mode.  Once in your room - assuming you were able to get an ocean view - you will love the view. Once on the beach, there are complimentary chairs, umbrellas and towels.  The location I spoke about earlier - you are a short walk to all the shops and excellent restaurants.  If you are looking for a fancy hotel - go to the Surf and
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review!  It's wonderful you enjoyed your stay at Pacific Edge Hotel so much! We strive for excellence so we're thrilled you appreciated not only our team and location, but also our gorgeous views and accommodations! Your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We can't wait to host you again soon for another amazing experience!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Staff was nice but room was not great
Summary: There seem to be some renovated buildings and some not renovated.  We were in the not renovated, which included stained carpet, a tiny bathroom, and a shower head that broke off, preventing anyone from taking a shower.  The only solution was for us to move rooms each night of our stay and we decided to leave this hotel after one night.  The staff was kind and gracious but there is only so much you can do with a run down building.  While we booked a double room, there really was not room for four people with luggage comfortably.  Also, you must be able to take stairs to your room as not all rooms are accessible by elevator.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, 25julies.  We're disappointed that your stay with us was less than ideal. It's unfortunate you've noticed a decline in the quality of our accommodations. We care about the comfort of our guests so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We hope for the opportunity to host you again soon for a more positive experience.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Depending on the building your room is in, you might end up in "Motel 6". In the buildings along PCH the bathroom is extremely small with smelly shower curtain, and people walking by look into your room so you can not even open the curtain. Parts of the property are dirty and in need of a total remodel. For $500+/night I expected much more. I do not recommend this hotel
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your feedback, lmn854.  We are disappointed to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. We strive to provide every guest with excellent experience and we regret that your stay with us did not reflect this. Please know that your concerns have been passed on to our management team so they can be properly addressed.  We hope to have the pleasure of hosting you again soon so we can show you the quality experience we know that we are capable of sharing with our guests.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We have been visiting Pacific Edge since before it was the Pacific Edge. We have always loved the hotel. We met Carlos when he first started working there. He is by far your greatest employee that we have had contact with. He always goes above and beyond. He actually really cares about the guest. I will go as far as to say Carlos makes the ridiculous nightly rate a little easier to handle. The other two beach attendants that we had the pleasure of meeting were Cesar and David S.  Both of them were taking lessons from Carlos and are doing a great job. They all worked great together and they really work hard.    My family and I
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, Kenny K.  We're happy you had a pleasant stay with us and enjoyed interacting with our amazing team. We will ensure that they receive your compliments! Another room didn‚Äôt have functioning air conditioning. It was also very difficult to get them to clean the rooms or provide any maintenance in a timely manner.  After all of the issues, very little was done to adjust or make any significant accommodation or rate reduction. After complaining to the manager multiple times to reduce the rates, he never followed up with me. My family have stayed at this hotel multiple times and visit Laguna every year, but we

Summary Heading: Second time here and will be back again!
Summary: This is the second time my husband and I have come to visit Pacific Edge, and we loved it both times! Amazing location, near downtown, and the Driftwood kitchen! The Bahia room isn‚Äôt ocean front but it was very spacious, clean and in a great location. The guys at the beach were helpful in getting our chairs setup. They have plenty of chairs and umbrellas, but umbrellas get taken quicker. They also have boogie boards and beach toys you can ask for. Make sure you get there early to get what you need. Will be back again!

Summary Heading: Deceiving, terrible valet and customer service
Summary: This was one of the worst experiences.  I booked a last minute trip thru Priceline where I would get one of 3 resorts.  This was actually the one I wanted (so I thought).    First, it looks like a beach front resort.  Pictures are deceiving.  They have 2 buildings that are oceanfront and one off of PCH with the back side of it looking out at a noisy, dirty, disgusting alley.  Since it was an express booking thru Priceline, guess what building I got?  Priceline tells you before check out that there is a resort fee.  What Priceline didn't tell me was that there was mandatory valet for $38.  That was a cost at the hotel.  When I told the girl at the desk that Priceline didn't state that fee, she basically said "well, it's like that at all the resorts here".  This was a lie.  I

Two restaurants on the property if you want to stay close. It‚Äôs a bit pricey for the room quality but the view and beach access is what I‚Äôm here for. If you want to sit in a nice room go to the Ritz and pay 1500 a night this is not your place. I will continue to return every year as long as it here and they don‚Äôt go over board with the cost. The room had a nice wood laminate floors which we really liked- All the staff were friendly- from the check in, housekeeping and valet. And the young men who put our chairs and umbrellas up were amazing!  We ate twice at the Deck and the food was so good- and the sunsets were beautiful!   The only negatives was the 38 dollars a night to park and my sisters car did end up with door dings- we still aren't sure how they were getting in and out of the cars because they park so close to each other.  My only

Summary: Stayed here for a business trip as a group and we were completely shocked by the condition of the rooms that many of us stayed in. My room looked like a tired dorm room with no closet doors, no extra deadbolt lock on the door, missing window locks, very sloppy paint job, crooked light fixtures, and dirty floors. Others in my group experienced getting room assignments and walking in on guests already occupying rooms, boarded up windows, and uncleanliness. Very disappointed as this was supposed to be a treat to our sales team and it was far from our expectations.

Summary Heading: When you first see it your thinking, ‚ÄúMaybe it‚Äôs not as bad as it seems‚Äù. Until they tell you how to get to your room.
Summary: Not sure where to begin, It‚Äôs like they took a bunch of apartments or motel 6‚Äôs and called it the pacific edge hotel. It need to be pushed over the edge of the cliff. To get to your rooms you will need the map and hiking boots. You may get lost and end up in someone‚Äôs home if your not paying attention. First, go down the elevator, take the send right, down the stairs, across the alley, go 1 block, make a right, down 3 flights of stairs.l and your room is on the right.. ‚Äúcan you say that again‚Äù‚Ä¶ this is not for the elderly or disabled. The room was outdated and it didn‚Äôt smell clean. I wouldn‚Äôt want my dog to stay there. The location is unbelievable and the views are amazing from the balcony as long as you don‚Äôt mind the pigeons setting in the balcony connected to yours.

Bit this is NOT a resort!  Hahahaha! Not even CLOSE.   However,  it was clean, comfy, fabulous location,  staff was lovely,  bed was very comfortable with a huge array of pillows from fat to skinny,  hard to soft (perfect GoldiLocks Selection) lol.  We were after something

When we arrived at 5pm our room was not ready and the manager was very rude about it. When we got to the room it was about as run down as my apartment in college for 600 a night. Carpets were ripped place smelled and decor was very old and dated. The only redeeming quality of this hotel is the location - it‚Äôs on a great beach in laguna. I did not read the reviews before coming here but if I did it would have been an easy pass for me. Don‚Äôt make the same mistake I did!

The rooms are equipped with full beds, which was a total disappointment. Ordered room service and it never came, ordered a roll in bed 5 times and took 4 hours to receive it. Asked for 5 towels and they brought 2. For over $1100 for three nights you expect a nicer hotel, it‚Äôs more like a motel 6.

However, once in the room, the tired air conditioner, shabby privacy glass, cushion less deck chairs, and floors that could at least use an area rug make you feel you e been had. $500/night for this? Summary Heading: Great location on the beach close to downtown with friendly staff
Summary: My family and I have been coming to the Pacific Edge Hotel for decades. It has a great location on the beach just blocks from downtown Laguna Beach. It has two swimming pools plus hot tub to enjoy in addition to the beach. Beach towels, chairs and umbrellas are provided by the hotel which is a nice amenity. The Deck and Driftwood Kitchen restaurants are conveniently located next to the hotel, and the Orange Inn is a great cafe for a healthy breakfast or lunch just a half block away. The Pacific Edge staff is wonderful. Ryan and Victoria at the front desk took great care of us during our stay and went out of their way to help with any needs or questions which we really appreciated. The housekeeping staff was friendly and professional and also enhanced our stay. We look forward to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this wonderful review, Eric!  We're so glad to hear that you had a positive stay with us at Pacific Edge Hotel! We're also thrilled that you loved our central location so much! We'd love to see you again soon so we can share an even more enjoyable experience with you.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Our trip to laguna was gorgeous and the hotel staff and amenities were extra helpful. Irene at the front made our experience unique and accommodated our needs.  We will back to enjoy the views, food and location at Pacific edge hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for the perfect rating, yonsesaka-ruiz!  We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon at Pacific Edge Hotel.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Excellent Day at Pacific Edge Hotel!
Summary: We booked the Gorjana bungalow for a company event. From beginning to end the experience was amazing. Caroline Bosak did an excellent job of going over the bungalow and event options with me. Once booked, Kerry Smoody was always available and at my complete disposal for all my questions. Her response time was incredible. They were both extremely professional and responsive.  On the day of the event Chris was our personal server. Wow! He seemed to always appear at the right time. We did not have to look for him at all. Our prearranged orders came on time starting with breakfast through lunch. He made suggestions and was just super friendly. Honestly, he made the day. Chris‚Äô shift ended during our stay and Ryan took over. Ryan was just as incredible even for the short amount of
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, Theresa W!  We're so glad we could host you for your company event at Pacific Edge Hotel, and we will definitely pass your kind words along to Caroline Bosak, Kerry Smoody, your personal servers Chris and Ryan, as well as our Director of Engineering Mark Johnson! It's great to hear you enjoyed our prime location in Laguna Beach, delicious food and refreshing drinks, and our top-notch service. We will address your concerns regarding the morning valet and we hope we can host you again for an even better experience!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Do not be fooled by the photos online
Summary: Do not be fooled by the online photos. Our "suite" overlooked an alley and had not been updated in 30 years. The bathrooms were disgusting, the kitchen area was gross and the carpet appeared to have a blood stain on it (could have been wine...). All of this, and we paid MORE to get the suite. The pool was not well maintained, the public areas were dirty, and there really was a total lack of customer service. The only highlight is the beach set-up with the towels and the umbrellas. But save your money - there are AirBNBs all around there that are much less expensive and much much nicer (wish we had known that earlier - and not just taken the recommendation of the wedding invite). I have stayed at motels that were cleaner and nicer. There was nothing "redone" or renovated about
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  We regret that you experience with us was anything less than perfect and that the condition of our hotel did not meet your expectations. Please be assured that this is not the standard that we aspire to so we've shared your concerns with the appropriate members of our team so that we may improve moving forward.  We hope to have a chance to host you again so we may share a more positive experience that our guests are accustomed to.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We had a great time at this beautiful seaside hotel, Norbert was very helpful getting us checked in and directing us to a nearby restaurant Driftwood kitchen and The Deck.  The location is excellent walking distance to downtown with a gorgeous beach steps away.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review, hansewert!  We're so glad you enjoyed your lovely weekend getaway at our prime beachfront location in Laguna Beach! We would love to host you again sometime soon and we will pass your kind words along to Norbert!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Amazing Time at Pacific Edge Hotel
Summary: We had the best experience staying by the beach with our family! They have amazing food, customer service and everything is easy walking distance to anything you need. Can‚Äôt beat the view and beach!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review.  We're thrilled you enjoyed the fantastic views from Pacific Edge Hotel's prime location. We agree that we have the best placement in the city and we love sharing it with our treasured guests. We can't wait to see you again soon for another amazing experience!  Have a fantastic day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Booked a standard room and it looked nothing like the pictures on the website. The room was super small on the lower level next to valet and was not at all 4 star worthy 1-2 at most. The rooms need to be updated or the pictures on the website need to reflect what you are actually receiving. Would not recommended for the quality/price of the rooms.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback.  We regret to hear that you were unsatisfied with your room. We aim to provide our guests with the most comfortable experience possible, and we'd love to help you reserve a room that better suits your individual needs of space and comfort in the future.  We hope for the opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Excellent location, premium service, inviting staff.
Summary: Stayed 4 nights in a premier ocean view room.  Very spacious room wIth kitchenette, and great view with excellent service and staff.  Special shout out to Ryan at the front desk that made sure everything was seamless and perfect.  My original plan was 3 nights, but it was so comfortable I extended my stay and Ryan made it possible without having to change rooms.  The Pacific Edge exceeded my expectations.  Literally steps from the beach and the peaceful sound of the crashing waves made the already extremely comfortable bed and pillows 4 of the best night sleep I‚Äôve had in recent memory.  The location is excellent and in walking distance of everything you need in Laguna.  My wife and I will be back and looking forward to that oceanfront room in the newly renovated building.
Manager Response: Thanks for the amazing review, Phil!  It's wonderful you enjoyed your time at Pacific Edge Hotel so much! We're delighted you appreciate our convenient location with its stunning views. We love sharing our breathtaking sights with our guests and your praise lets us know we're succeeding! We look forward to hosting you again soon for another excellent experience!  Have a lovely day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We had an amazing view from our room and the staff was super friendly. Victoria left a Happy Anniversary note and wine in the room which made our stay even more special. Definitely recommend and looking forward to staying again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review, Jackie!  It's outstanding you had such a wonderful experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! We're delighted you enjoyed our excellent location with its stunning and breathtaking views. That's what we like to see! We can't wait to see you again soon so we can share those beautiful scenes with you once more!  Have a fantastic day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Our first time at the Pacific Edge and it was amazing! We upgraded to a 2 room suite and had the best customer service!
Summary: Our first time at the Pacific Edge and it was amazing! We upgraded to a 2 room suite and had the best customer service by Irene at check in and also from the rest of the staff at the restaurant and room service. HIGHLY recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review, tcaitlin391!  We're pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us here at Pacific Edge Hotel. It's wonderful to know that our amazing staff and comfortable accommodations left a lasting impression. We truly appreciate you taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We look forward to hosting you again the next time you're in town!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: ROOM Is Not as Advertised. Deceptive Website Zero Stars DO NOT STAY HERE!
Summary: In looking at the website, the Pacific Edge looked like a comfortable hotel located on the beach.  The room on the website showed a room with chairs and a nice kitchen area.  What I received was a hotel room that had one bedroom, no chair to sit on (no chair to sit at on desk, had to sit on the bed, not ideal), no working TV, and no working shower.  Since I had purchased this on Groupon, I decided to tough it out and stay for the night.  The stairs were broken and had yellow hazard tape on them.   It was only after I came in from a night walk on the beach, that my shower did not work. I had to wash off in the sink.  As a female traveling solo, it should be advertised that this is a MOTEL, not a HOTEL. The room had no security other than a latch, it opened directly to the
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback.  It's unfortunate your stay in our hotel didn't exceed your expectations. We regret you weren't entirely satisfied with our furnishings and accommodations. We care deeply about the happiness and satisfaction of our guests so we'll address all of your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: This is our second spring break at Pacific Edge.  This trip we used CC points and somehow the reservation for our suite got messed up.  It was our fault and we were horribly embarrassed, but Chase worked several different angles to find us a solution for 5 with two joined rooms.  We were so stressed, but he kept working our problem even with a constant line of 5-10 people who HAD their reservations.  At the end he made it work, got the supervisor on board, and they did not gouge us over the situation or make us feel worse.     Customer service saved our vacation!
Manager Response: Thank you for the fantastic review!  We're delighted to hear that you had an amazing experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! We appreciate your compliments regarding our hard-working team and their abilities to accommodate you. We will make sure to pass on your kind words to Chase! We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience!  Thank you again for sharing your review. Have a lovely day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: This hotel has all the charm of old dorm room. We actually found that we didn't want to spend any time in our hotel room. We had a "suite" but the living area was so depressing and uninviting that we avoided it. We paid $650 / night. Never again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We were disappointed to learn that the condition of our hotel did not meet your expectations. Please be assured that this is not the standard that we aspire to and we will share your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward.  We hope you allow us the chance to share a more positive experience with you soon.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We spent two nights here on business and I must say that everything was excellent. For a nominal fee, Ryan at the front desk was kind to upgrade our room for a beachside suite, which has excellent furnishing and felt super comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others having a business trip. Amazing value for money and the staff are friendly and helpful. Thanks Ryan,
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely review, Ernie!  It's excellent your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so fantastic! We're thrilled our team took such wonderful care of you. We can't wait until your next visit so we can share another amazing experience with you, Ernie! Have a splendid day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: This hotel is not worth the money, it is a motel 6 on the ocean.   If you want to spend a lot on a room because of the closeness to the ocean then go ahead but this is not a luxury hotel.    The actual room is nothing like the pictures which is very deceiving.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, Deany.  We're disappointed that your stay with us was less than ideal. It's unfortunate you've noticed a decline in the quality of our accommodations. We care about the comfort of our guests so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We hope for the opportunity to host you again soon for a more positive experience.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Amazing Location for a Business Meeting
Summary: We rented the Gorjana Cabana as recommended by Caroline in Sales.  The oceanfront cabana with outdoor seating (with umbrella) available was set up with a meeting table, flip board and flat screen with HDMI cables to project a computer.  The size was perfect for 7 people and had a bathroom and kitchenette stocked with water and soft drinks.  Breakfast was served first thing in the morning and we enjoyed it outside. The cabana also included beach towels and chairs which we used for a short break after lunch.  Meals were delicious and service was prompt.  We had a productive, fun and relaxing day which ended with sunset cocktails.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review!  We're thrilled you enjoyed your time at Pacific Edge Hotel! It's wonderful our team could take such great care of you and that we could help you and your team for the business meeting. We strive for excellence and your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience! Have an amazing day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: If I could give 0 stars I would
Summary: This place is nothing short of tragic. Do not trust any of the images you see on their website, it couldn't be further from the truth. We had 6 nights booked for a business trip... we stayed for 1 night but would've left immediately if we could've found somewhere to go at short notice.   The staff were all very nonchalant when we asked about the difference between images online + the reality of the place.   Didn't feel safe or clean at all, for the price it's an absolute con.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Our hotel has recently completed a photo shoot that shows more pictures of the exterior of our building as well as updated interior shots. We truly apologize that you did not feel safe, as we truly strive to make each and every guest feel as comfortable and happy as possible.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: This rip-off hotel got no shame and conscience by keeping heavy advertising what a high end hotel it is in the beautiful Laguna Beach,  CA,  I hate to see more people get deceived! We stayed there right after New Year and were given a room that was so bad that you thought you're in a inner city slum: The brown carpet was full of dirty stains,  and very used up and old. The furniture were cheap-quality and with chipped and damaged marks. The bath tube was with different spots of repainted and thicker white paints. You wouldn't believe this--all the pictures hanged on the walls were identical, and one side of night stand had a missing lamp. And the TV was ancient and too small to be viewed well from the bed back panel. I took photos. This property spoiled our vacation in the

We hope to have a chance to host you again so we may share a more positive experience that our guests are accustomed to.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Jayce at the front desk was so incredible. We checked in and he was awesome and then this morning I asked to change rooms, because our neighbors were super loud. No problem! Plus he said they would move our luggage for us! He was a pleasure to talk to and knows a lot about the property.
Manager Response: Thank you for the amazing review!  We're so happy to hear you had an enjoyable experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! Thanks again for sharing your kind review. We look forward to hosting you again soon for another incredible experience!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Ryan and Suzanne were amazing help!!
Summary: I had an amazing stay at the pacific edge hotel. Ryan and Suzanne were great help and made the entire last minute spontaneous overnight trip seamless. Definitely will be staying at this property again!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review, gabriellemI5448OI!  We're thrilled your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so amazing! They are very important members of our team!  We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience! Have a beautiful day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: I've been coming to this hotel multiple times a year since 2012 and always loved it. Now I've spent 2 days, 45 minutes, and 3 phone calls just trying to change my reservation for next week and no one can seem to get it done.  The first person couldn't find my reservation. The second hung up on me.  The third said there would be a fee but I have documents which clearly state there is not a fee to change if it's 72 hours or more before arrival. Which it is. Stay away. Used to be wonderful but now the service is absolutely horrendous. I can't imagine they're going to fix it and I'll probably end up in court because no one there can do their job.
Manager Response: We appreciate you sharing your feedback, sariz2020.  We are disappointed to hear that your stay with us did not meet your expectations. We strive to provide every guest with an excellent experience and we regret that your stay with us did not reflect this. We're are happy that we could further connect with you and resolve the issues you experienced. If there is anything else you need, please let us know.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: Cannot beat the location or the gorgeous views this hotel provides
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel for the first time in about 10 years.  It has been completely remodeled and looks amazing! There was an issue with our room, and  the manager took care of it and was able to find us another room quickly.   The new tower which faces the ocean is gorgeous -- our room was right near steps to the beach.  Pacific Edge is connected to two restaurants on site.  They provide room service.  We opted for this one night when it was raining and blowing outside.  Wish we could have dined at The Deck which has an amazing outside patio.  Rooms are decorated nicely, comfy beds, and are very clean.  Parking available on site for a fee (valet only).   Great location -- easy walk into core of downtown for dining, sightseeing or shopping.     Overall, an amazing
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing with us, Carolyn!  We're delighted to hear you had a fantastic time with us at Pacific Edge Hotel. We're glad to know that you appreciated our inviting atmosphere and central location, as well as our refreshed and comfortable accommodations. We strive to provide our guests with the most enjoyable time possible, so this is wonderful to hear! It sounds like you had a relaxing time with us.  Please come visit us again in the near future for another lovely experience!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: My husband and I booked this hotel on a Sunday following a particularly stressful work week. I work nights and was hoping to get away, sleep in, and relax. We knew we wanted a view, which we definitely got, and to enjoy the sound of the ocean - however the hotel had other plans. We were startled awake at 8am (my husband claims it started earlier, that it just took me a while to wake up from it) to loud banging and scraping right outside our room. The hotel scheduled construction and maintenance first thing in the morning and did not bother to give us a courtesy notice when we were checking in, had we known we would‚Äôve chosen a different room or opted for a different hotel altogether. We assumed it was an all day project and they needed to start first thing, but as we were
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We did have painting taking place that morning, and we deeply apologize for the inconvenience. We will be looking into the hot water issue, as we have not been notified of this previously. In regards to your billing challenge, please contact us directly so that we may look into this for you.  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Had 10 associates fly in for a two-day meeting.  This is the 4th or 5th time I've conducted a small meeting at the Pacific Edge.  As has been the case with each visit, the service was outstanding and the location is superb!  I work with Caroline in sales and Kerry in event coordinating.  Both provided excellent service, helping create a better than expected event.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this wonderful review, 268geoffk!  We're thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay at Pacific Edge Hotel so much! We strive for excellence so we're pleased to hear you appreciated not only our wonderful team, but also our prime location! Your praise lets us know we're succeeding!  We can't wait to host you again for yet another unforgettable visit! Have a lovely day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: I‚Äôve had an amazing week at the Pacific Edge!  I hosted a small team meeting in the Bungalows and stayed in a beautiful ocean front room. The location is fantastic!  Right on the beach and walking distance to downtown Laguna Beach restaurants, shops, and art galleries. I stayed in an ocean view room in the premier building. 10/10!  I took a peek at other ocean front rooms and they were also very nice.  Rooms without a view still provide a fantastic location if you‚Äôre not planning to be in the room much.   Jay (Sales) was fantastic to work with as I was planning the business portion of my stay. Norbert provided excellent check-in support and identifying a great room for my stay. My checkout with Jayce was super smooth as he helped me clarify the business and personal expenses.
Manager Response: Thanks for the excellent review, CaliKatieP!  We're delighted your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so outstanding as providing our guests with an excellent experience is very important to us. It's fantastic you appreciated our prime location and beautiful views as well as our helpful staff. That's what we like to see! We look forward to hosting you again soon for another fantastic experience.  Have an amazing day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: Absolutely love this place and all of the staff. Gorgeous ocean front rooms and perfect location! Jayce is always so pleasant and accommodating, really makes sure you are happy and taken care of!   This is one of my go-to places! Walk to downtown, visit the art galleries, kayak or paddle board in the bay, surf the waves, and romantic walks on one of the most beautiful beaches in the world!   Thank you Jayce for always making sure our stay is perfect in every way!
Manager Response: Thanks for the wonderful review!  It's excellent you had such a fantastic experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! We care deeply about the happiness and satisfaction of our guests and your praise for our team lets us know we're doing our job. Jayce is a valued member of our team so it's no surprise that they took such great care of you. That's what we like to see!  We look forward to sharing another splendid experience with you soon!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: I've been staying here for over 20 years.  I love the rooms, clean, ocean view and refrigerator.  The hotel is in the middle of Laguna Beach easy walk to Starbucks, cafe's and shopping.  The beach is the reason we go back several times a year.  What a treat to live in California!  Great service and valet parking.  The value is better than most beach towns.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review!  It's wonderful you enjoyed your stay at Pacific Edge Hotel so much! Your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We can't wait to host you again soon for another amazing experience!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: We just recently took a last minute staycation here. We had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is in perfect location, by the beach, close to restaurants and shops. Everything is in walking distance. We would definitely recommend it to other travelers.
Manager Response: Thank you for the glowing review!  We're delighted to hear that you had a wonderful stay at Pacific Edge Hotel. We'd love to host you again in the future so we can share another excellent experience with you.  We appreciate you for taking the time to leave your feedback!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: I had such a great time with my buddies! The hotel is right at the beach and I had a room with an amazing ocean view. The Bar is right at the edge of the beach and buzzing all day long. Parking was tight, but you do not need a car because you are in the middle of downtown, walking distance from all the restaurants, bars. Highly recommend the place if you are looking to have a great SOCAL experience!
Manager Response: Thanks for the wonderful review, Tamas!  We're delighted your time at Pacific Edge Hotel was so fantastic! We care deeply about the happiness of our guests so it's amazing we could share our beautiful views with you. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We look forward to seeing you again soon for another fantastic experience! Have a lovely day!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary Heading: WOW! Best location right at the beach
Summary: This was one of my best staycations since COVID started. I wanted to get away from the weekly grind with my wife and picked this hotel for the weekend. We only realized upon arrival how close everything is. In the heart of Laguna beach close to all the restaurants and bars. The first night we ate in the Hotels' restaurant which was awesome. It has this amazing view and is located right at the beach. The burger is to die for! Rooms are just the right size and you cannot say enough about the view! Highly recommended!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this wonderful review!  We're thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay at Pacific Edge Hotel so much! We strive for excellence so we're pleased to hear you appreciated not only our location and on-site restaurant, but also our gorgeous views, delicious food, and rooms! Summary Heading: For The Best SoCal Vacation, Pacific Edge Has It!
Summary: Without question, this was the best hotel experience I‚Äôve had in Southern!  From the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out, everything was smooth.    The hotel guest services are experts when it comes to recommendations.  Even better, if you‚Äôre needing a last minute dinner res somewhere, they‚Äôll personally call to help facilitate that res.  Bottomline, weather you‚Äôre a couple or a family, I can‚Äôt recommend Pacific Edge enough! Your kind words let us know we're doing our job!  We're already looking forward to your next visit so we can share another amazing experience with you soon!  Jeroen Quint Managing Director

Summary: So disappointed in the accommodations that I want to make sure that future travelers don't make the same mistake that we did.  The rooms were like a motel, and old and stained so much so that we were just amazed and frightened.  Add onto that the fact that it's not beachfront, you have to walk alongside other buildings and I think even through a garage to get to a strip of beach that they manage.  Needless to say I wouldn't go back there - plenty of other options in Laguna Beach.

Summary Heading: Amazing views and location but very outdated!
Summary: I was excited to arrive and check in.  Once I left the office I realized this hotel was not what I expected.  The routes to rooms are confusing and very run down.  Luckily I was in the closes building.  The first thing I noticed was the pool and hot tub.  It had a ton of kids but that's ok, I would never have gone in anyway.  It was stuck in a small space, looked run down and rough.  I'm talking sketchy MOTEL kind of rough.  Then I see that doors all  open to the outside, no carpeted hallway leading to inside doors.  My specific door(504) looked like it had been kicked in a time or two.  When I opened the door I was pleasantly surprised at my mostly up to date room.  I also had a balcony and AMAZING view of sand and beach.  Had the room not had that, I would have left
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best ocean view for the price. Very beachy. Not your Ritz. We love it!  Friendly service and good food on The Deck. Excellent location. Walk to everything. So nice that they setup chairs and umbrellas on the beach for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing!  We're delighted to hear that you had a wonderful experience at Pacific Edge Hotel! We're so glad you enjoyed our gorgeous ocean views, affordable rates, attentive service, delicious food, location, and beach accommodations. I believe his intention was to take a hostage to avoid the police because he claimed to be police. Security refused to secure the area. He tried to force his way in next door. Do not stay here. I was hurt and security was no where to be found. He refused to give our money back, and is making fun of us. He is
Manager Response: none

Summary: I treated myself to an oceanfront room for 3 nights with the intention of taking a break and having perspective shift by the sea. My room did not disppoint. The Valet Raymond was heartfelt and genuine. These are the staff people I interacted with- friendly and professional. The valet guys on dayshift when I checked out on Friday seemed interested in hustling for tips and not really caring otherwise- they were just fine to let me load my car myself without offering to lend a hand. I found great street

The rooms are a little dated and could do with a refurbishment but it‚Äôs been a pandemic where tourism and hospitality have been hit hard. Survival is just a priority right now.  All the staff were super helpful & friendly and it‚Äôs a great location in the centre of Laguna. It was our second stay in this hotel and we‚Äôll go back when visiting again.

Summary: My room was infested with mould to the point where we couldn‚Äôt stay there. You are right off the PCH and literally on the beach. You‚Äôre paying for that. Because of that, they don‚Äôt really care that this isn‚Äôt perfect. Nor should you. The rooms are sparse. The bathrooms clean. That‚Äôs it. The place also has a great restaurant that‚Äôs an awesome place for drinks and food literally on the beach. That is a reason to stay here‚Ä¶.you‚Äôll love it. nothing is cheap in Laguna. The beauty is why. Unless you want a resort that is at a multiple of price, or stay at the Holiday Inn, which is actually pretty decent, just remember you‚Äôre at a motel and enjoy the beach.

Fake hardwood laminate peeling up in spots. Paint chipping on walls. Mirror in bathroom had chipped away in spots. Pieces of wood screwed into the wall make up the ‚Äúnightstands‚Äù in the guest bedroom. Most of the furniture was damaged, scuffed,& not up-kept well. Front desk staff were rude and unfriendly. Only one person up front when I checked in. It seemed like they had better things to do. Acted like they didn‚Äôt want to be there. I booked a 2 bed suite

This hotel buts up against another property that is owned by the same company.  You can use either pool-but the pools are in poor condition.  There are no lounge chairs at the other pool.

Local supermarket is in walking distance so that we can make our own meals. You can pay for parking (kind of pricey) or get lucky and park in metered parking in front of the hotel that has 4hr limits at a time but doesn't charge from 7pm to 8am for overnight parking.

We have stayed here before but I guess I seemed to forget a few things - and from the moment we arrived I was underwhelmed.    The one saving grace is that I contacted Flowers by the Sea and they brought in a wonderful display that was the highlight of the room.  Expectations need to be lowered here.  It is a motel.  I am not saying this as being spoiled or entitled - $700 was a big hit for us and only get a way in almost 2 years.    Room (surf tower):  From the start - Key lock

This is the definition of the Southern California surf hotel.  Surf, body board, skim board and soak in the sun during the day and walk to amazing restaurants at night. Summary Heading: Great place for what it is...
Summary: My wife and I live in the desert, so trips to the beach are a regular thing for us. This is about our 10th visit to Pacific Edge. We come every spring and fall (to avoid peak season prices) PE is an older hotel right next to the beach. We always get an Ocean Front room. We leave our balcony door open and sleep with the sound of the crashing of the waves only 40-50ft from our door. We usually come for 4-5 days at a time. The rooms are modest... but comfortable. The staff is always friendly and seem eager to serve.  This is not a luxury beach resort, so... if you are expecting 5 star accommodations... you will be disappointed. They are nice, basic rooms. Bathrooms are small and basic. Sink, toilet, tub/shower. The ocean front rooms have a mini fridge and a coffee maker. We usually

Summary: Such potential - Such a Rip Off  We paid 5 Star prices for what should have been a stellar birthday weekend overlooking the sand in Laguna Beach.   The room had fingernails on the floor and sand on the bed, and the bathroom seemed to have been spot cleaned only.   Walls are very thin, which interrupted our sleep when our drunk neighbors fought and the police responded. Loud and noisy experience each of the two nights - with little concern from management when we reported each of the items above...or tried to - as the phones don‚Äôt work!  There are truly wonderful 5-Star resorts in Laguna - but this is very far from that designation, and should be avoided.   BUYER BEWARE - Read Yelp Reviews!!!  Such a disappointing waste of money - try Surf & Sand instead.

The location in town is ideal and an easy to

Summary: Totally unethical. My wife stayed here. Originally confirmed by Expedia for $230/night; desk clerk offered her an ocean view upgrade for $300/night (including parking) when she checked in. I called her that night to inform her the hotel had pre-charged our credit card over $1,300. When she checked the next morning, the clerk and manager informed her the rate was $600/night. She immediately canceled her second night, which Expedia confirmed. The hotel would not give her a receipt when she checked out, and I have tried numerous times to reach them, but they won't return phone calls or emails. Our credit card was charged $600. AVOID THIS PLACE!!!

No one offered to help with luggage. The bed was comfortable and the location is good but that is the Only good part. My friend actually used  the word ‚Äúdump‚Äù to describe the Pacific Edge. For the $600 a night this cost  I‚Äôd spend the extra $$ for a better hotel,   and a quiet cool good nights sleep.  I‚Äôm a travel advisor and won‚Äôt be sending my clients here.

Wyland gallery, an amazing nail salon, and a fantastic french bakery within a few blocks as well. The water pressure in the shower is the best we‚Äôve had on our California adventure, a huge bonus. The A/C is loud, but works great. The TV is small, but has a bajillion free movies to watch via a generous cable subscription. WiFi is free and genuinely high speed.

Its laid back, good food and like going to Hawaii without jumping on an airplane.  I also want to point out, we just stayed there and had some difficulty. The layout we had in our suite the first time had a bedroom with two twin beds, but they changed it to a single queen. Although I understand why, I feel they should've put two double/full beds instead, as my two boys like to sleep separately. So we had to rent a cot bed for the trip.   Second, the kitchen was outdated. Although it was working, the counterspace and appliances, as well as some of the furniture were cheap and outdated. Also, I do not like the wood floors in the

The hotel was under maintenance (changing out carpet), which was a good idea because it smelled a little "doggy" and when you pay $400 for a room, you don't want it to smell.
