As our initial room had a funny smell and to be honest looked like it was furnished in the 1960's they showed is another one in the same block which wasn't
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  We're happy you had a pleasant experience with us! ¬†It's lovely you enjoyed our¬†Ocean Front room¬†so much. ¬†That view is incredible and you're right about being a million dollar view. Come see us again on your next holiday.   We look forward to hosting you again soon for an even better experience! ¬†Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I picked this hotel from the website pictures and have to say I was really disappointed with our 6 night stay!  By Australian standards it's a three star motel ... and I can't believe I paid AU$455 a night to stay there!!!  We were in Laguna Beach for a conference so luckily we didn't have to spend much time at the motel.  The room was old, the carpet was frayed, the edges of the bath and shower were rusty and the air conditioner was old and noisy - kept waking me up all night as it stopped and started.  There was no comfortable chair or couch to sit on, just two wooden chairs at the tiny table.  There was an inter-connecting door to the adjoining room which obviously had a family staying there.  The gap under the door was so big, we could hear their conversations and the
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback,¬†Joanne.  We're deeply disappointed that you had such challenges during your time with us. We regret your inconvenience as we¬†are making some renovations to further improve on our hotel. With that being said, we care about the comfort of our guests so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward. We do hope you come back to stay with us again to take advantage of our improvements.  Thank you again for your feedback and for bring this to our attention.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I loved my room, but I had an Oceanfront Room overlooking the ocean from a balcony. Others might not have had as good an experience. The property is actually a composite of a bunch of different motels bought up and merged under one name. There is a definite difference based on rooms. I would definitely stay here again, but only if I get an Oceanfront room. Ice machines were everywhere, but I wanted a soda one night and the only drink machine was at one of the pools in a section (former separate motel) quite a distance from where I was staying. Also, there  aren't any in room safes to store your valuables, however, I felt very safe here. My room had a refrigerator, which was wonderful. The shower was also wonderful and had various settings. The Staff was excellent. Every Hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  We're happy you had a pleasant experience with us! ¬†It's lovely you enjoyed your¬†room and our friendly service¬†so much. ¬†That's what we like to see! ¬†However, we regret that our¬†number of drink machines¬†didn't meet your expectations. ¬†We endeavor to offer a top-notch experience for our guests so we'll be sure to discuss your concerns moving forward.  We look forward to hosting you again soon for an even better experience! ¬†Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: The rooms are very well kept, the staff especially Stacy, Lauren and Tony the engineer are the best. Thanks guys! Supermarket in close proximity- cool! the valet service was right on point, would totally stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thanks for the amazing review! ¬†It's wonderful you enjoyed your time with us so much! ¬†We're delighted you appreciate our convenient location and top-notch team. ¬†We love sharing our outstanding service with our guests and your praise lets us know we're succeeding! ¬†We look forward to hosting you again soon for another excellent experience!  Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: After a minor reservation mishap, Lauren and her team really went the extra mile! Its nice to see old fashion customer service is still alive and well. Despite other reviews, this hotel has the best ocean front rooms in Laguna. Great Hotel! Great location! Great staff! We will be back soon for sure! Thanks Lauren!
Manager Response: Thank you for the outstanding review, Eric!  We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful! ¬†We strive to make all of our guests feel welcome and relaxed during their time with us. ¬†It's fantastic Lauren and the team could accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible. ¬†We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon! ¬†Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location but cannot make-up for negatives. Needs Extreme makeover!
Summary: I was thrilled to have discovered this hotel on the beach in central Laguna Beach. The price was OK I guess for the high season and for the 4 stars reviews on trip advisor... But now I wonder how tripadvisor rates their hotels, do they have a bias factor or put a bigger weight on positive reviews than negatives... Front desk staff was nice, but once you pass the front desk, the experience is a totally different one...Pictures do not match real experience. The room was tiny for a double bed, and carpet was dirty. Besides, the FIRST objective of a hotel is to offer its guest a good night sleep and here, I have to say that it is one of the worst experience in my 40 years hotel stays! I can confirm the critics of other guests that rooms are so noisy because of the individual A/C and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate your feedback. We regret that you had such difficulty during your time with us. We strive to offer quality service and comfort for our guests and it's we're disappointed to learn your room wasn't cleaned to the high standards we aspire to provide. It's also unfortunate to hear about the issues you faced with our air conditioning. We'll be sure to address these issues with our team moving forward.  We do hope you allow us to host you again soon so we can share a more positive experience with you. Thank you.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what we expected from website or reviews
Summary: This is a hotel in great need of TLC.  The rooms are not anything represented, small, not even a picture on the wall.  Terrible room service but you pay a hefty price, beware! The rooms are small, loud air conditioner, had to ask for room to be made up at 3:00 pm.  Nothing special!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We're deeply disappointed your experience with us was less than ideal. Our room service comes from our restaurant which gets rave reviews so I apologize that it wasn't up to standard.    We hope you give us the opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon. Thank you.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel because on pictures they have nice modern rooms, instead we got very outdated room with dirty carpets , dirty bathroom, bed is worse than seat on airline. AC unit is very old and make noise that you could not sleep , they also put this unit right next to bed and it was blowing all night to my legs. When I went to front desk and tell them about my experience they said " We are sorry but we can not control our rooms". What service is it ??? False advertising on website. This worst experience in hotel we had, we have traveled a lot and stayed in many places, I would suggest you DO NOT even think to stay here.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, Artur.  We're deeply disappointed you had such challenges during your time with us. We regret that your room wasn't what you expected and that our team didn't go above and beyond to accommodate your needs. We hold ourselves to a much higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our team to help us rectify these problems moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon. Thank you.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: Website pictures don't look anything like hotel. The room was dingy looking with stained carpets and a toilet that didn't flush. We looked at the pool and walked the other way and the beach was not inviting at all. Guest were sitting on top of each other and the beach chairs were uncomfortable. After spending two hours at the hotel, we packed up our things and moved to another one. This hotel was extremely disappointing as we were expecting a cute boutique hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, Sara.  I'm sorry that your experience wasn't what you expected.  I hope that you were able speak with someone before your departure so we could have looked into your room.  As for the beach, it can get crowded depending on the time of day, but it's still one of the most beautiful stretch of beach in all of California.  I'm sorry we didn't hit that mark.  If you decide to ever come back, let me know.  Thanks for the review.   Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I enjoyed my stay ... although beach condintions said otherwise... I would like to send coodoes to beach attendant Sam ...who handled the rather atrocious beach conditions with a smile....thanks Sam... you made what might have been a rotten day fun..you were awesome .... thanks for saving the. Day üòÉüòÉ
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review and comments about Sam, Lindy!  I'm sure he would love the cookies from you.  Just send it to the Hotel and address the cookies to Sam (Beach Attendant) and I'll make sure he gets them.  The beach was a bit of a challenge as you know with the lack of beach due to the tides.  One day we had a lot of it and the next, it was half gone.  We're hoping the change in tides will bring the beach back.  We're so thrilled for this review and we appreciate your gesture and review!  Thanks again Lindy!!!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: Went to Pacific Edge Hotel on a Wednesday and as met with an unfriendly woman at the front desk. I cant recall her name but she was short, dark haired and training an employee who was checking me in. I explained to her that I was traveling with my 90 year old parents and 85 year old aunt. We were booked for 2 rooms and if possible I requested a room right away as my parents and aunt wanted to rest. She had no desire in accommodating me. She could have called housekeeping and inquired is 1 room was ready but said I would have to wait until 4 pm. This woman never smiled never said, welcome to our hotel super cold. I arrived there 11am which was check out time. After asking her is she was sure there was anything she could do, again she said NO. My sister arrived about 5 minutes
Manager Response: Thanks for the review Gia,  We appreciate your feedback. We're deeply disappointed to hear about the challenges you faced during your stay. It's unfortunate that our service didn't meet your expectations. We strive to offer top-notch service and comfort for our guests. We hold ourselves to a higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward. I'm glad James was able to take it upon himself to make up for the lack of service that you experienced.  I'll make sure that we recognize him for a job well done.  Thanks for choosing us and I hope that you, your grandparents and your aunt were able to have a good time.  We hope to see you again.   Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: We started going here 30 years ago when it was Vacation Village. Nothing in Laguna is cheap, but this is the most affordable on-the-waterfront hotel around. It has changed hands a few times and just recently acquired a new owner. There was a mixup on our most recent stay because they were changing reservations systems, but they worked hard to rectify it. They have a nice range of room prices depending on your location, but even the street side rooms are 10 steps from the water (maybe a little under exadurated). We enjoy the Reef Tower that is right on the water. You are walking distance to downtown, but they have a great restaurant and beach front bar. The reef tower still have bath tubs, but some of the newer remodeled rooms have showers only. Parking is valet only, but it they
Manager Response: Jim,  You say 30 years of great visits, but we say 30 years of being able to host incredible guests that we had the priviledge of hosting.  Thanks for the continued loyalty and we're excited to see you back here year after year. Thanks for the great review!   All my best,  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel June 30 - July 2, 2017 in the Reef building (2 queen beds). Confirmation #59774SB152043, or the other confirmation I received later: # 39191052-1. This is an honest review and not exaggerated. We did not have a good experience.  My sister was getting married July 7 and me and my other sister wanted to spend a special 2 days at the beach to relax and celebrate with the bride to be & we chose the Pacific Edge Hotel.  So, there were 3 of us and I clearly stated this when I reserved the room.  I also called to request champagne & strawberries to be placed in the room upon our arrival to make it more special. They could not provide strawberries or any snacks which was a disappointment but I thought at least we'd have champagne.  - When we entered
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate the feedback. ¬†I'm disappointed that the amenity wasn't in place for you for such a special occasion.  I wish you would have said something to us to make up for the lack of service that you received.  I'll make sure to follow up with the team to make sure this doesn't happen again in the future.  If you change your mind about coming back, give me a call at the hotel.  Thanks again for the review and I look forward to hearing from you.    Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and always enjoy the scenic views. The staff is always very friendly and willing to accommodate me. I wanted to recognize Javid who assisted our family with great restaurants in the area and professional service. Keep up the good work!
Manager Response: Cowboy and Curry!  Thanks so much for the fantastic review! ¬†We're happy you had such a wonderful experience with us and Javid and the team were able to elevate that experience. Thanks for the return visit and we can't wait for you to come back and visit us again.  Thanks for the review!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I checked stayed here July 1st for only one night the service was great and the staff is always very friendly. I should have booked additional nights and will make sure I do this in the future. Looking forward to my return visit.
Manager Response: Thanks for the fantastic review! ¬†We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us so much and I'm sorry it was so short. ¬†Definitely make it a longer stay next time and we can't wait for you to visit us again!    Have a beautiful day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: I took my Wife to the Pacific Edge for her birthday.  I studied the rooms online and they looked great. I prepaid 1473 American dollars for 4 nights. In the meantime I guess the hotel sold out to another company. In any event I was already in for almost 1500 dollars . I work extremely hard for my money and when we arrived and saw the room I was not impressed. We just sucked it up and thought well the pictures were very misleading and we had prepaid so what could we do? We talked to the front desk guy and he said he understood and that he reached out to the GM and he would contact us. Well 4 days later... Nothing. I have some of the pictures but I won't even post these because no one would believe them. I told my Wife upon departure to take a good look at the sign because we will
Manager Response: Jordanniko,  I'm so sorry that your experience wasn't a great one.  I don't have a record of a call back, but I would love to hear from you so we can discuss your experience.  Please give me a call at the hotel.  I would be happy to talk to you and get some more details of your stay.  I appreciate your feedback and I look forward to hearing from you.    Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: We just returned from our stay at Pacific Edge. This was our third time staying and will not be our last.  We have always stayed in an ocean front room, which I highly recommend. You can not beat the spectacular views!  Everyone was very friendly during our stay.  The rooms aren't fancy, but they've been updated, and are perfect for a beachfront hotel.  Our room was spacious, and housekeeping did a wonderful job. We stayed in the Reef building, room 125. It was perfect.
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, Gigi!  We're so thrilled you've enjoyed your experiences with us! It's fantastic you were able to enjoy our ocean front rooms as well as our service. We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We look forward to sharing another wonderful experience with you soon. Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: First time staying at this property and was fortunate to have JAMES handle our checkin! He offered outstanding customer service accommodating us and providing recommendations for great places to visit during our stay.  Stayed in the building closest to HWY but didn't really notice the noise.  Amazing location steps to the beach with complimentary chairs, towels, umbrella and sand toys.  Will definitely stay again!!!
Manager Response: Thanks for your review, Alison!  We're delighted your time with us was so wonderful! It's outstanding to hear that James took such great care of you and made you feel so welcome. We aim to please and your praise for our service lets us know we're doing our job! We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you soon!  Have a beautiful day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary Heading: Unimpressive room and very loud loading at 3am that woke the whole family up
Summary: My biggest complaint is that a big hotel vendor truck parked direclty in front of our room/balcony and was loading glass or metal or something really loud for almost 30 minutes at 3AM. It was so loud that it woke up every person in our room including 9 month old babies who we then had to try and get back to sleep. I had to call the front desk and ask them to have the truck move, which they did. I asked two separate times to speak with a manager and was told both times that a manager would contact me. No one ever contacted me and I didn't have the desire to call and ask for a manager a third time. But needless to say the customer service and handling of valid guest complaints needs work.  We had a room in the older, not updated Bahia building. The room was stark, no decor other
Manager Response: Dear Traveler1915,  We're disappointed that your time with us was less than ideal.  Your experience is not on par with the level of service we're accustomed to providing and it's unfortunate our service and accommodations didn't exceed your expectations.  We'll be addressing your concerns with the managers on duty to better handle and follow up with our guests.  My sincerest of apologies.  We hope you give us another opportunity to demonstrate the high-caliber service we're capable of sharing with our guests.  Thank you.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: This is one of the best located ocean-side hotels in Laguna Beach.  The rooms have been remodeled and you have to treat yourself to the ocean view.  Waves practically crashing under your balcony!  The staff consistently welcoming and accommodating.  Stacie and Cameron are so friendly and interested in your comfort!   I have stayed at six hotels between Dana Point and LBeach in the past several years and this is my favorite for the reasons above!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great rating and review, Sue!  We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us! It‚Äôs wonderful you enjoyed our fantastic location and our customer service from Stacie and Cam. We strive for excellence!  We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another amazing experience!  Have a great day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary Heading: A delightful get-away at the ocean
Summary: Just returned from a two-night stay in an ocean-front King room in the Reef building. We loved the view from the room and enjoyed being a little distance from the more active area of the hotel. Watching the ocean, feeling the breeze and sipping wine on our balcony was serene and romantic. The buildings are old and in need of updating, but our room was just fine. We had the parking/breakfast package and loved sitting on the waterfront having a delicious breakfast. The many galleries and restaurants are just a block away. Highly recommend the extra expense of an ocean-front room. We found everyone from the valet service to the employees of the restaurants and hotel to be friendly and helpful. A special thank you to the charming young man who was seating people at the Deck on the
Manager Response: Thanks for the 4/5 rating, Linda!  We're thrilled you had such a pleasant experience with us!  It's excellent you enjoyed our prime location with its stunning views and proximity to so many of the city's best attractions.  That's what we like to see!  We're happy our team took such great care of you and made you feel so welcome.  We strive for excellence so we look forward to sharing an even better experience with you soon!  Have a lovely day!  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely and can't beat the view
Summary: We were here for three nights in the Reef building and you simply can't beat the view. Waves crash 24/7 and the deck looks right out to ocean. At high tide, the water comes right under the deck. The beach is sandy and chairs, umbrellas and towels are included. Very friendly guys working on the beach. Check in was easy and staff was very professional. Easy to walk to local shops and restaurants. Downside: the room could have been cleaner. When we arrived, there were clothes tags on the floor and soap residue on the bath tub's soap shelf. Stains on carpet. But plenty of towels, comfy beds, no noise from neighboring rooms, and sheets were very clean. You're paying for the beach front.
Manager Response: Thanks for the 5/5 review, Lisa!  We're delighted to hear that you had a fantastic stay with us! It's wonderful that you loved the view from your room! We're also very pleased that our team provided you with friendly and professional service. However, we'll be addressing your concerns about housekeeping with the appropriate members of our team. We'd love to have you back again soon for an even more positive experience.  Alex Yi General Manager

Summary: This place was awesome when I visited 2 years ago, now however the staff seems to be a little off.  Still very friendly none the less.  For the price and location you still cannot beat this hotel.  Upgrade to the view room it is completely worth it.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the 5/5 rating!  It's great you enjoyed our prime location so much.  We appreciate the feedback regarding our team and we look forward to sharing an even better experience with you soon!  Have a fantastic day!

Summary: Before heading home from Disneyland, decided to stay overnight in Laguna Beach. Very happy to return to Pacific Edge. James, at the front desk, got us a room overlooking the pool and great for our toddler! The beach is easy access and with window open I could hear the ocean. James, our front desk clerk was courteous, kind & a pleasure to deal with. I was so tired and a bit frazzled from Disneyland still..James couldn't have been more understanding and nice to me. Everyone at Pacific Edge was friendly and ready to serve. The room was clean, comfy beds and safe feeling.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the excellent review!  We're delighted your experience with us was so wonderful!  We endeavor to make all of our guests feel welcome and relaxed during their time with us.  It's fantastic our team could accommodate your needs and assist you in any way possible.  We aim to please and your praise lets us know we're doing our job!  We look forward to sharing another amazing experience with you!  Have a lovely day!

Summary: the rooms were not in accordance with the price. Yes they have magnificent ocean views, but the suite we had  was less than any other place I have ever stayed in. The rooms are very disappointing and not as clean as you would think for a place stating their reputation. Master bath was small with no place for your personal items, no robe hook and no shelving. The Master bedroom in our suite had dirty carpet and was a plain as a room could be. No table for in room dining and a lack of seating except for the bed which is where we ate when ordering in room. The second family bedroom and bath was horrible, the bath was actually better in size than the master but everything was old and not a new as in the photos. I will not recommend or stay at the location again. There are much
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, George.  We're disappointed your experience with us was less than ideal.  We strive to offer quality service and convenience for our guests.  It's unfortunate your room wasn't refreshed properly and that our accommodations didn't meet your expectations.  We hold ourselves to a higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary Heading: A little pricey but great place
Summary: Older Hotel... a little on the expensive side... but our ocean view room was tremendous! We slept with our balcony door open to listen to the waves about 30 ft from our balcony. The room itself was average... but the room location.... PERFECT!
Manager Response: It's so lovely having waves as the background music, Bill! I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. While we are comparable to all the other hotels in the area, I appreciate the feedback. Hopefully, you'll be back to enjoy more of Laguna Beach soon!  Take care, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is one of my favorite places to stay in Laguna Beach both for the price, customer service and for the location. This time I was greeted by CJ and Stacie at the front desk and both went above and beyond to make my stay a very memorable one. If you are looking for a cool and hip place to stay, I definitely recommend this place
Manager Response: Dwight, I'm so glad we're you go-to for whenever you're in Laguna Beach! I'll let Stacie and CJ know about the kind words -- it's guests like you that inspire us to keep up the friendly service. Here's to next time!  Safe travels, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My daughters and I stayed here for a week or two every summer when they were little.  They are now grown and it was awesome to revisit and to find the place is still wonderful!          ___________ The place is still very well maintained with a nice pool, beach access.  __  _
Manager Response: That's so lovely to hear -- welcome back to Laguna Beach! It seems like you all had a nice reunion with us. Thank you so much for the feedback and hope you'll be back next summer!  Till next time, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Quality of the room is just ordinary
Summary: CJ was very helpful in getting us an adjoining room in exchange for the 2 bedroom apartment that only has one bathroom and requires renovation.  Not recommended for anyone requiring wheelchair or walker.  The valet is not convenient unless you're staying on the same level since the complex are in 3 levels and multiple building.  Too far from the lobby.
Manager Response: Thanks for all the feedback -- I'm glad we were able to accommodate your needs to make you all feel as comfortable as possible during your stay with us. We take health and safety requirements very seriously, so I hope you'll think of us next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Thanks again, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Not the most accomodating. We booked through Hotels.Com and the staff  gave us a small stale  room with no balcony facing a pool full of kids. I wouldn't mind, except I think the hotel was half empty and they could have offered a nicer room had we known.
Manager Response: It sounds like overall you had a nice stay with us but weren't quite happy with your room. We're always happy to answer any questions or concerns straight away while you're with us, and we try to accommodate guests with their preferences as much as possible. I hope you'll be back again.  Thanks so much, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Good: Location and view and on site restaurants. Our 2 bedroom apartment was spacious and had a great view of the ocean from the big living room which had a wall filled with sliding glass doors leading to a large balcony. We stayed in room #12, on the third floor, in the building closest to the street. Our ocean view was obstructed a bit by another building, but not by much. We had a decent sized kitchen, 2 nice sized bedrooms (1with access to the large balcony) and a bathroom. The bath towels were really big and the beds & pillows were very comfortable. We had dinner at The Deck and it was delicious! We didn't try the second restaurant on the property, but heard it is good too.   Bad: Everything was pretty shabby & outdated other than the bed linens, pillows and bath towels.
Manager Response: Wendy, while I'm glad you enjoyed the amazing ocean views and felt at home in your room, I'm sorry you found a few things that weren't to your liking. As you pointed out, we've made a lot of updates around the property to make sure your stay is comfortable and fun, and we're excited about continuing to do so. We want you to come back and stay with us for a visit that's full of relaxation and totally worth the price.  Take care, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: I Mean, You're Right on the Beach
Summary: You get what you pay for here and then some. A bit pricey at $120-$150 a night, but what do you expect, its right on the beach? In a popular and up scaly area you could do much worse with this price, and the other prices around aren't comparable (Holiday Inn is far more expensive, and probably just as good). I was in a cheaper room closer to the street, noise really didn't bother me. Things get quiet here around 10 or so, and I was on the first floor so didn't hear the bar. Bed was comfy, wifi was fast, and there's a fridge which is nice. Location is perfect. Near the hills for a long hike, right on the beach, five minute walk to some great restaurants (check out Nick's!) and in the center of town for a pleasant nightlife scene on weekends. But it's far enough away from the main
Manager Response: Thanks for all of this detail! I'm sure fellow travelers will appreciate the information. I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay with us when you were here in Laguna -- that's great to hear. I appreciate the feedback and hope we'll see you again sometime!  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Make sure and get the ocean view rooms
Summary: Rooms are large but just okay. Laundry pickup came in a large truck in middle of the night and made incredibly loud noise. No way to sleep through it. Sand on the floors was okay but sand in the bed? Ocean view rooms have a great view of the beach and staff was friendly. Great location a few blocks from downtown Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: I'm sorry for any excessive noise our staff may have caused -- I'll definitely look into that feedback. It sounds like you did generally enjoy your stay, though, and I'm happy to hear it. I hope we'll see you next time you're in town!  Safe travels, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a beach hotel, a very good beach hotel with great ocean views--if you splurge for the right room! It is not the Ritz! It's a little dirty at places; sand will do that! But get an ocean-front room, let the waves lull you to sleep, see dolphins from your room, and walk down a short flight of steps to get to the beach where you can walk for an hour or more! It's pretty casual, rooms are very nice but not huge or special. The beach and the ocean are what makes this hotel special. A lovely stay here.
Manager Response: It sounds like the location really wowed you, Arnie, and I have to say we feel lucky to be here! I'm glad you decided to stay with us and am even happier that you enjoyed yourself. Thank you for all of this feedback, and we'll see you next time!  Until then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I booked directly with the hotel and asked for a quiet room (because it was a special occasion) away from PCH traffic noise.  They did move me back from the highway but our room was directly above their restaurant and bar and was very noisy until it closed at 1:00 am.  The room was horrible with damp stained carpet and a bad smell.   There was no internet access and when I asked at the front desk they couldn't seem to figure it out and when I asked about other rooms the only other choice was a room right on the highway.   I know the hotel was not full but they didn't seem to care.   The bar is nice with some tasty appetizers but this is the only good thing I can say about this place.  Hard to believe it's a Joie de Vivre property!
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you weren't pleased with your visit, Michelle, as it's always our goal to provide a fun and comfortable place for our guests. Due to our the liveliness of our location, it can be difficult to find a perfectly quiet room, although I can assure you that we certainly try our best to accommodate. As for the rooms, cleanliness is, of course, incredibly important to us as well, and I'll certainly look into this right away. With that in mind, we do hope we'll get another chance to host you sometime. We know that we're capable of much more.  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Spent 5 days at Pacific Edge 4/5/17 to 4/10/17. Had a great time.  Staff was very courteous and helpful.  Have stayed there 3 other times and never had any problems. Got ocean side room and sunsets and night made our whole trip enjoyable!!!
Manager Response: It's wonderful to hear that you've consistently enjoyed staying with us, John! We're all about a comfortable spot with great views so that means a lot. We hope to host you again soon!  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great customer service on the beach
Summary: We live in the area but decided to find a surf-side hotel/resort to celebrate our anniversary. After reviewing one hotel after the other in Laguna Beach, we settled on Pacific Edge mainly because of the price and location. We didn't want to spend upwards of $600 a night for a mere 14-hour stay, especially if we weren't interested in spa amenities. When I called to ask about the rooms, the rep who answered (Karen) was very friendly and courteous and lowered the advertised room rate by $100. Score! She also told me that the room was located in the Reef building, which is the southern-most building on their property -- in a quieter area. There are rooms, fyi, located above outdoor cabanas that are rented. It can get very loud if you're located in this building, over these cabanas.
Manager Response: Good to hear from you guys! Thanks for spending your anniversary with us. Knowing that you were so impressed with the service and that you had a nice stay overall is amazing -- thanks for taking the time to let us know!  Hope you'll be back before long,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Wondrful location, pay for the view!
Summary: We stayed here of one night on our vacation to explore the southern California coast. We loved the location of the hotel, right in the middle of the action on the 101 and on the trolly line to get quickly into town for dinner.  The room we booked was ocean front and worth every penny of the upgrade cost. I read some compaints about the rooms, but most of them were booking the cheapest rate, and then compaining that they couldn't see the ocean. Stop being so cheap, you get what you pay for!  We use the valet service and this day was a rare rainy down poor kind of day, yet they were super friendly and efficient. They even lugged all my luggage up to my room once it was available without me having to lift a finger. Great service.  I highly recomend this hotel for a fun beach stay,
Manager Response: I'm happy we got to see you when you were exploring the area, Anthony! We feel lucky to call our location home, and I'm glad that you were pleased with it as well. Hope we'll see you back next time you venture this way!  Until then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Only stayed one night as we were there for a wedding.  The room was clean the bed comfortable, and it was nice to have a kitchenette, although we were only there for one night so didn't really make use of it.  Location was great, walking distance to many many restaurants and shops in downtown Laguna.  The wedding reception was at the Driftwood Cafe on property where the food was remarkable! The guys staffing the front desk were all super friendly and helpful! The one thing I should mention, and I hoe management takes note, is that there was not a full length mirror in the room.  I thought this strange as it seems like it should be a pretty standard piece in most hotel rooms.
Manager Response: Glad we got to see you when you were in town for the wedding, Jennifer! I appreciate the feedback about the mirror -- I'll definitely take note of that moving forward. Thanks for the amazing review. I'm happy you had a great time at the wedding, and I hope this will be the first of more stays to come!  Wishing you the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is perfect! This was our 2nd time staying here. It sits right on the edge of the pacific ocean on Pacific coast highway. Pay the money for the upgrade to ocean front it is worth every penny. There are two pools, one is in a shady area and the other on the street but most your time will be on the beach. You can walk down the hill into town or up the hill for local eats and bars. Town is quaint and adorable. Shops, art galleries and restaurants are just a 5 min walk .
Manager Response: Sounds like the view and location both impressed! I'm happy that you guys enjoyed your Laguna Beach vacation, and I hope your next one will be before too long.  Looking forward to round three, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty good price for being right on the ocean
Summary: It is definitely worth the money to get an ocean view room. We started out with an interior room and it was odd that it had sliding glass patio doors that opened to the outdoor hallway. We moved to an ocean view and the view was stunning. The ocean is literally right beneath your balcony. This is the place to stay in Laguna if you want to be right on the ocean. There are two good restaurants on site as well but make reservations in advance if you want dinner there, they both fill up quickly with locals who stay all night and drink. There is room for improvement at this hotel but it seems like they're working on it.
Manager Response: Those views are really something! I'm happy you found them as impressive as we do, Kelsey. You're right that we're working on improving our facilities in general, so please don't hesitate to reach out if you have more direct feedback!  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Pacific Edge was okay. The location is probably the best feature. Kind of a funky set up with rooms in several different buildings. We were upgraded to a beach front and I would definitely recommend an upgrade. The room was basic - two beds, a chair. Patio had a table and two chairs. Had a small fridge. No microwave. My thought is people don't spend a lot of time in the rooms so not slot of bells and whistles. I booked it for location, and that didn't disappoint. You can walk down to beach and along beach. Easy to walk into town. They do provide umbrellas and chairs, but we weren't there long enough to utilize. The front desk and valets were nice, friendly. For the price, I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for the review!  I'm glad that you were upgraded and were able to experience the amazing views from your room.  I'm disappointed that we weren't able to impress you further.  Thanks for the compliments on the team and we hope you'll come and see us again.    Best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nice staff, and the views are amazing. There is a private beach where they provide chairs for the guests. There is plenty of stuff to do around here. Oh and Kevin from the Backstreet Boys is staying here right now while we are here..so that's cool haha.
Manager Response: I'm happy that the staff and views alike impressed, Whitney! Pretty cool that you were in the midst of a celebrity, too. That's what we'd call the icing on top of the cake!  Looking forward to your next visit, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: First of all: if you've got a balcony watching over the Pacific you're king. Decent fare this hotel. Clean but outdated rooms, two very small swimmingpools but who needs that when you're smack right at the Pacific edge. Shops and restaurants abound. Nice and decent staff. Valetparking is good. Restaurant is good as well.
Manager Response: Those views are pretty nice! We can't take much credit for that, though. I'm happy that you liked your room and the service you received from the staff! Thanks so much for dropping by our page and letting us know.  See you next time! Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The reservation agent said, "you know it's a luxury hotel correct?".   Right  on the beach, but a variety of buildings. We were in one that was old, mildew smell and dirty from oldness. Loud. Sanitation trucks, back up sounds, people, valet loud. You name it and it was the worst sleep ever.   Second room was newer,  quieter  but still the sound of doors slamming, kids running up and down on the decks made it noisy.    Valet parking  added to the "Springbreak" deal, doesn't make this property worth it.   Only saving grace, guys at the beach helpful.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that your accommodations weren't what you were expecting, Kathy -- I'm disappointed that they didn't live up to your expectations. I want to do what we can to improve moving forward, so I appreciate the feedback. If there's anything else we can clear up for you, don't hesitate to reach out.  Wishing you the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Expensive, but you pay for the view and what a view.
Summary: We had a surfside room with a king bed and what a view. We sat on the deck looking at the ocean most of our time there.   I didn't like that you can't check-in until 4 pm. I understand why they do it, but most hotels have a 2 or 3 pm check-in and manage just fine.  And why they placed the bed against the wall with an obstructed view I have no idea. With a little brute strength you can move the bed, so that you have a view of the ocean as you fall asleep. Also, the view rooms are just above the dining area, so don't expect quiet.
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback about the check-in time -- we do have that policy in place for operational reasons, but I'll definitely keep that in mind. I'm happy that you enjoyed the view from your deck, though.  Hope we'll see you back! Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Had a nice stay, Ocean View Room was great !
Summary: I was with a group of friends and stayed a night on a Saturday for a friends birthday celebration here in Laguna.  I would say it is a basic 3 star hotel.    It is in a great location on PCH in the busy downtown part of Laguna, but not in the main part.  It is walking distance to many restaurants, (Nick's, Watermarc, The Saloon, The Dirty Bird, a Mexican Restaurant, and Main Street) shops, bars.   Parking was $30 for valet and you can take your car in and out as much as you want.  If your going around town it is probably best to just Uber around. In Laguna most parking is metered and hard to find.  Most of the hotel have valet in town, so expect that.  It is far cheaper than a parking ticket.  It was perfect for the 1st weekend of Spring.  It was sunny.  The beach bar there "The
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us! I'm glad that you and your friends enjoyed what the hotel had to offer which are incredible views from the oceanfront rooms and the great restaurants we have here. Thanks for the review and hope you'll be back for another visit.   Best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: ANOTHER GREAT STAY AT PACIFIC EDGE !!!
Summary: Best Location in Laguna Beach......Have been visiting Pacific Edge for years....you can't beat the location -the atmosphere-service -rooms are clean and Awesome ocean views...front desk- Valet- room service- house keeping...are all top notch !!!  Everything you want to do is just steps away up and down the PCH .... we can't wait to go back soon !!
Manager Response: Laguna Beach has some awesome spots, Jeff, so that's quite a compliment! The whole team has appreciated each and every one of your years of support. The loyalty is awesome! Can't wait for your next visit.  Until then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I never book hotels through discount websites and now I know why. They give you the worst room they have! First of all, you have to pay $30 for the hotel's valet service because finding metered parking is almost impossible on the street. Then, you have to keep putting more money in the meter to keep your car there overnight. We noticed right away that the hotel is a hodge lodge of different buildings, some looking better than others. Our room was right next to the pool with only a glass window between our slider, the corridor, and the pool. I felt like they were swimming in my room-screaming, laughing. The room was so tiny and outdated. There were no pictures on the walls, and the drapes were very old and ugly. Next we were in an adjoining room with the loudest people in the
Manager Response: We want our rooms to be consistently up to our standards, Tia, regardless who you book through or which room you get. I'll make sure to look into each of the comments you laid out here to see if there are some upgrades to the room that we need to consider. I'm sorry you weren't as happy with your visit as we would have wanted, but thanks again for the feedback.  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed one night to attend a wedding in town. Clean room with Keurig inside. We booked a village view so we looked out at Pacific Coast Highway. As others have mentioned the walls are a bit thin, but overall for the price it was a good value. Front desk staff were very helpful and efficient.
Manager Response: I'm glad we got to have you for that wedding weekend! I hope you guys enjoyed yourselves when you were here in Laguna Beach. Next time you venture this way, you know where to find us!  Best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, Great value for money
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for one night and spent  most of that with friends away from the hotel so my review can only cover what we managed to experience. 1. Location - right in the heart of Laguna beach with lots of restaurants and shops close by. The hotel is on the main coastal road going through the town and is split into several buildings. 2. Room - Ours was on a building next to reception and one lane back from the beach. Access to the beach was easy enough and our sea view room had great views. We were given a small studio type room which had a small kitchen and dining area, large bathroom and very comfortable bed. The room was slightly dated but very clean. 3. Extras - complimentary bottle of wine on arrival, bottles of water in the room and a coffee pod machine in room. As
Manager Response: I'm glad that you and your friends enjoyed your visit to Laguna Beach. It's hard not to love this place, if you ask us! It's great that you found your stay with us to be comfortable both in terms of service and your room. As far as parking goes, we ultimately want you to have a choice other than street parking -- we hope that your options were communicated to you clearly, though. Everything said, thanks for leaving this review for us. The entire team is grateful for the support!  Best wishes, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: You can hear right through the walls/We didn't sleep a wink
Summary: I booked on Hotels.com was expecting something completely different....  Our room faced PCH(no where close to the ocean) We didn't sleep because the traffic noise was so loud, the walls were so thin we could hear everything that went on next door.  The Hotel was clean and does have nicer rooms closer to the beach. If you are going to book here make sure you're room is not in the 2 buildings closest to PCH. Staff was friendly and even gave us a bottle of Champagne, I'm guessing they knew what we were in for....
Manager Response: Of course we want our guests to be clear on the rooms they'll be staying in, Tanya, so I'm really sorry if yours wasn't what you were expecting. We have several different options so that our guests have the ability to choose which room works best for them, but I'm confident we'll be able to find a room that's more to your liking if you decide to stay with us again.  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Breath Taking Views & Absolutely Wonderful Service
Summary: You need to stay here if you travel to Laguna Beach! We visited for a week to see both friends and family - the #1 must was having a hotel with ocean views. Wow! Honestly, the room was right on the beach and when it was high tide the balcony was literally over the ocean. However the beautiful view was possibly tied with the level of service received by the Pacific Edge staff during our stay. Starting at our late check in (around 9:30-10PM because of a flight delay) the front desk personnel warmly greeted us and provided wonderful recommendations for places to see and restaurants to try out during the week long visit. Honestly, we couldn't have asked for a better welcome after a tiring day of travel. From there, we had to valet the rental car and the valets were incredibly
Manager Response: Wow, Laurel, it's hard to know where to begin here -- this feedback is so detailed! I know fellow travelers will appreciate it just as much as I did, so I can't thank you enough for taking the time to let us know how you guys enjoyed your stay here. From those views to the consistently helpful and friendly service, I couldn't be happier knowing everything hit the mark.   Looking forward to your return to Laguna Beach! Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: FIND SOMEWHERE NICER LIKE SURF AND SAND FOR THE MONEY!
Summary: We stayed in the Pacific Suite for 6 nights in Dec/Jan.  We also rented a beachfront king and a beachfront 2 Queens.  We had stayed last year in the same rooms as well.  Nancy Sperling took care of all of the reservations and was always very nice and very professional.  A week before our arrival I gave her the names of our son's and daughter's families.  I told her they would arrive before I did and since they wouldn't have my credit card I wanted them to be able to check in.  In her response she told me that she had the names already.  	My son's family arrived first.  Zack at the counter told him that they could not check in to the room until I got there.  I spoke with Zack on the phone and he was very rude to me.  When  I told him of my email to Nancy and that she hadn‚Äôt
Manager Response: No one on the staff would ever intend to come off as anything other than polite and courteous, so I truly apologize that didn't come across for you. There are certain processes especially with credit cards that we keep in place for the safety of that credit card holder and us as a business. Taking a credit card number and authorizing over the phone on the day of the reservation is honestly a cause for concern.  We take credit card fraud very seriously and even though this was not the case, there are processes that we have to follow.  I apologize that this wasn't explained to you when making the reservation.  When it comes to the Pacific Suite, we take pride in the condition of the suite and do so with daily inspections of the suite.  I'm sorry that we weren't able to exceed your expectations, but I hope that you would consider us in the future.  Thank you for your feedback.   Take care, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Worst hotel experience I've ever had
Summary: Im not the kind of person who would usually complain but this place was unbelievable.   I booked through Expedia and felt scammed as the Expedia photos show their beach front location. Unfortunately there's more buildings than that, and my room was a few blocks from the ocean facing the costal highway. Sound proofing was literally non existent. Traffic can be heard throughout the night as loudly as if I had pitched a tent on the side of the road. I could hear my neighbour on all sides, their tvs, their conversations and even their coughs.   Do not stay here without ensuring you are in the building depicted in their photos.
Manager Response: Judy, we would never intentionally mislead our guests, so I'm really sorry that you weren't clear on which room you were booking.  The room you were in was only a building away from the ocean, but try the oceanfront rooms next time.   As far as the room itself goes, I apologize for any excessive noise. That's good feedback to have, though, and I'll definitely be looking into it further.  All the best, Alex Yi,  Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here with a Groupon and we didn't know what to expect. The room is big and the balcony over hangs the beach. During high tide the waves crash within 5 feet of the building. You cannot beat the view. The hotel has a private stairwell from our building to the beach. All of our encounters with personnel( valet, house keeping, front desk) were A+. If you have a Drone, bring it. The whole beach is drone friendly, and the footage is breathtaking. We will definitely come back again.
Manager Response: We think that those views sure do make waking up a pretty pleasant experience, Stephanie, and we're glad you feel the same way. I can't wait to see you guys back again next time -- make sure it's sooner rather than later!  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Needed a room change, but then things were good
Summary: We stayed at Pacific Edge 2 years ago and enjoyed it very much, so booked it again this trip for 4 nights. However, the first room we were given did not have any table or desk (or anything that could be used for it) nor any chairs. The only place to sit was on the bed. The next day we asked for another room. The staff was very helpful in moving us to a room that had a small table and two bare chairs. Still not great, but some place where we could write and put our laptops. Overall the staff was very friendly and accommodating and did their best to get us something agreeable on a busy weekend.   There were sone other minor problems with both rooms. Water pressure wasn't great, and the temperature of the shower was sporadic. Sometimes hot enough, sometimes not really. Furnishings
Manager Response: I'm so sorry about the inconvenience of your first night, but I'm glad our team worked together to find you a different room to accommodate your needs.  Thanks for being great guests and thanks for coming back to enjoy Laguna Beach.  We hope to see you again.    Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for two nights in february 2017. We enjoyed our stay, here is a few plus and minuses. Comfy beds, great view overlooking the ocean! The hotel is right next to a road with alot of traffic. Right outside our room there where a strong smell of cat piss, fortunately the smell stayed out there and didn't reach our room. The pools that the hotel had where tiny and the sun didnt reach there since it was so close to the buildings, too bad as we wanted to lay out. It was a rel nice restaurant/bar attached to the hotel that we enjoyed.
Manager Response: I'm happy to hear that, despite a few minuses, you guys enjoyed your stay overall, Mersina. It's great that our beach, beds, and bar area were enough to offset some of those other issues you had, but I hope you know we would have gladly looked for another room for you had we known there was a smell issue with your hallway area -- or at the very lease sent someone up to give it a little attention. Regardless, I hope you'll come back sometime in the future so that we can make an even better impression on you then!  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Had a room with no heat the first night but got a great suite the second night no upcharge! CJ and Stacie are super friendly hosts, had great recommendations for things to do and places to eat!  If it wasn't for the first room we would have given it 5 stars.  CJ made it a 5 star experience!
Manager Response: I'm so sorry about the trouble with your first room, Buzoman, but it's great to know we got you into a suite the second evening! I'll let CJ and Stacie know how much you appreciated their assistance here, and we hope you'll come back sometime so that we can land that last star!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I am reviewing this as someone who paid $265/night with a Groupon to stay in a Beachfront King room in the Reef Building, so keep that in mind. You are definitely paying for the view -- and it's spectacular. The ocean literally sweeps right up under your private balcony; the sounds and smells waft into your room and it's magical. The room itself is definitely nothing special. It's pretty equivalent to your average Best Western room, even though they've been lightly renovated. Our room had one side window with no curtain and the light woke us at 6 am each morning which was annoying -- it also leaked when it rained. The room featured nice, modern furniture and artwork; a fridge which was useful, and a small bathroom. The bed and pillows were wildly uncomfortable and I woke with
Manager Response: While I'm slightly disappointed our room wasn't impressive, it's so wonderful to hear you enjoyed the ocean view, Chris! I have to admit, the sound of the waves is so soothing to me, and I'm happy you appreciated being right next to that during your stay as well. If only the weather had cooperated! But still, we'll be around to welcome you back for a sunnier stay whenever you're ready for it.   Until then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Legendary Hotel Service with Breathtaking Views
Summary: As business traveler, I certainly didn't expect to receive the high level of customer service and hospitality that I received from the hotel's front desk staff Javid and Sandi. Both team members were extremely polite and courteousy in resolving the minor issue I encountered upon checking into the hotel (minor wind draft). Javid quickly responded by quickly moving me to another room and spending a treat compliments to the hotel for the small inconvenience.    All in All my four night stay couldn't have been any better. Thanks again Sandi and Javid for the excellent service and attention to detail.
Manager Response: I'm glad Javid and Stacie were able to surprise you with their warm welcome and friendly service! Great to hear they could get that little hiccup taken care of so quickly, too. We'll be here whenever you're ready for another beach getaway and thanks for the great review!    Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I have stayed at The Pacific Edge before and enjoyed it. This time we stayed in a Surf Wing  Beach front. What an absolute treat! Some of the rooms have been newly renovated and the decor was so calming.  Neutral tones, granite counters and a nice coastal feel. Cameron who greeted us at the feont desk was professional and friendly.  He also offered us a bottle of wine! All of the valet and housekeeping people are helpful and friendly.  We can't wait to come back to Pacific Edge again!
Manager Response: What a joy it is to know you and your husband have spent some wonderful vacations with us, Danielle! I'm thrilled we could make you two feel right at home in our Surf Wing, and I'll certainly let Cameron aong with valet and housekeeping know how much you appreciated their service. We can't wait to see you two again!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: fabulous rooms. with balconies right on the beach
Summary: A cute gem of a hotel, but make sure you book a room on the beach. You will be literally suspended over the waves. Those rooms have gorgeous views. The pool is nice and I hear they have a good restaurant. Fun surfboard decor outside some of the buildings.
Manager Response: I'm glad you enjoyed your ocean view so much!  We'll be around whenever you're ready for another beach vacation and try the restaurant next time.  It's amazing and the views are just as good.   We can't wait to see you again.     Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here at Pacific Edge for a long weekend in January.  One of the big reasons that we initially chose the hotel was because we got such a good deal - and we could not have been more pleasantly surprised!  Upon checkin, the staff were very helpful.  We booked a Village View Queen room and had expected to have little view from our room.  However, we ended up getting a room that was actually right above the lobby, and the room actually had a partial view of the ocean! We may have been slightly upgraded since it seemed like a slow time of year, I'm not sure.  But it was lovely! The room decor was a bit simple, but we weren't expecting anything too extravagant, so it was perfect for us.  The room was very clean and the bathroom was nicely updated. One of the
Manager Response: I'm thrilled we could make you and your husband feel so comfortable during your stay, Becca! I always like when we can surprise our guests by being the best, and I'll certainly let our front desk team know you appreciated everything. Great to hear you two decided to brave the chilly weather to spend some time on our beach, too, and we'll be around if you want to come back for a warmer vacation next time!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is virtually on the edge of the Pacific Ocean. You'll sleep and wake up to the sound of ocean waves crashing onto the shore. That alone is worth the stay. The rooms are ordinary, but you hardly notice that. The restaurants and the bungalows make for a great retreat for lunch, dinner or just some offsite meetings. You get nickel and dimed on parking. There's lots of parking available, but you can't self park - you can only do valet for $30 a night or use the parking meter on the street.. Overall, worth staying.
Manager Response: I'm delighted you enjoyed such a relaxing stay with us, Ajay! I wish our rooms had been able to impress you a little more, and I'm sorry we didn't do a better job of explaining that our valet services are optional, but those things aside, it's a pleasure to hear you loved being so close to the ocean. We'll be here whenever you're ready for another trip!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Love this beautiful old hotel have stayed here many times over the years. Updated rooms cheery colors great service. It's worth the extra money to get a beachfront room. There's nothing like the reef tower king suite.
Manager Response: That truly means the world to us, Christina! I'm so happy our charming little place has had the chance to host you over the years and I'm glad our team has always been able to make those visits wonderful.  We'll be here whenever you're ready for another cheerful beach getaway!   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Front Desk agent was rude and short.
Summary: We decided to Splurge on part of our honeymoon to the Pacific Edge hotel. And upon arriving the gentleman at the front desk made us feel unwelcomed, unimportant, short, and just kind of rude. We had got the Beach front King room, which was beautiful and the view was gorgeous. But we had so many questions to ask but he seemed like we were being inconvenient for him. Our main issue, was we wanted to find out about the celebrations packages we had read about. And anytime we would start to talking and bring up our honeymoon, or anything he would cut us off. So unfortunate. Thats what we get for splurging I guess. The hotel didn't have any checking for the Saturday we were checking out on, so we couldn't stay longer. S we stayed at the Laguna Beach Lodge. And she let us check in at
Manager Response: I'm very concerned to hear a member of our team failed to give you the warm welcome you deserved, Bethany. That is unacceptable, and I want you to know I will be following up to figure out what happened here. In the meantime, I hope you can appreciate that this was a rare and unfortunate happening, and I will keep my fingers crossed that we'll get another chance to show you that. I'm glad you and your husband enjoyed a wonderful stay in our King suite, and we'd all like to wish you congratulations on your marriage.   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach is my HAPPY PLACE away from home and Pacific Edge fits my happy spot
Summary: I've stayed at Pacific Edge four times in the past 18 months (each time for two nights) and it's my favourite hotel in Laguna Beach.  I agree some of the rooms are maybe not up to par or what you're expecting but I've been fortunate in getting great rooms each time.  The main reason I stay at this hotel is because they allow dogs at no charge and there are no resort fees.  I paid a lot just before Thanksgiving for an oceanfront room but my adult daughter became ill so it was just me and the dogs in this beautiful, large room.  I went again at the beginning of this year, with my daughter and granddaughter and dogs.  This time I couldn't afford to pay for an oceanfront room but Michael -- God bless him -- knew I'd been there before on my lonesome and he gave us the exact same room
Manager Response: Hey, Elizabeth! Thank you so much for taking time out of your day to leave this awesome review! I'm delighted we've been able to make each of those four visits so special, and I'll let Michael know how happy you were with the room he found you for your second stay. We're already looking forward to having you back again!  Until then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Ocean view room is worth the price!
Summary: Everything about this hotel was amazing.  Close walk to town, right on the beach, amazing views from ocean view rooms and restaurants.  The food was wonderful and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Our only complaint was that the hot tub had a lot of debris and sand at the bottom.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm so proud we could amaze you with everything from our location to our friendly service! It means the world that you enjoyed your stay and we'll look forward to having you back again.    All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Ocean view but other than that not impressed at all
Summary: The front desk was friendly at check in. The location is right on a nice little strip of beach which is nice. The room also did have a nice ocean view. The room itself was small. It was one of the remodeled rooms but the remodel was very basic and cheaply done. The bed was extremely uncomfortable and bouncy. We both woke up with sore backs.The property itself is worn down and the pools were laughable. The view is the only plus to this property.  As others have mentioned in their reviews the only parking available is valet which is $30 a day which I find excessive. I"m giving two stars strictly for the ocean view
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our friendly staff and wonderful beach views, but I'm disappointed to hear that it wasn't a great stay.  As I've mentioned in response to those other reviews, our valet charge keeps you from having to find street parking in Laguna and we forgo charging a resort fee as others currently do including charging for parking on top of that fee.  Hopefully, we'll get another chance to make a better impression on you on your next visit.     Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Myself and 2 friends stayed at this hotel on January 14. I was extremely disappointed. I wanted a beach view but nothing was available, we asked to have the pullout sofa made up and came back after dinner to find the bed linens outside on the dirty carpet.  The furniture is old and chipped, the tub is chipped. There were only two mugs for coffee in the morning. Sofa bed was very uncomfortable. I thought I was booking an upscale motel with a beach vibe. I was very disappointed.  Staff at the front desk and valets were courteous. Booking.com has not refunded my money like a previous reviewer stated. The hotel did take the valet charges off when I complained at check out. I would not recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you didn't enjoy your stay, Maureen. It seems you had some specific expectations before arriving and I'm disappointed we couldn't meet them for you. Oceanfront rooms are usually the first to sell out on weekends.  That said, I hope you and your friends will be willing to give us another chance sometime. I think that one of our ocean view rooms would have been perfect for you and your friends and I hope that you'll give us another try.     All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed here this past weekend for a small local getaway. King beachfront room was awesome. View great. Room a little over but not bad. Bed was comfortable and room clean. Only downside is the layout of the hotel. Several different buildings across the alley from each other or residences between them. I checked in and had a ways to walk which included going across the alley to get to room. No elevator to my room so had to walk to sets of stairs. And overnight parking is steep at $30 a night.   Close to main beach and all the shops and restaurants. Will definitely stay again!   Pictures are from the rooms balcony.
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could help you enjoy a mini vacation, Shanna! From our ocean view to our cozy bed, it's good to know you enjoyed yourself here, and we're so glad you're planning on coming back sometime!   Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I wish I could say that I had a good experience at this hotel. I had a last minute business trip to Orange County.  I was looking for a quick, easy and trustworthy property.  Without much research I booked Pacific Edge because it was a Joie de Vivre property with a reasonable rate.  I should have known better and read the Tripadvisor reviews.   Upon arrival, I was greeted by a very nice front desk manager.  He was friendly, upbeat and helpful and even gave me a bottle of wine to enjoy in my room.  I had booked a city view queen and asked if I could get an upgrade.  The manager assured me that I had already been upgraded to a partial ocean view that would not disappoint.  I couldn't wait to see the room! I made my way down the hallway to room 12 and when I got there the light
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you didn't enjoy a pleasant night with us, Molly. I have to say, we don't often hear complaints about our rooms being too big, and I imagine putting you in a larger suite is what the person who greeted you thought you would appreciate. While I'm happy he made such a marvelous first impression, I wish that you had let us know you were uncomfortable in your room, we would have gladly found you a smaller one had we known you weren't feeling safe.  I hope we'll get another chance to welcome you back and hope to making you feel more comfortable next time around.     Best,   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach...great access to the beach
Summary: The hotel is located on the beach. Quick access for a walk, run or swim. Restaurants and retail stores are within walking distance.  The hotel room was quite basic, not sure if there are options for other rooms on the property.  If you are a light sleeper be careful of booking a room that overlooks the ocean.  The sound of the waves are soothing during the day, not so much at night if you are a light sleeper.
Manager Response: Hi Karen! Thanks for letting us know how your stay was.  I'm so glad you enjoyed our convenient location! We do actually have different options for room amenities, and we'll be glad to talk more about them if you decide to come back and see us for another visit. Many of our guests prefer to fall asleep with the sound of the waves crashing in the background, but I can certainly understand how it might keep some light sleepers awake. We'll be happy to find you a room without that issue next time.    Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I was so excited to visit pacific edge. I had read a few of the negative reviews so I even called and asked the hotel clerk to be really honest with me...I told her it was my 50th birthday and wanted to make sure I wouldn't be disappointed. she assured me I would love it. I was completely disappointed!! the first room they gave us looked out into the parking lot. the tv was broken and the room was tiny. also, no evidence of a birthday celebration...not even a note. we asked for an upgrade and were put into an uglier, very small room overlooking the sand-filled pool.  my son didn't want to hurt my feelings but when I told him we were canceling and leaving, he said "oh good, mom. this place is awful. why didn't you book a Marriott? they're so consistent".  this hotel is dirty,
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you felt this let down after booking a birthday stay with us. I truly wish we could have done more to make your visit special, and I know the rest of the team feels the same way. We actually do offer special gift options and accommodations for celebrations, like birthdays, but we can't provide them unless they're requested at the time of booking. If you asked or a special welcome package beforehand and didn't get it, that was absolutely our mistake. As I don't have your name, though, I can't look back to see if that was the case or not. That said, I'd be glad to speak with you more about your visit over the phone at 949.494.8566, and I can provide more detailed answers that way, too. I look forward to speaking with you.   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great little hotel clean great view great location if you don't need luxury like me it's a nice place to stay the vie from our balcony was awesome to bad for smog tho I would go back anytime hope I get a chance
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could welcome you here for a lovely beach vacation, Ghyslain! Sorry the fog kept you from enjoying your balcony as much as you would have, but we can't wait to see you back when the weather's cooperating!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: What can I say? This place was absolutely perfect! My husband and I were so pleased with Pacific Edge Hotel as our little romantic getaway choice. Our beachfront room with its magnificent view of the ocean was incredible! The entire staff made us feel welcome and special from start to finish. Upon entering our room, we were greeted with a lovely anniversary card and a cute beach gift bag, along with a nice bottle of champagne. Inside the beach bag was a cozy, little blanket and all sorts of yummy treats for us to enjoy. What a wonderful way to begin our stay!  We will definitely be coming back soon, booking the same perfect bungalow!!!
Manager Response: I'm so glad we achieved a perfectly romantic stay for you and your husband! It was our pleasure to welcome you both to our beach for a little getaway, and we can't wait to have you both back again.  Thanks for the great review!  Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was our second time visiting the Pacific Edge.  The first time we stayed in the Reef Wing and could not have been happier.  This time was short notice, so only Surf Wing ocean front was available.  While the Reef was super private with waves crashing below your balcony, the Surf is right over their Bungalows.  The Bungalows did not seem to have a lot of guests, but we still pretty loud for our room right above.  Could have done without the cleaning crew for the Bungalows firing up music at 730am when cleaning their deck.  Many have complained on proximity to the Deck bar from Surf, but while you heard conversations, it was not too distracting.  Also, since there is more beach space in front of the Surf (versus Reef), you have less privacy, but better people watching.  Also
Manager Response: While I wish your second visit could have been just as amazing as your first, William, I'm still really happy we got to welcome you in again. I'll definitely touch base with the cleaning crew to ensure we're not providing earlier-than-asked-for wake-up calls with our music, and I certainly appreciate you letting me know about that.   Apart from the unexpected concert, it's good to know you guys still loved spending time on our beach and walking around downtown Laguna. I hope we'll get to host a third trip for you guys soon!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: This place has totally lost its Joie De Vivre
Summary: I have stayed in the ocean front rooms and suites at Pacific Edge more than 10 times. My first time was in the early 1990s when it was known as Vacation Village Inn.... so I am the true definition of a regular. I have always known that it was "not new". It was about location location location, and of course the sound of the waves crashing all night right below our balcony.  We just left the place after a few days in early January today. We are agast at how this place has fallen out of Lustre.  This was our third or forth visit to Pacific Edge under the Joie De Vivre management. The first time we could see some interesting new vibe and some decor changes. So again... a trip booked to Southern California we did not hesitate to come to the Pacific Edge. What a mistake. What a
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you got the impression we don't care about making your stay as pleasant as we can, Ken. Considering you've had ten years of wonderful vacations at our hotel, it's especially disappointing we let you down this time.  We hold ourselves to incredibly high standards when it comes to service and I'll speak to our team to ensure we're always offering the best.  I apologize again for dropping the ball, and I want you to know we're available to talk more if you'd like to speak over the phone.     Thanks,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We first stayed at Pacific Edge in May 2016 and liked it so decided to stay again in November 2016.  The difference in oceanfront rooms was really disappointing.  Although on the same floor, the room in November could be best described as shabby.
