Normally I would not revisit a previous review; however, I thought this needed to be brought to the readers attention as the rooms were so different in quality, decor, and overall cleanliness. To start, there was a dull gray coverlet at the foot of the bed; there were no colorful pillows on the bed; the microwave was a true relic with scratches; the carpet was a disgrace with spots and stains all over it.  We saw none of this in our May visit.  That room was clean, lots of color in pillows and orange throw at foot of bed and rattan
Manager Response: I'm sorry your second visit wasn't as wonderful as the first, Karen.  I'm disappointed the difference was so stark for you even tough the only change in the room was the orange throw pillows and coverlet which was replaced with the mentioned gray back in September.  We've also just had carpet in those rooms, but I apologize that it wasn't up to the standards we expect it to be.  Please give me a call for your next visit and we can make sure that we place back the orange pillows and coverlet for your specific room and make sure everything is perfect.    Until then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what we envisioned...Will never, ever return...
Summary: This quaint hotel boasts ocean views "perfect for couples, families and business travelers".  While the staff is professional and the room was clean, we found this hotel most unsuitable for our family of four. Admittedly, we purchased this room using a Groupon and believed the selected reviews offered on this site.  We booked an additional night (before the Groupon date) as we were really looking forward to this vacation spot.  We were aware of the (ridiculous) $30 valet charge as there is very limited parking at the hotel.  Why such limited parking??   The hotel is located DIRECTLY on the Pacific Coast Highway!  Approximately 50 YARDS from the Pacific Coast Highway!  And yes, our room (along with 30 others) was facing the Pacific Coast Highway with its zooming, deafening
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you and your family didn't enjoy your stay. It seems that your biggest frustration had to do with our location -- or, more specifically, your room's. While I'm certainly disappointed you didn't get to stay in an ocean-facing room, I hope you know that we would have been glad to arrange that when making your reservations had we known it was your preference. As I'm sure you realize, not every room in our hotel can face the ocean; however, I do believe that would have helped you enjoy your time here more, and I wish we could have done that for you. As you noted, though, Laguna Beach is a beautiful destination, and our rooms book up quite quickly. Still, it's good to know our team did what we could to make your stay pleasant, and I'm glad we could work with Groupon afterwards. If you're ever interested in returning to our beach, I hope you'll let us know so we can take another shot at impressing you and your family.   Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Location ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Staff ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Bedding and towels ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Bathroom ‚≠êÔ∏è ( water temperature fluctuated as neighbor used them, bathtub's paint chipped off a big blotch, shower head loose) Room decor ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Mandatory Valet Parking fees $30 per day!!!üò±
Manager Response: I'm so sorry about the water temperature, Bogard. We do have to deal with some older facilities, but I'm happy they didn't keep you from enjoying the rest of your stay! Give us a call if you decide to come back out to Laguna for another getaway.   Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Good hotel for a longer stay in Laguna. With pros and cons. Other reviewers have noted that hotel rooms are not on the beach, but separated from the beach by the hotel's restaurants and other facilities. But our 2nd-floor suite had a beautiful ocean view for evenings on the outdoor porch. Amenities such as dishes, utensils, morning coffee were lacking. But management responded promptly to all of our requests so it was not a big problem. The suite was spacious and bedrooms comfortable, quite satisfactory for two couples. Good internet and TV service. Convenient location. We enjoyed the hotel and recommend it!
Manager Response: I'm happy you enjoyed that beautiful beach view, Jim! Always great to hear we made you feel welcome, and I hope you'll think of us next time you're ready for a Laguna Beach getaway.  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great little getaway for those with a surf attitude. Service is outstanding, valet rocked and felt well taken care of. Surf and sand with location was our goal,so mission accomplished. We had our 7 year old and opted for the kids package and a special bucket full of treats and beach goodies awaited. Room fit our needs but we are pretty low maintenance and again there for the surf and sand. You want luxury or spa maybe not for you. Love Laguna and look forward to visiting more of this companies properties.
Manager Response: It's so wonderful to know you enjoyed everything about your visit, Peter! I'm delighted to know we could show you and your family such great service, and it's great that you got plenty of sun and sand, too. Hope you'll come see us again next time you're ready for a beach getaway!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The info for this hotel is completely misrepresented.  My "beach front" room faced a restaurant and parking lot and not a hint of ocean. I am so sleep deprived from the garbage trucks, restaurant deliveries, laundry carts. And to top it off? We were charged $30 a night for 5 nights.  Was really looking forward to a nice beach vacation that was affordable. Not so.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your experience Shari. I assure you we do have beach front rooms available, but it seems the reservation that was booked was for a non oceanfront room. If you have a confirmation for it, please let us know and we'll make it right.  Apart from that, I must say that our rate is fairly standard for Laguna Beach, but I'm sorry you thought it was too high all the same. It looks like the team made up for it with waiving your parking fee for the 5 nghts and thank you for extending your stay an extra night. I wish we had been able to show you a nice beach vacation from start to finish, but I hope the rest of your trip was pleasant at least.   Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The ocean front room are everything!
Summary: I booked the two queens oceanfront room in the Reef Building. Worth every penny! I had a lovely stay. My daughter and I fell asleep to the sound of the ocean. The only issue is that you're not going to leave the room once you arrive. Great location, near all the shops and restaurants. Perfectly decorated and cozy.  The downside is all the stairs, but just have one of the bellhops help with your luggage, otherwise it's a steep haul.
Manager Response: So happy you enjoyed that oceanfront room, Destenie! Doesn't get better when you can fall asleep to the crashing of the waves.  I'm delighted we could show you and your daughter a lovely time and it's good to know you two were able to relax with us. Hope to see you both again and thanks for the great review!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We came down for a wedding and spent our 1st night at the Hotel Laguna. I grabbed a night here at the Pacific edge  on Groupon, and are we glad we did!! We had a great weekend and found a gem of a place. The accommodations were super. The ocean is just steps away from your room, the jacuzzi & pool were at perfect temperatures & very clean. Valet was very convenient and Javid and the rest of the staff were very helpful. The deck restaurant serves up great fare & spirits, our favorite was the beach burger and grill cheese with gruyere & bacon. We will definitely be coming back for another weekend and hoping to get an ocean front room!! Don't wait y'all book now, even in December the weather is fantastic..
Manager Response: We're glad you found that Groupon and came to stay with us, Kathy! So glad to know everything from our beach to our restaurant was a hit, and we definitely can't wait to welcome you back next time.  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I chose this location based on reviews on Trip Advisor and the Driftwood Kitchen has great reviews.  It is reasonably priced, and located right on Laguna Beach.  It has everything you need.  The rooms were somewhat dated but did have some updating such as new carpet.  VERY clean and the little kitchenette is handy if you were staying for more than a couple of days. The staff are extremely friendly and the valet parking is very convenient. Would stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: I'm so glad those other Trip Advisor reviews brought you to us, Jill!  It's wonderful to know we made you feel so welcome while you were here  and I hope you'll join us again next time you're in town!  Thanks for the great review!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Perfect Place to watch the Sunsets from your Balcony, Walk on the beach, Love the sounds of the waves, Excellent staff, Food, and always wants to make your stay great relaxed memories..!!!!! Soothe My Soul....!!!!!!
Manager Response: I'm so glad we could provide the perfect beach spot, Bonnie! From those sunset views to our friendly staff, it's a pleasure to know you enjoyed everything about your stay. Can't wait to have you again!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't get any closer to the ocean without getting wet
Summary: We went to the Pacific Edge for a combination Thanksgiving/ 52nd aniversary.  We went to the same place for many years when it was Vacation Village. We booked a ocean front dog friendly room in the Reef building. Check in was a breeze.Having to use the valet was not our preference but can understand because parking is at a premium in Laguna Beach. An elevator or a dumb waiter would have been nice as we had to go up and down 3 fights of stairs to get to our room. Since we were staying 4 days we brought a lot of stuff for us and the dog. Leaving the hotel was the same ordeal. We are not young and the stairs aren't the best as they are concrete and it did rain while we were there making it slippery. All in all it was worth it for the view, fabulous! The front staff were very
Manager Response: I am beyond thrilled we could welcome you guys here for both of those happy occasions -- and that you brought your pup to celebrate with you, too! Sorry the trek up and down the stairs was a bit of a hike, but I'm so happy everything else about your stay was pleasant. Can't wait to welcome you back next time!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. It was awesome! Room was big, nicely decorated, clean. Bar and restaurant onsite were both great. Food good, employees very nice. Location is great. Plenty of places in walking distance. We will be back! Tip: Valet is in the alley behind the hotel. You can drop off in front but area is small and congested. Not enough valet help for a Friday night....save yourself the stress and pull around back!
Manager Response: I'm happy you had a chance to take in some awesome ocean views from your room, Karen! Thanks for the great comments on our restaurants and service of staff.  We hope you'll come see us again next time when you're ready for a stress-free trip!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great laid back choice on the beach
Summary: There are several buildings to this hotel. Try to get the bungalows if you can , they have a private deck on the beach. We Gascony good facilities with a terrace and direct view from of the ocean in the Seas building. Some traffic noise could be heard. We will come back but I will try to get the bungalows, Surf Wing or Reef building which are all removed from street noises. Good option in Laguna and we walked to town and strolled on the beach
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a nice trip to the beach, Pernille, and we're happy we got to be a part of it. Thanks for stopping by our page to let us know about your experience -- we appreciate it!  Looking forward to next time, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: OH , I really wanted to give a better rating but im so agrivated with a few things that are very important to me. I do not function well when i can not start my morning off with out coffe.  There. Is kurig in room with 2 regular 2 decaffeinated.  So i go to lobby and told they are out. (Strike 1) then im watching a staff member walking back and fourth taking time to stock some girls from above. (Strike 2) then finally the one that ripped me, i get back to my room and its only had the garbage can emptied.  Ill clean the place myself but with what.there is almost nothing in this room. This place has a near perfect location, it has plenty of space,  i did feel the woman that checked us in was great.  But who owns this place.  I dont feel there is any pride of ownership. Not all bad
Manager Response: I can certainly see you were frustrated with a few things, Darrell, and I'm so sorry we couldn't provide a perfect stay this time. Having the amenities that you expect, especially coffee should have been in the room.  Being a coffee drinker myself, I can understand the frustration of being caffine deprived.   I'll be touching base with the team to ensure we have the proper amenites in the rooms and that this doesn't happen again.   All that said, I'm glad there were some redeeming things about your stay, but I promise that you'll have a flawless stay the next time.  I hope we get that chance to welcome you back.      All the Best,   Alex Yi Assistant General Manager

Summary: We too, got assigned the hideous room downstairs across from the pool, no view and TINY. Walked in and just said 'no way' - stained old carpets, no tub, no dresser, nothing but a bed. Went up to the desk to ask for an upgrade - they said it would cost over twice what we paid to stay. We were only staying for one night, so just toughed it out with that room, but honestly I don't think we have EVER stayed in such a gross room. This place is nothing like the pictures at all. Really disappointed and have no idea how this got a 4 star overall review - ouch.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you were surprised by your room, Shirlee, but I have to say we take pride in making our place as welcoming as possible -- and we also do all we can to offer quality at a great price. Still, it sounds like you were picturing something different before arriving, and I apologize. I am glad to know our team tried to offer you another room when they learned you weren't happy, though it's a shame that didn't work out.   If you're ever back in Laguna, I hope you'll consider checking out one of our beach front rooms -- they've already undergone the upgrades every room will eventually get.    Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Pacific Edge for the weekend in November 16.  We arrived to find ourselves assigned to a very small room, downstairs next to the pool, right on PCH.  The room was dated, the furniture had lots of wear and tear and the carpet was just dingy.  The bathroom was tiny, and there was only a shower.  They did have very large tubes of good quality and complimentary toiletries.  The was damage to the exterior walls, and the place generally looked like a 50's constructed beach hotel that hadn't had a lot of love lately.   The parking is $29/night, valet only.  I suppose for a place as crowded as Laguna that's not horrible.  And there was parking, which for the beach cities is good.  The restaurant was closed on Saturday for a private event.  That was annoying as we'd looked
Manager Response: Sounds like you guys had a pretty mixed experience with us, Cathy, and while I'm sorry the room wasn't as up-to-date as you would have liked, it's good to know there were several redeeming things about us that made your stay pleasant. I appreciate your understanding when it came to our valet -- we agree that's a competitive price for limited parking in Laguna, but it's always nice to know you appreciated that service. I'm sorry our restaurant was booked, but I hope you'll come back sometime to enjoy that lovely beach breakfast you were after.   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: All about being on the "Right Side of the Tracks"
Summary: So...I want to like this place...I have stayed 3 times...I really, really like the part of the hotel that is on the ocean-side, and I love the restaurant (it's busy, make reservations!!).    So...with this...if you are stuck staying on the road-side rooms...ask for a change and do this right away!!  And if they can't do this...change hotels!!  We did this recently and moved to the Laguna Beach House just a bit north.  Great Spot!!  The staff is friendly, the location is good, the restaurants nearby are really good (think Mexican food and Breakfast!) and the surf break is perfect for beginners and StandUp Paddle...but...  The rooms on the road-side...are brutal, terrible and...Insert Adjective!!  They really should just sell these to a Condo Developer do start all over...they
Manager Response: While I am glad to hear there were some highlights to the friendliness of the staff and your other 3 stays, I'm disappointed this room wasn't up to your standards this time. That said, I hope we'll get another chance to welcome you back into a beachfront room so that you can enjoy everything from our friendly staff to our convenient location.   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My family was visiting  from Seattle and i choose this hotel for location and they have 2 bedroom apartments , fabulous location , Zach at front desk was great as was rest of crew. they only negative thing would be that for these units , when you open the sliding glass doors to the balcony , you are facing the alley and their restaurant Driftwood Kitchen , it can be pretty loud  with trucks unloading and lots of traffic .
Manager Response: I'm thrilled you chose Laguna Beach to spend that valuable  family time that's lacking when you're states apart and choosing us to facilitate that.   From me, Zach and the rest of our team, thank you for taking the time to let us know what a great time you had. I hope this reunion gets to be an annual trip for everyone and we can't wait to welcome you back.    Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: From Check in to check out, the staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was clean, we had a quiet location. The d√©cor is outdated but because everything else was on point, we didn't mind that so much. I believe that $30 a day is too much for parking. I understand that parking is limited, but we are staying at the hotel. we never used our car. We are looking forward to our next trip there.
Manager Response: I'm thrilled we could make your stay special from the moment you arrived to the minute you left us, Teahen! While I'm sorry our valet system was a bit of a pain for you, I assure you we only offer that service to save you from having to pay by the hour for street parking. Still, we'll be glad to talk more about that next time you join us, and we can't wait to welcome you back.  Thanks for the great review!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Well looking back at the pictures on this site my room and view was nothing like that  First room given was like a dingy motel room yes the pool was outside our door but that looked as dull. Nothing round the pool No beds just chairs and the room was all stained carpets I think they put all their money into ocean view rooms and shove everyone who can't afford that into a dingy room We had to get a upgrade I refused to stay in that room is was my honeymoon and then we was moved to a apartment which was slightly better but still very dull and stained carpets  Didn't enjoy my stay sorry
Manager Response: I'm so sorry your room wasn't what you were expecting, Rachael. While we try to be very clear about which features and amenities each room offers, we can't show every room on our website, and it sounds like that led to some frustration for you. While I'm disappointed we let you down there, it's great to hear we were able to get you upgraded so you could enjoy your honeymoon, and I hope your visit improved once that happened.   If you're ever back in Laguna Beach, I hope we'll get a chance to show you how phenomenal both our service and rooms can be, and we wish you the best.   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Wonderful stay, amazing place, last call we got the 2 bedroom apartment for $164 per night! They said partial view, but there is an amazing view! Everything clean, fully equipped kitchen. We got a complementary bottle of champagne. Valet parking for 30$. If you want to leave your car after you check out, there is a 5$ per hour charge. You are in the middle of Laguna Beach, you could walk to all shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: I'm so happy you had an amazing time here, Cori! It's always our pleasure to make you feel welcome, and I'm glad we could do that this time with the champagne and your beach view. Hope we'll get to see you again next time you visit Laguna!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: After me making a dumb mistake and booking for the wrong weekend, CJ and Ashrak at the front desk were extremely accommodating and were able to get me in last minute. The room is great, but the staff is even better! :)
Manager Response: I'm thrilled CJ and Ashraf could help you out in a bind! They'll be so happy to know you appreciated their work here, and I'll certainly let them know how happy I am they were able to find you a room this weekend. Thanks for taking the time to fill out a review and for the incredible comments about the service of staff.  I hope we'll get to welcome you back again.    Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I live just north in Huntington Beach and we LOVE coming here for a quick getaway! It's perfectly located because not only do you have the very cool vibe of The Deck restaurant on the property but it's literally an 8 minute walk to the main charming town of Laguna Beach.  The rooms at Pacific Edge are best in The Reef And Surf buildings because they are the most recently remodeled and have the ocean front rooms.  The only reason I didn't give this fabulous location 5 stars is because the older part of the property needs updating.  Once that is done, the property will be close to perfect. It's not too Ritzy here....it's welcoming and full of beach charm and insane views.  I have to say the one thing though that truly helps put this place on the top of our get-away
Manager Response: I'm absolutely thrilled we've been able to take care of you and your husband when you two need a little R+R, Jessica! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us this kind note -- I'm touched to know I and my team have made your stays so enjoyable, and we can't wait to welcome you two back for another visit soon!    All the best,  Alex Yi

Summary: I agree with previous reviewers, next time I'm in town I will book the ocean view room because I do like this section of the beach. Our room was clean, spacious...but felt like a dark basement? It did have a balcony overlooking parking in between the two buildings. Hotel restaurant was great.
Manager Response: While I'm glad to hear your room was clean and spacious, it's great to know you're planning on giving our ocean view rooms a try next time you're in Laguna Beach! We can't wait to show you a phenomenal time then.   Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Pacific edge again after 3 years. Love the location and it's proximity to the ocean and the local restaurants, bars and shops. We stayed in an ocean view room which was amazing. The staff were just as friendly and welcoming as before and were happy to help in any way. The front PCH facing rooms need renovating but are comfortable enough for a short stay. If you are visiting Laguna then I would recommend staying here for the location. It's a 5 minute walk to the main beach or you can walk along the beach which is even better and quicker. The  valet staff were excellent. Definitely will make it a third visit in the not so distant future.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you came back to spend some more time with us, Sam! It's an absolute pleasure to know we made this visit just as great as the first, and we appreciate you recommending us to others. Can't wait to see you for vacation number three soon!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great location right on the sand! Listening to the waves without a sound machine made for a good nights sleep. CJ, the front desk supervisor, was extremely responsive to my request for a room with a tranquil vibe.
Manager Response: I'm so happy you got to fall asleep to the sound of the waves! That's absolutely one of my favorite things about living near the beach, so it's always nice when our guests get to enjoy it as well. I'll be sure to let CJ know how much you appreciated that, and we hope we'll get to welcome you back again sometime!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The fact that we were right on the beach was amazing, but that's about it.  You have to walk through an alley complete with garbage cans and people smoking to get to the room.  The room was clean and pleasant....no soda machines, no ice machines, however I did come back from an outing to find that the housekeepers did NOT close our room door completely; they left it ajar for who knows how long.  Nothing was stolen,but quite worrisome.
Manager Response: While I'm very happy to hear you enjoyed being so close to our beach, I'm disappointed the rest of your visit was a bit of a letdown, Susan. Not having the door properly closed after cleaning your room is absolutely inexcusable. I want to apologize for this oversight on our part. Ialso want to assure you that we take your security very seriously and I'll bring this up with the team to reiterate our standards. I appreciate you reaching out about this. I hope this experienced hasn't deterred you from staying wiht us again and I hope you get to enjoy your stay even more the next time around.    All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: My Birthday Visit/ASHRAF and CJ are the Best!!
Summary: Me and my girlfriend came to the Pacific Edge for my birthday. We checked in kind of late in the day and the rooms we reserved were taken for the night. CJ and ASHRAF worked together to find an amazing solution to our problem. Hey guys! Thanks so much!! My birthday has been made!!
Manager Response: I'm so happy CJ and Ashraf got that done for you, Ferrari! I'll pass your thanks along to them, and I know they'll be thrilled to hear your birthday trip was so great. Hope to see you and your girlfriend visit us again and maybe for her birthday?  Just putting it out there.  Thanks for the great review and we'll see you again.    Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Quiet place with an amazing view
Summary: We spent two nights at the property while in the area for a wedding. Although the rooms are in need of modernization, they are clean and have all the basics, including a refrigerator. We had an ocean view, which was awesome. Beach access is easy as well. The only negative was the parking. It cost 30 dollars a day to park, and the valet system was slow.
Manager Response: I'm so happy you enjoyed your ocean view, Bruce! And it's wonderful to know you appreciated the other amenities in your room as well. I am so sorry our valet wasn't as speedy as it should be, though, and we'll take a look to make sure we're running that as efficiently as possible now that you've brought it to our attention. In the meantime, I hope we'll have the pleasure of welcoming you back sometime!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Ashraf made our family trip to celebrate my sister's graduation simply amazing. He took his time to show us various rooms to make sure it suited our needs and wants and placed on in rooms that everyone was happy with, especially the view of the ocean.  I will definitely return. Ashraf and Michael D. are smiling helpful faces that can brighten anyone's mood.
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could help your family celebrate such a spectacular occasion! I have to agree with you, Ashraf and Michael are fantastic and I'll certainly let them know you mentioned both by name here. I know they'll join me in hoping we can welcome you back for another beach trip soon.  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We happened to stay in a room where you could hear the waves all night long. We also had our dogs with us and had a wonderful time. I love this place and going back in just a few days. Close to everything.
Manager Response: I'm thrilled you got to spend an evening enjoying the sound of the waves with your pups here! We're already looking forward to having you back, and we hope your next visit will be just as great as the first.   Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Still a Great Location and Relaxing Beach
Summary: This was my third stay at this hotel. The first time time not actually in a "beach front" room. (The Price is way too expensive now since it has changed ownership and become "fancy"). If you can afford it for several days, it is so worth being able to leave the balcony door open and listen to the ocean during the night and see the beach town wake up with the sun... The stay was only for one night, and the room by the street was fine. Convenient to the Lobby and to take luggage to the room. All parking is by valet only, and there is a daily charge everyday. So if you are using your car a lot, it may be an inconvenience. Walking is the best way to get around Laguna Beach, lots of stores and restaurants are within easy walking distance. The small beach in front of the hotel is the
Manager Response: I'm so happy you've enjoyed visiting us enough to keep coming back, Deb! I have to agree with you -- falling asleep to the sound of the waves is one of the most relaxing things I can think of, so it's really wonderful to know you've been able to experience that here. I hope you'll make it back to spend some time on our beach soon!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is one of our favorite hotels in the country. The view is amazing and the staff is always top notch. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Being on the ocean sometimes it feels a little damp but it doesn't other us. Definitely worth checking out as long as you get a room with a view of the ocean. Shopping and food around the neighborhood is amazing. Great place.
Manager Response: We're so proud to be one of your favorite spots, Jason! That's a huge honor, and I can't tell you how wonderful it is to know you've had some great times here. From our beach view to our proximity to downtown, we're glad you've enjoyed everything we offer, and I hope we'll get to host you again sometime!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't bother with the ordinary village rooms, get the seaview!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here two nights at the end of our long Route 66 journey across the States from Chicago to LA. The first night (Sunday), we only had a village room despite me asking for an upgrade (no seaview rooms available). The village rooms were very ordinary and we discovered the toilets in both these and the seaview rooms are not the easiest to get to flush fully. Location is excellent though and we had a quiet night in the village room then visited the reception in the morning and arranged for our packed-up luggage to be moved for us later in the monring to our new seaview room in Surf block. The difference was like chalk & cheese! Fantastic view, much more luxurious throughout, bigger TV, better wifi and our own balcony overlooking the beach! Beautiful! Toilet flush
Manager Response: Even though the toilets weren't quite what you were expecting, I'm so glad to see you enjoyed your stay with us. It's wonderful the location, view, and restaurant were so impressive! Thanks for the kind words -- we'd love to welcome you in again someday!  Best wishes, Alex Yi Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome beachfront resort! Good customer service.
Summary: We had a great time here, stayed for 3 nights. We were offered wine upon arrival which is always nice. The hotel is in a fantastic place right on the beach, we did not have an ocean front room but were still step away from the water. You are basically in the heart of Laguna, so lots of shops, art galleries, bars, and restaurants. Laguna is a rich beach town so if your looking to save money this wont be the place for you. Overall almost all of the customer service reps were very nice, I went on a paid vacation for the trip (paid by the company I work for). Oddly enough they tried to charge my card which the young lady did not explain. We got it sorted upon check out but was a touch frustrating...but at the end of the day when you steps away from the beach you can let things go
Manager Response: It was such a pleasure to host you, Jaeger, and I couldn't be happier to see that the feeling was mutual! We really do love our little piece of this amazing city, and I'm sure you can see why -- nothing's better than being so close to the beach! I'd like to apologize again about that confusion regarding your card, but thank you so much for patience and understanding in the matter.   Cheers,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We booked a junior suite for two days but as soon as we arrived we booked a third night. Well priced for two nights but the third (Saturday) was virtually same price. However worth it. Rooms are a little tired and not new but are fine. Ours had a kitchen and eating area and was reasonably equipped so you could actually cook there. Oven, hob, microwave, freezer, large fridge , toaster, and crockery. Large bed and sofa area. 2nd bed is the sofa which was ok but not like a real bed. Main bed - super comfortable. No safe. Great cable tv with EPL most games on NBC Channel 82. Large balcony but ours only had two high stools and table and no loungers. But ok. Hotel has two pools - only 4 loungers in top pool. Top pool noisy as by main 4-lane highway. Beach access direct from hotel is
Manager Response: Thanks so much for the kind words, Steve! I'm thrilled you were so impressed upon arriving that you guys decided to extend your visit.  It's even more wonderful to know you enjoyed spending some time on our beach and got to see the surfers in action on those big waves.  We can't wait to see you again for your next trip and thanks for visiting us all the way from England!      Till then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Clean rooms but if you don't get the right room it feels like you're in a dungeon. I would not stay here again unless I specified an ocean view room. Staff was nice all about the room no thank you. We were right by the pool room 29 did not like it.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you didn't get to enjoy as much of a beach view as you would have liked, Andrew. I know that can be a make-or-break thing for a lot of people, so I understand why you weren't happy with it this time. That said, we're always happy to reserve ocean view rooms for you in advance.    I hope the great service you saw this time combined with our beach location will be enough to earn us another chance to impress you in the future!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I think the word spectacular does not describe the beauty of the views from their beach front balcony rooms. You could hear the ocean even with the doors closed, that is how close you are to the water. We come to California at least twice a year on business for my husband and will be staying again. I can't wait to bring my daughters and grandson on vacation here. They also have a Penthouse Suite, which is very nice, has great views, full kitchen, dinning room, living space & bedroom, but is in another bungalow therefore it's further from the ocean. It is near all the local restaurants, bars and local stores, I walked the two days we stayed there and enjoyed the balcony to the max! The only reason I gave it a 4/5 was because you see some areas rusty and the bathtub looked cheap.
Manager Response: There really is nothing like falling asleep to the sound of the waves and I can't begin to tell you how happy I am that you enjoyed this while visiting us, Mrs. Ancruzer. From the surf outside your door to our proximity to downtown, it's such a joy to know you and your husband could relax here, and we're looking forward to seeing you and the rest of your family next time!   Till then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, great location with beach access, we only stayed 2 night but really enjoyed it, we ate on the deck and I have to say the burgers we exceptional best we've had so far, there is construction work being carried out next to the hotel which spoils the look of the hotel but I suppose that's to be expected, one other detail you should be aware of it they only do valet parking which is $30 per day, I thought that was rather expensive, there are parking meters out side but it means you would have keep topping it up every 4hrs there is also a car park 2 blocks up if you don't want valet parking, if you want to buy any food and drinks visit Ralphs, which is on the opposite  side of the road on the next corner
Manager Response: Thanks for joining us for those 2 nights, Christine -- it was such a pleasure to host you! We really do love our little spot near the beach, and it's wonderful to see how much you enjoyed your time with us -- that's the biggest compliment we could ask for. That being said, I do apologize for the construction -- it is, unfortunately, out of our control.   We'd love for you to give us another opportunity to show you just how great we can be, and I know that we are more than capable of giving you the full five-star experience you deserve.   Regards,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Perfect Laguna Beach Hotel on the beach. Rooms (we were upgraded to a sea view balcony room over looking the beach) are clean, comfy and very modern. We had a bar in the room and were given a bottle of bubbly and a half bottle of rum when we checked in... bonus and very nice touch! Small pool and hot tub behind the beach side building, they were clean and nice to use. Staff friendly and helpful with all info we needed. Car was even cleaned while we were there - again we didn't ask for it or pay for it ( but they got a tip at the end of the trip) Short walk to Laguna's shops - although its very hilly.. good for working off the extra treats! I will be back again - so relaxing falling asleep with the sound of the ocean outside.
Manager Response: I'm beyond thrilled your stay here was perfect! From your ocean view room to the valet service and everything in between, I'm glad we could make your stay memorable. We're already looking forward to your next Laguna Beach vacation!  Till then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The rooms were very dated and expensive. No artwork on the walls. Bathroom wasn't clean. The guest service seemed nice and accommodating.  They tried to charge me for valet parking when I had no car. So always double check your charges when leaving. Would probably not stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry we couldn't make you more comfortable here, Tessa. While we do take pride in the presentation of our rooms, it's certainly disappointing when the amenities we offer aren't what you were expecting or hoping for.   More concerning that that, though, is the fact that you were charged a valet fee when you had no car to valet. We are required to charge a parking fee due to the limited space available in Laguna Beach, but we waive resort fees to make up for this inconvenience. Still, I'm wondering if this was an error or failure in communication, and I'd certainly like to clear it up either way. If you'd like to talk more about it, please give us a call at 949.281.5709.   Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: You really can't beat this location. Right on the beach. Right in the middle of town. Walking distance to restaurants.  I had an ocean view room and I recommend it. If you are going to be here, give yourself a treat and upgrade to an ocean view. The water is literally a stones throw away. At night you hear the waves crashing. Could life get any better?  There is a restaurant on site which is good. I will be honest I didn't use that facilities that much because the beach is right there.
Manager Response: I'm thrilled you had such a great time on our beach, and it's a joy to know you took advantage of how close we are to downtown Laguna! From the surf and sand to dinner at the Driftwood, it was our pleasure to make you feel welcome here, and I hope we'll get to do it again sometime.  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I've been coming to this location for 40 years and am always blown away by the stunning location right on the ocean with the waves crashing under your balcony. The furnishings have updated nicely. The staff, as always, is wonderfully attentive and helpful. They now have a room service which is a nice plus. Two very nearby and very nice ocean-front restaurants. Easy walking distance to downtown and Main beach. 4 times more expensive than in the late 70s, but well worth it.
Manager Response: I can't begin to tell you what a joy it is that you've loved coming to see us over the years, David! It's a delight to know we've been able to make you feel at home here on our beach, and I'm thrilled you've taken advantage of our location as well. Looking forward to having you again next time!  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: What's not to love about a beachfront hotel in Laguna Beach. The place definitely has a laid back vibe and the guys who set you up on the beach with chairs and towels were great. Their restaurant (Driftwood Kitchen) was a nice surprise with excellent food. We went back after the first meal was so good (and the second meal was even better).  That said one is paying for location here and we were disappointed to arrive at the normal check in time only to find there was only one oceanfront room left as we reserved and it was right above a private event space, so the option of leaving the patio door open or using our patio itself was diminished. If we had known in advance about the noise level (which can go until 10pm) we would have considered another room type. Closing the sliding
Manager Response: I'm so sorry you weren't impressed with your location of your room this time, Jim. While it is good to know you enjoyed spending some time on our beach, I hope we'll have another chance to make you feel welcome.    All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great value but not for us!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night.  Although the hotel was clean, has good service and was a good value, this is not the hotel to say at if you plan on bringing your whole family or your spouse for a weekend get away.   This hotel is much more suited for the 20 and early 30 somethings that want to enjoy a good weekend with friends.   The rooms towards the front of the hotel are dated, very low water pressure and you can hear your neighbors.   The rooms towards the side of the ocean seem to be more updated but are of-course always booked.
Manager Response: As happy as I am that you enjoyed spending a night with us, Breddie, I'm sorry some aspects of your room weren't as modern as you would have hoped. We are in the process of updating our hotel, though, so I hope you'll pay us a visit once we get everything finished. I'm eager to share those improvements with you, and we look forward to hosting you and whomever you bring along next time you're planning a trip to Laguna Beach!   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a terrible stay! When we arrived you need to pay 30$ per night for parking at the hotel, or drive up 10min away to find a parking, IF you are lucky! otherwise pay at the roads.   Got to the room, DIRTY! on the disgusting carpet in the room looked like they never cleaned it, The bathroom was not clean and old trashy towels they prob use for whip of water (maids) then on one bed the bedsheets was not really clean i guess, got allergies during the first night!!!  morning after, I went out for a long walk and put -Do not disturb on the door (as my brother is sick and need rest) 2 TIMES the cleaners tried to open the door!there is a DO NOT DISTURB sign!   I got back from my walk and my brother told me this so I had enough!  Had a talk with the staff about the situation, Yes
Manager Response: Sara, I'm so sorry you and your family didn't enjoy your stay this time. Regarding the cost of parking, we are required to charge a fee due to the limited space available in Laguna Beach, but we do waive the resort fees in order to offset this inconvenience. Still, I'm disappointed we weren't better about communicating that this time.   I'm also disappointed you had some issues getting your room cleaned when you wanted it, but I am glad our front desk took steps to make this right for you in the moment. I hope that in combination with our beach location will be enough to earn us a second shot at welcoming you to Laguna next time you head this way on vacation.  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great but not 100% dog friendly! (Splurge for the ocean view)
Summary: When we called to see about a room we asked about the property and the beach. The agent told is it was a "private beach" with beach valet.  I asked if that meant that we could take our dog on the "private beach" and she said yes.    This was not accurate and the public beach doesn't allow dogs from 10am-6pm so about 15 minutes after setting up camp to relax the lifeguard came over and told us we had to take our dog off the beach.     This was one of the main reasons we booked this specific hotel/room so it was pretty disappointing.   Aside from that the room was great and literally right on the water. Restaurants right next door are super convenient and excellent food so we never had to leave the property if we desired.  Getting a room with an ocean view is the way to go here.
Manager Response: So sorry for the confusion about having your dog on the beach, DJ.  I'm not sure why you would have been told that without our mentioning the hours, but I'm disappointed by the communication breakdown regardless. Hope you were able to take your pup out to the surf in the morning or evening.  I'm glad you guys enjoyed everything else about your stay as much as you did. Always a pleasure to make you feel welcome here and I hope we'll have the chance to host you again sometime.  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Ok Folks, As several reviewers have noted, this is a beach hotel.  We stayed two nights, 9/28-9/29, specifically to see the Pageant of the Masters as well to enjoy the town. We had a pretty standard room, 55, with no view.  The room was clean and maintained.  The strange thing was there was nothing on the walls, (all painted an off white) and not one chair. I can not remember staying in a more "bland" room. For a artistic beach community, we thought it odd that they had no local decor in the room.  The good side, The Deck food and drink service was very good and reasonable as well as the main restaurant.  The staff service at the main desk and the valet was very competent and friendly.  I would recommend it particularly for the location and their beach service.
Manager Response: So sorry you found our decor a bit lacking in your room. While we aim for a simplistic, clean aesthetic in our hotel, we always want you to feel comfortable in your room. That said, I'm glad you spent some time at The Deck enjoying some great drinks and dishes! I'll be sure to let the team down there know how much you appreciated everything, and we hope you'll join us again next time you're visiting Laguna Beach!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Sound of the ocean in a So Cal beach hotel
Summary: As a travel agent we are in a lot of hotels. When reviewing please remember they type of accommodations you are in - this is a typical beach hotel you'll find all down the California coast which means sand in the elevator, some rust on the exterior, etc.   We stayed just one night (unfortunately) and had two renovated rooms on the back side of the ocean front building (which has the best pool). Location speaks for itself. Our biggest shout out also goes to the staff, hotel and restaurant.Thanks JT for great breakfast service.  Always a hello and smile. The room was small with bright bedding and great mattresses, but a bit drab. Not sure why there isn't wall artwork to add some interest and color, plus there is no chair or desk. It is a perfect and nicely priced escape location,
Manager Response: I'm absolutely thrilled we were able to host you on your Laguna Beach vacation, Dan! It's a pleasure to know you enjoyed your time here, and I'll absolutely pass your compliments along to JT and the rest of the team -- I know they'll be just as happy as I am to know you had a great time, and we hope to see you again!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: If you want to be close to beach, this is a great location.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  Our room had refrigerator, store, etc. and was decent in size; it did not have plates, silverware.  A particularly nice feature is that when you go to beach there is a facility for the hotel that sets up recliners, beach umbrella, etc.
Manager Response: I'm glad you guys had a great time with us, Carla! I know when I go on a beach vacation the best part is always reclining in the sand, so it's wonderful our team could make that part of your trip even easier to enjoy. Hope we'll get the chance to welcome you back to Laguna Beach for another trip sometime!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: ***If you choose this hotel, insist on staying in a room that looks like what's advertised on their website! Rooms in the old building are smelly, outdated, uncomfortable and nowhere near the price to stay.**  Here's the experience I had with this hotel last week:  I had to change rooms 4 times. The first two rooms were in the old building and those rooms look nothing like the rooms advertised on their website.   The first two rooms smelled like old wet clothes. In the second room, there was no dead bolt, the wifi didn't work, there were no curtains and the blinds were old and bent so people could see in the room.   My roommate and I asked to move rooms. We were moved to an ocean front but we had to pack up all of our luggage and be without a room for a few hoed in order to
Manager Response: I'm so sorry we weren't able to make your stay in Laguna a relaxing one. I can certainly understand why having to change rooms several times would be a bit frustrating, and I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.   That said, I am proud my team was able to accommodate your request for a new room. It sounds like we had to do some juggling to make this happen, though, and explaining those processes may have helped alleviate some of your stress. I apologize that we weren't better at communicating with you, but i want to assure you we are completely dedicated to helping you unwind when you're here. I hope we'll have a chance to show you that next time you're in Laguna Beach, and we wish you the best.   Take care,   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was my second stay at Pacific Edge, and it was almost as enjoyable as first trip (admittedly because I had low expectations and was pleasantly surprised on first visit). It's not a fancy hotel but you can't beat the location. (I can bring my own robe and slippers, right?)  Location: This hotel is beach/oceanfront AND close to downtown Laguna Beach. The heart of the Village (where restaurants and shops are) is a lovely 5-10 minute walk, and you can walk along the beach. Plus the hotel IS on the beach.   Room location: I love their ocean/beachfront rooms. I've stayed in both the Reef and Surf Wings. I prefer Reef because it's closer to the water but you can hear the ocean surf from both buildings' oceanfront rooms. When the tide comes in, the Reef building rooms are pretty
Manager Response: Moe, I'm so glad we could welcome you and your husband back for another visit and it's music to my ears that you had as much fun as the first time.  Thanks for the great review and we can't wait to welcome you back again and again.    Till next time,   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location is beautiful, that goes without saying. But what makes this hotel stand out is the amazing staff. From the moment we walked in until the time we left, we were treated with kindness. The staff was so welcoming.  I have to give a special shout out to Javid at the front desk. He was so accommodating and made our stay special. I will definitely return.   Elaine
Manager Response: I'm absolutely thrilled we could make you feel so welcome and well taken care of here, Elaine! Thanks for taking the time to tell us how much you appreciated Javid's hard work -- I'll definitely pass your compliments over his way, and I know he'll be just as excited as I was to hear it. Looking forward to your next visit!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location, although not quite as advertised
Summary: We made the reservation several months ago. Upon arriving, they stated the parking was now a different price -- and at a new $30 per night (valet only!), is a hefty percentage of the cost of the room by itself. The room price was honored though. It is very close to the ocean, but they are not ocean view rooms for the most part. The room size is good, but our room (Seas 5 I think) had an adjoining (locked) door with the room next door -- so there was quite a bit of spoken noise from that room. Bed is comfortable, but the air conditioning is not central, with a window unit cycling on and off all night. The bathroom door does not stay open, so you constantly kick your feet against it. Fixtures are very basic and old -- but you are at the beach! The outdoor stairs are black, but the
Manager Response: So sorry for the confusion regarding our parking situation, Lester. I want to make sure we're always communicating that clearly, and it sounds like we missed that goal this time. Just to explain, we're required to offer valet parking due to the limited space in Laguna, but we do forego charging resort fees to make up for this inconvenience. Still, I'm sorry this wasn't mentioned to you sooner.   I'm also sorry you had some trouble with our stairs. I'll definitely take a look at this so we can rectify the signage here, and I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. I hope we'll have another chance to host you next time you visit Laguna Beach so we can show you the awesome service I know we're capable of.   Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Yes, the hotel has some issues.  For the price we paid, on would think they could include a few small bottles of free water rather than charge $4 for a large one.   It would also be nice to have two bars of soap, one for the sink and one for the shower.  These are the basic amenities one would expect in an above average hotel.   But these deficiencies were made up for by the great view we had from our ocean front room in the Reef building.  Walk down a few steps and you are right on the beach, while you can watch the early morning surfers from your balcony.  Further grief came from a check-in delated 20 minutes after the rather late 4 p.m. standard check-in time, and card keys that were not programmed to open the door.  The manager met these concerns by offering a decent
Manager Response: We're looking forward to having you stay with us again, Lespes, and we're absolutely delighted that our location was conducive to a convenient beach vacation. With that said, it sounds like there were a couple mishaps during your stay. While management was, of course, happy to correct our mistakes, we apologize for any inconvenience. Thank you for your feedback and kind words about our location, view and packages. We'll be looking forward to your next stay with us!  All the best, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Birthday getaway with my husband  and had a great time.We have been there 3 times this year and it's a great getaway with family also.Great location to walk to dinner and shopping.The Deck is a good place to eat,service and margaritas are yummy.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing to celebrate your husband's birthday with us! You both deserved that fantastic experience, and believe me when I say it was a pleasure to show you a great time.  Take care, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great hotel, bit basic but great location on the beach.  Well priced! The bathroom was a bit old and shower was a bit hard to turn on but overall still a great stay. The Deck bar at hotel had great cocktails but service was a bit hit and miss. The hotel staff though were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, Cliff -- it was a pleasure to have you over! Sorry about the little kinks, but I'll definitely be discussing them with the team so we can make some improvements there. Ultimately, I'm glad you enjoyed some wonderful service with us, and I very much hope to welcome you back one day and completely blow you away.   Kind regards, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Pacific Edge is a great get-away for those of us in SoCal.   Excellent restaurants all around & hotel is pet friendly.   Parking is a challenge so use valet.   Drift bar / restaurant is a kick.   Right on the beach.   They have all kinds of toys to rent as well as umbrellas & lounges on the sand which the staff will bring right to you.   Staff is very friendly & willing to always help.   Pool is adequate .
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us -- it was a pleasure to have you over for some relaxation time! I'm glad you enjoyed it all. You certainly deserved that fantastic service.  Hope to see you again one day, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay in the back building for a better view and better rooms
Summary: 3.5 stars, actually but I am grading up, because of the customer service I received upon departure.  My stay honestly was not good. There were many issues that really were not acceptable. And a one star review was well on it's way to being given. HOWEVER, as we were departing, I was asked how our stay was. I asked them if they 'really want to know?" And I was given a sincere "Yes". So, I listed my grievances. A supervisor was called (Todd Metzger), and he politely asked me to repeat them. He was respectful, and attentive to my complaints. At no point did he try to make excuses. He apologized sincerely and told me how he was working on correcting these issues so other guests would not have these same problems or complaints. And he also made sure I left with a smile.  Most
Manager Response: While I'd like to apologize, once again, for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay with us, I'm pleased we were able to help make a positive impact in the end. You deserved so much more than this, and I know we'll be able to show you the kind of stay you deserve the next time you visit.   Kindest regards, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nice place to stay for a night or two. Very close to shopping and dining. We stayed there and saw The Pageant of the Masters.  Great little weekend getaway.  Big room and friendly staff.  Nice bar on site, but very close to other venues.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could welcome you to Laguna this time, Kyle! It's a pleasure to know we made your visit fun, and I'm especially happy you took advantage of our location by exploring some of the downtown spots. Hope The Pageant was incredible and we look forward to having you again sometime!  Best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at other Joie de Vivre hotels that were quite nice. This one is terribly disappointing! Rooms are dank, uninteresting and sad.   Staff is very nice and location is great. That's it. Recommend the management/ownership put some dollars into it. Sadly enough it's sold out because of season so they probably don't see the need.   So glad we will not be spending any time in the room.
Manager Response: First, thanks for the feedback here, Lisa. I'm glad to know you've enjoyed spending time at some Joie de Vivre hotels in the past, and I appreciate you taking the time to let us know how your visit here was.   That said, I want you to know that we're definitely aware that some of our rooms need updating and are continuously making improvements as we've already updated all of our oceanfront rooms.  As I'm sure you can understand, this does take some time when it comes to an operating hotel.  I really hope you'll be willing to come back once we finish our face lift, as we all look forward to making a better impression on you in the future.   Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Actual stay was May 2015, but I can't scroll back that far in time on trip advisor.  My new wife and I stayed here for a few days for a, "pre-honeymoon," since we couldn't afford a proper honeymoon at the time. My coworker recommend this place. So I took her advice and booked a room.   I believe I reserved the Beachfront King Reef Building. The room was very nice. The view of the Ocean and beach was spectacular. We left the window open to the balcony so we hear the ocean waves. The bed  was comfy. The bathroom was nice too. Everything was simply, but clean. In my opinion, the price is definitely worth it!   You are just a staircase away from the beach. Amazing. The neighborhood is nice and quiet. Be wary it's an expensive area, so all the restaurants are pricey. There is only
Manager Response: I'm absolutely thrilled we could help you and your wife celebrate your marriage, Adnan! It's an honor to have hosted you two on your pre-honeymoon, and I'm glad everything about your stay was so awesome -- especially that short walk to the beach. I know when I go on vacation the mark of a great trip is how many steps it takes before my feet hit sand, so I'm happy that was a small number for you two. Hope we'll see you back again sometime! Maybe for an anniversary trip, eh?   Till next time, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: King bed ocean view top floor room 138.  Wonderful ocean view right on the beach. Great room service.  Given view is facing west, air is extremely important for for afternoon sun. The small window air was inadequate and too old to cool room. The air conditioner in the next room faced our balcony. It made so manynoises that it drown out the sound of the waves rolling in.  We complained and the response was we could ask our neighbors to turn off their air. When checking out (our room was $600 per night) the manager said they were aware that the air conditioner need replacement and they hoped to get to them next winter. So beware staying in ocean front!
Manager Response: So sorry to hear you weren't able to enjoy the sound of the waves this time. I know how integral that is to a beach vacation, so I can completely understand what a disappointment that would have been. As our team mentioned, we have taken the steps to address this issue by upgrading out AC units. I know that doesn't change the circumstances of your recent visit, but I sincerely hope you'll be willing to come back and spend some time with us once we get this resolved. I look forward to showing you that every aspect of your stay can be as wonderful as the room service and view you enjoyed this time.   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great location , ocean views and one of the best bar/ restaurants in town.  Perfect Laguna spot to walk around town or just get the free trolley that takes you anywhere.  Also try the Beachwood restaurant attached to the hotel which has a beautiful wood paneled bar with great food too
Manager Response: So glad you enjoyed spending some time with us! I'm always happy when our guests take advantage of our location, so it's really wonderful to hear you had fun walking around Laguna and checking out some of the local flare.   Hope we'll see you again! Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Awful! Worst hotel ever stayed in
Summary: The worst hotel I have ever been to & I have been to a lot. Firstly, there was no elevator to our room which made it hard to carry our suitcases up the stairs. When we arrived in our room we were shocked at how small it was compared to the pictures. Advertised on the beach, it's not our building wasn't on the beach. We had a room facing the street and there was so much noise during night. I wish someone had mentioned this to us because we would've considered something else. We got there quite late (9pm) due to complications with transport and when we went to get food the staff clearly weren't happy with us. On top of this, the food was overly expensive for what it was and we didn't eat there again. We were meant to stay 4 nights however the hotel was so bad that we didn't do
Manager Response: I'm really disappointed we couldn't make a better impression on you this time, Emily. While we are required to offer valet parking due to the limited space available in Laguna Beach, Pacific Edge has chosen to forego charging resort fees in order to make up for this to our guests. I'm sorry if that wasn't explained to you more clearly, but I hope that information will help alleviate some of your frustration there.  Regarding the state of your rooms, I just want to make it clear that cleanliness is absolutely a priority for us, and I'm sorry that wasn't more apparent to you based on your rooms. As far as the decor and furnishings go, we are aware that some of our buildings need to be updated, and I'm excited to say we are actually in that process currently. I hope you'll be willing to return once we get through the face lift so we might show you what our best looks like.   Take care,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Absolutely disgusting hotel, never coming back !!
Summary: Absolutely disgusting hotel, felt very old fashioned outdated, and dirty with very little space. We were in a room of four which first of all was tiny no where near enough room, in addition to this it was advertised as on the beach - our building was the furthest back with a road and a good few buildings in between, on top of which we were facing the road with noisy traffic which kept us awake which was advertised as the 'village rooms'. The first time using the shower it leaked and we had to move rooms away from our friends who were staying in the room next door, plus the fact we had to re pack our clothes and luggage, ruining our first day. Both rooms had a very old feel especially the bathrooms which were of a old dirty cream colour. In addition to this the rooms felt and
Manager Response: I'm sorry  you weren't happy with either of your rooms, Charlotte, and I apologize if you felt we misrepresented our facilities in any way. While it's disappointing to know you weren't impressed with our decor, I am glad we took steps to make it right when we learned you were unsatisfied with the first room. I also want to assure you we clean all of our rooms regularly, but I'll follow up with our team to make sure we're always leaving them spotless.   We are in the process of upgrading some of our buildings, and I hope you'll be willing to return once we get through. I look forward to the opportunity to make a better impression next time you and your family visit Laguna Beach.  All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel was exactly what I needed! It was a 2 bedroom one bath until.  It is located right on the beach and walking distance to shops and restaurants.  The unit had a kitchen with a regular size fridge.  The place was clean.  It is not very fancy but great for a short stay at the beach! I had my mom, dad, nieces and nephews.  They do have valet parking for $20.  The beach is very eroded.  I understand this is a recent occurrence.  The bed was very comfortable!  I would stay there again! Staff very friendly
Manager Response: I'm so happy to hear you and your family had such a wonderful time with us, Diana! From the rooms to the service, it's really great to know that all of it made your visit enjoyable.  Thanks for staying with us and we're all looking forward to hosting your next beach trip!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Poor sick bird in the lobby should be this hotels mascot.
Summary: Birds have had symbolic meaning throughout antiquity and are imbedded in much of the mythology of the world. From Asian Crane to Native American Eagles to the phoenix, birds are part of our folklore and shared culture. When first entering the Pacific Edge and seeing the obviously ill bird in the cage, my 8-year old daughter asked the front desk what was wrong with it. Their response to her was no one knows, her feathers have been that way for about 6 months. My daughter was upset that no one mentioned a vet. This event should have been taken as a harbinger of events to come. After attempting to give us a room different than the one we booked, we were told our room would be ready soon and that we would be on the priority list. Normally when you valet a car at a hotel someone
Manager Response: Eric, as we mentioned in response to your Yelp review, our bird are not ill, and we take care to ensure he gets regular check ups to make sure he's as happy and healthy as can be.   Regarding the rest of your experience, I mentioned having no notes describing your visit, and I did ask for more details so I could follow up on your concerning account. I'd still really like to get that information from you, so please give me a call at 949.281.5701 when you have a moment.   I look forward to straightening this out, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Great location! Hotel is pretty old, so the rooms are pretty out dated. They have a fabulous restaurant on the property. They have a nice beach with awesome chairs and umbrellas. Overall a nice hotel, I would definatly stay here again, but I would request a ocean view on the ocean front next time. I will add this is a petty expensive hotel compared to a lot of the other hotels I've stayed in.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you enjoyed spending some quality beach time with us! There's really not much I like more than taking a book out to one of our chairs and just spending a day reading under an umbrella, and it's really phenomenal to hear you took advantage of that while you were here. We'd love to have you again, and I look forward to seeing what you think of our ocean view rooms!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We got an ocean view room and it was wonderful! We he so much fun hanging at the room, the beach and the deck! This hotel is located by everything, walking distance to down town with all the shopping, bars and restaurants, if you are in town this is great adorable place to stay
Manager Response: Tabs, I'm thrilled you guys enjoyed spending some time with us on your vacation! It's always great when our guests can relax on our beach, and I'm especially proud when our location proves to be convenient for you. Hope we'll get to welcome you back and thanks for the great review!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Incredible Views. Superb Service. A Classic Beach Hotel.
Summary: I found this hotel to be a classic beach hotel experience...sand on the floor of the elevators, salty air in the breezeways and amazing views of the Pacific Ocean.   Front desk staff is friendly, informative, knowledgeable about the area and efficient.  Room was beachfront, balcony view and was spacious and well equipped with fridge, mirrors, desk and closet.  Bathroom is small but perfectly functional with tiled shower and a real window to open for ventilation.  Electronic key card for access and plenty of electrical outlets for devices.  Balcony featured huge door and table and chairs.  There is a Ralphs' grocery store less than a block and a half away and a Taco Bell practically in the parking lot.  Best part is the bar and bar staff...very sharp and attentive.     Only
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could give you the quintessential beach hotel experience this time! It's a joy to know our team could make you feel at home during your stay, and I'm glad you got to spend so much time on the sand. Sorry the mazey layout was a little complex for you, but you're exactly right about the reason behind it. And hopefully you'll be back to spend some more time with us now that you know your way around!  Till then,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: Our family visits every chance we get, but we all come together every summer at least. Rooms with kitchens make life pretty easy for a big family, but tools to cook with are scarce. the beach is where we spend all day every day, so beach service for chairs and umbrellas is important. The guys are friendly and attentive with lounge chairs, towels, etc. Two pools and, guest laundry are nice touches
Manager Response: Glad your family has enjoyed spending part of your summer vacation with us!  It's always great to hear that you were able to use the amenities that we offer.  Thanks for the wonderful comments about the beach guys and  we can't wait for you to come back and visit.    Best,   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for my one night stay at Laguna Beach
Summary: The friendly and very helpful hotel staff helped me get my luggage out of my jammed car trunk on arrival, and gave me a room with a view of the ocean. Likewise, the hotel staff on the beach were also very friendly and helpful (held onto my valuables while I went swimming).  Great semi-private beach.  The Deck restaurant is the place to hang out and have a drink and/or eat in the evening while the sun is setting. The fish tacos were delicious. There was a significant wait to get an outside table, but the time can easily be spent on the beach while waiting (notification by text message).
Manager Response: I'm thrilled we could make you feel welcome and well taken care of here! It's always a joy to know our team did everything they could to make your vacation memorable, and I'm so glad we could be here for you when you needed us -- both while unloading your car and going for a swim. Hope we'll be able to host your next vacation soon!  Till then, Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the pictures.
Summary: We were so excited to stay at the Pacific Edge hotel for our beach vacation as it is right on the ocean, it's website showed beautiful, modern rooms with elegant, but not over the top decor, and its proximity to town.  I thought we snagged a fantastic deal for a village room willing to concede an ocean view -- but not quality of the interior space -- for a great price.    Wow! Was I fooled! Village view doesn't necessarily get you what you see in the pictures!  Perhaps some Village rooms have been updated but not ours.  While the bed was clean and the floor in the bathroom has new tile, I don't know where to begin with the things that were off-putting for a hotel that promotes itself in the manner in which it does.  The carpet was disgusting (I didn't dare allow my clothes, or
Manager Response: I'm so very sorry you weren't happy with your room this time. While I feel that we do a good job of communicating what our guests can expect from a stay here, I am disappointed to know you would disagree. That said, we would have gladly taken steps to make this right for you had we known you were unhappy with your room, and I hope we'll have another chance to show you how dedicated we are to making your vacation spectacular in the future.   All the best,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: The afternoon crew were amazing. They were very helpful and friendly. Very down to earth and personable! Special thanks to Bryan and Kolin for making me feel at home. The valet crew were very nice as well.
Manager Response: I'm thrilled Bryan and Kolin could take such great care of you this time! I'll definitely let them know how much their work is appreciated, and I'm certain they'll be as excited as I am to hear we made you feel at home on your trip.   Looking forward to having you again! Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: $450 a night - you have got to be kidding!!!
Summary: The reviews and photos sounded great, but from the moment we drove up and walked into their lobby which was worn and dirty I got a sinking feeling.  Tiny dated partial ocean view room overlooking the parking lot and other old buildings with the ocean in the distance was enough for us to cancel our second reserved night.  If you have children who want to hang out at the beach, and maybe if you got a full ocean view room it might be acceptable, but I thought for $450it would be something lovely.  Boy was I wrong. We booked a lovely room at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach for our second night only a few miles down the road for  $315 a night including valet parking.  No beach, but so much cleaner, larger and more comfortable.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry we failed to make a great impression on you during your first night here. I know we could have made you feel more than welcome here on our little slice of beach, and I certainly wish we had had the opportunity to do that. It sounds like there may have been a difference in expectations at the heart of this disappointment, and I want to apologize if we failed to communicate in any way. That said, I hope your second evening was wonderful, and we wish you all the best.   Take care,   Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager

Summary: We love the beach front experience that the hotel provided.  It is older but perfect for our needs.  We played at the beach all day and enjoyed sunset views at night.  There is the restaurant next door which was good and right on the sand as well.  The pool is there if you get tired of the waves.  Valet parking made life easy.  The shops and restaurants are all around you.  We have stayed a few times and enjoyed it each time.  We requested a fold out bed for our kids which was a little tired but, they fixed it.  Excellent service there each time as well.  We'll go back soon.
Manager Response: I'm so happy we could make you and your family comfortable each time you've vacationed with us! I always say the highest compliment our guests can pay us is a return visit, and I'm delighted we've been able to play host a few times for you.   Looking forward to next time,  Alex Yi, Assistant General Manager
