That would probably be the only reason I would pick this place.  Between the waves breaking which we absolutely loved listening too and the hideous pump (I
Manager Response: Thanks so much for taking the time to review! I'm happy to hear you enjoyed it overall, but we're sorry to hear there were noises at night that bothered you. Next time, please let us know -- we always want to do what we can to make things right in the moment. Now, if you're ever in the Laguna Beach area again, we'd love to see you!  Many thanks, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I stayed here Lastnight  it was nice but when we booked   it said it was $115 when we got to the hotel we asked the guy where to park he said we could fill the  meter  from 7pm to 8am or pay $27 To use their parking.... why can't  they just give one price.
Manager Response: Thanks for reaching out, but I'm sorry for any confusion. Please know I appreciate your feedback on pricing, and will continue to think about how we can improve it. Now if you're ever in the Laguna Beach area again, we'd love to see you.   Many thanks, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect room, with a perfect view, and perfect staff.
Summary: My fiance and I came to Pacific Edge to celebrate an anniversary. Right when we arrived we were greeted by every staff member we saw. The staff was very friendly. We checked in with Luis and Kim at the front desk which only took a few minutes. We booked a regular room with no ocean view, but since they had a few ocean rooms available, due to the poor weather, Luis upgraded our room to an oceanfront. We were thrilled and so thankful. They even gave us some ocean water taffy, which was delicious. We ended up parking about 4 blocked away because overnight parking was $27/night. When we got to the room we were shocked by the view. The waved were literally crashing under us. No pictures did the room justice. The room was clean, tidy, and comfortable. We slept with the sliding door
Manager Response: Thanks for celebrating with us! So happy to hear that you and your fiance felt at home. Hope to welcome you back again soon, but until then, congratulations!   Regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: No Better View, Beautiful Beach, Family Friendly and Great Room
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during fall break. It was a work trip for me that my family attended with me as they were off on break for the week. I had originally reserved one of their rooms that included a kitchenette and after reading reviews I requested to change my reservation upon check-in for a room against the beach. They have two towers that are beachfront with a full ocean view make sure if this is what you are expecting that you clarify that the room you are booking has a full ocean view and is beachfront. I can't speak to the other rooms but upgrading to this room was the best decision. The balcony of the room hung over the beach below, the view was incredible! We fell asleep to the sound of the ocean every night, my family played at the beach in front of our room everyday
Manager Response: You're right -- there really is no better view! So glad you loved every minute of your stay. We can't wait to welcome you back for another relaxing getaway!  Regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My wife and I just stayed at the Pacific Edge hotel to celebrate our 25th anniversary. I‚Äôm a big fan of staying close enough to the water to hear the waves and that limits the choices in nearby Laguna Beach.   The other true beachfront hotels (Montage, Ritz Carlton, Surf and Sand) all were in the $700 per night range, a little rich for my blood.  My solution was to stay at the Pacific Edge Hotel in a King Oceanfront room.  For our purposes, the hotel was ideal.    The location was fantastic.  RIGHT on the water.  Like being on a boat.  We even got a little spray on our balcony‚Ä¶we were that close to the water.  We saw dolphins one morning and there were always surfers to watch.  The hotel is closely allied with two adjacent beachfront restaurants, The Deck at Laguna and The
Manager Response: What a fantastic celebration! It was a pleasure to be a part of it, and to read your kind words. Looking forward to welcoming you back again -- no matter what the occasion! :)  Warm regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We live in Las Vegas and this is our weekend getaway.  If you stay, the ocean front rooms are the best.  The main reason we stay here is the location.  You are literally on the beach.  The Deck offers great food and cocktails.  We have gotten to know one of the bar tenders and valet knows me by name.
Manager Response: Always happy to see you, Shawn! Thanks for the fantastic review and let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next stay even better.  Can't wait to have you back, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Open air drinks on the deck not available to paying guests
Summary: The view is spectacular and maid service for the room is great.  However the services end there.  We went down to have a drink at "The Deck" and eat at "The Driftwood".  Both mentioned on the web site as part of the hotel accomodations.  The hostess at the Driftwood could not take a reservation because she was still trying to "unscramble things" and she didn't know if there was room so we could check back.  However we were told we could go have a drink down at The Deck and that it was open seating.  We went down, seated ourselves; only to be asked to leave because it was not open seating and we were not on "the list".  We were not asked our name nor our room number so how did they even know we were not on "the list".  We went back to the hotel desk and complained and they were
Manager Response: Sorry about the confusion, Debbi. While I hope that the rest of your visit was wonderful and relaxing, I'll definitely share this with  both teams at our restaurants to discover the cause of the trouble. Thanks for letting me know about this, and I hope we'll have a chance to show you the fantastic service we're known for.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Very cute boutique hotel, great location!
Summary: I believe this is a renovated motel - within the past few years.  They "upgraded" me to a suite when I got there which was a pleasant surprise!  The room was huge!  Had a full kitchen, dining room, living room/bed room.  The balcony was awesome, and it overlooked the one restaurant.  I could see the water from my room, but i wouldn't say it was an ocean view.  Kind of a pain that its valet parking only, but it was OK because everything was in walking distance.  Went to this really cute cafe about a block or 2 away for breakfast.  The only thing that I didn't like is that there was only 1 lock on the door.  I think Laguna is a pretty safe town, but the door was direct access and it would have been nice to have more than 1 lock to feel safer.  The room probably still needed a
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed the upgrade! That really is a lovely view, and of course, you can't beat the proximity to the beach. Thanks for your suggestions, and keep us in mind next time you need a little sun! :)  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: While it tries to be a hip little boutique on the beach, in reality it is little more than a rip-off with minimal improvements, noisy rooms, shotty amenities and hidden charges like $27 for nightly parking that they don't tell you about until check-in.  If they just were up from the about what you're actually getting, then it wouldn't be so disappointing.  D
Manager Response: It's really disappointing that we weren't what you expected, Dexter. Most folks rave about our view and quaint rooms, so I wish you'd had the same experience. I'd like to know more about your stay, specifically, which room you were in and the dates of your visit, so let me know if you want to continue the conversation.  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The crew at Pacific Edge worked really hard to make sure we had a fabulous experience. From Drew at the Valet to Javid who helped us to our room to Luis who made sure we had everything we needed, the experience was top notch. Don't hesitate to book a vacation here!
Manager Response: Wow! So happy to hear how much you enjoyed your stay, and Javid and the rest of our team will be, too. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  Hope to see you soon, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: ... and not much else. Beachfront rooms have a beautiful view, in fact, the ocean waves crash underneath your balcony. Balcony open to all sides, no privacy. Room equipment basic but modern, very comfy beds but no hairdryer, no microwave, extremely small bathroom with no place to put things. Hotel is more motelstyle, outside area could do with a renovation or better cleaning. Not for disabled people as there are stairs to rooms. First hotel ever visited that serves b'fast only from 9am.
Manager Response: Yes, some of our rooms are a bit more basic than others, but we feel that we have a wide range to choose from! Aside from your room, it's good to hear that your stay was lovely. Hope to have you back next time you need a little California sun, Nucita!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I grew up going to the now defunct beach house restaurant (now driftwood kitchen) and always wondered what the dorm looking buildings were that run along side. i finally figured it out (thanks to google maps).  my dream has always been to be the girl on the balcony of the oceanfront room.  when I opened the door to the room tears ran down my face. our room looked exactly like the picture on their website. the ocean is literally right there, maybe 30 feet away. no tall grass to hide your view, just the ocean. when the tide comes in at night it's even closer.  there are 2 different buildings. the reef building is much quieter than the surf building. we've stayed in both. we like the surf building as there is more to see. you can see to main beach and heisler park. people and their
Manager Response: What a powerful image! We're getting a little watery just reading your review. So happy to hear that you loved every second of your stay -- and of course, soaking in that gorgeous view. We can't wait to have you back again next year!  Thanks for the love, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Cool, funky rooms with great proximity to beach life. Luis and Javid run the desk at night and totally took care of me when I had a last minute reservation. Luis recognized me from a previous visit and hooked me up with a great ocean view room. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Sounds like you felt right at home! Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun.   Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel for a one night stay in hopes of a nice quiet boutique hotel! Boy was I surprised. I have to give their marketing and website people some credit for presenting a very beautiful picture of their hotel as well as highlighting probably their best room to show as an example. This is nothing more than what appears to be a "re-purposed Motel 6"  We booked a queen room and got what looked like a full bed, a smelly room with a 70's looking kitchenette and barely there bathroom.  We also had a door that connected to the adjacent room and while it was not open we could hear everything next door (loud screaming child!). In addition, the rooms were located next to an alley which I suppose trash pick up was happening on the morning we stayed so awoke to the wonderful
Manager Response: We're so sorry the noise from the alley and the room next door woke you up, Lucy! I completely understand how frustrating that must have been, and I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. While we certainly want all of our guests to be able to be able to relax, we hope you can understand that some circumstances are beyond our control. As for our prices, we do feel they are competitive for the area, but we'll be sure to keep your feedback about the decor in mind. Should you come back and see us in the future, we feel sure you'll be more impressed all around!  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: So I had a work trip that I turned into a mini vacation as well. My 15 year old daughter came along with me so we could visit aunts and uncles in Laguna woods. Staff was extremely welcoming. Valet was quick and professional and courteous. The only negative I had isn't really a negative. The restaurant is so popular that there was always a wait. So make reservations because otherwise you wait a while. The beach attendants were great. They setup chairs and umbrellas and everything. Checked on us multiple times. A stay here is well worth it.
Manager Response: Work trips that turn into mini-vacations are always the best! Thanks for letting us know you had such a nice time. Sorry to hear the restaurant was so busy, though, but I'm very happy you were able to try it out!  Hope to have you back for more not-quite-work trips in the future.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is awesome! I love how convenient this hotel is to the beach, restaurants, and shops! Driftwood restaurant is right behind the hotel room and faces the beach. Jack gladly provided us a beach umbrella, lounge chairs, and beach towels. Thanks for the great customer service.
Manager Response: Glad you had such an awesome stay with us -- convenience is always key to a relaxing vacation! It sounds like you enjoyed a lovely visit from start to finish, and I can't wait to share the great feedback with the rest of the team. Hurry back to see us!  All the best, Thomas Lee, General Manager

Summary: I picked this hotel based on location first and price second.  I wanted to be right on the beach. This hotel is broken up into 4 buildings plus the lobby with a small street in between. I splurged and chose to stay in the surf wing with an ocean view. I had a room on the 4th floor which is the top floor. (Room 704) This is one of the remodeled rooms. The room had a very comfortable king bed, minibar, coffee maker, small sink, flat screen TV, free Wi-Fi, ample desk & drawer space. The bathroom was small with a shower. The balcony had a table & 2 wicker chairs perfect to view the beach below & the evening sunset. The price was more than I usually spend but was the best value in Laguna Beach and the location just can't be beat.  There are plenty of shops, galleries and restaurants
Manager Response: Thanks for all your feedback, Michelle! Like you said, we're an older property -- but we'd never want that to keep you from enjoying all that our beautiful area has to offer! I'm glad to hear that you could enjoy the beautiful views and our proximity to the beach. I hope you'll come back and see us again someday!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a beachfront room, which was right above the sand and had beautiful views of the Pacific from the balcony. It was just stunning. However, we felt our stay was of poor value -- I think the price reflects the amazing location alone -- and will likely not stay here again.   Pros: The views from the beachfront room were amazing and it was great to have a small balcony with a table and chairs to enjoy the views. The beach is just steps away.  The breakfast served at the restaurant was delicious and it had a nice atmosphere.  The front desk and housekeeping staff were helpful.  Cons: While the room was clean, it was basic, sparsely decorated and had the feel of a less expensive motel room. The bathroom was very small with only a shower (no tub). However, there was a
Manager Response: I'm sorry that some of the other guests caused you some frustration. We want every single guest to be able to relax and enjoy their stay, and we try our very best to meet the needs of everyone involved in a situation like the one you describe. That said, boisterous guests who are just having fun and not endangering themselves or anyone else are sometimes part and parcel of being a sought-out vacation spot! Hopefully they didn't put too much of a damper on your own beach getaway.  As for our prices, we feel that they're quite affordable for our location, but I can definitely keep your comments on the decor in mind looking forward. Thanks for your feedback -- I hope we'll have the chance to earn those last two stars someday!  Sincerely, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Cozy two night stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: This is our third trip to the Pacific Edge Hotel in Laguna and each time it's been perfect.  The weather ... the location ... the easy access to the beach ... and little extras like valet parking and $20 to The Deck, their outside caf√©/bar, and the friendliest and helpful front desk staff.  Would love to come back and stay longer next time.  The staff even sent a complimentary bottle of wine for my birthday ... what's not to love about this wonderful hotel!!
Manager Response: Thanks for always coming back to see us, Debi! I'm so glad we could help make your birthday a special one. Celebrating with some wine, sun, and sand? Sounds pretty perfect to me!  'Til next time, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is wonderful! Spent 3 nights there last week and couldn't have been more pleased. The entire staff is very friendly, the rooms are great and the ocean view amazing. We stayed on the top floor, farthest north room.  Darin, who works on the beach was great and Bobby, our waiter for breakfast at the Driftwood Kitchen next door was the best! We can't wait to go back, it's the perfect spot and reasonably priced!
Manager Response: Heidi, I'm thrilled to read how much you enjoyed your stay! I'll definitely pass your compliments along to Darin and Bobby -- they'll love hearing how much you appreciated their hard work. Thanks so much for sharing your kind words -- I hope we'll see you the next time you're in town!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Our room was in the building on PCH (room 11) but it was quiet and we could see the ocean and hear the surf from our balcony. Worth it.  The kitchenette was nice but we ate out most meals. Ralph's is very close and good for having food in the room.  The bathroom was spacious. The shower/bathtub was small but had a great shower head.  The room itself was large with a nice sitting area. It was really more than we needed for 2 people. The furniture was a little on the beat up side of things but the bed was comfortable.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: This is so great! I'm so happy that you enjoyed your stay and got to explore Laguna Beach. The sight of the ocean still sometimes gets me, so I'm really glad you were able to see it from your room. Looking forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Take care, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Dated but very functional. Great staff!!!
Summary: Stayed in two rooms last minute with three adults and an infant. Reasonably priced, clean and the staff was over the top. The hotel is a little dated on the road side, nicer on the beach side. Our room above the office was very big and had a nice view. Our roadside room was small but clean and comfy. Two nice pools and a hot tub. The beach is perfect and they provide umbrellas, chairs and some beach toys all free. The restaurant was above average and the deck bar was great. Nothing negative I can think of except the parking. You must use valet, it's expensive and a hassle to get your keys every time you need them. But valet staff is very accommodating. Great family hotel.
Manager Response: Sounds like a great trip to the beach! Thanks for making us a part of it, Don. Hope to have you back again next year.  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: So amazing, we went back again!
Summary: Our first time to Laguna Beach in January we randomly selected this hotel. PHENOMENAL! Staff was SO nice and attentive, the view was breathtaking and it was a perfect central location with walking distance to shops and restaurants. Our first night there we had a couple next to us that got into an altercation. We called the front desk and they checked on the room. When that didn't quiet them down and we had to call again, they sent security right away. The noise stopped after that.   We came back to visit again in April and had the exact same experiences. Even had the room right next to our first room. We know there are many beach front options, but we would HIGHLY recommend this one.
Manager Response: Thanks so much, Cara! We hope we'll get to welcome you back in a few more months. Nothing like summertime at the beach! :)  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Wanted to stay on the beach & not spend a ton and this fit the bill.  My 3 yr old enjoyed the beach then the pool then back to the beach.  Our view of the beach from our balcony was spectacular.  Great staff of people.  Both restaurants blew us away.  Food, service, view...all amazing!!  Will definately come back!
Manager Response: Perfect! We can't wait to welcome you back next time you and your family need a little sun!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful Beach Bungalow and breath taking views
Summary: The Pacific Edge is the perfect beach getaway.  The rooms are of high quality and reflective on Sothern California atmosphere.  The name of the hotel is spot on.  Located right on the Pacific Edge, as a guest, you can enjoy all beach activities.  Relaxing, surfing, paddle boarding, local ecological exploration, whale watching and the most beautiful sunset are all readily available at the hotel.  Dinning at the two on site restaurants are not to be missed.  Most importantly the service was exceptional and know how to treat a guest.  Located in the heart of Laguna everything is in walking distance. Thank you and I look forward in a return visit soon!
Manager Response: You know how to vacation, Nicole! Thanks so much for spending your time of with us -- there's no better compliment. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We stayed here one night because everything else was booked. The website photos look so much better than the reality. It's basically a cheap motel with fresh paint and no love put in to the rooms and fixtures. Our room felt a bit dingy and overlooked the parking lot and walkway with blackout curtains only for any privacy.  The pool areas were dirty, next to the highway and parking lot, with used towels everywhere and no fresh ones. The front desk service was very friendly and welcoming however.  I wouldn't go back though. It is way overpriced for what you get compared to other hotels in the area.
Manager Response: I'm sorry you were disappointed, Elle. For our location, we feel that our prices are actually quite affordable, but we will certainly keep your feedback regarding our appearance in mind for our future guests. Thank you, and don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this further.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Our stay at Pacific edge hotel
Summary: My friend and I stayed the night at pacific edge and had a great time . We had breakfast at Driftwood kitchen and Dale our server was very friendly and attentive . Checking out our valet attendant Drew was helpful and friendly as well . The staff here made us feel at home , we love the Deck .
Manager Response: Sounds perfect! Thanks for vacationing with us, and for the great review. Can't wait to have you back again!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This is my absolute favorite beach spot to vacation. The hotel is beautiful, quaint, well decorated, comfortable, and exactly what I need! They accomodate my puppy without any dog fees and even have treats waiting for her in the room when we arrive! The beachfront rooms are so adorable and have beautiful views. The sound of the ocean lulls us to sleep at night and wakes us in the morning! The on-property dining options are so delicious we rarely leave to dine elsewhere although it's certainly not hard since we are walking distance to everything! We never have to use our car when we are there and enjoy walking on the beach everywhere we need to go. I miss it already and can't wait to visit again soon!
Manager Response: Always  happy to make our furry friends feel welcome, too, Katie! Thanks for the wonderful review. Can't wait to have you back!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: first off this property is one of the nicest locations imaginable. just amazing. the staff is helpful and very happy, the customer service at Pacific Edge is at a 10. the best advice is pay for ocean front. you can hear the ocean all night long. this place is very well maintained and cared for. close the so many shopping and restaurants you don't even need a car. and be aware the parking is $27 a day. but don't let that be a deal breaker. you will love your stay at Pacific Edge
Manager Response: Sounds like a wonderful trip! It was a pleasure to be a part of it, David. Let us know if there's anything else we can do to make your next visit even more memorable.  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We stayed last November, so apologies for the late review.  We were staying in the Reef Tower and our first sight of the view was at high tide.  Felt as though we were on a boat as from the door we could only see the ocean through the window!  Clean room with fridge, coffee machine, extremely comfortable bed and the best views ever.  I want to live here.  If you are in California and are staying in Laguna this is a great place to stay - really does have a relaxed, beachy vibe - that is the whole point of the place!  We stayed a week and loved every second! Only negative - $27 a day for valet parking in the empty car park.  We got a ticket avoiding this as we parked facing the wrong direction in a side street and a friendly local (!) took photos and called the police!
Manager Response: No worries, Tracy, we're just glad you're still savoring the memories of your trip! :) Thank you for the lovely review. Can't wait to welcome you back next time you need a little California sun!  Regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Four adults, long time friends, spent a night, in March, at the Pacific Edge in Laguna Beach.  The location can't be beat. The property is right on the ocean and a block from the main town.  Our two rooms were 131 & 133 in the Reef Tower.  These were ocean front rooms with a balcony.  We left our balcony door open at night and it was wonderful hearing the waves lull us to sleep.  Its a four story building and our rooms were on the 2nd floor, which was at parking lot level, so no need for stairs.  The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished.  Room 131 room and bathroom was a little larger than room 133.  Each room had 2 queen beds.  We had breakfast in the Driftwood Kitchen, this too was oceanfront.  The food was very good and lots of it!  The staff, front desk, and valet were
Manager Response: Is there anything more relaxing than the sound of the waves? What a lovely review, Carolyn -- thanks so much for leaving it. We can't wait to welcome back you and your spouses for another rejuvenating visit!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Disappointing Rooms...Felt more like a Motel than a Hotel
Summary: We were very excited about our upcoming stay at the Pacific Edge Hotel.  Unfortunately, our room was unacceptable for us to stay in at the hotel.  The room was rundown and looked nothing like the photo on the Pacific Edge Hotel website.   The staff was very apologetic about our room and did their best to be helpful to our family.  We ended up checking out of the hotel an hour later and driving back to Los Angeles.  The Pacific Edge felt more like a motel than a hotel.  I would also note that Tripadvisor should include an area on their review lists that depicts hotels as luxury, upscale, moderate and budget.
Manager Response: While I'm glad that our team made you feel at home, I'm sorry that you weren't as happy with your room. We are continuously making the necessary updates, but we feel that our beach-side location makes the experience an unforgettable one. We hope to have another chance to wow you soon, but until then, thank you for your candor.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: What a blast!  Great staff and great location.  Will definitely be back next year!
Summary: My wife, daughter and I had a fantastic trip at the Pacific Edge Hotel.  We live in Dallas, but my wife is from the Laguna Beach area and I am from LA  - so we felt like tourists in our home town.  The hotel is in a great central location within walking distance of a ton of great spots.  While I am sure not all rooms are created equal, we stayed in the Reef Building on the top floor in the corner- Rm 134.  The view was incredible - right on the sand with the water at the bottom of the bluff at high tide.    All of the staff was great.  Always friendly and accommodating - but 2 people stand out.  Drew in the valet lot was always very cheerful, helpful, thoughtful and most importantly kind to my wife and daughter.  A very classy guy.  And Graciela, who took care of our room, a
Manager Response: Glad we could give you a taste of California life! Sounds like the whole family had a blast, Matthew, and I couldn't be happier to hear that. We can't wait to welcome you back next time you need to get away!  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Can't beat the location, right on the beach and you get to enjoy the sun in the private beach.  The price is "affordable" given the location.   Friendly staff.  Valley parking only but not a big deal since we spend all day on the beach anyway and everything is withing walking distance.  Definitely will come back again.
Manager Response: We can't wait to have you back again, Kim! Thanks for reviewing us.  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, nice location, a bit noisy
Summary: This is an older building; the rooms are not greatly soundproofed and feel a bit run down.  I'm a budget traveler and chose the cheapest rooms, which are on the road-side versus beach-side - so lots of noise from cars as well.  But the aircondition/fan unit made it quiet enough, and for the area, it is reasonably priced (valet parking adds to the cost).  Staff are very friendly and helpful.  I'd stay there again, as I hate driving in this area; the location makes it great to walk to lots at Laguna Beach
Manager Response: Thanks for that feedback! While we're glad you enjoyed your trip, we're sorry if you were a bit disappointed with your room. But, we hope that our proximity to the beach and our location within town made up for it. Thanks again, and we hope to have you back soon!  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Me and my friend were on a road trip passing through Laguna beach and decided wanted to stay couple of nights. After asking around for prices, the Pacific edge came the most appealing from them all. The staff were great Luis and Javid did there uttermost to help us and provide us with the best service. Hotel is clean and brilliant with own private beach. Will deffinitly stay again.
Manager Response: What a lovely stay! Thank you for reviewing us, and for the shout out to our team: we'll make sure they see it. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun, Jacques! :)  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My friend and I spent 3 days hiking from San Clemente toNewport Beach, stopping at 3 hotels along the way. The Pacific Edge was, by far the best. The friendliness and their willingness to make our experience wonderful was above and beyond, especially Amanda and Madison. We were upgraded to the Villa from our standard oceanfront room, and after recovering from the shock of this immense, lovely property we enjoyed our wine on the balcony steps from the ocean. I can't wait to bring my husband to this wonderful hotel!
Manager Response: Wine on a balcony overlooking a beach -- you really know how to live! :) Thanks for spending the day with us, and for the lovely review. Hope to see you again very soon!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing Staff, Amazing Hotel and Amazing Place...!!!
Summary: My wife and I have been coming here for years, (I also asked her to marry me there :) Every time we come here we always stay in the ocean front rooms. One of the reasons we love staying here is because it is so close to everything downtown. In a short quick walk your are surrounded with great restaurants and amazing art. There is a place right next door called "The Deck". The have the best food and most amazing views. You can always expect a clean room and a smile when you check in and check out...but you wont want to leave.  I wanted to also take a second to recognize the house keeping staff, especially Rafaela!!! I saw her every morning when I got up early to go and get coffee and she would always ask me if there was anything that she could do to make our stay better, also had
Manager Response: So many beautiful memories! It has been a pleasure to be a part of them, and we can't wait to make more with you. Until next time, thank you for the lovely review. It made our day!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I stayed in a "Beachfront One King Bed Surf" room several weeks ago. While the hotel's location is very good, the rooms and general property vibe are very much on the level of a roadside motel.  Particularly disappointing to me was the large air gap below the door to my room. This dramatically reduces the sense of privacy in the room. Lying in bed, I was disrupted at all hours by the sound of people coming and going in the adjoining rooms, loud conversations in the hallway, door slams, etc.   Along these same lines, the interior convenience door to the next room (unused by me, which I kept closed and locked) is not very soundproof. I could hear my neighbors' TV and conversations fairly clearly.  Finally, my balcony looked over the hotel's beachfront party area, reserved for the
Manager Response: That's useful feedback, so thank you for leaving it. We understand your concerns and suggest calling to ensure that your room will be a quiet one, as we do have that option as well. In the meantime, we'll do our best to ensure our customers are happy with their stay.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The location is right next to the main drag in Laguna, and you can walk to all the shops and restaurants. The staff that we encountered were very friendly. The product is what dragged down the review. The room itself is very similar to what you would find in a motel. The bathrooms were very outdated, and extremely worn. Drapes don't cover the windows. It does the job for a night one stay, could be rough for longer.
Manager Response: We're sorry you weren't impressed with your room, but we hope that our beach-side location helped you relax. Thanks for your feedback -- we'll certainly keep it in mind as we work to become even better for our guests.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent staff but be aware what you are reserving
Summary: The most outstanding staff I have seen in quite some time. Always friendly and courteous and responsive to requests.   On the flip side, the room I thought I reserved was not what I got. The pictures on the website lead you to think all the rooms are facing the ocean and balconies come with them! Not so..if you book a great rate PLEASE PLEASE call the hotel and ask exactly what the view is from your room and whether you are facing the ocean without a building in front of you. My room faced the street, was super small, hard bed, tiny shower only, came with ear plugs (hint:noise from street and people staying in rooms above/beside you). Only time I heard the ocean was when I was in front of it. Management needs to clarify room descriptions a great deal so people don't feel taken
Manager Response: I'm sorry we weren't quite what you were expecting, Steph, but I really appreciate that feedback. We hope to have another chance to knock it out of the park for you next time you need to get away. Until then, thanks for your candor.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Our room above the beach, 504, was perfect for a weekend away with my wife, and without the kids. All of Laguna Beach is within a comfortable walking distance. The view was fabulous. We enjoyed relaxing on our room's balcony and watching the people, dolphins, whales, and sunsets.
Manager Response: Dolphins and whales? You hit the jackpot, Michael! Thanks for staying with us. Hope to have you back soon!  Take care, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel in a beautiful location
Summary: We did not have the highest expectations for the "ocean view room" we'd booked, knowing hotels often overstate the scene. Our room, however, set the bar to new heights. It was lovely: beautifully furnished, large comfortable bed, wooden floor and new carpet, and a floor to ceiling sliding door leading to our private patio which was surrounded by a low clear wall. This was perfect since the beach was directly below us. In fact, when the tide was in, the waves crashed under our patio deck. The 160 degree views of the ocean and coastline were incomparable. The bathroom was small, but clean. The Keurig and mini-fridge were appreciated. The hotel setting outside the room is funky, befitting the Laguna location, but it's clean and quiet. The staff was the icing on the cake: Rafaela,
Manager Response: 160 degree views -- yes! Now that's a vacation. Thanks for making us a part of it, and for shouting out our team. I'll share this with them right away!   Come back and see us soon, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I met Luis the 1st time I stayed here. He provided excellent customer service. Now every time I come to Orange County on business, Pacific edge is my 1st choice to stay at. Luis, Javid, and Zach are the 3 guys I've dealt with and all 3 provided excellent service. I highly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Luis, Javid and Zach really do make us smile! Thanks for the fantastic review. We can't wait to have you back again!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: The Pacific Edge is truly our home away from home that we stay at least 3 times a year!
Summary: Just leave the car keys with valet, you will not being needing them again until you depart! The Pacific Edge is truly our home away from home that we stay at least 3 times a year. Extremely friendly staff, family or couples oriented, well maintained, very convenient and beautiful location. It has the most spectacular breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and colorful sunsets right off your balcony. The friendliest and most accommodating GM and staff that you will ever meet!  A TRUE BEACHFRONT Hotel with beachfront rooms and plenty to do within walking distance including: tons of restaurants, shopping, art, bars and nightlife.  After nearly 40 years of staying here; it is still our favorite place in the world to visit, and we have been to many Caribbean and Mexico destinations.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for making so many memories with us, Marie! Forty years of lovely vacations just means the world to us. We can't wait to have you back again, but until then, thank you for the fantastic review. It made our day!   Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Funky hotel; great location; double-check your reservations
Summary: I took my two daughters (ages 18 and 21) for a long weekend at Pacific Edge.  Great location, right on the beach, within walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  Paid a little more for a room overlooking the Pacific, and glad I did, as it had a balcony and we spent quite a bit of time on the balcony talking and enjoying the view.  The only complaint is that I booked a room through Rocketmiles and specifically requested ocean view/two queen beds, as there were 3 of us in the room.  When we checked in, they had booked us in a one King bed room.  No other options available.  So we had to get a rollaway.  Bummer.  Don't know if the problem was with Rocketmiles or Pacific Edge, but I'd just recommend that if you book through a 3rd party, to call Pacific Edge afterward to
Manager Response: We're sorry, Jennifer. We do our best to honor all guest requests, but we try to always offer an alternative if we cannot. We hope you were still comfortable, and that you and your daughters had a lovely time. Looking forward to your next visit!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: First off I have to mention Luis, this guy made the trip amazing, the 90 degree weather helped, but he went out of his way to make our anniversary trip amazing. I called ahead and when I arrived he had a great corner room waiting for me. I grabbed my wife a little later in the day and we had dinner at The Deck, delicious. We spent saturday and sunday on the beach, the hotel has chairs, towels, umbrellas all ready to go for you. I can't wait to go back, but once again I must thank Luis for his professionalism and attention to detail.
Manager Response: Pleasure to have you here! Thanks for celebrating with us, and for the lovely review. We'll pass it on to Luis right away!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Great place to stay and walk to everywhere. Our room house keeper Ruafalia is the best So friendly and always wanting to help. Goes out of her way for you. Ben is great providing chairs and towels on the sandy beach. Bryan at the front desk was pleasant and very helpful.we love the hotel's relaxed atmosphere and vibe. Only complaint is the The Deck Restaurant is always so busy and crowded. The bar tenders work hard and fast and it shows they are a bit strained, by not making walk ups feel very welcome. The order to go we placed messed up and we had to call to have them bring the rest to our room. Management was very good about it once we were able to get to them to explain. We will go back to this hotel!!
Manager Response: Rafaela really is the best, and we'll be sure to share this with her! Thank you so much for your feedback, Darla, and for letting us know about your experience with The Deck. We'll discus it with them right away and we hope your next visit is even better!  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Love this place!!! The staff is always so friendly & helpful! Thank you Luis & Zach for all your help in making difficult day of travel less painful.  I truly appreciate all you did for me!  Can't wait to bring the kids back again.  Also thanks Bryan for giving me all the advice on rooms for my future visits with the kids.  We can't wait to come back as a family.  This was a solo visit but have stayed 3 other times with the family and always have the best time.  We truly love this place!   Great location, amazing staff, fair price, clean rooms with great amenities for kids.  Only wish the deluxe rooms had a futon for kids :-)
Manager Response: Thank you, Erica! We can't wait for your next visit, but until then, let us know if there's anything we can do to make it even more memorable!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Pros of this hotel are first and foremost, location. You are right on the beach or facing the pool or street and you are in walking distance to the entire town of laguna beach. The second pro is having two restaurants right there on the beach to choose from. The Deck is better. Great food at reasonable prices literally overlooking the beach. Another plus about being right on the beach is there is an attendant there who will put out your lounge chairs and umbrella so no need to drag your own umbrella and chairs. There are two slightly heated pools but I preferred the jacuzzi. The in room towels are thick and soft and the bedding is wonderful. I loved the beds! Be sure to use the earplugs they provide if you are on the street side. To me this is a perfect place for a weekend
Manager Response: Sounds like a fantastic vacation! Thanks for making us a part of all your Laguna Beach fun. Keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: So little sleep in heart of Laguna Beach
Summary: The hotel is in a great location, except that it is a refurbished 1960s era motel right on Pacific Coast Highway. My room faced PCH and I wasn't surprised they provided earplugs. Little did I know that even with earplugs I would hear my neighbor get up at 4:30 to shower and then listen to the morning news. I could hear the stories as though the television were on in my room. The rooms on the ocean side of the hotel may be better insulated. My room also seemed a little worn out. I couldn't help but compare to hotel in Santa Cruz with the ingenious wood floors and think how smart that is for a beach hotel.  Other parts of the hotel were nicely detailed. The pool is beautifully maintained. The reception area is pleasant with a great waiting area. The valet service was responsive.
Manager Response: We're so sorry for the noise, Julie. Of course, different days will have a different noise level, but we hope that our location alongside the beach can make up for it. Still, we'll keep your thoughts in mind for our future guests, and we hope to have another chance to impress you next time you need to get away.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This is my third time staying at this hotel. The previous time I stayed here was managed by a different company. Joie de Vivre hotels did an incredible job on upgrading the hotel. Though I got a travelzoo deal, the staff treated me with the same level of great service. I was greeted by a bottle of red wine upon my arrival for being a Joie de Vivre member which was awesome.   I booked a two-night stay at the ocean front room. The room was upgraded with beautiful  decor and a comfortable modern chaise chair. Very clean and extremely comfortable. The view from the balcony was hands down the best part of the hotel. You could easily walk down the beach within 20 steps. The hotel also provided you with lounge chairs and towels for your own use at no additional cost. Staff on site was
Manager Response: You're right -- it's hard to beat a view like that! So glad you enjoyed yourself, and that our team made you feel at home. You've received your ID and credit card by now, right?  Looking forward to your next visit, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We had a great time all office staff we were very Helpful and cleaning staff was on top of everything if we needed something we were tended to right away we are looking forward to our next Visit during the summer
Manager Response: Thank you for making us a part of your special day! We can't wait to have you back later this year.  Warm regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't Beat the Location of this Boutique Hotel in Paradise
Summary: Enjoyed a Stay-cation here in February, booked a beach front room with a gorgeous view off TravelZoo for 1/2 price! What a great deal, I already want to go back. I live 30 minutes away and frequent The Deck Restaurant next door. When eating there I always wondered about this Pacific Edge hotel. Well now I have first hand experience. I was right on the sand in a beach front room, the crashing waves were so loud it woke me up a few times! But then I realized it was the soothing sound of waves and fell back to sleep. If you can afford the view rooms I highly recommend it. However if you can't it's okay, the beach is right there and the hotel provides beach chairs, towel and umbrellas at no charge. So really I didn't spend that much time in my room because I was on the beach or at
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to share your story, Joyce! We can't wait to welcome you back next time you need to get away. Until then, let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next visit even better.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Location is what is amazing but the staff make it a complete package of perfection! My friend and I have stressful jobs and we visit the Pacific Edge 2-3 times a year for several days each time. We can really get away from it all and be treated so well. Sometimes we don't even leave the room much. Just sit on the ocean front balcony and stare at that magnificent ocean. Nothing like falling asleep to the sound of the waves crashing right under your room. Treat yourself to an ocean front room. Thank you to all the staff who make our stay so pleasant every time. Headed back in a week. Yay!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Sounds like you and your friend really know how to relax! Glad we could help you get away from it all, Meg, and we look forward to welcoming you both back again soon. Til then, thank you for the rave review!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I will always remember the kindness and compassion we received at pacfic edge on one of the saddest days of my life. I lost my mom the day we checked in it happened so unexpected. Brian and James were at the front desk when we arrived. They could clearly see I was upset and asked me if I was ok. Not knowing my mom had past yet I said I think I just might have lost my mom. They both just looked at each other and said how sorry they were. In that moment they upgraded us to probably the most amazing room in the hotel we were floored to say the least. I can't tell you how nice it was to be in such a beautiful surrounding finding out my mom was gone. I will always remember their kindness and sympathy. I have been coming to this hotel when it was the former vacation village what great
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry for your loss, and we hope that you were able to revisit many happy memories of your mother while you were with us. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your story. We wish you and yours the very best.  Warm regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We just got back from another great stay at the Pacific Edge. The valet staff was always welcoming and friendly every time we needed their service. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. Our room was very clean and tidy, and my husband and I are quite particular when it comes to cleanliness! Finally, the location is perfect; right on the beach and close to everything! We'll definitely be back soon!
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to welcome you to Laguna Beach, Suzie! Thanks for taking the time to review us, and please keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I read the reviews online and many people mentioned the location, but, wow, they understated it. First of all, if you've never been to Laguna Beach (I hadn't), this is a little piece of paradise. The hotels are wonderful, the shops are ideal, the beachfront is clean and beautiful and just what you would picture if you booked a place on a beach in California. I paid extra to have an oceanfront room ($280 for the night), but decided to do so as a treat for my kids. Even though it was cold and windy, it was still worth the extra cost to sit on the balcony wrapped in a blanket at sunset. The room was small (which a lot of people mentioned) but my family fit just fine. One of my kids even slept on the floor and there was plenty of room. The fee to drive the car 15 yards was
Manager Response: What a lovely family getaway! Thanks for making us a part of it, Sheri. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun.  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Right on the main highway , overlooking the Pacific Ocean (most of the hotel)  is the Pacific Edge Hotel ( a joie de Vivre property) Comfortable rooms, nice in room amenities.Parking was a bit confusing. Close to downtown Laguna each (you can walk along the beach)
Manager Response: We can't think of a better way to relax! Thank you for the lovely review, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little sunshine.  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice location but website is deceiving
Summary: Back side of the hotel located on the Beach. Front side faces very noisy traffic. After first night I spoke to the front desk. Their website said you can "hear the ocean" from your room. Told her all I could hear was traffic. I was moved to a poolside room with bathroom window that when you open it, you can hear the waves. Beach front rooms are an additional $125/NT. Good to know, right?
Manager Response: Glad we were able to get you into a new room! Thanks for sharing your experience with us -- it'll only make us better. We hope to have another chance to show you a five-star vacation soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: You can understand the physical attributes of this property from other reviews. There is no disputing that the location is breathtaking and the restaurant and bar are fresh and charming . I would like to emphasize how the staff makes this place unique.  My daughter and I spent the previous week visiting luxury hotels coming down the CA coast.  While booking our adventure I was concerned that our final nights (Laguna being our last stop)  might not be equal to our other accommodations.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Though this hotel may not be super-plush and some wear and tear is evident ... NO other place on our journey made us feel as welcome, appreciated, and comfortable. I wish I could state everyone's name, but from the front desk to the valet staff, to the
Manager Response: Wow, it truly puts a smile on my face to read your compliments about our staff! They're so kind, so I'll be sure to share this with the entire team. While I wish your stay was longer as well, that just means you'll have to come back for another visit, right?  Until next time, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Luis is over the top professional, helpful and courteous.  great lovely hotel with fabulous beach.  Very nice place and people.  you will love it.  Third stay and will come again.  very cooly decorated and super clean too.
Manager Response: It's so great to hear that you had another lovely stay with us! Thank you so much for taking the time to leave such an awesome review. Looking forward to having you back again soon!   All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Location, Location, and Location....and noisy guests
Summary: We spent four nights here. We took a beachfront King room in the Surf complex.  The room was spacious, clean, and attractive. Nice bed and nice bathroom - with shower, but no tub. The carpet looked like it had seen a lot of traffic. Nice Keurig coffeemaker with complimentary K-cups.  The hotel is very close to downtown Laguna Beach. We walked everywhere. The Surf building is one laneway west of the main drag, so traffic noise was not an issue. The beach was right outside our balcony, and the view was awesome. There is a private staircase from the Surf building to the beach.   Right at the corner on the main drag, we found a very well equipped supermarket - Ralph's - with a great selection of wine and beer, and the Orange Inn, which is probably the nicest quick breakfast/lunch
Manager Response: Thanks for reviewing us! While it sounds like you really did enjoy your time in Laguna Beach, it's upsetting that we couldn't do more to quiet that rowdy party. We understand that this can be frustrating, but we hope it wasn't distracting enough to detract from your relaxing stay. That said, we'll certainly keep this in mind for the future and we hope to have another chance to show you a five star visit soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Incredible warmth and attention to detail
Summary: This hotel is situated perfectly on a pristine beach, within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, galleries and anything else you could possibly need. There is no need to go anywhere else when planning a beach vacation. With a saline pool which is kept warm enough for even small children to enjoy, a giant hot tub and rooms well-equipped, clean, bright, and modern (but not luxurious), this is a perfect spot for a family holiday.  The front desk staff, particularly Madison, is so helpful, creative and flexible. We just celebrated our daughter's birthday in one of their beach front cabanas, and it was the best celebration we could have imagined on every level.  Stay here! Rent a cabana here! But don't tell too many people because then we'll never get in and they'll raise
Manager Response: You're too kind, Cindy! Thank you for making us a part of your daughter's celebration, and for singing Madison's praises. We can't wait to welcome all of you back next time you need to unwind!  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Had a great one night stay here, really great. The staff is on point, restaurant is great - deck is amazing. love the place overall. other hotels should observe this hotel to see how things are done. Also the internet worked well which is not usually the case in small hotels.
Manager Response: Wow, Brad! Sound like a fantastic time. Thanks for getting away with us, and please let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next visit even more special.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Pac Edge this past weekend for a girls trip getaway.  The Location is PERFECT... 1 minute walk from the beach and close to a bunch of great shops and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful!   Big thanks to Ben on the beach for setting us up with towels and lounge chairs... Javid for giving me water when I came back from a run...  Brian for helping with our bags and Madison for informing me when our room was ready!    Driftwood Kitchen and The Deck were fantastic dining options for lunch, afternoon, cocktails, and Dinner.  Thanks for a great weekend!
Manager Response: So glad you and your friends enjoyed yourself, Meg! Thank you for making us a part of your weekend, and for the rave review. Hope we'll get to have all of you back again next year!  Take care,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Just visiting from Connecticut on vacation found the perfect spot in Laguna beach at the Pacific Edge Hotel. Brandon made my day special very efficient and helpful with local  events and made me feel welcome if you come here ask for Brandon and get a room with a veiw
Manager Response: A dream, indeed! Thanks for making us a part of your California vacation, Lauren. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sunshine!  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay at the Pacific Edge Hotel and it was, as the first visit, perfect.  James and Kelsey and the rest of the friendly, accommodating Staff welcomes you immediately and makes you feel like you are their only guest.  They go out of their way to help you with any "tourist questions" or needs.  The hotel lobby is bright and spotless and there is always fresh coffee & amazing chilled lemon water.  The rooms are retro and clean and the hospitality staff is just awesome - Always friendly and helpful.  Short walk to the beach and you can hear the waves at night ~ Would recommend this beautiful place to anyone wanting to relax and enjoy all their amenities!
Manager Response: Sounds like our team made you feel right at home! I'll be sure to share that with James and Kelsey, but in the meantime, thanks so much for staying with us. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sunshine!  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Stayed here March 2015 with my husband for an anniversary get-away.   Javid made us feel welcome and comfortable the moment we checked in. He offered dinning tips without being pushy.  Rooms are roomy comfortable and clean.  Great location; walk to the beach and to shops and restaurants.  Will definitely return.
Manager Response: What a lovely anniversary! Thanks for celebrating with us, Sue, and for taking the time to review us. Keep us in mind for next year -- we'd love to see you again!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Great get away location with outstanding oceanfront rooms. Relaxing on the balcony with the surf lapping on the beach makes for a great start and ending to every day. Nice place. Will stay there again soon!
Manager Response: Nothing more relaxing than a day at the beach! :) Looking forward to your next visit.  Thanks for reviewing us,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: A wonderful few days on the beach (with the upgrade)
Summary: We selected this hotel because it was on the beach side of the Pacific Coast Highway. We didn't want to pay what seemed like a steep price for an ocean view, so we booked a room without the view. However, when we arrived, they upgraded us to an ocean view room, which was just lovely. We enjoyed it immensely. But on seeing where the non-view rooms were, I'm not sure how happy we would have been in one of those rooms.  The front desk staff was helpful and pleasant (the two times we dealt with them at check-in and check-out). Valet parking was convenient and worked well, and we were surprised to find that it was also included in our room rate.   We found the bathroom layout a little bit odd, but it certainly wasn't a negative.   The hotel has a great location - not just being on
Manager Response: So glad you got the upgrade! It really is nice to have that beach view when you wake up in the morning. I'm glad to hear that you felt at home, and that our team was there whenever you needed them. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun, but until then, thanks for reviewing us!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, room more like motel.....
Summary: Room is dated and old, hotel is noisy from adjoining guests and street noise....bathrooms are old, carpet is worn...gap under door from room next door was pretty large and you could hear every word they said...beds clean and food at restaurant was average..also I couldn't lock the windows to my room..had to have stick in track which is not great security ..
Manager Response: Sorry you weren't impressed with your room, Phil. We understand that there are updates to be made and we will certainly keep your thoughts in mind moving forward, but we hope that our location helped you unwind. Thanks for your feedback, and we hope to have another chance to impress you soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I spent the weekend here with my boyfriend for my birthday and I couldn't have been more ecstatic about my stay. We had a beautiful suite with an ocean front view and there's absolutely nothing better than waking up to such an incredible sight. I've worked for years in the hotel industry myself and I'm typically very critical of hotels I stay in, but this was the exception. We only stayed for 2 nights but while we were there housekeeping was on top of everything and the newly renovated rooms are beautiful.  I also have to mention how helpful Madison at the front desk was and her efforts to go above and beyond making my birthday weekend special. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway or the perfect place to celebrate any special occasion.
Manager Response: We can't think of a better way to celebrate! Thanks for making us a part of the festivities, and for your kind words -- Madison will be thrilled. Hope to have you back again soon, but until then, happy birthday!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Started out with a TravelZoo deal for a non-view queen room, decided to upgrade to the Beachfront King room - and glad I did. We were put into the "Reef" building which is four levels. Our room was on the lowest level. Walked into the room, clean, nicely furnished then out onto the balcony...when they say Beachfront! You're standing 10 feet above the beach! The waves are literally breaking 30-40 feet away. High tide and the water was washing against the building below your feet! So cool! Walked out of our room, down a short hall and 1 light of stairs to the sand.  And the VIEW. To the north (towards Newport) a large peninsula which is beautiful at night. To the south the beach just goes on and on. First morning out on the balcony drinking coffee (Keurig machine in the room) and
Manager Response: We're glad you got that Beachfront room, too, Cheryl! It really is lovely to watch the waves, and to hear them crashing at night. Sorry it was a bit too loud, though -- we never know how rough the waters will be! That aside, we're thrilled that you enjoyed yourself, and we hope to have another chance to welcome you back for an even more memorable getaway.   Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This time I stayed in an oceanfront room across from the first room I had.  This room isn't decorated as nice and bed is kinda hard.  But great deal for the price.  Staff is very helpful.  Rooms are very clean.  Of course you have the oceanfront million dollar view.  Down the street the Surf and Sand runs 500 to 700 a night with the same view.  The beds there are of course extremely comfortable.    Nice tv but no on demand for movie purchases.  Just an FYI if you like that stuff.  Great deal in my opinion.
Manager Response: I'm glad to hear you felt you got a great deal on your stay! We appreciate your feedback, and I'm happy you enjoyed the "million-dollar view" during your stay with us.  Hope to see you again soon,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Horrible Customer Service - Poor room quality!
Summary: Booked an oceanfront room for Friday night and an ocean view room for Saturday (oceanfront was sold out) over Valentines weekend, flying in from Minneapolis for the weekend this was a well deserved $2k getaway from the cold. When we arrived to our room there was a barking dog in the connecting room and so we contacted the front desk, they came, left and again at 11 we called again because the dog was still barking, they came and went and we fell asleep when it stopped, then at 2am we were woken again and called once again to security who came and went. The dog continued to bark the rest of the night and we had only a few hours of disrupted sleep. In the morning we asked for a later checkout because we hadn't slept and were denied, then moved to the new room a couple hours later.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry, Anthony. It's clear that we should have handled this differently, and I apologize for the lukewarm reception you got after voicing your complaints. That said, we want to make this right. Since we've spoken on the phone we will continue to follow up to make sure you are fully satisfied. Until then, thank you for your candor.   Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We originally intended on staying two nights which turned into three. While my other half was on business I kept quite busy/relaxed at the beach and the great proximity to the village shops. Great, beachy boutique hotel with every attention to detail including a bottle of wine at check in. Amanda and the rest of the staff were courteous and professional offering lots of info on the area and meeting every need. We can't wait to come back whether for business or pleasure!  And may I mention, even with a non ocean front room we heard the crashing waves every night. Just perfect. Kim Komar & Sal Gentile.
Manager Response: That really is perfect, Kim! We're thrilled that Amanda and the rest of our team made you feel at home, and that you and Sal had such a lovely time with us. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun -- the beach is beautiful all year long.  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Unfortunately we were only here for 2 Nights. Used it as a rest period in between two busy weeks. We were in a beach front room, with the most amazing view you could wish for. Perfect. Sitting on the balcony, watching the amazing sunset was incredible.. So relaxing. Would love to come back one day. Views that dreams are made of.
Manager Response: So true! We dream of that view, too. Thank you for staying with us, and for the lovely review -- we can picture that sunset now. Come back and see us again soon!  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: LOVED this little hotel! GREAT value!
Summary: We had just flown in from the midwest and we just needed a place to clean up and sleep. We literally pulled off the road into the driveway of this hotel because it was right near downtown Laguna Beach, and we were happily surprised at the reasonable price.   The pool area was cute as could be, even though we didn't have enough time to enjoy it. The lobby and rooms were absolutely as well decorated as any place I could imagine. I love the beach, and this is one of the cutest beach hotels I have ever experienced.   Location is excellent, easy to walk to town for restaurants, shopping, etc.   The staff was extremely helpful. The restaurant was excellent and relaxing. We thoroughly enjoyed Laguna Beach, and I cannot wait to return. When I return, I will most likely stay here again!
Manager Response: Your support and thoughtful feedback just made our day! You made a long trip all the way from the Midwest and we couldn't be happier to hear that you found the trip so worthwhile. Thanks for being a fan of our beach-scene style and atmosphere, location, and staff. We mean it when we say we can't wait to have you back in Laguna Beach again soon!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This is a charming little boutique hotel.  Don't expect large fancy rooms it's a simple beach themed property, with a comfortable bed.mmwhat makes it special iAds the beach front rooms.  They rooms are maybe 50 feet from the soothing gently crashing waves.  The sun sets over the edge of catalina island, so be sure to grab some champagne and a snack and enjoy the last hour before sunset on your private deck.  We sleep with the sliding door open as the sound of the surf is an awesome way to fall asleep. There are many fancier and much more expensive properties in Laguna, but this is a little romantic gem.  Across the street and a block or so away I recomend Watermarc for dinner and Tommy Bahamas forms a drink with great live music.
Manager Response: Is there any sound more soothing than crashing waves? So happy to hear that you loved every minute of your stay, and that you felt right at home, Andreas. We can't wait to have you back next time you need to get away!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: After reading the negative reviews on here, I called and begged to be upgraded to a renovated room fearing what the others looked like. I booked the room for such a low rate that I knew it had to be the dreaded "Village Rooms."  However, it was Valentines weekend and I was too late in asking for an upgrade. The front desk staff was SO accommodating anyways, especially Luis. Because they were not able to upgrade our room, he validated our parking ($27) and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne instead. When we arrived, I was so surprised at the room, it was not bad at all. Sure, it isn't the Hilton, but we got a great deal and actually ended up extending our stay. We went to the front desk again and Luis gave us an even better deal than we were able to get online.   The
Manager Response: Haley, what a nice dose of encouragement! I can't thank you enough for taking the time to detail your experience with our rooms, restaurants, amenities, and service here on TripAdvisor. This feedback is more rewarding than you know.  I'm very sorry that you weren't able to get seated at The Deck. As you know, this is a very busy restaurant, and we appreciate you outlining your suggestions about this for us!  All in all, we can't wait to have you back again sometime. Have a great day!  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with Amazing View and Location
Summary: We checked in for Valentine's day weekend in the Surf Wing, room 503. We had an amazing view! The decor in the rooms is really cute, the definitely captured the beach vibe. The hotel has a great location within walking distance to shops and restaurants. We enjoyed room service dinner right on our patio as we were one level above the Deck. Room service was quick and the food was of very good quality. Housekeeping did a fabulous job touching up our room daily. There is a Ralph's right across the street which was handy for stocking our room with snacks and there is also plenty of space for stashing snacks as there is a large "bar" sort of area in the room. We loved having a larger refrigerator with space for the drinks we liked (the mini bar is almost the size of an under counter
Manager Response: Thanks for spending Valentine's Day with us! We really appreciate your feedback, especially in regards to storage, and we'll keep that in mind as we continue to find ways to serve our guests. Until then, we hope to have you back soon. Laguna Beach is gorgeous all year long!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Wow...the location at this hotel is unbelievable. Our room was facing the beach, and was 100 percent worth the money, so spend that little bit more on a sea view room. The sunset was beautiful, especially being able to watch it from the balcony. Our room was also lovely, very modern and stylish. In fact this was one of the best rooms we had during our stay in California.   The wifi was also brilliant within the hotel, even though our room was one of the furthest away from reception.   A couple of negative points that I would mention, would be the room service and parking. This isn't something we ever do, however if you enjoy doing this, then it is very expensive! The food looks lovely, but there is a minimum order value which was around 30USD. The minimum value can be hard to
Manager Response: Wow, Christina! I'm so glad that you enjoyed your stay. Thanks for your rating, and the feedback about room service. We'll certainly keep it in mind, and we hope your next visit is even more memorable!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Best location on the beach... disappointing room
Summary: Our room (138) is kind of like a Motel 6 on steroids.  Magnificent views. We're perched on the top floor (3rd.) overlooking the ocean which is literally at the base of the hotel.  Easy walking distance to the heart of the downtown area.  I guess it's the old "location, location" scenario.  The price for our mid-week (February) stay is something like $270 per night.  You must valet park (no option) for an additional $27 per day.  The rooms are old, cheaply constructed, but updated with newer carpet, lighting and bright colored (orange) paint (accent walls).  A comfortable bed and the room is clean (although there is water damage to the ceiling).  Very small rooms.  The bathroom has a small single basin sink, with a shower / tub & toilet and only enough room to squeeze in to shut
Manager Response: Although I'm glad you enjoyed the location, I'm sorry that the room wasn't quite what you were expecting. We definitely have a beachy feel here, and we think that our amenities and decor are reflective of that. Still, we would have been happy to bring additional towels if needed, or discuss different room options with you. Thanks for leaving that feedback, David, and we hope you'll give us a second change to impress you next time you need to get away.  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: The good the bad vs price tag
Summary: The hotel is combined of 4 separate buildings , Reef, bungalows, Seas & Bahia, Reef & bungalow is beach front while rest is street side. We booked 2 room, one though the travelzoo deal under 200 for the Ocean View king at Reef and another double that end up at Seas. The location is superb., walking distant to rest, art gallery etc, the king room decent size with small balcony looking out the ocean.,the room equip comparable to Best Western level, the Sea room remind me of motel 6. Keep in mind you paying for the location. The private beach & complimentary beach chair n towel umbrellas is great plus., staff are friendly and upbeat.. Bottom line is.. I wouldnt choose this place if i just need a hotel room near beach; Sea room ( standard double bed) is too dated, noisy and
Manager Response: First off, please let me apologize on behalf of those more lively guests. I hope they weren't too much of an interruption, and I will certainly be happy to put an end to it if you contact us at the front desk. That said, I'm thrilled that you loved the view, and I hope that we'll get a chance to show you a five-star trip next time you're in town. Until then, thanks for your candor.  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My husband, five month old daughter and I stayed one night on Christmas Day. We paid over $400 for an ocean view room. On departure I forgot six pieces of clothing in one of the dresser drawers, and one of them was my daughter's favorite winter jacket - a gift from her grandmother - a lot of meaning. Over the next three weeks my husband and I each left several phone messages with housekeeping. Nobody ever returned our call. Luckily my brother and sister in law were staying there in early February, and physically went to housekeeping and inquired. They were taken to an area where lost and found items are kept, and they found my clothes, with a label stating room number, date of stay, and description of items. A happy ending after all, in spite of nonexistent customer service.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry that we weren't able to get in touch with you. That's unacceptable, and I'm going to check in with our team about it right away, as well as reminding our team to make sure they have permission to enter before beginning their cleaning. Still, I'm glad your brother and sister in law found your items, and I hope we'll have a chance to show you a warm welcome in the near future.   Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Brandon at the beach was very helpful ,the room was big and the acces to the beach too convenient , front disk people were helpful . Pool and jacuzzi was nice for the kids , price wise was acceptable  , the kids had a good time , we love coming to Laguna beach it's wonderful place to visit , very clean, lots of restaurants
Manager Response: What a lovely getaway! We'll be sure to share your kind words with our team, Sarasama -- thanks for the fantastic review. We can't wait to have you back for more R & R!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Excellent stay, great surf view bungalow was awesome, we checked in with Amanda and she right off the bat made us feel very special about the whole valentines day shindig we had going on, she even was able to accommodate a early check-in on a super busy day, the view...wow amazing and this place is so close to the main street dining. Also the bed...wow..so comfy..All in all a excellent stay :) !
Manager Response: Sounds perfect! Thanks for celebrating with us, and keep us in mind next time you need a quick getaway! :)  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: 4 of us stayed here on for one night on our 2 week California roadtrip, which also happened to fall on my birthday.   First impression is that it's a little rundown but completely fine for what we paid and for 1 night stay.  Rooms are clean, pretty basic but not horrible at all.   Location is superb. Right on the beautiful beach where we sat and watched the Dolphins.   Wasn't a huge fan of the pool, we didn't use it, but who needs a pool when you have such a great beach instead.   The hotel staff recommended a great little restaurant to go for a birthday dinner (really delicious) and Laguna generally was a lot of fun.
