The bar on the beach is nice for a cocktail and snack too.   Overall, this hotel is fine. It wasn't the nicest we stayed in on our trip but completely sufficient
Manager Response: So glad you got to watch the dolphins! What a wonderful memory. That aside, I wish you had been more impressed with our amenities, but it sounds like you enjoyed your stay, and that's always good to hear. We'll keep your feedback in mind for our future guests, and we hope to have another chance to wow you soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Much Needed Escape close to home
Summary: It was a wonderful overnight stay at the Pacific Edge.  We got there a little early but no hassle with check in.  Our room was spacious with a little mini kitchen, refrigerator, sink, dishes, etc.  It is an older property but in great repair with some funky touches such as a little animal on the bed who lives there and must not be taken away.  The valet parking was included so we walked to the Laguna Theater for show (something to check on to see what is available when you would be there).  Since we were members of Joie de Vivre we came back to a wonderful bottle of red wine waiting for us at the door.  We had snacks in the room and then went down to the other set of buildings to use the common hot tub.  It was well maintained and relaxing.  We met interesting people both times
Manager Response: What a lovely vacation! We really appreciate your kind words, and we can't wait to welcome you back for another California getaway. Until then, thanks again!  Regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: From the moment we checked in, the service was top notch. Javid helped us sort out some room confusion (we booked two double beds, they gave us a king...they ended up giving us an even better room, so thank you for that!)     This hotel is so beautiful. Very clean, modern, classy, and elegant. I can't wait to come back. Best kept secret in Laguna Beach!
Manager Response: Our pleasure, Melissa! Hope you got some good sleep and some California sun. :) Thanks for the lovely review!  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I am on the fence with the Pacific Edge Hotel as to whether or not I would recommend it. The view is killer and the location is perfect. Another reviewer mentioned the day bungalows and the noise from them. We booked a family room so our king bed was above the bungalows and the kids room faced in so it was much quieter for the kids than for us. There is no doubt that it is noisy if you have your sliding doors open. I would not say this is a hotel for someone looking for a quiet getaway.  The waterfront room was nice and spacious. The first night our towels looked pretty old and ragged but when they were replaced the next day, they were much better. The room could use a full length mirror.  The kids double bed room was pretty standard but all the beds were super comfortable. My
Manager Response: Thanks for that feedback, Heidi. It seems that most of your issues stemmed from our decor and layout. We'll certainly keep this in mind moving forward, but please don't hesitate to let us know if the door is ever a concern. Most rooms have the sliding door leading to the balcony, but we can get you a rod to make sure the kiddos can't open it as easily. That aside, it sounds like you enjoyed the rest of your stay, and we hope to make more memories with you soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Just returned from our annual stay in Laguna Beach. This was our 6th consecutive stay at Pacific Edge and we keep going back for the unbeatable location.  We were disappointed that the beachfront junior suites were no longer available.  To avoid settling for a smaller room, we stayed in an apartment this year. Great space, could use some updating, but, not the beachfront experience we have grown to love.  Service is outstanding.  The people are great.  Great value.  Would like the suites back.
Manager Response: Six times in a row? We're honored that you've kept coming back to us! Thank you for that, but we hope to get you into a beach-side room next time. Just keep checking back when you're ready to plan your next trip -- we'll do everything we can!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We booked a ocean front room to celebrate our anniversary. What the hotel does not tell you is that directly below these rooms they rent out the deck for parties. We were here for the equivalent of "Jersey Shore reuionon party." Complete with beer pong, screaming and yelling, etc... If you want to be able to enjoy a ocean front room from the deck, I would recommend staying somewhere else.  I would challenge the owner of this property to spend the evening in one of these rooms on a celebration night with his significant other while a party is being held directly below.   As a local Orange County resident I will be sharing out experience with and asking them not to patronize the restauarant at this property.
Manager Response: I'm so sorry that we weren't able to offer you the experience you were looking for, Brian. We wish we could have done more to impress you, especially on your anniversary weekend, and I hope we'll get a chance to make it up to you soon.  I know you were speaking with our Front Office Manager, Brian Sullivan, during your stay.  Expect a call from him soon, we would love to show you the experience you planned on having, and everything Pacific Edge has to offer.  Thanks for your candor, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing location right on the beach
Summary: We stayed in an ocean-front room, and the location was incredible - right on the beach above the high tide line.  The balcony was comfortable and private.  The room was comfortable and pleasantly, if a little sparsely, furnished.  The lobby staff were helpful and friendly. We had a room-service breakfast, and that was great, but a bit pricey. Having a Ralph's supermarket across the street is a big plus.
Manager Response: Sounds like the perfect get away! Thank you for making us a part of it, Ann. We look forward to welcoming you back again!  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My husband and I spent Christmas Eve here. Initially tried to book through Groupon, but the deal wouldn't process so I called for a same day reservation and the hotel honored the Groupon rate. We were right on the water and just the sound of the waves crashing at night was reason enough to stay here. Sure the hotel isn't the most up-to-date in terms of architecture and amenities--but nothing around here is. The hotel staff were warm and friendly also. We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your holiday, Lily! We hope you'll keep us in mind next time you need a quick, sunny getaway.  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I have always stayed at the Inn at Laguna Beach, but it was booked, so we took a chance on Pacific Edge.   I was not disappointed.   Excellent views from the room, which was recently renovated.   It is my understanding that the other rooms are a bit dated, but apparently the King Oceanfront rooms have all been renovated.   Will definitely stay at PE again!
Manager Response: It really is a gorgeous view! We hope to welcome you back again soon, Jeremy, but until then, let us know if there's anything else we can do to make your next visit even better.  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We have spent time in many hotels in Laguna Beach. Pacific Edge is the best. The oceanside rooms are actually above the sand. An advantage is that being higher up makes the room private, no prying eyes here. We felt totally safe leaving the balcony doors open so we could hear the surf all night long. There are two restaurants next to the property, but the patrons' celebrations were not a distraction. The wifi was free and reliable.  The Italian restaurant across the street offers delicious seafood, pasta, and meat options.  This is now our go to hotel in Laguna!
Manager Response: Good find! We love that restaurant, too, but we're thrilled to hear that you loved your room even more. It's the perfect private getaway! Keep us in mind when you need a little me time. :)  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This is a wonderful hotel in a beautiful location. The staff is top notch, and our total fee for staying five nights, including valet, was less than $600. Amazing value for a beachfront property. Mini fridge in room. Ralph's two blocks away. If you can't afford an oceanfront room, ask for a corner room in the villa - definitely talk to someone at the hotel before you book.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and that you got such a fantastic price! Thanks for staying with us, Beth. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun. :)  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: If there is a heaven on Earth, this is now the place. We had an oceanfront room 128. The room could not be more perfect. The place was clean and comfortable and a reasonable size. The decor was appropriate and nice. The bed comfortable. The TV huge and has more channels than any other hotel. The staff are amazing from guest services Amanda, Gemma and Jack, to beach side Ben. Ben really rocks. To the guys at valet who remembers their customers names. Nice touch. The housekeepers with smiles and warm welcomes. It was 5 days of heaven. I can't wait to come back again and again.
Manager Response: That does sound pretty heavenly, Michael! We'll be sure to send your regard to Amanda, Gemma, Jack, Ben and the rest of the team -- thanks for singing their praises. Can't wait to have you back for more R & R soon!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My wife and I recently stayed here for our anniversary and what a great property. First, it is located right in the heart of all the restaurants and shops - a 4 minute walk to main beach. Next, we opted for a beach front room. We were quite literally over the surf as the tide came in. The room was excellent - if the views from the balcony weren't enough.   And the staff...all I can say is that they were all so kind and wonderful. Stacey, Kelsey, Zach. Rochelle and Javid. I got their names because I wanted to call the general manager and let him know how great our experience was. Every person was professional, friendly and helpful.   We used a LivingSocial voucher for our stay, so there was a part of me that felt like we might be treated differently because we got a "deal." I
Manager Response: All in all, it sounds like you had a lovely time, Scott! I couldn't be happier to hear that, and I know that our team will feel the same way. I can't wait to share your kind words with them, so thanks for leaving them. We'll see you next time you need to get away!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This was our first time to Laguna Beach and what a beautiful place! To start off the hotel, beach and most of the restaurants in the area (that have patios) are dog friendly!! When we arrived, we were met by Amanda and Madison who couldn't have been sweeter after an 8 hour drive. These girls felt my pain! 8 hours in a car with cranky wife and dog to a hotel you've never been to? We had reserved a Village View room. Since it was our first time to the hotel and they weren't that busy they upgraded us to an oceanfront room which spoiled us These rooms are spacious and recently remodeled. Oceanview rooms have new comfortable king-size beds, private balcony, new flatscreen TV,s,Big size shower and a refrigerated minibar that's very reasonable. There is also two heated pools and the
Manager Response: Glad to hear that you, Carrie and Akeena felt at home with us! Thanks for the shout out, Archie. Keep us in mind next time you three need to get away!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Funky time in Laguna Beach....having an earthy style and feeling!
Summary: Spent a delightful weekend in room 305 with partial ocean view but with full ocean sound.We are in our late 60's; the room reminded us of surfer pads where you brought a chick and chlled (*modern word for you know what:>)). The room had a mini fridge, stove and keurig coffee maker. The location is perfect; you can walk to downtown by way of the beach or on the sidewalk. You don't need a car when you stay at this hotel.  It rained for the most part; the hotel provided umbrellas that enabled us the short walk to the next door "The Deck" restaurant. We had the best blue berry pancakes and the best egg fritata ever with a view of the ocean. we also found "the stand", vegan eatery with great sandwiches and desserts on Thalia street. We ate we drank and loved walking on the beach. We
Manager Response: What a perfect breakfast! Thanks for hanging out with us, Ralph, and for the fantastic review -- we loved getting a glimpse of your vacation. :) Come back and see us again soon!  Take care, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My husband and I recently stayed in an oceanfront King in the Surf wing for NYE. We were attending a wedding and had limited time in the room but overall the room was perfect. It was newly renovated and decorated in a hip beach themed style. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom a little small but the space was clean. The reality of this hotel and the room situation is spelled out here on Tripadvisor. If, you book an oceanfront renovated room with a balcony, you will be happy as you can't beat the unobstructed ocean views. This same room down the street at the Montage or Ritz Carlton would be $600+ a night and your looking at the same Pacific Ocean.   If, you book a room that has NOT been renovated and faces the street... well, you get what you pay for.   Oh and the sunset from
Manager Response: Yes! That view really is priceless. Glad you enjoyed it, and that we were a part of the wedding weekend. Keep us in mind next time you need to get away -- we'd love to welcome you back.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff. We were given bottle of wine for our  anniversary. We were also allowed to check in early. The room however, was not up to the standard that we expected for a Joie de vive hotel. This was being compared to the Citizen in Sacramento, which was beautiful. The room was small unlike the pictures. The bathroom tub had large chips in the middle. We need ed to prop the window open with a trash can because it was broken. We would not stay again.
Manager Response: I wish we could have done more to wow you. Most of our guests feel quite at home with us, so I'd be happy to look into your room to make sure it's up to par. If you can get back to us with your room number and the dates of your stay, I'd love to check into this matter.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This place could be so good, it has such potential, but ultimately you'll be disappointed! Compared to surrounding hotel/motels this place is expensive. We stayed in one of the apartments.  The room looked like it hadn't been renovated since 1980. The paint colors, the stains, the furnature (and lack of it) was poor. Beds were uncomfortable with really old pillows. The sofa had bad stains... I'll let you use your imagination to guess what made them. The kitchen didn't really have any cutlery, knives, etc.The view was over a parking lot. The wi-fi didn't work. The TV in the bedroom was below the bed so you could't watch it... so we came up with an inventive way to raise the TV with the ironing board. It was raining and everything was  flooded in the outdoor corridors that became
Manager Response: I'm sorry that the weather didn't cooperate during your visit, Simon, but it's even more disappointing that you weren't happy with your room. Different rooms have different views, and we wish we could have explained that better. Were you able to ask for a room change? We would have been happy to do everything we could to accommodate you, and we hope to have the opportunity for further discussion soon.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice room, great location, friendly staff
Summary: The view from the room was fantastic.  We arrived early, so the room wasn't ready.  We went to lunch and within 1/2 hour, they called that it was available.  Right over the beach, you could watch the sun set while laying in bed.    The room was clean, the staff helpful.  Even the "honor bar" proces were reasonable.
Manager Response: Thanks for your patience, William! Glad we were able to welcome you after your lunch, and that you loved our beautiful view. Looking forward to having you back for another relaxing beach-side vacation!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: My stat at the Pacific Edge.
Summary: Our stay at the pacific edge was perfect.  Immediately upon check in, Luis & David who were working at the front desk graciously upgraded our room to a bungalow with an ocean view.  The following morning we got a call and were upgraded yet AGAIN to an ocean view room with a balcony overlooking the water, a large King size bed & a joining room with two full beds. I could not have been happier with the service, the room(s), or the location - steps from the beach & minutes walk from downtown. "Laguna Beach" echoes through the hotel from their choice of dec√¥r, to the individualized vases filled with sand from various beaches in Laguna, to the unreal salt water taffy available in the lobby. Do yourself a favor & stay here!
Manager Response: A balcony, a beach view and a king bed -- what could be better? Thanks for the fantastic review, Frank! We can't wait to see you next time you need a little sun.  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This is my favorite and only place I stay in Laguna. Not only is the view and location outstanding but the staff is so friendly. I travel frequently to the area and they always make me feel at home and welcome. I am always treated to beautiful rooms , with a bottle of wine always delivered to my room. My most recent visit I received an amazing surprise upgrade from Luis. After a very long day I was treated to the most beautiful room I have every stayed in the Pacific Edge Suite ,ocean view , fire place , deck , and an amazing bath tub. I cannot wait to get back also eat at Driftwood best breakfast in Laguna Beach!  See you soon Pacific Edge and thank you !!!
Manager Response: It sounds like you've made some beautiful memories with us, and we couldn't be happier to be a part of them. Thank you for your continued support, and for the lovely review. Let us know what we can do to make you next trip even more special!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: This hotel was a horrible experience. The only nice thing was the beach was near.
Summary: First of all I feel like this hotel is one big scam.I called 2 times before arriving in California to request an early check in. the actual day we arrived they told us that it would be a little while. Two hours passed and nothing they just string us a long and nothing. The employees where very fake after finding our room it was outdated and tacky . False advertisement.
Manager Response: While I wish we could have done more to get you into your room more quickly, I'm shocked to hear that you felt our team was unwelcoming. We pride ourselves on making all guests feel at home, so I will look into this immediately. I fear that you may have caught us on an off day, and I apologize, but I know we're capable of so much more. I hope to be able to demonstrate that in the near future.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Spent new years weekend back on the beach at Pacific Edge and as usual the weekend was a blast.  Oceanfront accomodations have the best view and are right over the water.  The sunsets were better each night and I have a slew of photos to remind me of our time.  Staff at the property are accomodating to any need and respond quickly on every request.  I would recommend this property to anyone wanting to be in a great location and beachfront in Laguna Beach.  This was our eighth visit in 3 years.  Will be back again for sure!
Manager Response: This view really is spectacular! So happy to hear that you've felt at home over the years, and we can't wait to continue making memories with you. Until next time, thank you for the lovely review -- it means the world to us!  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Most Amazing hotel ever. The location is beyond perfect. I had been looking at staying here for a little while. After the worst experience at another hotel in which I packed up and left without staying the remaining of my reservation, I was nervous on booking another hotel that was a 3 star. I actually called the front desk prior to booking and the gentleman ensured me that he would take care of me upon my arrival. I must say I believe this hotel is more then a 3 star. It's simple but comfortable. It isn't brand new but very well kept. I feel at home here. Very peaceful. The staff is beyond amazing. So accommodating and friendly. When I checked in I was telling the clerk my horror story and she was so kind she gave me an upgrade. Highly recommended by me. I plan on coming here
Manager Response: Thanks for giving us a shot! Knowing that you felt at home is such a compliment, so thanks for taking the time to review us. Can't wait to have you back next time you need a little California sun!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My friend and I do an annual night after Christmas get away. This year we chose Pacific Edge Hotel. Our room faced the ocean. What a awesome view. We slept with the door open to hear the waves even though it was kind of chilly outside. I also had the heater on.   I will say the picture of the room looked much bigger on their website but not a big deal. How much time do you actually spend in the room anyway?    We took many pictures. This Hotel is within walking distance of downtown. Staff is very friendly and will recommend bars, restaurants, etc. in the area. There's a restaurant next door to the Hotel we had breakfast there very good.
Manager Response: Sounds like a perfect beach-side getaway! Thanks for making us a part of your trip, and for the lovely review. We can't wait to welcome you back -- perhaps in the summertime!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel Without Heat In Room 21 Do Not Stay Here
Summary: I previously stayed there over Halloween and upgraded to a Ocean View room and paid a premium price for the upgrade.  I booked a two night stay over New Years Eve and requested a room not on PCH because of Noise and past reviews.  I was assigned to room 21. it faces the pool  and PCH. I survived the noise but want to share my cancellation due to NO HEAT IN THE ROOM. Only an air conditioner which as you know cools the room. Asked about heat and front desk said check the thermostat. THERE IS NO THERMOSTAT!!!   The called housekeeping and responded with a very small portable room heater( about 8 inches high) probably a Kmart special. The heater only kept half the bed warm. Spent New Years eve bundled up and freezing in bed with extra blankets to keep from freezing.
Manager Response: This is really disappointing, especially since you were looking forward to visiting us. We want to make this right, so if this has yet to be resolved, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com. Until then, thanks for bringing this to our attention -- it'll only make us better.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Great experience at this lovely hotel
Summary: Even through the weather was a bit cold the week after Christmas, our family had great time at this hotel. The hotel staff was wonderful and friendly. Oh, and the location on beach cannot be beat. Hope to come back soon in warmer time of the year :)
Manager Response: Yes, it would be lovely to welcome you back during the summer, John! Until then, thanks for getting away with us, and for the fantastic review.  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Pacific Edge took me to paradise!
Summary: Todd and Amanda were genuine and friendly at check-in. The ocean views were amazing and hearing the waves crashing as you sleep is way better than my clock's radio setting. Thank you for your outstanding customer service. Until next time Pacific Edge!
Manager Response: We can't think of a better way to fall asleep than with the crashing waves as a soundtrack to your dreams. Thank you for staying with us, and for your kind words for Todd and Amanda -- they'll be thrilled!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: They made our trip truly amazing.....
Summary: We didnt make any reservations as we didn't know what day we would arrive....from Canada.. This place gave us the most amazing Christmas gift by allowing us a adjoining room so that we wouldn't be so tight for space....2 adults, 2 kids, old lab dog  The beach is right there and we loved being that close.... Hotel staff were friendly and helpful in every regard...cleaning staff were wonderful... Loved that we had a kitchen and the grocery store is a block way...awesome for families!! Pools and hot tub was great...there was nothing that this hotel didn't think of......so accomodating!!  We cannot say enough good things about this hotel....simply put "Thank you Pacific Edge for your kindness and thoughtfulness...
Manager Response: Happy to make you feel at home! Thanks for staying with us, and for the wonderful review -- you're too kind. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Our 5th stay and still loving this place
Summary: This is a complex with many several buildings, so when you make your reservation be specific of where you want to be.  We always stay in the building RIGHT on the beach with full balcony view that is literally over the beach.  You can open the large sliding doors and lay in bed and watch for whales while enjoying the sound of the high tide hitting the base of the motel, yes, it IS that close to the ocean.  The best rooms in this building are on the far LEFT side so you will only have one neighbor on the balcony plus be away from the sometimes noisy bar to the right of the motel.  Now this is NOT a 5-star motel, I would give it a 3, maybe a 4, but it's clean, well maintained, very friendly staff, polite and attentive housekeeping, decent TV, nice soft beds, and very nicely
Manager Response: Five years and still going strong! It means the world to us that you've continued to join us for lovely beach-side vacations, and I hope we'll continue to do so for many more years. Until next time, thanks for the fantastic review!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised when I checked in to the hotel. Javid Bholat provided outstanding customer service he was very professional and pleasant. I was a bit surprised at how thin the walls were as I could hear other guest and unfortunately the internet signal was weak. I was really impressed with Javid he did everything possible to accommodate my request and as an owner of my own business I would be more than happy to hire him as one of my employees.
Manager Response: Javid really is a pleasure to work with! So happy to hear that you felt the same way, but we apologize if your neighbors' chatter was a bit bothersome. We'll keep that in mind as we move forward, but in the meantime, thank you so much for the wonderful rating!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I loved being so close to the beach. The weather was perfect and it wasn't very crowded. Javid got us accommodated with the most perfect room. He gave us all the information we asked for and then some! He made me feel very welcomed and excited for my vacation. The service at this hotel is fantastic and I couldn't have asked for more!
Manager Response: You can't beat this view! Thanks for the lovely review, and for your kind words for Javid -- we'll share them with him right away. Looking forward to welcoming you back again!  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing view and location in the heart of Laguna Beach
Summary: Our first experience was admittedly less than great, because their WiFi was completely down all weekend. BUT this was almost 2 years ago, and they have since upgraded their system and all was well. In fact they get very high praise from us because the manager without hesitation almost 2 years later not only honored the chance to make it up to us, but went above an beyond. We were pampered to an absolutely gorgeous 2-night stay in a view that is literally overlooking the ocean. You can hear and practically feel every crash of the waves, the seagulls visit the cute balcony, and it was otherwise silent and serene and beautiful. The room was clean and a good size, the entire staff was friendly and helpful. In fact even the valet guy was great, he seemed to tirelessly work every
Manager Response: So glad we had a chance to make this right, Boaz! Thank you for giving us that opportunity, and for taking the time to leave such a lovely review -- that means the world to us. We can't wait to have you back again!  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at Pacific Edge several times and just love it. We had a balcony off our second story room right above the beach. There were ear plugs on the nightstand to drown out the ocean waves, but I love listening to the ocean and waves throughout the night. We did use the valet service for our car which was easy and quick. During the day we would sit at the beach, have lunch at one of the many restraunts to choose from. Our fave was at dinner, Driftwood Kitchen had the best food and best service. It used to be a home to old Hollywood actor Slim Summerville. It is right on the beach and adjacent to Pacific Edge so it is in walking distance. You will not be dissapointed.
Manager Response: We love listening to the waves, and we're glad you did, too, Jasmine! Thank you for making us a part of your getaway, and for the lovely review. We hope to welcome you back next time you need a little peace and quiet!  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I enjoying staying at Pacific Edge in Laguna Beach.  Clean, comfortable, friendly and on the beach!  Breakfast is good, coffee is good--and did I mention that it is on the beach??  Beautiful sunsets.... This hotel is well decorated and comfortable, from the (breakfast) lounge to the outdoor seating.
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your beach-side getaway! Can't wait to have you back for another fantastic stay.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We were at the Pacific Edge a few weeks ago and had a pretty sketchy experience that is worth sharing.  The hotel is fine, basically what we expected in terms of motel-type quality but with amazing views.  We were in one of the renovated ocean-front rooms which is located in a separate building from the lobby.  The problem was security.  All the rooms in this building are directly accessible from the beach and the small street between the beach and PCH.  Anyone can walk right up to your door.  Normally, this wouldn't be a problem but the room directly next to ours was occupied by some people who made our stay very uncomfortable and who it seemed were having some kind of business transactions.  It started with talking on cell phones at 6:30 in the morning in the common corridor
Manager Response: I'm so sorry to hear that you felt uncomfortable. Our guests' safety is our first priority, and as such, complaints like these are all but unheard of. It sounds like we should have offered to move you to a different room, and I'm sorry that we missed that opportunity. I want to make this right, so please don't hesitate to contact us via email at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you want to talk. Until then, thank you for your candor.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a special occasion and booked the beach-side room with a patio. I know those rooms are a bit more expensive but trust me when I say it's worth it. We had a spacious room with a mini-kitchen with a fridge, microwave, sink and plenty of counter-top space. The view was to die for; we were on the top floor overlooking the beach. The patio is a nice size as well; we sat out there a lot eating breakfast or just reading. The bed was comfortable and the room was just perfect. The location of the hotel is excellent. Walking distance to everything - once you've valeted your car, you don't need it until you're checking out. The front desk service was ok, I would expect something better from a Joie de Vivre group hotel (which is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) - check
Manager Response: Please allow me to apologize for the slow check in, and if we didn't make you feel as welcome as we should have. Most of our guests rave about our team, so I can assure you that this is completely unlike us. That aside, I'm thrilled that you were so happy with the view, and I hope we'll have a chance to welcome you back next time you're looking for a little time away!  Best.  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Tatty old motel needs drastic refurb
Summary: I'm totally amazed by some of the other reviews. If you take it that this is an old motel then yes it's fine. It certainly isn't anything like a boutique hotel. I was shown 5 different rooms and the non refurbished ones are plain tatty. The days when simply painting a wall a bright color was enough are long gone. The rooms remind me of student digs. Why would you offer rooms that have no net curtains whe they are totally overlooked by other rooms. The walls are so thin that you can hear pretty much everything from adjoining rooms.The one upside is the staff who are very good, endlessly cheerful whilst knowing the limitations of the hotel And the Internet is terribly unreliable. If some serious money was spent on thus place it could be fabulous, it's a wonderful location.
Manager Response: Sorry you weren't impressed. We are currently in the process of renovating all of our rooms, and we feel that you'd be wowed by the updates. We can assure you that simply adding a new coat of paint doesn't cut it for us, either, but we'll certainly keep this in mind moving forward. Thanks for your candor.  Best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Laguna beach is one of my favorite places to visit with my husband it was fun with our older kids as well. We have stayed at this hotel several times over the years. We get a good deal at this great location by staying in the buildings that are not right on the ocean. The buildings are older but the hotel works at keeping them clean, colorfully decorated and full of money saving extras like fridge and microwave. Oatmeal or cereal and milk is all we need for breakfast. Walk over to Ralph's grocery store. Rooms with kitchenettes or full kitchens are handy also and you get a home away from home feel.  You have to pay to park. Only valet available. We like to park and then walk everywhere. The beach, restaurants, shops, and great park along the water are all walking distance.  Hotel
Manager Response: Thanks for making us one of your go-to-getaways! We're thrilled that you and your family have made so many memories with us, and we hope to continue to create even more during the next few years. Until then, thanks so much for your feedback -- coming from a frequent guest, it means a lot to us to see how we've done over the years. Looking forward to your next trip, and we'll definitely work on that Internet in the meantime! :)  See you soon, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The hotel itself is ok. You can tell its older, but it is kept up well. But the view from our room was awesome. We had a beachfront room, and it was right on the water. The beds were pretty comfortable, and the room was clean. The staff was very friendly. Our room had a minifridge, flat screen tv and a kuerig coffee maker. Everything you need is walking distance. The only negatives I have about this place was the parking. You have to pay $27/day to "valet" park, but they had us pull into a parking lot that was steps away from our room, and they just pulled it in backwards for you and hang on to your key.
Manager Response: You really can't beat this view! Happy to hear that you felt so relaxed, but we're sorry you were disappointed with the valet. Parking in Laguna Beach is hard to come by, but you're always welcome to attempt to find street parking if you like. We'll be sure to remind our guests of that, but until then, we hope to welcome you back soon!  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We recommend staying here , as it is right on the beach and the view is spectacular. Ask for an ocean front room. 701 is great - top level on a corner overlooking the beach. Ralph's is a block away to stock up or whole foods is a short walk away. Great restaurants and caf√©s. The hotel has all the deck chairs and mats for the beach below and free of charge. A good size pool and spa too. Lovely decor. Wished we could stay longer.
Manager Response: You can't beat that view! So happy to hear that you enjoyed it, Alan, and we hope to welcome you back for many more beach-side getaways. Until then, thanks for the fantastic review!  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: The location and view don't get any better than this.  So many extras at this hotel - 2 restaurants, beach chairs, umbrellas, etc are furnished, dog friendly hotel, 2 swimming pools, jacuzzi, ping pong table, mini kitchen with frig, stove, pots and pans and dishes included, very comfortable bed and recently remodeled rooms. This hotel is older which is part of it's charm. So you could say it's slightly rustic, but again, the location in the beach is just awesome. Plus you can walk to most of the restaurants and shopping.
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a really nice time during your stay, Pamela, and I couldn't be happier that you took full advantage of all our great amenities. You really can't go wrong with a hotel room right by the beach, right? We're happy to be your home-away-from-home anytime you're in the area, so please keep us on your list! Thanks for taking the time to write this awesome review, and feel free to reach out with any other feedback you might have.   All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Pacific Edge on a compensation package for corporate meeting planning.  This hotel has the perfect location, great beach access, very comfortable beds and great towels.  The hotel service is wonderful, they were quick and were very friendly to address any question or needs that we had.  If you are looking for a location with a view, this is definitely the place.  On the negative, the hotel is older and has been cosmetically upgraded.  The bathrooms are very small and very noisy.  You can hear the plumbing from the surrounding rooms.  The air and heating are window and wall units, also very noisy.  While all the amenities of outlet plugs, large plasma TV, refrigerator are available in the rooms, they are installed with extension cords and retrofitted to
Manager Response: This is a perfect place for family vacations, or just a quiet beach-side getaway, but I'm sorry we weren't quite what you were looking for for your event, Ellen. Thanks for that feedback, and I hope we'll get to welcome you back next time you're able to relax for a little bit longer.  Warm regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times. I have traveled here as a single female traveler and felt completely safe.  I have come here before with my husband and kids for the time of our life. My favorite time here has been renting an ocean view room in the Reef building, simply to sit on the balcony for 10 hours... ready, eat and watch the waves... and not be bothered.  Walking distance to a convenience store, fast food, and boutique stores.  Stroll down the other direction and you will find your "typical" so-Cal beach filled with bikinis and volleyball in the summer.  Bike and jogging paths.  Upscale and safe, artsy town. I am saddened to see the reviews of salt water/typical beach wear/outdated kitchen. Call me crazy but it added to the beach charm.  I felt like I was staying
Manager Response: There's nothing like some quiet time on the balcony to enjoy this gorgeous view. We're so glad you and your family have made so many memories with us, and we can't wait to create even more. Until next time, thank you for your kind words -- they mean the world to us!  See you next month,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: As soon as we walked into the lobby area, we were greeted with smiles and a friendly "Hello" from staff. I have never stayed here before and did not know what to expect. We were also upgraded to a partial view room that was not on the beach but we could see it from our room over the hotel building with the beach side rooms. We were only there for one night.  It still was a very nice, large room with a kitchen, large living area and balcony. The room was not fancy and was a little lacking in wall decor, but its a beach hotel and it was clean and comfortable. And being a Joie de Vivre member, we were even treated to a bottle of wine, but that may be due to my member status. In all of my hotel stays over 30 years for business or pleasure, I have never been treated to a bottle of
Manager Response: So glad you felt at home! Thanks for making us a part of your getaway, and for singing Bryan and Luis' praises. They'll be thrilled to hear from you!  Looking forward to your next visit,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: I sort of want to keep this place my little secret.....
Summary: This is my 6th or 7th time staying at Pacific Edge, i will never stay anywhere else in Laguna!  The location is unsurpassed. The hotel staff is top notch every single time; and i mean the entire staff.  The valets, the beach attendant, the maid service, and the front desk all are spot on and have been each time i stay here.  The location is perfect, 5 minute walk to Downtown or the Main Beach.  The Hotel itself is an older property and does show its age is some aspects, but it is clean and charming.    I truly love this Hotel and am already planning my next getaway!
Manager Response: Looks like the secret's out, Diane! :) Thanks for singing our praises, and for making so many memories with us. We can't wait to see you again!  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I took my mom to the Pacific Edge for her 80th birthday in September, 2014 and we both loved it.  We had a room on the second floor overlooking the beach, which was beautiful.  At night we kept our door to the balcony slightly open so we could hear the surf.  The room was very bright and sunny with bright colors and simple furniture.  Our room was very quiet because we were located on a corner so we only had people to the right of us.  The beach was within 5 minutes from our room via a small staircase.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  We did have a rather negative experience on the beach due to a shortage of chairs, however, the manager on duty that day was very kind in helping resolve the issue.  The hotel definitely needs to make certain they have plenty of chairs on
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your mom's special day! We're thrilled that you were so pleased with your room, and that our team made you feel at home. Keep us in mind next time you need to get away. We'd love to welcome you back!  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Everyone was very friendly, Teresa helped stock our room with towels and anything else we needed.. They have washing machine and dryers located at the hotel which is very helpful.. When you walk around the grounds all of the staff greats you with a smile and says hello and asks if there is anything they can do for you.. And the best part is its pet friendly...
Manager Response: We'll pass this along to her! Thanks for making us a part of your time in California. Keep us in mind if you ever need to get away from those chilly Michigan winters! :)  All the best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: You can't beat the location if you are in the wing that sits right on the ocean.  Loud waves and a lot of activity on the rented rented cabana open space below if you keep your door open.  But they shut it down at 10pm.  I think the price is very high due to location, but the rooms are dated and could use some upgrading - remove the carpet, put in some nice tile, redo baseboards, etc.  Things by the ocean always need touch ups...
Manager Response: We're currently in the process of making the necessary updates to our rooms, and we'll certainly keep your feedback in mind as we move forward. I'm sorry you weren't happier with your stay, but I hope you were able to enjoy the beautiful beach, and I'd be happy to discuss this further if you're so inclined.  Thanks for your candor,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: You are definitely paying for the location of this hotel.  We loved eveything about Laguna and what it had to offer, a completely different feel to the rest of California.  We enjoyed our stay at the hotel but mainly for its gorgeous location right on the beach.  The rooms are tired and really need some money spending on them especially the bath rooms, but when you can lie on the bed and see the ocean its perfect.  Pros, free chairs and parasols on the beach, free wifi and its walking distance to all the restaurants and shops of Laguna.
Manager Response: Laguna Beach really is unique! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, Courtney, but it sounds like you were a bit disappointed with your room. We're currently in the process of making the necessary updates, but we'd be happy to discuss this further if you'd like. Until then, thanks for reviewing us.  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful Boutique Hotel on the Beach
Summary: We loved the location, in the heart of town! On site restaurants and bar was a bonus! Although there are many choices in a variety of food tastes within walking distance. Galleries, shops & specialty stores all within a short walk as well. Our room aesthetic was cool & contemporary. The bedding was very comfortable, the room clean and the private balcony overlooking the beach and ocean had amazing views!!! We stayed in the Reef Tower, a little quieter and peaceful! We visited to Celebrate our Anniversary and it surpassed our expectations!!! It was a Romantic, Fun & Relaxing Escape!!! Employees were very polite, professional & friendly! We would like to recognize "Javid" for exemplary customer service regarding an inconvenience. His attitude and thoughtfulness regarding our
Manager Response: Sounds like a fantastic escape, Nadine! We can't wait to welcome you back next time you find yourself on the west coast!  Cheers, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: I was concerned about all of the negative reviews for this hotel.  Very wary of our little weekend trip, BUT pleasantly surprised!  Having done loads of research on beachfront lodging (whether it's a house, hotel or motel) the going price for an inexpensive oceanfront room is typically $400 nightly and the variables are far and wide.  For $200 we secured a room in the beachfront building.  Our room was next to the beach steps and while there were people passing by often it was really nice to hear the ocean from our bed even if we didn't have the unobstructed view.  The room size was ample, had a jacuzzi tub and was dated but worth it for the price.  Once you hit the sand you don't want to leave!  There are staff present to lend out chairs, umbrellas and even sand toys.  This is
Manager Response: It's always hard to leave once you get a whiff of that fresh ocean air! Sounds like you had a fantastic time with us, and it was a pleasure to make you feel at home. Thanks for the wonderful review, and keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: A must do experience!  Extremely helpful staff - Stacey at the front desk was so helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.  This is a very pet friendly hotel with an amazing view and location.  Right on the beach, with heated pool, huge hot tub, free beach chairs, walking distance to Ralphs and shops.  We didnt want to leave the hotel.  Food is a little costly and walls are a little thin, but every staff member we saw was nice, friendly and enjoyed their job.  From Stacey to Javid, to the beach chair guy, maid service, etc.  All smiles from all employees!
Manager Response: It's hard not to smile when you're in Laguna Beach! Thanks, Barrett. Hope we'll get to have you back soon!  All the best, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My husband and I were in the area for my brother-in-law's Marine Corp graduation and can I just say the staff made our stay here great. Akiko was great at check in and made sure the two rooms we had were close. They remembered our names every time they saw use. While we may not have had a straight view of the ocean (we had a small view) we were a two second walk from the beach!! The hotel is a very short walk from all the restaurants, shopping, galleries, and bars. We had a great time and all the staff was amazing. Thank you for making our family trip such a great one and we will be back :)
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your stay, Aimee! We hope we'll get to welcome you back again soon.  Warm regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary Heading: Fantastic, we will be back (as soon as possible!)
Summary: We stayed 5 nights at this property right on the beach and we really couldn't have been happier with our stay. We weren't totally satisfied with a couple of aspects of our room after our first night and we shared our concerns with Akiko at the front desk (who was so amazing at her job, a wonderful and helpful presence to have on the front desk!) and she promptly and professionally resolved our concerns by having us moved to a different room. And I don't mean just giving us a room key, but having everything in our room, including the snacks and drinks we had put in our mini-fridge, moved to a new room while we were able to go and enjoy the beach. Outstanding. I think the rooms at this property vary in quality as there are multiple buildings of different ages and states of
Manager Response: Yes, the Purple Haze goat cheese does have a very unique flavor! I'm glad that team was able to make you a new dish, and that you were so happy with the rest of your stay. I'll definitely pass your kind words on to Akiko -- she'll be delighted! Keep us in mind next time you need to get away, but until then, thanks for reviewing us!  Regards,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: Located right on the edge of the Pacific Ocean,our room actually did offer unencumbered views of the surf and sand below us.  Our room was huge, by hotel standards, and featured a kitchenette with full sized fridge, stove, microwave, dishes and cups plus cute dining table and chairs.  The decor is retro 60s but clean and our bed super comfy.  We had a balcony with high belly bar table and chairs perfect for having cocktails and enjoying sunset.  Two adjacent restaurants provide beach fare--the deck and driftwood which offers room service.  Last morning there I ordered scrambled eggs and they were very fresh and fluffy, with bacon and toast.  We ate dinner at driftwood which we thought was kinda pricey. I had lobster for $50--I thought it was chewy and my husbands cioppino had a
Manager Response: That sounds absolutely perfect, Diane! Thanks for the lovely review. Keep us in mind next time you're looking to unwind -- after all, you can't beat these views!  Regards, Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: My friend and I stayed at the Pacific Edge hotel for his birthday. It is a bit of a staycation. The hotel is right on the beach, great location. We booked a standard non view room and to our delight it had amazing Laguna and ocean views.  The restaurant the Deck was fun for drinks in the afternoon. Amazing views and fun atmosphere. The rooms are a bit dated however the view made up for it. There was a giant Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The location of the hotel is great. So many restaurants, bars and shopping within walking distance.  The staff were super friendly. We definitely  had a great stay.
Manager Response: Thanks for celebrating with us! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay, and the fabulous view. Keep us in mind for next year -- we'd love to welcome you back again!  Cheers,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: This hotel is mediocre at best. It feels and looks like a surfer's hostel from the 60's. The only thing going for it is the proximity to the ocean.  The hotel amenities are non-existent, the rooms are in rough shape, towels do not match, the balcony is desperately in need of a paint job.  Other than its location next to the beach there is absolutely no reason to recommend staying at this hotel. For the price it would be better to stay at a real hotel.
Manager Response: We do host a good amount of surfers, but we want all our guests to feel at home with us. We're sorry that you didn't, but it seems that your room has yet to receive the renovation we've been planning. We hope to have another chance to wow you once the remodel is complete, but until then, thanks for your feedback.  Best,  Thomas Lee General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at other Joie de Vivre hotels and always been happy, but this one misses the mark. I would describe it as a "surfer hotel." Its best attribute is its location--right on the beach and easy walking distance to the very interesting town of Laguna Beach, which is full of boutiques and restaurants.   The hotel itself is very basic. Mandatory valet parking adds $27 per night to your bill. Our ocean view room had a torn curtain, badly stained carpet, a toilet that ran continuously without a jiggle, and furniture that was equivalent to what was in my college dorm. When we tried to enjoy the beach, the chairs were hard plastic and they were out of beach towels.  This hotel reminded me of places where we spent spring break when I was in college. They were great when I was
Manager Response: We completely understand. Our accommodations are typically on the simpler side, but most of our guests find that they're exactly what they need. I'm sorry you were disappointed, but we've always felt the view made up for anything we lacked. Still, we hope you'll keep this in mind next time you need to get away -- we're working on renovating the entire property, and we know we can wow you!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Perhaps my expectations were too high...
Summary: I wanted pool and beach.  Well the pool closed early, maybe 10pm? I guess it's because of noise because it was EXTREMELY loud from our room.  Suddenly it got quiet and we were excited to enjoy the amenities and they were closed.  gr.  Also the pool is embedded between parking garage and buildings > not much ambience.  The other pool is right on PCH.  The beach is VERY small.  It's unlikely anyone will sit on the beach outside the hotel.  The room was ok, nothing special.  The best thing was the mimosas etc in the lobby early on Sunday morning.  By the time I went back to the room to get my husband and come back they were gone.  Oh and there's a ping pong table, but all the balls were under a vending machine and most were smashed on one side.  Disappointed :(
Manager Response: It's upsetting that you left disappointed, as we certainly would have been happy to try to find you an ocean side view. However, I'm surprised that you found our beach on the smaller side. It's a private beach, but we don't typically hear that feedback, but I appreciate your candor. I hope we'll get another chance to wow you once our renovations are complete.   Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: LOVE this place.  The ocean view is spectacular!!  We drive over every year, park our car and don't move it the whole entire time we are there.  The hotel is so centrally located that we can walk everywhere.  Have enjoyed the staff throughout the 15 years we have been going to Pacific Edge and can't wait to get back next year.
Manager Response: We're proud to be your favorite spot in town, Julie! Looking forward to welcoming you back again next year.  Thanks for all your support, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This charming hotel has everything going for it...location, walkability into town, beautiful beach, clean comfortable rooms, terrific places to eat close by and at the top of the list, a staff that make you feel you are the most important guests ever!
Manager Response: Thanks so much, Jane! Hope to have you back again soon.  Warm regards,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Beach shack feel right on the beach with friendly staff spectacular views from restaurant and all facilities provided on the beach. We only stayed one night and whilst the village view room was clean it was quite exposed to the outside hallway,the enamel on the bath had worn through. We ate lunch but there was a funeral tea on the adjacent balcony leaving staff stretched for service.
Manager Response: We hope we get to host you for a longer stay soon, John, but in the meantime, thanks for your feedback. Looking forward to having you back someday!  Cheers,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Oceanfront!  Our latest staycation as at Pacific Edge Hotel.  Great staff and comfortable, well laid out rooms.  Recommend Reef Wing for oceanfront vs what we stayed in - Surf Wing.  Noise from Bungalow Party Rooms below us put a bit of a damper on our stay.  Other than that - fabulous location and hotel.
Manager Response: Sorry to hear that the party was a bit loud for you. We hope that wasn't too intrusive, Sue, and we're thrilled that you had such a great time with us. Looking forward to welcoming you back again next year!  Regards,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: The Beach, the Food, the Shopping- some of the best!
Summary: This boutique Hotel is right on the beach.  We had an ocean side room and it was amazing to hear the surf and be lulled to sleep by the sounds of waves.  Just a short walk to a variety of eateries and shopping.  The vendors were all helpful, warm and friendly.  Walking the gorgeous beach was amazing.  Would I go back...absolutely!
Manager Response: Sounds like a fantastic trip! Thanks for making us a part of it.  Warm regards,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I gave this hotel an average rating.  It's not that the hotel was average.  It's that there were highs and lows that averaged out:  High - LOCATION - This hotel is in the perfect location in Laguna Beach.  Great beach spot, in the middle of the great Laguna Beach Restaurants, Galleries and Shops in their Upscale Glory.  High - Service - All employees were friendly and helpful.  Low - LOCATION - At this hotel you better have forked over the bucks for a beachfront room or a bungalow or you'll miss out on much of what this hotel has to offer.  We booked a "Village View" Room.  What you see is a view of the windows in one of the hotel's other buildings.  In fact the "window" is actually facing the outdoor hallway.  Open your curtains and allow anyone walking by to peer into your
Manager Response: Yes, we are currently performing maintenance to better our guests' experience, and I'm sorry if no apologies were offered due to the interruption. Still, I appreciate your candor, and I'm glad that you still enjoyed our location. I hope you'll get to join us again next time you need to unwind, Mark. I know you'll be impressed once the renovations are complete!  Regards,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We Love this hotel because the location is right on the beach, sound of the waves from your balcony, the view, staff is excellent and caring, near shopping, and restaurants are right on the property.. Sunset is unreal with beauty..!!!  My husband has health issues and I can put him on the Balcony where he can enjoy the view and etc, while I can walk on the beach and still keep an eye on him. I spend my birthday here every year.. We so love it here.   This is the hotel to come to totally relax, enjoy, put smiley faces in your veins, and Soothe Your Soul.....My Favorite Place...!!!!
Manager Response: You really can't miss those sunsets! So happy to hear that you and your husband were able to enjoy them, and that you've made us a part of your celebration every year, Bonnie. That means the world to us! Thank you for the kind words, and please let us know if there's anything we can do to make you and your husband feel even more at home. That's what we're here for!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: QUITE FRANKLY THE BEST EXPERIENCE IN LB!
Summary: I've stayed at this property before; it's a beach house feel property, however this time I can safely say my experience was 10x better by how friendly and accommodating the staff was this time around. They've clearly gotten some new hires which is a good thing. At check in a gentleman by the name of Javid greeted us with smiles and warm welcomes; definitely a first, most people (including staff) in LB are stuck up and unfriendly. A great host and definitely made the stay welcoming this time around. A big thanks to Javid; we'll be staying more and more now at this property now that staff has improved immensely! Cheers!
Manager Response: While I'm sorry you've found some of our team unwelcoming, I'm thrilled that Javid made you feel at home. Thanks for staying with us! We can't wait to have you back again.  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Great location but that's it. The room was old and dated, stains on the carpet and a musty smell, water pressure so low I'm still covered in soap.Some rooms may have a view but most do not. If you're intention is to stay out of the room as long as possible and you want to be walking distance to the beach and downtown, this place will work if you set your expectation bar pretty low.
Manager Response: It seems that we have yet to renovate that particular room, Chris, but it shouldn't have been in such poor condition. I'm sorry, but most of our guests feel that the view is what sets us apart. I hope we'll get a chance to have you back when all the rooms are complete, but until then, thanks for voicing your concerns.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This was our 4th stop on our California road trip, and probably the most disappointing. Check in was swift, with a really helpful friendly guy. Managed to sort valet parking, although the guy was mega busy and harassed, but was keen to be as helpful as possible. Room was beach front in the Reef block. Absolutely fabulous views, and lovely to be able to hear the sea so close, but the room was something resembling a surf shack with a very large flat screen TV, just didn't seem to go. The bathroom was tiny, no where to put anything, minimal towels ( which to be honest is not a bad thing) no safe, and a fridge that you would throw out of a student house. When you went on the balcony you were inhaling cigarette smoke from next door and got a constant drip of water on your head from
Manager Response: Thanks for your input, Carol. We do have simple amenities, but we feel that our view is what really makes the vacation worthwhile. I'm sorry you were disappointed, but I understand your concerns, and I'll keep it all in mind moving forward. Hope we'll have another chance to wow you next time you're in California.   Regards,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The room was a bit smaller than we anticipated. But when we stepped out on the balcony....wow. Enjoyed every minute of our stay. Everything we needed was in walking distance. We will definitely go back again.
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your time away! Can't wait to have you back next time you need a little sunshine.  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It was valet parking which cost  $24 per night. You don't have much choice as it is metered parking on the street. The room we stayed in was basic, very clean, but when you step out onto the balcony the view was AMAZING. The balcony actually overhung into the Pacific hence the name. At night it was so relaxing sitting on your balcony and hearing the waves crash off the rocks and watching the sun set. The staff were very helpful as well. Not all the rooms look onto the ocean so it may be better to ask for a room overlooking at time of booking.
Manager Response: It really is amazing! So glad you loved every minute of your stay. Eddie. We'll see you next time you need a little California sun!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed in room 136 right on the water. This property is literally on the main beach within walking distance of all Laguna has to offer. The room was beautifully decorated, cozy, clean and the property is very welcoming. You will not be disappointed with your decision to stay here.
Manager Response: You can't beat that view! Thanks for staying with us, Tanya. We can't wait to have you back!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: laguna beach itself is magical.  I have stayed at this hotel several times and I would never stay anywhere else. ocean front rooms are the best if you are wanting to commune with sea because you can see and hear it all the time. breathtaking sunsets. clean beach. beds comfortable, staff very friendly and responsive. nice pool if you prefer that. free chairs and umbrellas set up for you. easy walk to shops and restaurants. can't say enough good things about this place!
Manager Response: So glad you've loved every single trip, Louise! Thanks for relaxing with us, and for singing our praises. We'll be here next time you need a little California sun! :)  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Pleasantly surprised. I thought that the rooms would be hit or miss, but our two rooms were great.   The oceanfront room was recently redone: good size, nice decor. Bathroom is tiny but functional.   Village view room, also recently updated: good size, nice decor, small (not updated) kitchenette. Tiny, functional bathroom.   Staff: extremely friendly and helpful.   Dog friendly! No hassles, no deposit or fee.   I think the property would be challenging for the mobility-impaired due to the layout.  I would definitely return. And spring for the oceanfront room.
Manager Response: Can't wait to have you back again! Keep us in mind next time you need to get away from it all. You're going to love that ocean-front room! :)  Thanks for reviewing us, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: we stayed with another couple the week after Labor Day.  we had an excellent stay in the reef building.  the rooms have beautiful views, the beds comfortable, microwaves upon request.  the cleaning staff are excellent, very accomdating if you want them to come back later in the day.  the coffee k-cups are an excellent touch and they will refill your coffee needs daily and your soaps, shampoos, clean towels. this hotel is walking distance to all the local restaurants, shops, etc..  the laguna beach down the road and in walking distance is beautiful.  this hotel has been renovated in the last year, and is an excellent place to stay.  many reviews state it still needs work, which is true and I would add to continue to keep up the improvements so it keeps it current state or better.
Manager Response: I'm sorry for the miscommunication, Renee. It seems that we were unaware of your request, but we'd be happy to discuss this further so we can book your stay as soon as possible. Email us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you'd like to talk!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Three of my bridge ladies and myself have been going to this hotel yearly since the early 1990's.  The location is great for walking and leaving the car behind for restaurants and shopping.  We enjoy the beach amenities: lounge chairs, and/or short chairs, towels and umbrellas plus a thundering surf which encourages some surfers to provide beach entertainment for all guests to enjoy.  The staff is helpful and friendly and the hotel is frequently updated to maintain a comfortable stay.
Manager Response: Always good to see you again, Janice! Thanks for making us a part of your girls' weekend, and for all your support -- that means the world to us. Can't wait to have you back next year!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Pacific Edge hotel in late July 2014. We knew we'd be paying a premium for oceanfront accommodations but at $600+ a night, we would have expected a bit of luxury. Reading reviews and doing research, the Reef building is the best option. We found the rooms there, although certainly on the beach, to be rather motel-like. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms and it still had that feel. Exterior was tired too, rusty stairs and hand rails going down to the beach. The staff was nice, we loved the onsite DECK bar/restaurant, and it was a good location for walking into the main town, but I would not stay here again for that amount of $, maybe half. For that price point they're going up against Ritz Carlton and other luxury hotels -- Pacific Edge isn't in that class.
Manager Response: While we do have a more relaxed ambiance than some of our sister properties, we take pride in offering all of our guests a welcoming beach-side environment. I'm sorry you were disappointed with your room, and especially the exterior. It requires constant attention as the salt water is quite harsh on our buildings, but we've always felt that the view was well worth it. Still, we appreciate your feedback, and we hope you'll give us another chance to wow you next time you're in California.   Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We're here for a wedding. Great location, great atmosphere. Great clubs within walking distance. Great value. Request a lower room on the water. They're much nicer than the east facing rooms. We were walking around at 3 am, Very Very Happy and no one batted an eye. I'd definitely go back. Great spot for a staycation.  All staffers we met were great. Nothing negative can be said about Pacific Edge. Just get a West facing room. You can literally reach out and touch the water. Almost like Bali, but with waves.
Manager Response: Great comparison! It sounds like you felt right at home, Chad, and we're thrilled that you had such a relaxing wedding weekend. Keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My wife & I went here for our honeymoon this week, this hotel is amazing!  A MUST stay in Laguna. We stayed in the 'Reef Tower' which is literally on the ocean!  It has the charm of an old beach/surf hotel, but some updates have been made. Our room was clean, remodeled, and I had towels in 2 minutes after calling the front desk. Kudos to the Pacific Edge staff!
Manager Response: Thanks for celebrating with us! Keep us in mind next time you need to get away, and above all, congratulations!!   Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing view, just a little tired around the edges
Summary: The first thing we saw on opening our room door was the ocean through the balcony window.  The room was literally over hanging the ocean, it was incredible, and everything we'd hoped for.  Balcony was perfect for sitting with a cold beer watching the sunset, the surfers and waves.  For that this hotel is worth ten out of ten.  Our room was a good size, but the paintwork, carpets, bathroom and balcony were all in need of improvement.  This is sort of reflected in the price as compared other Laguna hotels that were on the beach.  We had an ongoing complaint about water dripping on our balcony from the upstairs room.  We told reception about it on three separate days, they said it was the aircon from the balcony above and would send the engineer, but as we write this on our final
Manager Response: You're right, Tina -- we should have been more forthcoming about the leak. One of our engineers did get a chance to check it out, but since there was no glaring issue, we concluded that the drip was simply condensation from the unit. Still, we understand that this could be bothersome, and we hope we can get it taken care of for the next guests. That aside, I'm glad you enjoyed the views, and I hope you had a chance to unwind. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My work schedule has me working 60 hours per week, six days a week. So every 5-6 months I  like to get away down to where I grew up in Laguna Beach. I always like to stay at the Pacific Edge Hotel that is right on the beach. A special thanks to: Bryan Dougherty, Front Desk Supervisor, that ALWAYS gives me a warm welcome and excellent service!
Manager Response: Those are some long weeks! I'm so glad you were able to get away, Bob, and that you felt at home with us. Let us know if we can do anything else to help you relax -- you deserve it!  Thanks, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I agree with others, that the hotel needs work. However knowing this, that the $300 a night- off season for an ocean front view- makes it worth while.  The staff are always friendly and welcoming, and when we called regarding early morning construction/welding noises they offered to have them start later. Not the best way to relax on a vacation, with repair work  to the rusted railings, especially wanting to stay in the comfy bed as long as possible.  We will stay there again, finding a deal that includes parking again, every little bit helps. The beach access and views are worth everything.
Manager Response: Sorry if the construction got you out of bed too early. We do our best to start off at a reasonable hour, but we can definitely talk to the team to make sure everyone has a chance to enjoy their morning. That aside, we're thrilled that you loved your stay -- we loved having you! Keep us in mind next time you need to get away. The beach is gorgeous in the fall, too!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: 25th wedding anniversary stay. Got the Reef Tower, and worth every penny! Staff exceeded my expectations, everything was truly great, and every staff person went out of their way to make me feel personally valued. Add that excellence in service to a fabulous suite with a wrap-around private balcony, and you have a great memory waiting to happen. Just so fabulous! It'll be our place for our anniversary for years to come.
Manager Response: I'm so glad you decided to celebrate with us and had such a nice time. I just love hearing that the staff really made you feel welcome and comfortable. Thank you so much for sharing your experience and I hope to see you again soon.  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Edge on Laguna Beach over Labor Day weekend and had a wonderful time.  The hotel was just terrific and the front office staff were the friendliest and most accommodating people to work with.  Our room was great except for Wi-Fi, which was spotty throughout our time.  The TV would lose its signal and maintenance fixed it once but it went out again after a couple days.  Overall, the room was spacious with very nice furniture, a nice kitchenette area, and good-sized bathroom with an EXCELLENT shower and nice plush towels. We didn't need a rental car because the Free Shuttle Trolley stops just a few steps from the hotel and stops at various locations around Laguna Beach, and it runs all day until around midnight.  You are within walking
Manager Response: Sorry for those initial hiccups, Jan, but we're thrilled that you loved your stay with us! The ocean really is beautiful at this time of year. We hope we'll get to welcome you back for more R & R soon!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My son & I recently stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel in Laguna Beach. For a room that cost close to $300 a night, this hotel needs major work.  First, the positive. We found the staff to be entirely welcoming. We had no problems on check in and our request for a room on the upper level of the Bahia building was easily accommodated.  The valet staff was friendly and always prompt with bringing our car when we asked for it. Housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean.  The bungalow and restaurant areas were very nice and well maintained.  The location is good, in the center of town, and within easy walking distance of shops and restaurants.   HOWEVER, this hotel needs major work. We had a two bedroom apartment. First, the lock on the front door did not work properly and
Manager Response: It is clear that you room is in need of further renovations, and we appreciate your thorough feedback. We will certainly keep this in mind as we move forward, but we are currently in the process of making the necessary updates. Thank you for your candor, and we hope to have another chance to impress you next time you need some California sun.  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for two days in one of their honeymoon suites. The view was to die for! Romantic sunsets right outside our balcony view. They surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne. (definitely a nice touch) Nice restaurants in the area. A Ralphs Grocery store walking distance for convenience. Everyone was helpful and friendly throughout our stay. Definitely a relaxing get-away! Would stay there again in a heart beat.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for making us a part of your honeymoon, Wilmery! We're thrilled that you felt at home, and we'd love to see you again next year. Until then, let us know if there's anything else we can do to make your next visit even more memorable!  Congratulations,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Make sure to read this before hitting confirm
Summary: Let me say that the whole reason I write reviews is to give honest upfront answers. The facts! Thing I would tell my family if they were staying there.......  Positive : Right on the ocean 10 min walk downtown The deck great place to have drinks and watch sunset  Negative:READ! -Free wi-fi internet never worked- went down twice and she said oh it must be your cell service and we are fully booked so a lot of people are using it which in that case the building should be equipped for that kind of high usage -several issues with the key card not working -Rooms very small, shower is tiny and gross you can hear the other people in the other room talking and there tv on -tiny pools one of them backs up to highway -Enter the room from outside so not very safe -EXTREMELY NOISY!! Windows
Manager Response: We pride ourselves on making everyone feel at home, so it's upsetting that you felt as though your concerns went unheard. However, we feel that your comments are quite valid and we'd like to look into them further, particularly the incident with the guest in your room.
