Please email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com so we can discuss this in depth. I hope to hear from you soon.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I visited for the weekend to celebrate his birthday.  It was a lovely choice for us.  Relaxing and in walking distance to just about everything.  We will certainly select this hotel for future stays.
Manager Response: Thanks for celebrating with us, Lynne! We'd love to have you back next year -- or sooner!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: With the online reviews I can only say we were pleasantly surprised with our stay.  The rooms were comfortable, clean and the staff were very friendly and attentive to your requests. With the recent storm there was little to no beach at the hotel but a easy walk and you had plenty of beach to enjoy.  This hotel is centrally located to shops and many dining options.
Manager Response: Sounds like we exceeded your expectations! Thanks for the wonderful review, Bruce. We'd love to welcome you back again next year!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Even Off The Highway, The Rooms Are Great!
Summary: Stay a night at the Pacific Edge and it was exactly what we wanted and hoped for. The rooms are very simple, but with a modern edge to them. The benefit is that you should actually get out of the room and enjoy dining in the area, the beach, etc. You can get delivery to the room, but I have always felt it is work traveling out. We got a room with a partial view of the ocean, but the partial was more than that and wonderful. Hearing the sea and waves at night were a great way to relax and fall asleep! The front desk staff were great and offered suggestions during our stay.  Tips: Valet the car and they will also sort your luggage, go out to eat, and enjoy the beach!
Manager Response: There's no better way to fall asleep than by listening to the sound of the waves! It seems like you had a lovely time in Laguna Beach, and it was a pleasure to be a part of it. Keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I certainly do not know where all the negative comments are comimg from but I must say I never write reviews online but this hotel earned a darn good one. I stayed at the hotel with my mom from aug 20 to 22 to take a really important exam in the area and I must say, the hotel really made it a suprisingly beautiful experience.  I opted for the village view room which is the room without the ocean view but I thought it was the best value. I requested a room that was not near the road so they gave me one in one of the renovated areas. So if youre worried about street noise, just request early. It was clean, cozy, and you could tell it had a lot of that beach charm. I could even hear the waves from our room. The staff was top notch and everything that came with the hotel especially
Manager Response: Sounds like you felt very refreshed before your exam! It was a pleasure to make you feel at home, and to read your kind words. Thanks so much for making us a part of your visit, Francis. We hope you get your results back soon!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We booked last minute and was able to check-in early to an oceanfront room.  Javid, Marrisa and Britnie were awesome from check-in to check-out.  The room was clean, close to great restaurants, shops and a flight down the steps to the sand! We could not have been happier.  We were celebrating birthdays and anniversary all in one and it was worth the added$ upgrade to ocean front. We look forward to returning at some point to this hotel. Loved it! Thank you.
Manager Response: That view is definitely worth the upgrade! So glad that we could be a part of your special celebration, Kelly. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: I'd rather go to Laguna Beach (Pacific Edge hotel) than Hawaii
Summary: Recently I stayed at Pacific Edge Hotel at Laguna Beach California.   Fantastic time and stay. stayed 8 days at the Reef Rooms.  they have now been remodeled and updated and it made a difference! (new bathrooms, carpeting, bedding, drapery , huge Flat Screen TV wall)    the view from the room is amazing - with Huge ocean waves,, and sunset .    Above all, the front desk office staff -- every one of them -- always First Class.  (Brian, Kim, and others).   Willing to answer and help with any questions on the reservation when I called - one does not always find this ever.  they are so friendly , makes you feel like they have known you as a friend.    The Hotel has a fantastic Valet service  - (hastle free ,, and great speedy guys that run it).   The Hotel now has a new restaurant
Manager Response: You'd choose us over Hawaii?? That's quite a compliment, Sharon! Thanks for the fantastic review --  we'll be sure to share it with the whole crew. Keep us in mind next time you need to unwind. The ocean is beautiful all year long!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Alert, Alert, Alert!!!  Last days storm (August 26 till now) resulted in a terrible beach erosion. The sand level at the hotel beach dropped six (6) feet. No more sand on the beach. Just huge rocks. Obviously, no umbrellas, chairs, etc. Swimming is prohibited.  Ocean lovers must be aware!
Manager Response: Yes, that storm really was intense, but we're just happy that everyone is OK and there was no major damage. As you know, we are unable to control the weather, but we are able to protect the safety of our guests, and that's why swimming was prohibited. I'm sorry you were disappointed, Pete, but I hope you'll have another chance to join us again. We hope the weather will cooperate next time!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My family and I just spent a week at pacific edge and had a perfect vacation. Laguna is gorgeous and the weather was fantastic. But the most memorable part of our stay is how great, helpful, professional and accommodating everyone was who works at Pacific Edge. From the valet and housekeeping to the front desk team, these folks do a fantastic job of helping people feel at home and comfortable!! Way to go!! I especially want to thank Blake, Stacey and Marissa!! You all were so wonderful to deal with. What a great customer experience! We will return and will refer others to you for a stay in the future.
Manager Response: I'll definitely pass this along to them, Lance! Thanks for making us a part of your trip, and for the stellar review. We can't wait to have you back again!  Take care, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My family and I have stayed at Pacific edge for over 10yrs and have generally enjoyed our experience. We understand it is a beach front hotel so the rooms can be a little sandy and beach like. With that being said our last trip was a terrible experience. I made our reservation over 3 months ahead of time and requested room 14 as it is our favorite, I understand it is only a request so when we arrived and found out that 14 was booked we were disappointed not to mention the fact that the front desk agent as she was telling us the room was booked also asked us if we had ever stayed their before (how would I know where room 14 was if I had never been there, I'm also part of your joy club) obviously no one looked at the reservation or training is not happening. She explained to us
Manager Response: First off, let me apologize on behalf of our team. You've been a part of our family for a long time, so you know that what you experienced is completely out of the ordinary. We should have done more to make sure that everything was up to par before you moved into Room 14, and we should have checked on you afterword. That's unacceptable, Kristen, and I'll talk to everyone about this so we can see what went wrong. In the meantime, I appreciate your candor, and I hope you'll email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com so we can make this right.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We were on our way up the coast and decided to stay a night in Laguna Beach for the night. A quick internet search on dog friendly hotels and this was one of two places we were interested. We were on a bit of a budget and wanted to stay under 200.00 per night. Javid met us at the reception desk and offered us a very good rate for a beautiful room with a ocean view. He also sent us a bottle of wine to celebrate our first visit. Javid and all the staff at the hotel were committed to customer service and it showed!  We will be back for a longer stay next year.
Manager Response: Sounds like everyone had a blast! Thanks for making us a part of your trip.  Hope to have you back soon, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful week long stay at this hotel! We were here for our honeymoon over from the UK and were really looking forward to staying so close to the beach, we didn't realise how close to the beach we would be until we arrived in our room, our balcony over-looked the beach and next to our room was a staircase leading directly down to the beach below us. The room wasn't overly big or well decorated but we didn't spend much time in there anyway. Had a good size bed for two, with enough space for us to unpack. The bathroom was simple but had a great, powerful shower.  The view and location was really the best thing about it all. The only thing in the room which would be good for them to add would be a safety deposit box in the room, as we were travelling from abroad, we had
Manager Response: That's a great suggestion, Lori, and we'll definitely consider the safes as we continue our renovations. That aside, I'm thrilled that you two loved the beach, and that you had some time to get a little sun before heading back home to the UK. :) Thanks for making us a part of your honeymoon!   Hope to have you back next year, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: stayed there , familly of four, ocean view room 133.  pro: the view, fantastic , the location on a very long beach, surfers around and "trendy atmosphere". room size was good, the beds are pretty large and in good condition.  cons: rooms looks like a motel 6 ones, but i guess this is what youd expect in this location, since i did not saw new buildings around.  service in the desk not friendly, rather rude . place in the shade refused for us, but next familly got em, although they said no reservation possible. food is good but overpriced
Manager Response: Nobody should have made you feel unwelcome, and I apologize on behalf of our staff for falling short. I'll speak to them about this immediately, as well as the beach chairs. Was the interior of the room up to your standard? We'd be happy to discuss this further -- let us know if you want to talk.  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I love the Pacific Edge- we have been coming every year since 2002. You cannot get a more perfect beach location. We love staying in the Reef and love that we can walk to everything. We park the car when we get here and don't get back into the car until it is time to go home. We walk to breakfast, dinner, downtown, and we also went to the Pageant of the Masters without having to worry about where we are going to park. We also got a great nights sleep because they beds were so soft. And we love all of the staff- very friendly. I LOVE this place!  Stacey
Manager Response: We love hearing from happy guests like you, Stacey! Thanks for the wonderful review. Keep us in mind when you need to get away! :)  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: For over 10 years we have been coming back to Pacific Edge. The location has me spoiled.  Overall it is the staff that makes it special. Each year they remember my family and always go out of their way to make it a great stay.  Special thanks to front desk staff , manager Brian D. And Zachery this year we had a little hiccup and they went above and beyond to make the rest of our stay memorable. Thank you:)
Manager Response: You're too kind, Joanne! Here's to the next 10 years! :)  Looking forward to your next visit, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a fabulous holiday  in the USA and we stayed our last five days at the Pacific Edge. We were lucky enough to have a room looking over the ocean which was perfect. The beds were great, the room had a fridge which was very handy if you wanted to buy some fruit etc at the local supermarket, Ralph's. Best of all was a proper coffee machine. The staff at the hotel were excellent, always helpful and friendly. The housekeeping were also very efficient. I thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the hotel had a very cool, funky ambience about it. My only slightly negative comment was that although the room had recently been refurbished and was of a good standard for the amount we paid, I did feel however that the refurbishment was not completed to a very high standard and I would think
Manager Response: I'm sorry you weren't happy with our renovation, Debbie. We think we've achieved a great beach look, but we'd be happy to hear more about your experience with the room. So, what didn't you like about it, exactly? That aside, it sounds like you had a fantastic trip, and it was a pleasure to be a part of it. Hope we'll get to have you back next time you need to get away!  Take care, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Beautiful view but the hotel itself could be improved. There were improvements going on as we were staying but for the price they were charging one would expect that these should have already been done. The first night and following day after we arrived there was no hot water. This was a nightmare for us as we were travelling with a small child who needed medicated bath oil for eczema and consequently became quite sore. The receptionist was not very apologetic and offered us another room to be able to have a shower- not helpful with a child under the age of 2. I was also annoyed that all we received was an apology. Hot water is a basic need and especially for a hotel that charges these prices. On the whole though the location is to die for which is why I rated a 3 and we still
Manager Response: HI Zeva90,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your stay. You're absolutely right -- hot water is such a basic part of your stay, and we should have been far more helpful when we tried to offer you a solution, especially considering your little one's bath time routine. I'm so sorry we fell short, but I want to make this right. Do you remember the receptionist's name?   Hope to speak with you soon, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Staying in room 308 in the Seas building and it is awful! Hotter than Las Vegas, no clock in the room, toilet runs, I can hear the entire conversation in the adjoining room, and that is just the beginning. Complete disappointment and $400 for this dump is ridiculous. I stayed in room 20 two months ago. While not luxurious, it was clean, well taken care of and I was completely satisfied! That's why I returned. The staff this visit is also completely in attentive but last visit they were amazing as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your most recent visit. We wouldn't want anyone to be uncomfortable, so I hope we were able to address these issues during your stay, especially the AC and toilet. Let me know if we didn't get a chance to make this right -- I know we can do better than this. Email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you want to discuss this further.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I am quite surprised by some of the reviews that aren't so good.  This place was great.  Yes, it is not as new and updated as some hotels, and it is a little funky, but you could not ask for better staff or a better location to town.The front desk staff was great, the valet staff is second to none, and the housekeepers were all very accommodating and friendly.  When we called the valet to get our car, on most occasions they asked if they could bring it to our room.  Once, when I thought I had gotten a nick on the car door, the valet went to his own car to get some rubbing compound. Luckily, it was only some gunk on the door.  The only thing that marred the stay was a couple next door who must not have been able to read the no smoking signs!  Great stay.  We would certainly
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay! Thanks for taking the time to share your story -- we can't wait to pass your kind words along to our team. Keep us in mind next time you need to unwind. We'd love to have you back!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed in room 105...one of the strangest rooms I have ever stayed in.  Can't have the curtains open because anyone walking past can see in the room.  The whole place smells of mold and is nasty.  I know this is the beach but I have stayed at surf and sand, the ritz and st regIs and none were like this.  Kitchen is out do the 50's and I wouldn't even get in the shower.  Slept with a chair under the door handle and can't wait to leave in the mornimg.  No closet just a rail in the corner of the room, nasty dirty broken furniture, and a tv that doesn't work.  Only consolation is the bed was clean, otherwise I would have given one star.  There is a lot better in the area.  Room looks nothing like the pictures on the website.
Manager Response: Hi englishgalinusa,  I apologize that you had this experience with our hotel, I'm really surprised that you left feeling so disappointed. We definitely would have been happy to look into these issues during your stay, as we'd never want anyone to be uncomfortable. Were you able to speak to anyone about this? Let me know -- I want to make this right, and I know we can do better.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: My favorite place in the world to stay that is literally on the beach and has the most spectacular views and sunsets!
Summary: I have been staying at this hotel for over 30 years. My mom fell in love here and brought me here as a child. I continued the tradition by bringing the man of my dreamshere, who would later propose to me in room 115 of the reef tower overlooking the beautiful Pacific Ocean.the entire hotel staff was in on the proposal and it was one of the happiest days of my life. Of course, we immediately planned out a way to get married there, it only seemed natural.I rented the entire surf wing and reef tower and had the wedding of my dreams; with white icicle lights that lit up every balcony and up the palm tree, over 5000 rose petals gently placed onto the wood deck, I married the    man of my dreams. Most of the staff attended my wedding and I remember thinking "there is no more beautiful
Manager Response: We have to admit -- reading your story brought a tear to our eye! It's such an honor to know that you've not only made many childhood memories here, but also that you and your husband have formed new ones with your own family. What a beautiful tradition, Marie! Thanks for sharing that with us, and please let us know if there's anything else we can do to make all your visits special!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Another Happy Birthday at Pacific Edge
Summary: Joie de Vivre never lets me down on my birthday -- this summer, I had a good room upgrade with partial view of the ocean. Traveling light, I declined bellhop services in checking in but was pleased to tip the valet parking attendant for helping me check out. A regret -- the former Beach House restaurant next door no longer serves breakfast during the week, but a small restaurant nearby was satisfactory.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a fabulous stay! Thanks for celebrating your big day with us -- we can't think of a better way to ring in another year. :) See you next time you need a little time away from it all!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice views if you pay Top Dollar!
Summary: My husband and I stayed for a weekend here after searching for a true ocean front property. Wet did get our wish, sliding doors open, wonderful sound of the ocean. Otherwise, a very strange hotel layout (really an old motel fixed up). Room was quaint, but small. Loud AC old fashioned wall units. Luckily is was cool in the evenings..1st room they assigned us was right next to the outdoor shower and 3 stairwells, including the one that comes up from the beach. A big NO thanks on that one. They did move us, with lots of begging.. Lots of rust and weathering on the railings and a little run down. Great overall concept for the place, but for $500+ per night, we would have rather stayed up the hill at the Ritz for the same price..
Manager Response: I'm sorry if you felt you had to fight for a different room. That shouldn't have been the case, so I'm going to look into this right away. Despite that, it sounds like you enjoyed most of your stay, and I hope you'll give us a chance to show you an even better time once our renovations are complete. I know you'll love it!  Thanks, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I've never taken the time to write a review but feel compelled to do so this time. Started with NO offers of help getting bags to our room. Then came the room shock.  My "room with a view" is about a 200 sq foot hole in the wall facing an alleyway and the back of the building that does have a view. There is a huge gap between the door and the doorframe where anything could come crawling in; not to mention the noise level.  I found the rooms to be stinky and downright gross. The restaurant is NOT kid friendly and is uber expensive. What you see online is NOT what you get and I should have took that advice. Big mistake coming here and not how I wish I was ending my CA vaca....not looking forward to another night.
Manager Response: While some of our rooms are in the midst of receiving the necessary upgrades, we have never found them to be in the condition you've described. Which room did you stay in? We want to know more about this so we can make this right, so don't hesitate to reach out if you want to discuss this further. We know we can do better than this.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Reserved beach front room to hear waves but all I heard in evening time is the back of the fan from the room next to me which sat right on my balcony. Room was not clean when I got there and a comb that did not belong to me sat under my bathroom sink my entire stay.  My maid NEVER stepped on the balcony or wiped any glass windows. The maids there when it was Vacation Village did it ALL!  The manager one night told me its the same maids.  If that's the case, my maid that showed up Monday morning must have started to work when she was 15 years old. For the price of that room I expected much more.  I have 4 children and am a part time teacher aid so I only get to take one trip a year.  This was it. The families I travel with every year stayed in the cheaper rooms to save money, but
Manager Response: It's so disappointing that you left feeling this way, Rita, especially since you have such fond memories of visiting with your family. However, it's clear that we've fallen short -- your room should have been in much better condition, and it's upsetting that our housekeeping staff didn't do more to impress you. This isn't OK with us, and we hope we can make it right. Please don't hesitate to email us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com so we can do just that.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We've gone to Laguna every summer for over 20 years. This time we thought we'd try Pacific Edge cause Joie de Vivre has a good reputation. Well they need to do more to improve this place, which used to be Vacation Village!  Despite what is shown on their website the room we got was literally 200 sq feet looking at the side of the building next door. The closet had a curtain. The tiny closet sized bathroom tile grout was staring to break up, even though this was one of the renovated rooms. After complaining, which we heard other guests also doing, they offered us some ice.  After complaining again, we were moved to another room on day 2 of 3.  One of the un-renovated rooms, it was nicer with a larger bathroom and a partial view of the ocean, but thin walls.  On the good side, the
Manager Response: While we are currently in the midst of making the necessary updates, it appears that we still have some work to do. I'm very sorry that we fell short, especially considering how long you've been visiting us, and I hope we'll have a chance to make this right soon. Please email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com -- we wouldn't want to lose you over this.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: It doesn't get better than this!!!
Summary: Paim the extra money for the junior suite. Sometimes the sound of the ocean is almost too loud!!! What a fabulous view in every direction. Everyone tries their best to make your stay the very best. Everyone smiles and is pleasant. The front destk supervisor, Bryan Dougherty is wonderful and goes out of his way to take care of each and every request. Yes, some of the accomodations are a bit worn and dated...but this place is a perfect place to relax and renew. Can't wait for our next trip back!!!
Manager Response: Nothing's more relaxing than the sound of the waves! Thanks for coming away with us, and for the wonderful review. We can't wait to see you again next year -- or sooner! ;)  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Checked in today, staying 5 nights in PARADISE!!
Summary: We checked in this afternoon, arrived 45 mins early and it was no problem at all. Our room, an oceanfront junior suite, is just simply amazing.  We are in this room for three night then will be spending two nights in their "Pacific Suite", the nicest room on the property.  I'm so glad that I worked the extra hours that I did in order to pay for our dream vacation. Amazing beach access, we saw dolphins from our balcony 10 mins after first walking into our room.  I'd just give two words of advice, BOOK IT!  And to the staff of PE please keep up the great service!!
Manager Response: That's great advice, David! ;) So glad that you loved your stay, and that you were able to see the dolphins from your balcony -- I hope you got some photos of that! Thanks for singing our praises. When will we get to have you back?  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This place is truly a Motel 6 charging big bucks. We booked a village view room and actually had a nice view of the ocean from the balcony but the room is utterly disappointing. From the gross carpet on the floor to the 1970s bathroom, it was really just a big letdown.  BIG LETDOWN!! They were our of beach towels all day. What beachfront hotel that charges $400 night doesn't buy enough beach towels? Motel 6.  There are many better places to stay in Laguna Beach. Don't do it!!
Manager Response: Dan,  Although some of our rooms have yet to receive the necessary updates, we are confident that our quality far surpasses that of the average motel chain. I'm sorry you were disappointed, and that we ran out of beach towels, but I can assure you that what you experienced is completely out of the ordinary. As such, I know we can do better, and I hope we'll have a chance to prove it to you during your next stay in Laguna Beach. If you have any further questions, don't hesitate to email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: We stayed at Pacific Edge for two days in mid-July.
Summary: Excellent service, great location.  Worth the expense of the junior suite.  We would definitely stay there again.  Go to Pageant of the Masters.  Unique experience! This is all travelers need to know about Pacific Edge.
Manager Response: Sounds like the perfect getaway! Thanks for making us a part of it. We'd love to see you again next summer -- or sooner!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Pacific Edge, we will come back.
Summary: We loved the hotel. The atmospere was great and the service also. Exstra good help from a lady with name Amanda. The hotel had great views and was located on the beach. It`s great for families with lots of activitys in the water. Nice pool and good service with bed and towels at the beach.
Manager Response: Amanda will be so glad to hear from you! Thanks for singing her praises, and for making us a part of your getaway. Keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun! :)  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My brother and I each booked a room at the Pacific Edge for a wedding weekend in June.  Mine was a generously sized oceanfront room with a balcony directly over the beach - beautiful views, great for watching surfers in the day and sunsets in the evening.  Room was nicely furnished, although the bathroom was on the tiny side. My only complaint would be the thin walls - teenagers partying next door at 3 am sounded like they were in my room.    My brother's room in contrast was unpleasant and looked out onto the parking lot; he ended up upgrading to an oceanfront room where he was very happy. There's coffee and baked things in the lobby in the morning, and two nice restaurants on site where we had three very good meals. Bottom line, if you can get an oceanfront room, it's worth
Manager Response: Although I'm sorry your brother wasn't happy with his original room, I'm glad we were able to upgrade him so quickly. It sounds like you two had a fabulous time here in Laguna Beach, but I apologize if your lively neighbors were a bit bothersome. We would have been happy to help quiet them down -- don't hesitate to ask us! Until next time, thanks for reviewing us. We hope you'll keep us in mind next time you need a little California sun!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I am a traveler from Cambodia to camping in Yosemite, but this has to be one of the most horrible places we have stayed at given it's price tag. I would value it at $30 a night given some better hotels I've stayed at for $50 beach side. They have only renovated a few selective rooms but the rest are out of the 1940's with carpets, bathrooms and walls that are from the 40's but with mold. If everything is booked in Laguna make the extra drive to Dana point for a much better hotel selection. It's worth it!!!
Manager Response: Your comments are disheartening, and I wish we could have done more to wow you. While I can assure you that all of our rooms have been updated well after 1940, we do have some that are more updated than others. Summer is a very busy time here in Laguna with most hotels sold our every night; we try hard to be very competitive in terms of pricing to offer a great oceanside escape to our guests. I want to thank you for your feedback and I will be sure to pass this along to our team and make the necessary corrections so these issues do not happen again.   Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: *BEWARE - The rooms in the pictures are NOT the rooms that you get.  We were told that they have "a few" renovated rooms that were already booked and a couple of bungalows that they rent for day use only.  Most of the people who checked in while we were there came back to complain about the quality of their room.  Very pleasant staff and are very good at smiling, apologizing, and mentioning the renovated rooms for future visits for a hefty price.   Pros:  On the beach side of the street.  Valet guys were super helpful and nice.  Beach staff for chairs and towels were super nice and helpful, too.   Cons:   Dirty, dirty, dirty!  Our room wasn't ready at 3:30 b/c check-in is at 4pm, so we parked our car with their valet for another $24 and walked around a bit. At 4pm they said it
Manager Response: We want our guests to know exactly what they're getting, Lisa, and we're sorry that you were so disappointed with your room. We try hard to point out the difference between the Village View rooms and the Ocean Front rooms. That said, we wish we could have done more to impress you. We appreciate your comments and we take them to heart. We will make sure to re-visit the room type descriptions on our 3rd party booking sites so that they match our own websites descriptions. We also like to encourage all guests to book directly with us so we can better inform them of our hotel and make sure they choose a room type that best fits their needs.    Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Sleeping in a closet for over $300 per night
Summary: We called the hotel at 11:30 in the morning and asked to see if our room might be ready when we arrived.  I also asked for an updated room, having read other reviews.  Four hours later we were finally able to check into our hotel room- which can be no larger than 220 square feet with a tiny bathroom.  Our window looks directly into the wall of the building next door.  Clearly Joie de Vivre put very little money into the renovation- the very old elevators barely function, the pathway between buildings is circuitous and we had to enter the restaurant through a bizarre path, because the room that the hostess normally takes you through had been rented- really? Next door are several children which I can easily hear through the walls and our room reverberates each time they slam the
Manager Response: I'm sorry you were disappointed with your room. Some rooms are a bit smaller than others, but we do our best to make all of them comfortable and welcoming. Were you able to voice your displeasure during your trip? We would have been happy to make new arrangements for you. Regardless, we want to make this right, and we hope we'll get a chance to do that soon. In the meantime, don't hesitate to email us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you want to talk.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Absolutely love this hotel. Great price and great location. I have stayed both ocean view and village view. Both are great, if you want to spend a little extra it is great to be ocean front and sit on the balcony in the evening and night. If you want to save a little money the village view is a great price especially in the off season and paying in advance. I find we do not spend much time in the room so village view is a great deal and you are still steps from the ocean where you can sit in the lounge chairs and umbrellas provided by the hotel. I am heading back on September 7th for my 4th stay. I am so excited! We also had a great housekeep Raphaela last May when we stayed, she was fantastic and we developed a quick friendship with her. She works her tail off!
Manager Response: Yes, the Village View really is a great deal! We're thrilled that you had such a fabulous time lounging on the beach with us, Laura, and we really appreciate your kind words. Looking forward to seeing you again in September -- it's only a few months away! :)  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We have been coming to this hotel for many years, back when it was Vacation Village actually. We absolutely love it! You are paying for the location definitely.  The hotel is nice but it is very casual and beachy. If your expecting Montage style amenities this is not for you. If you want a great family friendly hotel with a amazing view this is a great choice! We come back every year so they must be doing something right!!
Manager Response: It's always a pleasure to welcome you and your family back for a stay on the beach, Sally. You really can't beat these beach views, can you? Hope everyone had a wonderful visit, and we can't wait to see you back again!  Take care, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I loved the location, loved the staff, the cleanliness of the room was fair/poor however the room was different than the website it was stunning.. I was very dissatisfied with the room itself, the size, the location of the room and upkeep of the room. The room was approximately $400 per night and was the size of a very small bedroom -2 double beds, bathroom so small you could not turn around in it It faced the parking lot. I was shocked at the room compared to photos on the website. I went to the front desk and was upgraded for $105 extra per night, just so we could SEE the ocean over a all building in front of us, facing another parking lot. Valet parking was another $28 per night, so when you add it all up, I paid $532 per night, to face over a big gray building to see the
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize that you weren't satisfied with your initial room. It sounds like there was some miscommunication when you were booking -- the pictures online show a variety of rooms and room sizes, which may have caused some confusion. That said, we're more than happy to find you something more to your liking. Above all, we want you feel taken care of. Next time you book, don't hesitate to let us know if you have any questions or concerns. We'd be more than happy to explain exactly what you're booking.   Take care,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We planned a family vacation to Laguna Beach and wanted easy beach access and to be near shops and restaurants. That's why we chose this hotel.  Positives: Location is the best thing this hotel has going for it. They have beach staff that will provide you with towels and chairs, and you virtually have a private beach. This was the best part of staying here. They also have a restaurant called the Driftwood that overlooks the beach and has a nice, reasonably priced menu with good food. The front desk was very nice and professional, and the valet service was good. The free trolley service stops right out front which was convenient.  Negatives: Unless you are paying a premium to stay in the beach front buildings (Reef, Reef Tower, Surf, or Bungalows), please be aware that the two
Manager Response: If you're disappointed, we're disappointed. Thank you for taking the time to reach out to us here on TripAdvisor, travelmama, as it presents the opportunity to make things right.   While i'm happy to hear you enjoyed our location and tasty restaurant, I'm disheartened to read that we missed the mark in other areas. When it comes to your room, we list all of our room options on our website. That said, we never want our guests to feel frustrated, so I sincerely apologize for any miscommunication.  The last thing we want is our guests to leave unsatisfied, so I am truly sorry that we missed the opportunity to improve your experience before you left. Next time you need a Laguna Beach getaway, I sincerely hope you'll give us another chance to impress. After all, we're not happy until you're happy.  Kind regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome Beachfront Hotel, plus pets stay free!
Summary: Just remove the mold from the air vents and the place would score 100% in our gradebook! Plus our dog stayed for free! Only thing that needs to be told to all customers with pets is that your dog is not allowed on beach during the day. Evenings Is okay....the oceanfront rooms are worth the price!!!!
Manager Response: Mauricio and Amber,  Sounds like a great stay! Glad to hear that you and your pups enjoyed your time in Laguna Beach, and I hope that we'll get to welcome you back for more fun in the sun next time you need to get away from it all!  Thanks for reviewing us, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I have to start by saying I absolutely love the location of this hotel. I like that they now have valet parking and I love that we can walk to downtown so easily.....but I have to say the place is getting tired. The grounds are not as kept up as they could be, the rooms need new carpet & drapes, which seem heavy and old. We had a corner room and the sliding glass door window was clean but not the balcony nor the window to the south. In fact the side window was so dirty we just kept the drapes closed. It would also have been nice if the air had been on upon our arrival. The room was hot & stuffy. Thank goodness it has air conditioning. I'm really beginning to question if it's worth the money. I will really have to think about it before we stay there again.
Manager Response: I'm very sorry to learn of your disappointment, especially considering how excited you seemed to visit us. As you may have noticed, we are currently in the midst of making the necessary renovations, but it seems that we still have some work to do. However, they should be completed shortly, and we'll certainly remember your words as we move forward. Thanks for being so candid, and I hope we'll have another chance to show you a five star stay next time you need to get away.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing place excellent location great price
Summary: We love the Pacific Edge the staff are all very friendly and attentive we have stayed here the past 5 years and have never been disappointed I feel as if they have improved every year for the better not that they had alot to improve on you could just see that they want your stay to be amazing we love staying in the Ocean view rooms the best view we can walk to everything once we arrive we never use our car walk to breakfast lunch and dinner or eat at the hotels restuarant. We were just there thru the 4th of July and will return again in two weeks for a end of the summer stay.
Manager Response: Five years in a row? We're honored, Angela! It's been a pleasure to make you feel at home, and we hope to continue welcoming you back for years to come. Thanks for reviewing us, and be sure to join us during the winter months, too -- the ocean is absolutely beautiful all year long! :)  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a nice sized room which was clean and well appointed. The staff was very friendly. Parking is valet only which is a negative in being an additional cost considering how expensive the rooms already are. The beach was so-so compared to all the otherd we visited in Cali. May consider staying again if the price is right.
Manager Response: So happy to hear that our team made you feel at home! Thanks for making us a part of your trip, and please keep us in mind next time you need to get another taste of the West Coast!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Stayed at Pacific Edge as part of a block of rooms with a wedding.  The location is great - right on the water!  Loved hearing the sound of waves crashing, so peaceful!  I didn't get a chance to try any food at the hotel, but it is within walking distance of all the hustle and bustle, plenty of restaurants to go too around the area.  Room itself was very small considering the rate was close to $250/night.  It was also supposed to be a renovated room, but didn't really feel like it.  Bathtub very out of date, carpet seemed a little worn, and the A/C unit was so loud - made it difficult to sleep through the night without waking up.  I think the room could benefit from having a chair as well, there was nowhere else to sit in the room other than on the bed.  I was also a little
Manager Response: I'm sorry you were disappointed with your room. We are continuously updating our rooms, and we will certainly remember your words as we continue our work. That aside, I appreciate your candor, and I hope you had a fabulous time at the wedding. We hope to have another chance to make you feel at home soon.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Me and my brothers stayed at the hotel for 7 night. The restaurant are very good and the beds are amazing!!! You can not beat the ocean view. You are 5 minute walk to down town laguna. The front desk helps you find some great restaurants and things to do.
Manager Response: That's a lot of pluses! :) Thanks for making us a part of your getaway. We'd love to have you back soon!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Possibly the best kept secret hotel-wise in Laguna
Summary: My wife and I made a last minute decision to stay the weekend in Laguna -- "last minute" as in July THIRD -- not smart.  I scoured the Internet and found little available and what I did find available was either over-priced for its distance from the water or started around $1200 a night (not what we wanted to spend for a last minute stay).  We made some calls and eventually found The Pacific Edge Hotel.  I've been hanging around Laguna for most of my life and grew up surfing there, but couldn't think of where this place was for the life of me, but it was too good to beat for the price ($264 a night after a "Joy of Life" discount) so we took the chance.  CUT TO REVIEW:  This place was perfect.  We've never cared for the Montage/Ritz Carlton experience and if that's what you are
Manager Response: Wow, Chris! I'm absolutely thrilled to hear how much you and your wife enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you so much for taking the time to sing our praises -- that means the world to us. We can't wait to have you back again!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I will say, sometimes the view is all you need for people to come visit.  This little gem has depth! Just because the view was unbeatable you think I shouldn't expect too much in the way of service, after all this isn't the Montage.  We were so surprised to see this little Boutique Hotel was better than the Montage. The service was outstanding from the Valet to the Beach attendants. At no time did we feel we're staying in anything but a first class Hotel.  The restaurants are amazing, we saw the bungalows while we were there because Rebbecca took the time to show us around, everyone seemed to be focused on our visit. We had an amazing time and will be back. Thanks for making us feel welcome. We are back in Seattle now and can't stop talking about our amazing visit!
Manager Response: We want all of our guests to feel like they're staying at a five star resort, so I'm thrilled that you were so happy with your visit, Pete! Thanks for singing our team's praises, and please keep us in mind next time you need to get away. After all, you can't beat this view! :)  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I honestly don't know how anyone could ever rate this hotel anything but fabulous.  After a stressful work week, I checked in on Friday and spent a glorious weekend in one of the updated, beachfront rooms. My room was ready at 2pm so they allowed me to check in early.   Friends (from LA) joined me on Saturday and were amazed how close we were to the beach.  There really was no problem with thin walls either, as I didn't hear a peep out of the adjoining rooms.  Besides, the waves crashing outside were so loud, it would have drowned out any noise coming from the other rooms, which was just fine by me.  As others have said, the hotel is very close to the grocery store and fine dining.  We ate at "The Deck" and really enjoyed the atmosphere.  I would love to go back when I save up
Manager Response: Paradise, indeed! We're so glad that you and your friends had such a great time with us, and we'd love to welcome you back for many more. Until next time, thanks for the wonderful review. It made our day!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: VIEW OCEAN FOOD DRINKS -this place has it all
Summary: great views of the ocean and you are 'on it', great food (make a reservation a must) drinks, great servers, great employees that are so very caring. a perfectly funky and beachy place.  I would stay again for sure, great for business, couple, family, friends or solo!
Manager Response: Sounds like a lovely getaway! We can't wait to have you back again!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The whole trip started when i called to make a reservation with the hotel. Bryan at the front desk was extremely helpfully and really set my family up to have a great little vacation. Bryan met all my family's needs from an ocean view to having a pack in play all set up in the room for my 2 year old daughter when we got in the room. When we got to the hotel James checked us in and descried all of the amenities that the hotel has to offer which really helped us plan our evening. We really enjoyed how Jordan helped us get some beach chairs and towels when we made our way down to the water. Overall i cant what to go back and stay at the Pacific Edge again.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to make you feel at home, Thomas! Bryan, Jordan and James will be thrilled to hear how much you and your family enjoyed your stay, and we hope to welcome you back for years to come. Until next time, thanks for the fabulous review!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Now this place is a gem. I got a great deal on Hotels.com.  When I arrived the parking was a little confusing you have to go through the alley way to the valet.  Once I got to the reservation desk to check in I was pleasantly surprised with the service.  I asked for a better view and I was offered a beachfront view for hundred dollars more.  I took it, & boy was I glad I did!!!!! I sat outside on my L-shaped patio above the ocean listening to the waves. I didn't even want to sleep....or be in the room-  the view is that amazing.  When I got to my room I had a bottle of complimentary wine;)
Manager Response: We're so glad you loved your stay, Christine! Thanks for making us a part of it, and for sharing your fantastic review. We can't wait to welcome you back again -- the ocean is beautiful in the winter, too!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This place has character. It's not 5 star but it is cosy and perfectly positioned on the sands of Laguna Beach. If you want salt, sand, surf and sun this place is for you. The rooms vary in class from the bungalows on the beach to those 50m away. Whatever your budget, come to relax and unwind. The beachside restaurant is great. Perfect for cocktail over sunset. Wifi is good and there are heaps of great restaurants within walking distance to enjoy. I had a great week here.
Manager Response: A California dream, indeed! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your week with us, and we hope to continue welcoming you back for years to come. Until then, thank you for sharing your kind words!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We just got back from spending 4 memory filled, relaxing nights here. Having now stayed at this property, I think some of the mixed reviews stem from guests who paid for something other than a beach front view. Don't expect to go to sleep and wake to the therapeutic sounds of waves if you don't book a beach front room. Our room was so close to the water that it created an optical illusion that we were actually looking out from an ocean view room on a cruise ship!  The dining experience at the "The Deck" was terrific and it too is right on the water. Both the food and service were great. No issues with the responsiveness of the valet on our trip.  In summary, great location, great service and great value. Select the room type to match your expectations. Understand that while this
Manager Response: You're absolutely right, Elli -- those sunsets are absolutely unforgettable! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to continue welcoming you back for years to come. Until then, thanks for taking the time to review us!  Warm regards. Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Super friendly staff, bright and clean rooms, excellent service.  We also rented a bungalow for the day and hosted friends which I'd highly recommend.  The location can't be beat, literally steps from all Laguna has to offer.  The sunsets are also an amazing bonus :)
Manager Response: Those sunsets really are gorgeous! I'm glad you had a chance to soak them up, and I hope you'll continue to visit us for years to come. In the meantime, thank you for the fabulous review ;)  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I read a lot of bad reviews, but we stayed in a renovated room which was very nice. It's pricey, but you're right on the ocean and can't beat the view! Nice sized balcony with 2 chairs and a table. Left the patio door open and listened to the ocean every night we were there.
Manager Response: We love hearing the waves as you settle in for the night! Thanks for making us a part of your trip. We hope to welcome you back again next year -- or sooner!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Reading these reviews and trying to decide on place is really challenging, how can a place get 5 stars and then a 1 star from someone else. Which reviewer is sane?  Here is a " sane " take: The service was fantastic, on par with the Ritz Carlton, really!  I was treated like I owned the place and everyone used my name and they really cared.   Bryan and Kari at the front desk were amazing. She made a restaurant recommendation and then called to make sure they had what I wanted on the menu. Extra mile for sure.   Full disclosure, as a so cal native I do my best to avoid Laguna Beach because of all the tourists lol! But due to a seminar I found myself at the Pacific Edge Hotel and I was so glad I did!  Pros: Perfect  location, you can walk to any of the best restaurants. Park your
Manager Response: So glad we could make you feel at home during your seminar, Evan! Thanks for giving us a try, and for sharing your kind words -- they mean the world to us, especially coming from a California native. We hope to have you back again soon!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Bring the kids for the great beach
Summary: Second visit here, both sorta business trips for photography but I brought the family.  You have to lug your luggage if you're on the cheap side but the beach is great and staff are great.  I had to get my car to shoot and evening gig and, of course, the valet guys took 30 minutes to bring it up which meant I was late but they made up for it by keeping my car upstairs after that.  Watch the unsupervised pool\spa area for rowdy Euro (my countrymen) teens canon-balling into the hot tub.  And the pool is slippery if you have young ones.  But we've stayed there twice so we godda love it.  Right?
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that our valet wasn't timely, but I'm glad we were able to resolve the issue, and that you enjoyed the rest of your stay. Thanks for visiting, and for the great review. We can't wait to have you back!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had a room on PCH side half of hotel has been renovated not the half we stayed in. Pool areas need updating. Good budget hotel. The deck was lots of fun. Our room did not connect to an elevator so we had to lug our luggage up and down stairs.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us! Although it seems that you were a bit disappointed with the hotel, it's good to hear that you still enjoyed hanging out at the Deck. We hope you'll get a chance to try one of our renovated rooms sometime, but in the meantime, we appreciate your feedback!  Thanks, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place.  Highly recommend.  Location location location
Summary: This place is great.  It is located in town in close proximity to everything.  Park your car with the valet and forget about it.   Front desk staff...terrific.  From check in to check out.  One night, we needed a rollaway and due to fire laws could not bring a rollaway in.  But, the housekeeper came to look at room and suggested that we put a mattress on the floor.  This may not sound glamorous but the alternate was to sleep on the floor directly.  She was such a huge help and so nice of her to come to the room and we all decided that a top mattress between the beds was a great solution.  The beach is great but get your lounge chairs early because they run out in the early afternoon while we were there.  The hotel was at maximum capacity.
Manager Response: Nothing like a few days at the beach! Sounds like you had a lovely time, Tammy, and we couldn't be happier to hear that. Thanks, and keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We had never heard of the place, but took a chance because of the location.  Turns out the Pacific Edge is "THE"  place to stay.  The location is fantastic, within walking distance of shops, restaurants, art galleries and much more. The hotel is right on the beach, so no problem. The rooms are great, and the Deck for food and drinks is wonderful.   The best part  is the service.  It was phenomenal. From the valet to the beach guys, first rate every step of the way.  People went out of their way to insure that every need and request was covered.  I can't say enough for professionalism and courtesy of the entire staff.  We will be back again and again. It's the way a vacation is supposed to be.
Manager Response: We work hard to make sure that everyone feels at home, so its nice to know that you were so impressed with our service, Ben! Thank you, and keep us in mind next time you need to get away!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Hard to find a better view
Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge the week of May 19, 2014 in room 703.  We had a third floor beach front room with a great balcony and unobstructed view of the ocean and a long stretch of Laguna beach.  The room was large, clean and nicely decorated and recently remolded.    I originally tried to book a beach front room with two double beds to accommodate our family of four but nothing beach front was available.  Rather than give up the view, I opted for a beach front room with one king-size bed hoping we could somehow squeeze in two rollaway beds.  I was able to get one roll away bed no problem but I couldn't talk the staff into providing a second no matter how much I tried :-).  They said it was a fired hazard which I can certainly understand.    We ended up buying a nice
Manager Response: You're right -- views like this are hard to come by! It sounds like you and your family had a fantastic getaway, and it was a pleasure to be a part of it. Thanks for sharing your kind words, and for the note about your air conditioner. We'll look into it, but in the meantime, we hope to have you back next time you need a little sun!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: From check in to check out all the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect and my dog had so much fun on the beach and in the water. When I checked in the front desk gave me a free appetizer coupon for the desk so I took advantage of that and orders delicious shrimp taco's and beer and sat at the patio edge and listened to the musician and the waves crashing. It was delightful
Manager Response: It's nice to hear that you and your four-legged friend enjoyed your time on the beach! Thanks for staying with us, and for the fantastic review. We hope you'll keep us in mind for your next getaway!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in a great location in Laguna Beach.  The staff was really super.  I can't think of a room closer to the water than the room we stayed in.  At high tide the water was just under the balcony.    Check in was easy.  Our room was nice looking and well appointed.  You can tell that this is an older hotel that has been updated but it watching the sun go down from my deck was beautiful.  We actually live in the town that borders Laguna and attended a friends birthday.  The location was great and most restaurants and bars in town are walking distance from the hotel.  They also had a nice outdoor patio that we used with our friends get together.  We literally walked out our door and down some steps to the sand.  The guys put out a group of lounge chairs for us.  We all met
Manager Response: Sounds like a great vacation! Thanks for staying with us, and for your suggestions regarding our restaurant. We'll definitely keep those in mind, and we hope to have you back again before the summer's over!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The location of the hotel is awesome.  It is a few blocks down from the public beach and all the traffic and people so it is quiet.   The room was on the small size but we didn't spend a lot of time in the room so it really didn't matter.    I had requested early check-in and received a call when we were 15 min from the hotel telling me the room was ready.   The valet actually helped us with our luggage.   Everyone on the staff was helpful and very friendly.   They had lounge chairs, beach chairs, umbrellas and towels that we could use.   They even reserved chairs for you.   The only downside to the hotel was the number of stairs you had to walk to either get to your room and to get to the beach.   It is definitely not for someone who has trouble walking.    I would definitely
Manager Response: Lounge chairs, umbrellas and sunshine -- sounds like the perfect beach day, Susan! So glad you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to have you back again soon. Until then, thanks for the great review!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice accommodations with unbeatable ocean views
Summary: A friend and I were looking for true ocean front rooms in Laguna Beach and found exactly what we wanted with Pacific Edge. We stayed on the third floor of the updated Surf Wing and couldn't have been happier. The rooms were beautiful and had lovely balconies overlooking an expansive view of the Pacific Ocean. We both thoroughly enjoyed falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves.  My only criticism is with the connecting rooms. I apparently had a connecting room with a young couple who I could clearly hear having a "special" time one afternoon. Other than that, everything was great and I can't wait to go back.  We also enjoyed the beachfront restaurant. We only had a couple of cocktails and an appetizer, but service was good and the food was tasty.
Manager Response: Love that Surf Wing! It sounds like you had a lovely view, and we're delighted that you were able to fall asleep to the sound of crashing waves. There's nothing more relaxing! We're glad you enjoyed your stay, and we appreciate your feedback about the rooms. We'll keep that in mind! Until next time, thanks for the fabulous review. Looking forward to having you back!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The valet service was fast and friendly but all other service was disorganized and poor. Our room was tiny and had a urine smell. The towel bar came out of the wall and the quality of the room was poor overall for the price. The restaurant on site did have good food but was too small for this size hotel. It was extremely overcrowded. The cleanliness of the grounds was also poor.
Manager Response: I'm shocked to learn of the state of your room, Jennifer. I wish we could have moved you while you were staying with us, so please don't hesitate to ask next time. In the meantime, we want to make this right, so email us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you'd like to discuss this further.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: View to die for , hotel more like a motel!!!
Summary: We booked this place, due to the views .. We were not disappointed!, travelling all the way from Scotland , we love the USA , so we worked our way down the west coast. Stunning coast, BUT, the hotel was so, so disappointing !, we paid a great deal to stay 3 nights for a sea view, but the wood chop decor, the state of the run down room, no hot water for 36 hours!!, generally dirty state !. For such a stunning location , it seemed this hotel was too reliant on the view !. I spoke to the manager , he was apologetic  and told me I would be I would receive  a refund, 6 months on and still waiting!!. I would recommend to use a better hotel, this was like a British butlins!!. Avoid and book better, but the scenery was just beautiful!.
Manager Response: Although it's nice to hear that you loved our view, we wish that you were more impressed with your room. Since your visit 6 months ago, we have updated & renovated the oceanfront rooms that I know you will be impressed with. It's unfortunate that we couldn't refund you in a more timely manner, and we want to take care of this right away. Please email our Front Office Manager Brian Sullivan at bsullivan@jdvhotels.com so we can get your billing addressed. We know we have what it takes to make this right.   Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: We were confined in a box.
Summary: Got the hotel for Sat & Sun of Memorial weekend. I was told we would not have an ocean view for $200.00 a night, that's including parking. It being a holiday weekend I understood that. But I was not prepared for room #52.  This room had one tiny window that faced a wall, and if you opened the drapes people in the hallway, pool area, parking area, and balcony's off the facing building could see in. The room was tiny, in two steps you hit the bed. there was not even a chair to sit in. (not enough room). The Shower was tiles were cracked, and the window seal had bad water damage. On a good note all staff were very nice. Jerry
Manager Response: I'm sorry your room fell short of your expectations. As you mentioned, you visited during a busy holiday weekend, and we had a limited number of rooms available. From your description, it seems that your bathroom needs some attention so thank you for letting us know the room number. Still, we appreciate your feedback, and we hope to have another chance to show you a fabulous getaway soon. After all, our location can't be beat!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The hotel is located right on the beach and walking distance to everything else.  The staff are amazing and make-up for the minimum maintenance and upgrades that have been left out of the rooms.  We had a two rooms, one facing the pool and a shared suite that faced the ocean.  The main front room that faced the beach was fantastic!  Well decorated, well lit and included a mini-bar/kitchen area and an updated bathroom.  The other room was definitely meant for children and possible step-children.  There were two beds and no chairs.  The bathroom caulk was peeling and I could see into our neighbor's shower.  The air conditioners were noisy and you had to close the windows and lose the ocean breeze and sound of the waves because of your neighbor's A/C.  But wait a minute, we are on
Manager Response: You really can't beat our location! Although I'm thrilled that you enjoyed it, I wish you had been more impressed with our rooms. However, we appreciate that feedback, and we'll definitely keep it in mind moving forward. Thanks, and we'll see you next time you need to get away!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Waves crashing below...best nights sleep ever!
Summary: I am originally from SoCal. I miss Laguna Beach and when I have a chance go for a visit. A couple of years back we tried the Pacific Edge hotel. It is right next to one of my favorite restaurants the Beach House.  It turned out to be the perfect location. It is easy to walk to the main beach or just enjoy the beach right below. We kept the sliding doors to our balcony open all night and at high tide the water reached the base of the building....on clear days we could see Catalina Island. There are lots of cafes and restaurants near by and the grocery store on the corner caters to the hotel dwellers with fun take away food options and a good wine selection. I will be returning here again and again!!!
Manager Response: We can't wait to have you back again, Laurin! Until next time, thanks for the fantastic review. We'll be here when you're ready to relax!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Love this hotel. Beachy feel with a great location. You're just steps to the sand. Service is good. Location can't be beat. Love it. Perfect for a quick couple getaway or for families or for friends. Pool is nice for a quick dip after swimming in the ocean. You're close enough to town to just park your car and walk to dinner and then take a lot lovely stroll back to the hotel.
Manager Response: Excellent! So happy to hear that you enjoyed your vacation, and we hope to welcome you back for years to come. Until then, thanks for the lovely review!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Best kept hideaway in Laguna Beach
Summary: My daughter and I spent a lovely Easter weekend at this hip, cool, friendly little hotel. From the minute I made my reservations the manager "Brian"-( He was the best ) made sure to accommodate my unexpected change in dates and was happy to do it. The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is absolutely wonderful with the beach and surf theme to the ocean front rooms with a balcony overlooking Laguna's coast line . Rooms are clean, color coordinated and comfortable with an urban feel, but not overly swanky helping to keep the rates affordable. They offer beach side set up with lounge chairs and umbrellas and towels for a hassle free day at the beach.. If you have little ones they also offer a pool for a little swimming. I prefer the beautiful beach myself. At sunset you can hit
Manager Response: Yay! We're so glad that you've already booked your next visit! We can't wait to welcome you back, but until then, thanks for the fantastic review -- your kind words were a treat to read. See you soon!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel at Laguna for 6 nights .First impressions were great as I loved the reception area,  lovely & bright & clean. The staff were excellent so helpful & when we got to our room we were very pleasantly surprised .Having read some of the reviews before we went I knew we had to have a sea view.The room was bright & clean the bed was so comfortable but the view was the most amazing thing with a  balcony over looking the beach & the Pacific Ocean .We went on the beach every day and the hotel provide free sunbeds & towels.  The hotel has an unusual layout but that didn't detract from our overall experience.The laundry facilities were a welcome extra and quite cheap to use. We loved the Deck were we ate a few times & the food was fabulous the best food I
Manager Response: I can't thank you enough for this glowing feedback, Judy, and it was our pleasure having you stay with us. I hope you'll keep us in mind for your next trip to California, and we'll do everything we can to perfect your experience. Thanks again for the wonderful review and your recommendation.   Best,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Located just off Laguna Beach..perfect!  Room was clean & staff friendly.  Walking distance to restaurants, stores, downtown Laguna.  Walls were a little thin..but noise wasn't issue with the a/c running low.  Great place to stay, especially if you're gonna be out & about Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: We're so happy we could be your home away from home in Laguna. And it sounds like you were able to take advantage of the beach as well as the restaurants and shops in town -- that's the perfect way to spend time here, and we can't wait for next time.   Until then,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I look forward to my visits to Laguna Beach specifically because of this hotel!  It is so dreamy to be able to have an oceanfront room and fall asleep to the sounds of the ocean. Although there is a party atmosphere during the day, things quiet down early enough that I have never been bothered by it.  In fact, during the day, the people watching doesn't get any better.  The staff is so amazingly energetic, enthusiastic, friendly and helpful.  I have NEVER had a disappointing experience.  The location doesn't get any better.  We get up each morning and walk along the beach in either direction to get our morning coffee.  All the restaurants and shops are walking distance so there is no need for a car.  There's even a bus system that gets you to Dana Point or out to the Marine
Manager Response: What a lovely review! Nothing quite compares to walking along the beach to grab your morning coffee, right? It's one of those simple pleasures that truly make you feel like your on vacation and I am so happy that we could help provide that for you.   As for your comments about the staff, I couldn't be happier to know that everyone was energetic, friendly, and above all helpful. You can rest assured that I'll be sharing your wonderful words with the rest of the team.   Looking forward to your next trip,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge this past weekend, it was a beautiful location. Very friendly and polite staff, from the valet to the guy (Cameron Koekler) on the beach that provided chairs and umbrellas. The private beach was really appreciated. We stayed in a "Village Room" , unfortunately we were very disappointed with the room, and I booked this with a young lady at the front desk, not at a reservation center or online, it was very small and nothing like the photos on line, there was suppose to be a sink at the wet bar, but there wasn't one, not a real big deal. there was nothing to sit on but the bed, the little bench that was in the room was half taken up by the microwave. At one point the elevator was out of service for about half our stay, when we told the front desk about
Manager Response: Thanks for the feedback, Keith. While we're delighted that you loved our location, I am disappointed that we didn't give you that 5-star experience you deserve. As for your room, we have a wide variety of suites and I am really sorry if you felt that the photos online were in any way misleading. We'll be sure to take that feedback to heart. And as far as the elevator is concerned, thank you for your patience and understanding. While we can't predict hiccups in service, I am terribly sorry that we put you in a bind. We're dog lovers and we would never want to make an older dog have to conquer the stairs.   Next time you're in Laguna Beach, I hope you'll pay us a visit. I know we can give you the experience you're looking for.   'Til then,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location. Hotel is a maze.
Summary: My husband and I spent two nights to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel was very accommodating and even brought us a complementary bottle of wine and card signed by the staff.   We stayed in room 705 (I believe) located in the Surf building ‚Äì top floor, far left room (when facing the ocean).  The view from the balcony was excellent.  We left the sliding door open at night and listened to the waves crash.  The room was renovated, good size, and had a comfortable bed and a large sink/mini-fridge area.  The bathroom was also renovated but small compared to the rest of the room.  The furniture/cabinetry is trendy but cheap (think Ikea).   The exterior hotel renovations are showing their age and the interiors will eventually.  The restaurant/lounge is located on the deck/first
Manager Response: It's so great to hear that we could make your anniversary extra special! Thanks for taking the time to leave us some feedback. Next time you need a romantic getaway, keep us in mind.   Cheers,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We stayed the weekend at Pacific Edge. We rented the loft which was basically its own little stand-alone apartment complete with kitchen, living room, 2 big screens, and a balcony. Loved the privacy and the home away from home feel. It also has a little view to the ocean. We totally appreciated the free valet (it's ridiculous that hotels would even charge for parking) and the fabulous beach service! Cameron Koehler hooked us up with chairs, towels, and tips for enjoying our stay on the beach. Great weekend getaway!
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your vacation with us! The loft is such a wonderful room. I'm glad you enjoyed it. Thanks for the rave review here on TripAdvisor. If you ever need a vacation, stop in and visit us.   Best,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Treat yourself to an unbelievable experience!  Great service, wonderful accommodations and a fantastic beach experience.  Within 5 minutes walking to great dining in downtown Laguna Beach if you feel like not taking advantage of the outdoor bar/restaurant adjacent (great cocktails and food).  Seriously .. I could go on and on but just trust me, I can't wait to go back ... again!!!
Manager Response: Nothing makes me smile more than hearing from a satisfied guest, Jeff. I'm so glad that you enjoyed your trip and had a chance to relax. Thanks for the support. I hope you'll come stay with us some other time.   Cheers,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Enjoyed my stay at Pacific Edge Hotel. Our room was upgrade complimentary to ocean view. staff was very friendly a specially Cameron Koehler with setting our beach spot with lounge chairs and umbrellas, he gave us great recommendations for nearby spots.
Manager Response: The perfect trip, indeed! Thanks for making us a part of your getaway. We'd love to have you back soon!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: On a family vacation, room was perfect 2 rooms and a kitchen, met our needs perfectly. Weather was amazing and we spent most of our day playing on the beach. Cameron took care of everything we needed, he was wonderfully attentive. Brought us an umbrella and an extra towel. We love Laguna beach and will be back soon!!!
Manager Response: Glad the weather cooperated with us, Kayla! We can't wait to welcome you back again, but until then, thanks for singing Cameron's praises. He'll be thrilled to hear from you!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Wonderful weekend trip with girlfriends. We stayed in a beachside suite with full kitchen. Our main interest was to hit the beach and the experience was awesome. It was accessible and our beach staff, Cameron Koehler was so attentive and helpful. We felt taken care of and that level of service was appreciated!
Manager Response: Sounds like everyone had a blast! Thanks for coming away with us, Ashley. We'd love to have you back before the summer's over!  Take care, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We did a girls weekend for a friends birthday. The location is wonderful. Beachfront service was the best, Cameron was extremely helpful and made our beach day birthday celebration a true success! Hot tub closes early.
Manager Response: What a lovely weekend! Thanks for making us a part of it, Alex, and for singing Cameron's praises. Hope to have you back soon, no matter the occasion!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We love Pacific Edge. So far, Cameron Koehler has been so helpful getting us everything we need to get set up on the beach for a relaxing and fun day. He had a smile on his face and accommodated all our needs. Thanks Cameron!
