Manager Response: Cameron works so hard and I know he's going to be very excited to hear your compliments. We're all about top-notch service, so its great to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Next time you need a relaxing vacation, keep us in mind.   Best,  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My husband and I just wanted to get out of the heat of the desert and traveled over to the coast for a day and a night.Our destination was The Pacific Edge Hotel.  We arrived around noon and checked in with James , the front desk manager. He is what makes Joie de Vevre hotels so special. He attended to our every need, including handicap parking and a complementary bottle of wine delivered to our room.  Our oceanfront room was ready so we were able to check in. Our room was clean, decorated with a funky beach decor and and comfortable. Once we opened the sliding doors to the spacious balcony with full view of the pounding surf, we knew we had entered heaven. After going down to the beach and having our complimentary chairs and umbrella set up by a gracious and friendly attendant,
Manager Response: James and Adam will be thrilled to hear from you, Robert! We hope to have another chance to welcome you back again soon, no matter what the weather's like. :) Until then, thanks for taking the time to sing our praises. Your kind words mean the world to us!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We really enjoyed our three night stay at the Pacific Edge, an eclectic collection of buildings, right on Laguna Beach. They have been in this location for over 50 years.   When you check in there is a very small parking lot in front, or a valet parking lot just behind the building where you check in, which is much easier to navigate. The people were quite friendly and helpful. We got lucky and got a room in the Reef building, and all rooms in this building have beach front views.  We were on the ground floor, but still had the waves crashing under our balcony at night, awesome. While the rooms are air conditioned, we kept the door open to enjoy the sounds of the beach.  The room was pretty basic, everything you need. They do have a fridge in the room so stock up, especially on
Manager Response: We really enjoyed welcoming you to our hotel! Thanks for taking the time to share your story, Donald--I know all of your fellow travelers will really appreciate your detailed feedback. We can't wait to have you back again, but until next time, let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next visit even more memorable!   All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Pacific Edge Hotel on Laguna Beach created some of the best memories for my husband and me. The customer service was impeccable. Upon check-in, a wonderful lady at the front desk upgraded us to an oceanfront room for our anniversary (along with a bottle of sparkling wine)! The room was spectacular and the interior was designed very well. The hotel is conveniently located next to great shopping, dining, and fun. The beach attendants were constantly working diligently and efficiently for the hotel guests.  Overall, it was an amazing stay. We will definitely be back! Thank you, Pacific Edge!
Manager Response: Spectacular rooms, great dining and a lovely view--that says it all! Thanks for making us a part of your trip, and for the excellent review. We can't wait to have you back next time you need to get away!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We decided to head to the beach to get out of the extreme heat of Los Angeles. We found Pacific Edge in Laguna Beach, made our reservation directly from the hotel, great rates, no hassle. Upon arrival the temperature was 97 degrees, not exactly escaping the heat, but we were on the ocean! Check in was quick and very friendly, our room was not ready, the staff offered to stow our bags, use the pools or get lounges on the beach. Very nice. We decided to walk to town via the beach and grab some lunch. I got a call from Pacific Edge to inform us the room was ready. Our room was in the Reef Tower, 4th floor and we could see, hear the ocean from the room. Basic room, queen bed, nice linens, freshly painted, fridge, flat screen, but the bathroom needs work, a giant tub from the
Manager Response: You definitely deserved a beach getaway after dealing with that heat! Hopefully the ocean was enough to cool you down, and your room as well. Thanks for coming away with us, and for your wonderful review--we're flattered! We'd love to welcome you back again soon!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Our room overlooked the Pacific and we went to sleep with the sound of the waves. Large room with huge bed, relaxing beach decor and sun trap of a balcony to enjoy a glass of vino overlooking the beach. Bathroom was small but all that was required. Check in was quick and efficient and location of this hotel couldn't be better. Lots of shops, bars and restaurants within short walk.
Manager Response: "Idyllic" is the perfect word to describe us! With the beautiful view and relaxing nights on the balcony, we're thrilled that you loved every minute of your stay. Thank you, and we hope to have you back next time you're in the states!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location! Great price! Beach feel
Summary: The price of the stay is great because of the location.... You must understand though that the rooms are not going to be fancy, they are comfortable clean and get the job done. Think about it, your by the beach so staying inside all day is probably not going to happen. The staff is great and accommodating.. The shops and restaurants are all walking distance. I can't wait to stay again!
Manager Response: Comfortable, clean, and a beautiful beach view. That's what we're all about! Glad you enjoyed your stay, and we can't wait to have you back. Until next time, thanks for the fantastic review!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I had a funeral to go to in San Clemente on Friday, so I drove over on Thursday and stayed at this hotel. The front desk person was wonderful, Akiko Matsumura, she already had a customer and she let me know that she would be with as soon as she can. I told her I was with my mother, who has a hard time walking stairs so she gave us a room right on the ocean. The beds were comfortable, the pillows were thick and fluffy and in the morning looking out the patio I got to see whales and dolphins. It made a difficult day a little nicer.
Manager Response: We're so glad that we were able to bring a bit of relaxation and warmth to a difficult time, Nancee. Thank you for giving us that opportunity, and for the wonderful review. Our sincerest condolences to you and your family.  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We walked in and got a room just off the beach for a very good rate. Great service! We had some AC problems and they came to fix it in minutes. Our room was older but a huge 2 bedroom w kitchen and we spent most of our time w 2 kids and 2 dogs on the beach so we were sandy and dirty. The beds and bathroom were clean and comfy. Just older carpet and fixtures. Nice beach help setting up chairs and umbrellas. Great great location on the beach and close to shops and restaurants. We walked everywhere for 3 days. Go to the Orange Inn for a coffee and muffin in the morning.
Manager Response: Glad we got that AC taken care of so quickly! It was great to make you feel at home, and we hope that we'll get to welcome you back for years to come. Until then, thanks for taking the time to review us, Jane!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place  for the family..The PERFECT get away for couple'sWill definitely come back ..SOONÔøΩÔøΩ
Summary: I Know A few beaches in southern California.. But never felt so relax ..be at the beach worries freee.. Restaurants shops nice little village ..everything..Walking distance..safe and beautiful city..expend 3 day..didn't have to use my car at all.. So have a little tekila ..a margarita ..cerveza..y salud.. I think I found my perfec getaway!! Will come back soon
Manager Response: Enjoying a margarita, a sunset and this beautiful beach--that sounds like our perfect vacation! Thanks for the fantastic review, and keep us in mind next time you need to unwind!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Unreal. We were driving down the coast and decided to call it a night, called around to a few hotels to see what was available. It was late and we weren't having much luck. Really glad no one else had availability...  Spoke with Kerry on the phone. She was more than pleasant  and very happy to help. She said of course they had a room for us, just stop right in.  So we did. We met Javid, who again was warm and welcoming. He asked if it was our first time in the area. Finding out it was, he upgraded us to the gorgeous but still authentically beach-y penthouse, and threw in a bottle of wine to boot.   From then on, nothing but the best. Spotless room, great location, and the deck is a blast. We would only be happier with our stay if it had been longer. Thanks Javid and Kerry, we'll
Manager Response: Unreal, indeed! So glad to hear that Kerry was able to find you a room on such short notice, and that Javid made you feel at home as well. Thanks for making us a part of your get away, Kevin! We'd love to welcome you back again soon.  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is a great location - in the centre of Laguna Beach and right on the beach.    Unfortunately the hotel is in several separate buildings.  The reception is on the street, but many of the rooms are over another small street, so there is lots of stairs (not so stroller friendly) and you feel like you are walking through a multi-storey parking lot to get from reception to your room.  There was a small pool but not much space around it.  We were in room 54, right by the pool.  This was a room with 2 queens but unfortunately just not spacious enough for our family of 5.  That's not the hotel's fault - probably mine in booking it.  Unfortunately the main problem for us was that the weekend we booked was during Spring Break.  This and a wedding at the hotel meant there was loads of
Manager Response: We want all of our guests to feel welcome, so it's upsetting that we fell short. As you mentioned, we were quite busy when you and your family visited, and I apologize if we didn't do enough to make you comfortable. This feedback is extremely useful, and we hope to have another chance to make it right next time you and your family need to get away. Thank you.  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful views but not much else
Summary: We stayed in a junior suite in the Reef Tower.  The room had incredible 180 degree ocean views.  From certain vantage points in the room, you get the feeling that you are on a cruise ship because all you see is ocean.  The room was also very private since the other guests in the hotel are separate from this tower.  The room also has a nice balcony and we sat and watched the sunset while drinking champagne. That is the good.  Now for the bad;  The room has a small kitchenette that really serves no purpose because it is not set up to cook a full meal. It is good for warming up food and storing snacks. The bathroom was dated. The fixtures seemed old and the shower did not have good pressure. The tile floor had cracked tiles and was dirty.  The sink plumbing had rust on it.  When I
Manager Response: We should have made sure that someone attended to your room, Gene, so I apologize for falling short. That said, it seems that your room is still in need of renovations, and I hope that you'll give us another chance to make a better impression. After all, you can't beat our view! In the meantime, thank you very much for your feedback, especially about your room and our valet service. We know that you comments will only make us better!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We were at the Pacific Edge Hotel in mid-March.  Our flight in was delayed significantly, so I called the hotel to let them know we would be very late in checking in.  I also asked if their restaurant/bar would still be open.  Unfortunately, by the time we would get there, they wouldn't, so Madison, Pacific Edge employee, asked what kind of wine I would like and told me it would be waiting in the room!  We checked in about 10:30 that night - Madison was still there!  She greeted us with a huge, beautiful smile and extraordinary customer service!  We spent 3 nights at the hotel and couldn't have been happier!  Our room was spacious and clean; our bed was very comfortable; the amenities in room were wonderful (Keurig coffee maker; microwave, 'frig, loved the shampoo & lotion)!  We
Manager Response: I'm sorry our bar wasn't open when you arrived, Molly, but I'm so happy to hear that we were able to get you a nice bottle of wine to help you unwind after that flight! Between that, your room and our gorgeous view, it's great to hear that you loved staying with us. Thanks for sharing that, and keep us in mind for your next getaway!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This is basically and overprice, overrated motel. The money doesn't justify the quality.   Upon arrival we were told that the valet parking was basically in the back so we had to drive to the back to the hotel just to drop our car. No help was offered with our bags so we had to walk about half a block and up the stairs with our bags.   The room was old and put dated. Coffee machine didn't work, the rooms have a regular window AC so it doesn't cool the room at all. No mini bar, no snacks, no complimentary water. Just two bottles of water to purchase.   The balcony is nice but when you get out there the back of the neighbor AC is in your balcony so you can't enjoy the ocean without the sound of the AC or water dripping from it.   We went down to the beach and we asked to chair and
Manager Response: I'm surprised to hear that you were so disappointed with your stay. While it seems like your room is still in need of renovations, I want to address your comments regarding our staff. They are committed to providing excellent service, and as such I can assure you that those beach chairs had been pre-arranged, rather than withheld. I'm sorry you were disappointed with that, and with our rules regarding alcohol on the beach, but we stand by our team.  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Went there for one night to celebrate my 25th birthday.  Got the room on the beach.  The room was beautiful and the view was even better.  The staff was so helpful in picking good places to eat. Not only that when we got back from dinner there was a bottle of champagne for us to celebrate my birthday.  Very thoughtful of them. Definitely will be returning soon!
Manager Response: Thanks for celebrating your special day with us, Melissa! We can't wait to welcome you back again next year--or sooner. After all, there are plenty of great times to be had on this beach!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Ocean view hotel in Laguna Beach
Summary: Love the location of this hotel, right on the sand in Laguna.  Not all the rooms overlook the ocean but The Deck is a great place to overlook the ocean while eating or having drinks.  During the summer, they have a complimentary beach trolley that picks you up in front and drops you off at various locations within Laguna Beach.  The hotel provides beach chairs, towels, etc. and in summer there's even a beach butler who attends to your needs.
Manager Response: There's nothing better than enjoying a cocktail with an ocean view! Between that, our location, and staff, it sounds like you had a lovely stay with us, Mikki. Thanks for making us a part of your getaway, and let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next visit even more memorable!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: We love the location, so close to the wedding venue & everything in Laguna Beach. We got a block of rooms for family & friends. Most all the rooms in the Reef Building & the rooms were perfect, gorgeous views (Wish there was a elevator). One of our guests stayed in a queen non-beach view room & it wasn't as clean & nice as our rooms on the beach. We rented a bungalow for an afternoon visiting with family & friends in from across the country & stayed there for The Deck to cater our rehearsal dinner. The food was spectacular. Our waiter, Colby was perfection!! We rented The Villa for my son for the wedding night and it was gorgeous & they were thrilled with the whole beautiful set-up. Pacific Edge was just exactly what we needed for our very special occasion! Thanks to Karolin
Manager Response: What a wonderful wedding! It was a pleasure to make you and your family and friends feel at home, and I know that Karolin and Colby will be so thrilled to hear how much everyone enjoyed the day. Thank you for sharing that with us, and congratulations to the happy couple!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Right on the beautiful Laguna Sand!
Summary: We planned this trip last minute.  I had heard this used to be the old vacation villiage which I had stayed at as a kid.  It was the same spot but not the same place!  We had an amazing room right over the crashing waves, we saw dolphins every day from our room and the beach and the weather was perfect!  We all loved this place, it was relaxed and walking distance from everything to do in Laguna.  Their restaurant the Deck is a little pricey but it's right on the beach and the food for the most part was excellent as was the service. Make reservations ahead around sunset and you won't be sorry.  The staff was very pleasant and they sent us a complimentary bottle of wine with a very nice hand written note.  It's the little things that make a stay extra special. We had a great
Manager Response: So glad to hear the dolphins were out during your visit! What a lovely trip, Melonie. Thanks for making us a part of it, and for the wonderful review. We can't wait to welcome you back next year--or sooner!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge hotel excelled in the area of customer service.  I was there for a bachelorette party, and the front desk surprised us with some sweet treats and sparkling wine upon check-in.  Service was speedy each time we asked for anything.  The room we stayed in was dated but clean.  The hot tub was a large size and clean. The Deck hotel restaurant had good food with a great view.
Manager Response: Celebrating with you was a blast, Kathy, so I'm glad that you and your friends had such a great time! Thank you for sharing your kind words. We hope your next visit is even more memorable!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location and price is right.  Love this place.
Summary: If you like being near downtown and right on the beach at an economical price, this is the place for you!  The rooms are nothing fancy, but have everything you need for a few nights to a long vacation.   And the staff is fantastic. I have stayed in the queen deluxe, regular queen and 2 bedroom apartments.  All were great for what I needed.  We don't need much more than a clean room.  They were nice in size and great value for what you get.  Sand, Sun, Sunsets, Ocean and a clean room.  I love all the sand toys for the kids.  Means less packing for me on the plane.  Been 3 times in one year, and will definitely be back.  My boys just love it there!
Manager Response: You're too kind, Erica! Thank you for making us a part of your getaways. It means so much to us that you keep coming back to us time and time again, and we hope we'll continue to welcome you and your family back for years to come. Until then, thank you so much for the fantastic review--it means the world to us!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: The hotel is right along PCH and is a perfect location which makes up for the okay rooms. The lounges on the beach are also an added plus. The structure of the hotel is a bit confusing and there is a big price range, so it's hard to tell what sort of room you will get before you arrive.
Manager Response: Yes, our layout can be a bit confusing, but we hope that our rooms make up for it! I'm sorry that you seemed a bit disappointed in them, and I'd be happy to discuss that with you further. Still, I'm so happy to hear that you enjoyed our view, and I hope we'll get to welcome you back for years to come. Until then, thanks for reviewing us!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Such a great place. Excellent staff, fair pricing and a view to die for. I took my gf for Valentine's day.  We stayed in a room overlooking the water. It was an amazing stay. I hope to be back there soon.  :0  Eric
Manager Response: Sounds like a perfect Valentine's Day! Thank you for making us a part of it, and for the wonderful rating. We hope to welcome you both back again soon, Eric!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: First, I will qualify my review with the fact that I stayed here for a business meeting.  While it was more than adequate for that purpose, this hotel is really geared towards families and those who want a weekend on the beach in southern California.  I had a great oceanfront room that had definitely been recently renovated.  The room appointments, fixtures, etc were all contemporary and current - a good thing for a hotel that has been around for as long as this one.  The bungalows on the beach front are great spots for some group privacy and the chance to take in the great ocean views without being actually on the beach.  The beach:  view is beautiful, surf is great, more than enough sand to find a nice spot to take in the day.  However, keep your shoes on.  On several
Manager Response: Yes, attention to detail is very important. Those little issues should have been attended to before you checked in, and I apologize for falling short in that regard, as well some of our guests' pets' behavior. That's not acceptable, and we'll look into it immediately. Still, it sounds like you really enjoyed our views, and we hope to welcome you back next time you need to get a little sun!  Thanks Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Perfect location, clean grounds & nice accommodations.  Very active at night.  Staff was kind, polite and helpful...well-trained to care for vacationers.  We had a great stay.  Do not order a hamburger from the Orange caf√©...
Manager Response: Kind, polite and helpful--that's all we can ask for! Thanks for singing our team's praises, Steven. We'd love to have you back again soon!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Went here for my anniversary and had an oceanfront room. The room was very nice and the view was great. The staff was exeallent and the hotel even gave us complementary cake, flowers, and sparkling water. The only complaint I have was the room was above the restaraunt so from 9am to 10pm it was a little noisy . I enjoy going to sleep to the sound of the waves every night so 10p was ok.  Lots of food places to eat at (can get pricy) and art galleries in walking distance.
Manager Response: Sounds like a lovely anniversary! Thank you for celebrating this special occasion with us, and for the rave review. We can't wait to see you next year--or sooner!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Pacific Edge just keeps getting better!
Summary: I've stayed at Pacific Edge before & that's why I'll never stay anywhere else. If you're looking for the best location with clean, beach-themed rooms - look no further.   But the best part about Pacific Edge is the staff. You can't train people to be genuine, and when you interact with any employee at Pacific Edge, you'll experience this as well. They actually care and want to ensure your comfort & a successful trip. Brian Sullivan (GM) made a great impression on my family. James, Javid, Brian (FD Supervisor), Zachary (Beach Attendant)...all made an impact and I can't thank them enough. This trip was a long overdue gathering for my family - and everyone is STILL talking about it here at home :) Thanks for everything PAC Edge!! See you again very soon!
Manager Response: We work hard to continue surpassing our own standards, so it's such a pleasure to hear that you were impressed with your stay! Thanks for taking the time to shout out our team, and for making us a part of your getaways, Haley. We can't wait to welcome you back again!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed three nights in mid-March and celebrated our anniversary here and we were not disappointed. Many big pluses: (1) thoughtful staff: our thanks to Akiko for making our stay special -- she was wonderful! (2) location: great view of the beach and ocean (3) convenience: it is literally steps from the beach and a short walk to town and restaurants, (4) rooms have been recently renovated and are very clean, well kept and with good features (e.g. great balcony; counter space; good-size flat screen TV) and (5) although valet parking is necessary, they do provide an excellent service.  What could have made it better: we appreciate the extra large mini-fridge in the room but it is very noisy when you're trying to sleep (mentioned it many times to the front desk and
Manager Response: Akiko and the rest of our team will be so happy to hear your kind words! Between our staff, views and relaxing rooms, we're thrilled that you and your wife enjoyed your stay, Zachary, and we really appreciate your suggestions, too. Thanks, and keep us in mind for next year's getaway--if you can wait that long! :)  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: So great!  We are coming back.
Summary: Touring So Cal colleges and universities, this was a stop between L.A. and San Diego.  We wanted to be on the ocean.  We arrived late and were so happy to seSue the great large room that accommodated the 3 of us.  The refrigerator was appreciated to cool our water and snacks.  My daughter and granddaughter used the pool and spa in the morning, in addition to the Pacific Ocean!   A Ralph's Supermarkert is 1/2 a block a way, so I picked up muffins and fruit for breakfast.  The little town of Laguna Beach looked wonderful with great shops. But since our time was short, we didn't get to explore.  So we are definitely returning.  This property is not for those who have mobility difficulties.  Lots of stairs and no elevator.  But there are several buildings on the property and maybe
Manager Response: Sounds like the ultimate family getaway! I'm thrilled that all of you enjoyed your stay, and that you were able to take advantage of that Groupon deal, too. Thanks for the wonderful review, and we hope to have you back again soon!  Take care, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Good deal - Nice room - Beautiful View
Summary: We just spent a Travelzoo Voucher weekend and were very impressed with this lovely beach hotel.  The staff was great and we stayed in the newly renovated beach front tower on the 4th floor.  What a view!  We really enjoyed sitting on our balcony overlooking the gorgeous ocean, the food was good in the restaurant (even though the music was a bit loud) and it's close to everything.  Would definitely go back again!
Manager Response: What a view, indeed! Thanks for the wonderful review, and please let us know if we can do anything else to make your next trip worthy of five stars!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Just OK with a Great View
Summary: The reason to be here is the location - and only if better ocean front hotels are full. Don't get me wrong; our trip wasn't bad but anyone with a hint of traveling savvy would be delusional to give Pacific Edge a five star review. It's simply not that great. It's just OK.   The view IS spectacular.   Our room was freshly painted, clean, adequate, dated and staff was pleasant. Decor was distressed/ minimal/ not upscale. Single lamp offered poor light for reading. Outlets for recharging devices at floor level. Amenities included 2 bath towels for 2 guests. No hand towels.   Not horrible but not perfect or even outstanding. We would choose another Laguna hotel next trip.
Manager Response: I wish we could have done more to impress you, but we really appreciate your feedback. You should have had more towels, and lighting, and we'll check in to make sure that we don't fall short again. In the meantime, thanks for your candor, and I hope we'll get a chance to show you a five-star visit next time you need to get away. After all, you can't beat this view!  Best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel is on the Coast Hwy, beach side.  It is an older hotel.  However, it was clean, the staff was courteous.  There is no parking except for valet parking...which was fine.   With all that said, it has location, location, location.   Opt for a beach front room and your view is spectacular.  Can't say enough....we were here March 21st and thought it would be cooler weather at 65 degrees.  It was wonderful.   If you are heading to Laguna Beach...consider the Pacific Edge, you won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: So glad the weather cooperated with you, Kerrie! Thanks for staying with us, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little sun. We'd love to welcome you back!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I upgraded to the Beach side of hotel...so worth it.  I wanted to wake up to see & hear the ocean, this was perfect.  My room was decorated so well that I want to copy it at home, loved it.  Ate at the Deck 2 times, ordered dinner to bring to my room once...great food & drinks. I will be doing this every year at Pacific Edge.
Manager Response: You can't beat that view! I'm thrilled that you enjoyed your visit, Sharon, and I can't wait to have you back again next year. Until then, let us know if we can do anything else to make you feel at home‚Äîwe're all ears!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: We have stayed at this property 27 times
Summary: Get out of your car and relax.  Everything you might need is within walking distance.  Ask for an ocean front room and experience ocean front as you never have before.  Ocean breeze, waves breaking almost at your balcony, absolutely awesome.  The hotel is not a "new high rise",  its a quaint beach hotel.  We love the location (right downtown), the hotel staff is attentive and friendly. The beach is literally at your feet.
Manager Response: You really can't get any closer to the beach! Sounds like you had a fabulous getaway, and it was a pleasure to be a part of it. Thank you for sharing your kind words, and we can't wait to have you back for your 28th visit!  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: beware of the ocean front room
Summary: We are very familiar with this hotel. We have stayed here many times before it got sold to new ownership. We specifically reserved the ocean front room because of the relaxing ocean wave sounds. To our surprise, when we arrived they gave us a ocean front room right above the bar/party room. It was crazy, food smell and loud noise right below our room which has a patio to relax. We spent over $1000 for 3 nights. The party and loud noises went from around 5:00 pm to 9:00 to 10:00 pm every night. We has to complain few times to get little discount (nothing to mention about). Only time we enjoyed the patio was in the mornings. To top it off.... its only valet parking, $25 per night.  I'll say, make sure to call and confirm which room you will be getting before making a reservation.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear this, especially since you were so looking forward to your stay. We apologize if you found the event disruptive, but we felt that it ended at a reasonable hour, giving our guests plenty of time to unwind. Still, it's upsetting that you left feeling unhappy, and we want to make this right. Please don't hesitate to email us at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com if you'd like to discuss this further.   Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Edge excells at Best in Laguna Beach
Summary: ..my past 3 weeks at the Pacific Edge Hotel, in Laguna Beach...was filled with lifetime memories...from the great Location on the Beach...to the fantastic Staff and Accomidations...to excellent pricing...and family atmosphere...cannot say any more than thanks to the Pacific Edge...this is my 3rd visit there...and I will return again...along with other friends and family who have stayed there before...
Manager Response: Beautiful memories you'll keep for a lifetime‚Äîthat's more than we could ever ask for! Thanks for the fantastic review, and please let us know if there's anything else we can do to make your next visit even better!  Thank you again, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Excellent place! Very reasonable. Service was great, room was great, food was good, valet was fast every time, and The Deck is definitely a good time. Wish I could have stayed longer. Amazing and affordable place for a weekend getaway. I would recommend it to anyone! Going back very soon!
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing your kind words with us, Travis! We couldn't be happier to hear how much you enjoyed your stay, and we hope to have you back year after year. Until next time, let us know what we can do to make your next visit even better!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect chill right on the beach.
Summary: My wife and I just got back from a week at Pacific Edge on Laguna Beach. We have both experienced an avalanche of stress this past year...lots of family illness and deaths. When I booked us in at Pacific Edge and explained our situation they could not have been more compassionate and kind to us from the moment we checked in until the minute we checked out. They went out of their way to make us safe and comfortable. We had an awesome room looking over the beach and the surf. We literally took steps from our room onto the beach everyday, then were treated to beach chairs, towels, and an umbrella on the beach. The Reef Restaurant staff are unbelievably friendly and thoughtful (my wife forgot her purse containing her wallet and passport...when she realized and went back, the girl
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to make you feel at home with us, Timothy. After all that you've been through, we hope that we were able to offer you a moment of quiet and relaxation, and we're honored that you chose to spend your getaway with us. Thank you, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little R & R!  Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: A true gem in Laguna Beach
Summary: Found this hotel online, and decided to take a chance on it for a quick birthday getaway. We stayed one night in an Beachfront King room, newly renovated...   I am the first to admit, my husband and I are a tough audience because we work in the hospitality industry in Vegas. And this place BLEW US AWAY! The service from the time we pulled our car up to Valet to the time we drove away was spectacular. Everyone (valet attendants, housekeepers, front desk agents, etc) was super nice. Bryan, the front desk manager, was incredibly friendly and helpful! He wished me a Happy Birthday, and even recommended a few restaurants nearby worthy of a birthday celebration dinner. His favorite turned out to be more than fabulous - one of the best dining experiences we have had. The hotel room
Manager Response: We're so pleased to hear how impressed you were, especially coming from your background in hospitality! Thank you for taking the time to share that with us, Jacks, and for making us a part of this fabulous celebration. We can't wait to welcome you back again next year‚Äîor sooner! :)  Cheers, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: Spent the night here as a special birthday mini vacay.  For a very reasonable price chose to upgrade to ocean view!  WOW!!!  Unbelievable sunset view over the ocean and down to main beach.  Very relaxed atmosphere yet very professional.  Everyone from valets to housekeepers  super helpful and friendly.  The Deck Restaurant was amazing!  Awesome food and absolutely unbeatable service.  It was really busy but we never had to wait for anything.  couldn't recommend the whole experience more!  You gotta go!
Manager Response: Sounds like a fabulous birthday! I'm delighted that you were able to spend it admiring the sunset view, and I hope we'll be able to welcome you back for more special occasions. Until then, thanks for the fabulous review‚Äîyou made our day!  Happy birthday, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: I had scouted the internet relentlessly looking for a hotel located directly on the beach and yet affordable. I was concerned when I had checked in and was told that our room would be facing the main street. I had expressed this concern and was very pleasantly surprised with they upgraded us into a very nice 2 story apartment, facing the beach! Everyone would have LOVED to stay one or two more nights but our reservations to another hotel in San Diego could not be cancelled unfortunately. We felt very safe there and appreciated the valet parking, having someone there at all times. They offer beach towels, beach chairs and beach umbrella's. We did  not get a chance to utilize their restaurant but it was inviting every time we walked by to the delicious smells.It is such a
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a lot of much-needed rest and relaxation, Anne! That's what we aim for, so I'm thrilled that you loved your room and that fabulous view. We hope you'll keep us in mind for your next trip, but until then, thank you for the lovely review!  All the best, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: A brief relief from work life
Summary: I needed to see and hear the ocean for one day during a long stretch of business travel and i could not have picked a better place! The staff was friendly, the valets were helpful, the DECK food and staff were excellent and the ROOM on the beach was perfect! I will be back!!
Manager Response: Nothing like an ocean view to melt your troubles away! I'm so glad you found us, and that you felt at home at our hotel. Thanks for sharing that, and keep us in mind next time you need a little sun!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: This hotel was so accommodating to us after dealing with four flight cancellations to get out of Washington DC due to a massive snow storm.   Our trip included stays in Santa Monica, West Hollywood, Disney and Laguna Beach.  While all properties we stayed at were in the same category of expense and luxury, this property was by far the best experience.     Brian and the front desk staff was so welcoming and they created an environment that we were able to enjoy ourselves and truly relax.   I have zero complaints and only hope that I find a way to make it back to this hotel.
Manager Response: The weather didn't cooperate, but we're glad you finally got a chance to soak up the sun! Thanks for getting away with us, and for taking the time to sing our praises. We can't wait to have you back again!  Regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My wife and I wanted a relaxing, romantic week on the beach.  Being from the east coast, we knew very little about the best places to stay in California, let alone Laguna Beach.  So, we surfed the internet, read the reviews and settled on The Pacific Edge Hotel with slight trepidation caused by a tiny percentage of not-so-great reviews.  Jackpot!  The whole experience was amazing.  A beautiful, clean room with a king bed on the first floor, with a balcony literally hanging just 8 feet over the beach and the waves at high tide lapping within 6 feet of the building's foundation.  Every night, we watched an amazing sunset over the water and, later, the breaking waves lulled us to sleep.  Amazing maid and valet services.  The hotel's restaurant, The Deck, was right on the beach and
Manager Response: Thanks for making us a part of your California getaway! You just can't beat these views and being lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves. It was a pleasure to make you feel at home, and to read your kind words. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun!  Warm regards, Sean Castady Assistant General Manager

Summary: My friend and I wanted to "run away from home" for a few days on our February break. She is a Principal and I am a high school teacher. We booked a room at the Pacific Edge in Laguna Beach. The moment we walked into the lobby we were met with warmth, sincere friendliness, and lots of smiling faces. We were offered a fabulous upgrade and a complimentary bottle of wine and when we saw our room we knew we had made an awesome choice. EVERYTHING about our stay was perfect. The waves crashed right under our balcony and the sunsets were gorgeous! Nothing compares to being lulled to sleep by sound of waves.  Location, location, location! We were so close to all the best that Laguna has to offer so we walked everywhere. The "Deck" is a great place to eat with a friendly staff and another
Manager Response: Sounds like you two really did deserve a beach getaway! Between these beautiful views, a few bottles of wine and excellent company, it sounds like you two had a great time here in Laguna Beach. Thanks for making us a part of your trip, Meg, and keep us in mind when you two need a little time away from the kiddos!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend to get away from work. We wanted an ocean view room with a balcony so we could sit and read all day.   Stacie at the front desk was wonderful. She gave us a warm welcome, answered all our questions, and gave great advice for local restaurants.   We stayed in the Surf building. NOTE: The Surf building is adjacent to the restaurant, The Deck, so if restaurant noise bothers you, stay in one of the other buildings. The noise didn't bother us at all. It was nice to hear the sounds of people laughing and socializing, and on Saturday there was a wedding so we had a free soundtrack. The restaurant closes at 10, so after that, all you hear are the waves on the beach. : )  The bed is very comfortable, shower had great water pressure, and they
Manager Response: Sounds like the perfect getaway! Thanks for making us a part of it, and for taking the time to share these wonderful tips‚Äîthey'll definitely come in handy for our future guests! We can't wait to welcome you back, Elle. Until then, let us know if we can do anything to make your next trip even better!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We spent 10 days last summer on a road trip off the Pacific Coast and stayed 2 nights in Laguna Beach at this hotel. Location is great and views are fabulous, deck restaurant has great views as well. The fodd was nothing special and the rooms were run down, definitely not what I woud expect for the cost of the place. I would invest my money eslewhere next time. Bathroom was one star roadside motel caliper. Over priced by far!
Manager Response: We want all of our guests to feel welcome, so we're sorry you feel this way. However, we're currently completing the necessary renovations, and we're confident that you'll be amazed when they're finished. Still, we wish we could have resolved this during your stay, and we want to make this right. Don't hesitate to reach out to us if you'd like to discuss this further‚Äîwe know we can do better than this.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I stayed here with my boyfriend in October 2011 to celebrate our anniversary. We had the oceanview room with a King size bed. During high tide the ocean was right under our balcony, which was awesome! We could always hear the beautiful and soothing sound of the waves crashing against the shore, and we had stunning views of the entire laguna, and the sunset. The entire hotel has a beachy/ summer theme, and there are surfboards, and really neat decor. The decor of the hotel was inspired by a surfing movie called "Endless Summer." Since staying here, we were so inspired that we bought a movie poster of "Endless Summer" and have it hanging on our wall in Canada to remind us of our time at Pacific Edge hotel.  The staff and service were excellent. I stepped on a bee on the beach, and
Manager Response: Sunset and the sound of the waves‚Äîit doesn't get more California than that! I'm absolutely delighted to hear how much you enjoyed your vacation, despite running into that bee on the beach. That's not a fun surprise, so I hope you're feeling better! Moving on to your review, thanks so much for taking the time to share your kind words. Knowing that you felt at home means the world to us! We're looking forward to your next visit, too, but until then, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make it even better!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: As previously noted, the rooms are dingy, worn, and noisey. The room we'd booked had rickety aluminum windows that amplified the noisey street it faced. The toilet didn't flush, the two double beds extended to the limits of the room space meaning a person of average build would be scuttling sideways to get to the tiny, 1970s bathroom.   We were told we could upgrade to an apartment for $50 more per night. This room had a better window to the street so there was less noise but the moment we walked in, we saw the cracked kitchen tiles, the shoddy old cabinets (completely empty of dishes, silverware, cleaning supplies. The furniture was old and torn, the sofa bad unacceptably flimsy and without linens. Again, rickety aluminum sliding doors provided no insulation from the noise of
Manager Response: Yes, this is quite disappointing, especially since it seems like you were really looking forward to your getaway. Although we're in the midst of renovating all of our rooms, it seems that we were unable to book you a newly renovated suite. I apologize for that, but I want to make this right for you. If you'd like to discuss this further, please email me at bookpacificedge(at)jdvhotels(dot)com. I'm confident that we have what it takes to show you an unforgettable getaway!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My boyfriend and I made an unexpected trip to Laguna to give a friend a lift, and decided to stay there last minute. It was the 13th of February and we thought, it's late, we'll stay here to celebrate Valentine's Day. I found the room on Hotel Tonight (one of my favorite apps) and it was so affordable. I could not believe that I paid less than $200 on a holiday weekend on a beachfront hotel in Laguna.   On top of that, Javid at the front desk was more than accommodating he made us feel welcome, gave us great recommendations for dinner, and even sent us a bottle of wine. His coworkers seemed equally welcoming, but he really made our stay special. The beach towel and chair service steps away from your room, a large hot tub,  my favorite bathroom products (it's a line called
Manager Response: Sounds like a lovely getaway! We're so glad that you and your boyfriend enjoyed your time with us, Chelsey, and that Javid and the rest of our team made you feel at home. That's our goal! Thanks for sharing your kind words, and for making us a part of your Valentine's Day celebration. We'd love to have you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location, but some serious concerns for the money...
Summary: Here's the thing: the location is unbelievable. We watched the sun go down over the water at night and the dolphins frolicking in the morning. It's a short walk to the shops and restaurants of Laguna Beach. The staff is amazing--friendly and prompt. The service was impeccable.  But...  These are converted apartment buildings. The property has seen better days, even for beachfront.  I can't speak to the single rooms, perhaps they have been remodeled. The apartments, though, have not. Original kitchen--including stained sink, horribly chipped counter and basic wood cupboards. Original bathroom--old vanity, small tub shower, tiny toilet space, one sink. The carpet is worn and thin, and the furniture--while reaching for a beach cottage feel--looks more garage sale. The tv remote did
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us, Jen. It's wonderful that you and your family spotted dolphins off the coast ‚Äî that stunning view is not to be missed! I'm sorry that the kitchen and the older decor put a damper on your stay, though. We're actually in the process of renovating our rooms. We'd love to have you and your family stay with us during your next getaway to check out all of our upgrades!  Until then,  Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I chose Pacific Edge for an extended weekend getaway from snowy NY and I must say the property met my expectation. I work in travel and am very peculiar with where I stay. The staff was most welcoming and friendly. I had set up my reservation with Kelsi who assisted me with everything I needed prior to check in, answered all of my questions, and went above and beyond to make sure my requests were met. We had upgraded our original room stay to an ocean view and it was well worth it. You also get nice reminder emails about your upcoming stay to ensure everything is set.  The hotel itself has a great Californian surf feel to it. On arrival our GPS took us through the back to the valet area/Surf Wing via Sleepy Hollow. For those wondering valet is $24 a night. There really isn't
Manager Response: You can't beat that beautiful ocean front view, right? I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay, Amanda-Kristina. Thank you for sharing so many details! You painted a great picture for future guests, which is much appreciated. I bet you were ready to escape the New York weather for a fun beach vacation. I hope you enjoyed your trip to Laguna Beach! The next time you visit, we'd love to have you stay with us again.   Take care,  Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Pacific Edge Hotel for 5 days, and truly had an exceptional experience.  The staff consistently went above and beyond throughout the entire stay.  At check-in, Stacie at the front desk was an amazing start to our vacation - she accommodated our requests and was so friendly, happy, and had great suggestions for food and activities during our stay in Laguna. The whole staff was incredibly helpful throughout the entire stay.  Our room location was unbelievable - literally 8 steps from our room door to the sand. The room was clean and spacious, and we loved having a full size kitchen and electric fireplace in our room!  So romantic and fun!
Manager Response: Stacie and the rest of the team will be thrilled to hear from you, Michael! Thank you for making us a part of your romantic getaway, and for taking the time to sing our praises. We can't wait to welcome you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Ignore the paintwork, enjoy the view!
Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is pleasant with a great location. We had a deal through travel zoo so had a very good value stay - even though we then paid extra for the room upgrade.It is wonderful to look out over that gorgeous bay and to walk along the beach watching the sun go down. The foyer and staff are really nice and welcoming, the rooms very large and bright if a little tired in places.  The public area (the staircases around the rooms) do need updating, they feel a bit like a 60's student hall. We went and ate at the The Deck and had a really good evening. The appetisers were plenty for us, very generous and tasty.
Manager Response: Yes, the view doesn't get any more stunning! Although we're glad you enjoyed it, we did want to mention that we are in the middle of renovating, and hopefully you'll love the changes during your next visit. Until then, thanks for staying with us! We'd love to have you back soon.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Just got back from a 2 day stay at the Pacific Edge.  We had a warm welcome from the polite staff and the location of the resort was good. The valet parking guys were good as well.  However, the room was very outdated.  Appliances and cupboards in the kitchen must have been from the early 70's and the kitchennette was awful. No kitchen supplies. The fridge froze all our groceries on LOW setting...The room smelled very musky and was unpleasant... Dirty carpet..  no privacy...  no window shades in the kitchen.... dirty drapes... We did not look forward to coming back at the end of the day.  I will not ever book this place again.  Old and run down.  Vallet parking was a pain in the but to deal with as well.  Not worth the money!!
Manager Response: Although several of our rooms are still in need or renovations, we have never believed that they could be considered dirty. In fact, or housekeeping staff works hard to ensure that every room is spotless, so your comments were quite surprising. That said, I will certainly check in with them about this, Dan, but I wish that we had been able to move you to a room more suitable to your liking‚Äîdon't hesitate to ask. I'd be happy to discuss this with you further if you'd like to talk, but until then, thanks for your candor. It will only help us better ourselves as we work to complete our renovations.   Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for a relaxing weekend on the beach and that was exactly what we experienced. I suggest booking the beachfront rooms-the views were stunning.  The hotel is close to all the restaurants and shops; everything was within walking distance. Everyday we walked out onto the beach, the attendant provided lounge chairs and an umbrella, and towels. The staff was friendly and helpful and we plan to stay here again.
Manager Response: Yes, that view is truly amazing! Thanks for unwinding with us, Kristen, and for taking the time to sing our praises. We would love to have you back again, but in the meantime, let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next stay even better!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I wanted to get away after the holidays and Pacific Edge in Laguna Beach was the perfect spot. You can relax and do nothing on the beach or be active and walk a few blocks to the down town shops/galleries/restaurants  I felt very safe travelling alone and my whole experience was 'just what the doctor ordered'.   My room was wonderful-clean, spacious, steps from the beach and the price was perfect.  The staff was wonderful-all of them.  .
Manager Response: There's nothing better than getting away from it all, Juliette, so I'm thrilled that we were able to offer you some much-needed R & R. Thanks for making us a part of your getaway, and please come back and see us this summer!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Beach fun with the family dogs
Summary: This is a great pet-friendly property with ocean view rooms with private balcony overlooking the blue Pacific. The rooms are clean, bright, and beachy in decor.  The staff is great-from the valet parking attendant to the beach attendant eager to set you up with beach chairs, towels, and umbrella.  The Deck restaurant has a very nice ocean front view and great food.  The front desk staff will provide you with a list of pet-friendly restaurants nearby.  Dogs are allowed on the beach (on leash) between Labor Day and Memorial Day (there is an expansive off leash beach in nearby Huntington Beach).  Join the Hotel's "Joy of Life Club" which will offer you a complimentary bottle of wine upon arrival and a morning newspaper of your choice.  This is one of our favorite get away
Manager Response: Excellent tip! It's those little touches that really make the Joy of Life Club special, so we're glad you enjoyed them, Cindy. It's always great to welcome you back, and I hope we'll get another chance to see you again soon. Until then, thanks for the wonderful review!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: At the end of a long road trip and before heading back to Colorado and the snow and cold, we decided to try and stay at a hotel right on the beach in Laguna Beach.  The reservation went through quickly and easily on-line.  Then the day we were to arrive I decided to see if we could upgrade our room to an ocean front.  After all why go unless I could hear the sound of crashing waves as I went to sleep and woke up each day.  Javid who checked us in got us a fabulous room on the top floor, corner with a sitting area.  I could hear and see the ocean in both directions up and down the coast at all times.  He also arranged it so we could get into the room before the standard check-in time.  Room was spacious, bed very comfortable, kitchen area nice with refrigerator and microwave and
Manager Response: Your review really made our day, Barbara! After a lot of time on the road, I'm so glad that you were able to take a few days to enjoy some much-needed time on the beach. Thanks for making us a part of your adventure, and for your kind words‚ÄîI can't wait to share them with Javid! Hope to have you back again soon!  Take care, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is divided up into 4 or 5 clusters of room. A couple of the bldgs. are directly on the beach and the other two are back toward the street (but 30 second walk to the water).   I had standard king room in the reef bldg. Million dollar views, balcony with chairs. Saw lots of dolphins swimming around. Bed was very comfortable but the pillows were too hard for me. Small frig, iron, ironing board, hair dryer, Keurig machine, wall mounted tv, small table with two chairs. a/c didn't work and it was a brutally hot day in the 80s.   Bathroom is a little 70s looking and nothing fancy, but gets the job done. Main room is decorated in pretty yellow and turquoise. Beach front bar is nice, food in restaurant was good. Tons of local (but expensive) shops lining both sides of the
Manager Response: Million-dollar views and dolphins to boot! Sounds like a fantastic getaway, and it was a pleasure to be a part of it. Thank you for sharing your kind words with us, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little me time!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in the Reef Tower. The room was very spacious - it had a full kitchen (with a pink stove!). There are no cooking utensils and I didn't want to invest in them on vacation (we didn't spend a ton of time in Laguna anyway), so we didn't really make use of anything except the refrigerator. There is a grocery store just across the street with a great produce selection, so we stocked up on fruit to snack on. The room has a Keurig coffee maker.  Our room was not "technically" beach-front but it was VERY close and we still had a great view of the water. We booked at a discounted rate so I could not have asked for a better view for the price!   Within a very short walking distance is a Taco Bell, a great breakfast/lunch place called the Orange Inn (excellent lattes), the grocery
Manager Response: Thanks for leaving such a detailed account of your stay! We're glad you enjoyed it, but we wish we could have checked on your heater during your visit‚Äîwe don't want anyone to be chilly! We'll definitely look into that, but in the meantime thanks for sharing that photo with us, Paula‚Äîwe love that sunny beach view!  Hope to have you back soon, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This hotel was a nice surprise for the rate. Considering its location (right on the beach and within walking distance of shops, restaurants, and other activities),  colorful and clean rooms, a nice lobby, and a good restaurant and deck overlooking the ocean, the rates are very good. I had a small room without an ocean view, but it was basic, clean, and equipped with requested microwave and refrigerator.  I would have liked a chair in the room to check emails on my laptop or even just to sit somewhere other than on the bed. The walls between rooms are paper thin and I heard more than I wanted to hear from my neighbors. Otherwise, this is a very nice hotel at surprisingly affordable rates.
Manager Response: A wonderful view and a great rate‚Äîthat's what we're all about! Thanks for staying with us, and for sharing your feedback regarding our walls. It's definitely something we're looking in to for our future guests! In the meantime, we hope to welcome you back again next time you need a little sun, Belle-Lettrist. After all, you can't beat this view!  Thanks again, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient and inexpensive but older property
Summary: I was in Laguna for an annual event with friends and the hotel that everyone else was at was full, so I looked nearby.  I was amazed to find Pacific Edge right there and at a pretty reasonable price.  If you travel much and look for "value" hotels, you've likely run across at least one that appears to be either on older motel or apartment building converted into a hotel.  The part of Pacific Edge that I stayed in was that kind of building.  There are several distinct buildings, and I did not look at the others, so this review is only for the building immediately facing Pacific Coast Hwy. The linens were very nice (this seems to be a common denominator with this type of hotel).  The room and bathroom were clean.  The staff was unfailingly nice and helpful. The downside is that
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback. Although I'm very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, I'm sorry that you were a bit chilly during your visit. We should have had a heating unit available for you, and I'll speak to our team about this right away. That aside, you left some great suggestions for us, and we'll keep them in mind as we continue our renovations. Thank you, and we hope you'll keep us in mind next time you need to get away.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The hotel is on a beautiful area of Laguna beach. Our room was not all that large and appeared somewhat old and run down but the price was reasonable for the location, overall location great but hotel was not.
Manager Response: Sorry you were disappointed with your room. We're currently in the midst of making the necessary upgrades for our guests, but we wish we had been able to show you a better time. Still, we're glad that you loved being so close to the beach, and we hope to have you back next time you need a little sun. We know we have what it takes to show you a fabulous vacation!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Depends on the building and location of the room
Summary: There are several buildings, some on the beach and some behind the beach front ones.  We booked a room here based on its location.  We had got a room in the back building and decided to go for the deluxe rather than the basic room.  The deluxe featured a kitchenette, which was great because we like to eat breakfast in.  The windows faced the back of the ocean front buildings, but you could glimpse the ocean between the buildings.  The room on the other side of the building faced PCH and must have been very noisey all night.  Downside: Kitchenette had seen better days, rust at the bottom of the fridge, worn cabinet finishes.  You have to ask for dishes and utensils.  All had seen better days. One wall AC/heater with fan.  This was the only ventilation source.  Had to leave it on
Manager Response: Although it is clear that we were unable to offer you a five-star visit, it's very encouraging to see that you enjoyed your trip. I'm thrilled that you look forward to visiting us again, and I can assure you that you'll be very impressed once all of our renovations are complete. Until then, thanks for your honest feedback, and please let us know if you have any further suggestions‚Äîwe're all ears!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Surprisingly incredible, refreshing customer service! A gem!
Summary: We visited this hotel for several days in nov 2012, our family's first trip to disney and legoland.  We booked on expedia, wanting a mid point between our two destinations.  Upon arrival I was uneasy, as motels with the outside doors freak me out.  Upon check in, we were greeted with the absolute best staff we have ever encountered!  It is amazing, considering customer service in our country is declining rapidly.  They truly appear to love their jobs, and we will return to this hotel next time we go to the area.  Our children received a cute little bucket of sand toys, dinner on site with views and the serene sounds of ocean waves was awesome.  The blankets they provided as the evening chilled in the semi outdoor restaurant were a thoughtful touch.  The rooms aren't glitzy and
Manager Response: Wow, April! We couldn't have asked for kinder words, especially regarding our staff. I'm thrilled that they made you and your family feel so welcome, and they're going to be even happier to know that, too. Thanks so much for the kind words, and for making us a part of your vacation. We'd love to welcome you back whenever you need a little R & R!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Service, Hidden Gem
Summary: My amazing expierence started with the excellent Customer service at check in provided by Javid Bholat. He made sure that every question was answered, that our accommodations was what we wanted but more importantly he followed up to insure that we where happy. I was sometimes confused as to whom the staff were. Not only were the guest friendly the hotel staff was also accommodating. For example I was carryig more than a few bags and a staff asked if he could assist I polietly stated that I was ok less than a minute later a guest offered to assist as well. I accidently stumbled on this hotel. My getaway was always San Diego. Not anymore this is my Hidden paradise. I enjoyed the Hotel and its location but more importantly the Staff. Javid set the tone for an amazing stay. I was
Manager Response: We're so glad you found us, Victor! You're right about our team‚Äîthey're always happy to help, but it's good to see that our guests were just as friendly. We're lucky to have them! Thanks for the wonderful review, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little sun. I know Javid and the rest of our crew would love to have you back!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Like others have pointed out, the rooms are a little dated and possibly in need of modernisation, however, they are perfectly clean and comfortable.  Yes, the air conditioning unit is old fashioned, noisy, and struggles to keep the room cool  Anywhere else, the points mentioned above could have affected the quality of your stay, but we specifically chose an ocean front room which meant that we could stand or sit out on our balcony looking at the beach and the ocean.  Even better at night time we could sleep with the patio door open, just listening to the sound of the waves breaking on the beach below - perfect!  On one of the mornings we were enjoying our cup of coffee on the balcony when 3 dolphins cruised past probably not more than 50 yards from shore  Valet parking is
Manager Response: I'm so glad you were able to see the dolphins! They're really a sight to behold, especially from the comfort of the balcony. Thanks for making us a part of your trip to Laguna Beach, and for the kind words. We'd love to welcome you back next time you need a little sunshine!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This place has deteriorated and they try to paint over the well worn facility. They have doubled their prices over the last 3 years and yet its getting worse. terrible customer service. no discounts for frequent stays.  Last room we were in had torn curtains. 2 lights did not work and a door would not close. the carpets were filthy. Motel 6. , travel lodge, and holiday inn are a better deal for the money. you will be disappointed if you stay here. We started staying here in 2008 and it has gotten so bad over time. many better hotels to stay at for cheaper. The restaurant is now closed.
Manager Response: I'm surprised to hear about this, Bob, especially since it seems that you had enjoyed your previous stays. However, we are currently in the midst of implementing the necessary updates for our guests, and we look forward to the outcome of this project. We hope you'll be able to see our renovations for yourself next time you need to get away, but until then, thanks for your feedback.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Although slightly dated the hotel's location, cleanliness and friendly staff made our stay very enjoyable.  Great spot for those traveling on a budget, be aware the parking is valet only and not included in the cost of the room
Manager Response: You just can't beat this location! Thanks for making us a part of your getaway. Keep us in mind next time you need a little sun!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We got a good deal with Westjet with a stay at this hotel and it was a really great hotel right on the water. We loved being on the beach and being able to walk to the main centre of town within 5 minutes. Laguna Beach was such a nice place to go to, to relax and not feel like you have to do anything. We walked along the beach and explored as far as we could. The hotel was just what we needed. Have cold water in the lobby and helpful staff who directed us around and called a cab for us. If you want to go to Disneyland, be prepared to spend a lot on a taxi.
Manager Response: Walking distance from the beach and town center and plenty of family fun‚Äîsounds like a blast! Thanks for getting away with us. We'd love to welcome you back next time you need a little sun!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I found Pacific Edge through Expedia, and took advantage of a good deal on a village-facing room with two double beds. When we arrived, Javid, the friendly and efficient person who greeted us at check-in, offered us a very reasonable upgrade to an ocean-facing room with a king bed. We took him up on the offer, and were thrilled by everything about that choice: the view from the balcony, the quality of the room in every detail, the sound of ocean waves and proximity to the beach, just a short flight of stairs away. We were on the first floor, so the (salt-water) pool and hot tub were also just a short walk away. The pool area is enclosed, but open to the sky, so it was a comfortable combination of indoor-outdoor feeling, and I especially enjoyed the salt-water (large) jacuzzi,
Manager Response: We wish you had been able to stay a second night, too, but we're so happy to hear how much you enjoyed your visit! Your kind words mean the world to us, so thanks for leaving them. Please let us know if there's anything else we can do to show you an even better time!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing views awesome pool and spa and the staff are outstanding.
Summary: Javid helped us get set up and gave us a great rate for an ocean view room. Very polite staff and the view unbelievable, we slept with our patio door open all night. Having two kids we don't get to relax often but this was just what we needed. We can't wait to bring the kids next time!
Manager Response: Javid will be so happy to hear from you, Pamela! It sounds like you had a very relaxing stay with us‚Äîwhat's better than falling asleep to the sound of the waves? Thanks for making us a part of your getaway, and please keep us in mind next time you need a little R & R!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Depends on the Room you get
Summary: We booked the lowest level room and received a slight upgrade to a partial ocean view room.  We were in the main building.  Others we knew got the buildings closer to the ocean.  We could see it and it was fine.  But if you do pay for an Oceanview room, you should be very happy. To describe our room, we had 2 doubles instead of 2 queens.  We wanted a king, but it wasn't available at booking time.  The bathroom was adequate.  The toilet paper roll was on the door, so you had to shut the door if you didn't want to have an issue.  The bathtub was fine.  Wasn't thrilled with the lack of space to place your toiletries.  It had one pedestal sink with no cabinets.  One thin shelf above the toilet, so pretty important to leave the seat down in case your bag fell over.  There was another
Manager Response: It seems that we fell short during your visit, Benedetta. I'm sorry to hear about this, but I really appreciate your comprehensive feedback. It will only make us better! Thank you, and I hope we'll have another chance to better demonstrate our impeccable level of service next time you need to get away.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: great place!  great location!  great vacation!
Summary: This was our second visit back to this property and we were just as pleased the 2nd time.  Surf wing is the way to go with oceanfront room.  Location of room is perfect views and if you like to sleep to the sound of the surf this is where to be in Laguna.  Kids spent entire week on the beach.  Staff at the property can't do enough for you.  Perfect location also to get to shops and restaurants.  Only drawback we found this time was slower housekeeping support - room was not cleaned until late in the day (3-4pm) and since my balcony was one of my favorite places to be each day this was a bit of a downer.  On a side note - I would beiive if I requested an early cleaning the hotel would have done everything they could do to accomodate my request.  I will do that on my next visit
Manager Response: Great suggestion! We'll be sure to speak to our housekeeping staff about earlier assistance. That said, I'm delighted that you and your kids had such a fabulous time here in Laguna Beach, and we'd love to welcome you back again soon! Until next time, thanks for the fantastic review!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The photos on the website are exactly what you will get - spend the extra and get an ocean front room.  Being able to fall asleep to the sound of the crashing waves on the beach is worth every dollar.  The beach is steps away, with a very helpful beach attendant available on the weekends.  Will go back!!  Fabulous hotel with wonderful staff!
Manager Response: You're right‚Äîthere's nothing better than hearing the waves crashing outside your window! Thanks for staying with us, Heather, and for the kind words. We can't wait to welcome you back!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Spontaneity is the spice of life...
Summary: We will definitely return...the customer service was exceptional!  Our visit was quite spontaneous and we couldn't have been more pleased.  Watching the the Pacific sunset while sitting on our balcony was picture perfect.  While the room decor may not have been 5 star, the service was! We had some plumbing issues and Bryan (the front desk supervisor) and the maintenance staff went out of their way to make things right.    A special thank you to Bryan for all of your kind assistance!
Manager Response: Sometimes the spontaneous trips are the most fun! Thanks for thinking of us, Jill, and for the fabulous review. Come back and see us soon‚Äîthe beach is just as lovely during the winter months!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Life doesn't get much better than this!
Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge for a week in October and it was absolutely magnificient!  Our room had a large balcony which literally was right over the ocean when the tide was high.  It was nice having an oversized room with the huge granite countertop wetbar and kitchen area and  refrigerator, because we enjoyed many of our meals on our private deck just kicking back and enjoying the view. The sunsets were amazing and we loved the beach!  The vibe of the Pacific Edge was warm, inviting and totally unpretentious.  It's worth paying the extra money to be oceanfront, but with us, we parked our car for the week and didn't leave, except to take walks around the shops and streets of Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Beach views and a comfortable room‚Äîit doesn't get much better than that! Thanks for staying with us, Peggy. Come back and see us next time you need to unwind!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Their web shows awesome oceanfront rooms. However when you check in you find yourself in a different building with little or now view, unless you like Pacific Coast Highway. We were greatly disappointed. An old hotel remake trying to become luxurious. That was not what we found. We would never recommend them.
Manager Response: Although we're currently in the midst of implementing the necessary updates for our guests, some of our rooms have yet to be updated. I'm sorry you were disappointed, but we would have been happy to move you to another room had you brought this to our attention. That said, I wish we could have taken care of this during your visit, but I would be happy to discuss this further. Don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to talk.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My husband & I have been coming here since 1976!We have always enjoyed it here! It was family owned then & was Vacation Village.We have celebrated all of our wedding anniversaries & our son got married on the beach so we have many happy memories .It is now Pacific Edge .We are always welcomed by Rafael,who has been here for at least 35 yrs.He is without a doubt always so cordial & professional each time we arrive,& always meets all our needs & requests.We recently had the privilege of meeting Javid & he greeted us with the biggest smile & remembered us from our recent stay.His customer service along with Rafael is so welcoming !Our room is updated with perfect view of the ocean.We were offered a bottle of wine by Kim who was very helpful  & Brian who introduced himself to us.A
Manager Response: I can't describe how rewarding it is to keep welcoming you back after 35 years. Thank you so much for your support, Rosanne. It means the world to me, Rafael and the the rest of our team! We're looking forward to welcoming you and your husband back again, but please don't hesitate to reach out if there's anything we can do to make your next visit even better!  Take care, Bill

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel quite frequently since 1987 (when it was Vacation Village) and were looking forward to a memorable 4 days to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. I booked our room months in advance and requested the upper floor in the surf wing since we stayed there for years and were celebrating a milestone anniversary. The week before we arrived I called the hotel to be sure they had a note in their system regarding our request, which they confirmed they did.
