We hope to your next visit proves to be even better, and we can't wait to hear about it. Until then, thank you once again!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Back from our son's wedding weekend in Laguna Beach and a perfect stay at the Pacific Edge Hotel for us and our out of town guests (approx 120).  Location, location, location (beach front rooms, ideal swimming), exceptional service (front desk, A ++ valet parking attendants, beach crew, cleaning service); excellent value - most economical in Laguna (and we shopped!) and the magnificent Villa!!  This newly renovated gem gave us the perfect 'home' in which we loved to live and proudly entertain our guests.  Set up with fully furnished living room areas and fridge, the Villa gave us the opportunity to comfortably 'meet and greet'.   Sleeping accommodations at the Villa were outstanding - comfortably accommodating 5 guests.  We slept with the doors open to the sight, sound and
Manager Response: There's nothing more relaxing than being lulled to sleep by the sound of waves crashing on the beach. Thank you for staying with us, and for sharing your kind words with fellow travelers. We hope to welcome you back next time you're looking to get away!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here in 2011 and did not have such a great stay. The location is perfect *5* stars. No where better in Laguna. However the service back in 2011 was rubbish for the $400+ per night rate.. I followed up with an email and received an almost immediate response, apologising and updating me with changes that were being made to rectify the problems. They also offered a free night which I was very happy with and all the problems we had before were resolved. I would not hesitate to recommend Pacific Edge and would also recommend that any problem experienced is taken up with the manager on site. We made the mistake the first time in just speaking with reception who are more check in desk only staff. My tip would be to make dinner reservations in advance for local restuarants as
Manager Response: We feel that we have had a wonderful opportunity to grow these past few years, so it's extremely gratifying to see how impressed you were with your recent visit. On behalf of our entire staff, thank you for giving us another chance, and for your kind words. We can't wait to welcome you back!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Average Rooms but a Great Location
Summary: Our experience with the Pacific Edge Hotel had both positives and negatives.  The best part of this hotel was its location.  The beach was just a short walk down stairs from our room.  Other nicer rooms jut directly out over the ocean.  The hotel offered beach chairs and umbrellas to guests and had convenient showers to rinse off sand before returning to the room.  Another benefit of the location was the proximity to the Laguna Beach downtown.  The hotel was just a short walk via the street to all of the dining and shops.  It‚Äôs an even shorter walk if you walk along the beach.  In addition to the beautiful beach, the hotel offered a wonderful heated pool.  The front desk attendants were very courteous and helpful with an attendant at the desk 24 hours a day.  Finally, the hotel
Manager Response: We're thrilled that you enjoyed your time in Laguna Beach, Beth, but we wish that your room had left you with a better impression. Still, we are in the midst of implementing the necessary updates for our guests, and we hope that you have the opportunity to stay in one of our renovated rooms soon. Until then, thank you for taking the time to review us. We hope to welcome you back soon.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I have been staying here for twenty years and have never been sorry. I love sleeping here! You can hear the waves breaking all night. you can get chairs and towels and just relax on the beach. great location, an easy walk to shopping, movie, dinner. the reef tower is my favorite spot. splurge for an oceanfront room, you will not regret it. The staff is helpful and accommodating. This is a great place to bring kids and teens. the pools and game room will keep them busy after the beach..
Manager Response: Thanks for your support, Christina! It's always a pleasure to welcome you back, and it was an absolute joy to read your kind words. We'll see you next year!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Totally Relaxing Week in Laguna Beach
Summary: This was our first time to Orange County and Laguna Beach and it turned out to be a terrific choice.  We wanted to stay "on the beach" and the Pacific Edge is on the beach- make sure you get an oceanfront room.  The Reef rooms could use some updating but are still more than adequate and very clean.  One of the buildings has been updated and is nicer.  The hotel location can't be beat.  It is a short walk to the main area of shops, art galleries, restaurants.  The hotel staff exudes helpfulness - from the front desk to the garage attendants and they couldn't be nicer.  The $24 daily parking fee is just what it costs to park in Laguna Beach so just forget about it.  You are not going to have to move the car very often anyway.  In the morning I went to the lobby, poured a cup of
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a fabulous time here in Laguna Beach! While we appreciate your kind words, it appears that you were a bit disappointed with your stay. However, we are proud to report that we are currently making the necessary updates for our guests, and we hope that you'll be able to enjoy them during your next visit. Until then, thanks for staying with us! We can't wait to welcome you back.  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: A true Pacific Ocean experience!  After being upgraded to an ocean view room [in the older wing] we had a spectacular room that sat right above the beach - and when it was high tide, the waves reached right under our balcony. [Thank you to Madison Techmanski at the front desk] You can hear the waves& ocean all night long.  The room had a simple, but tasteful decor.  The bed was super-comfortable & the bedding very luxurious. Having stayed here before, I was happy to return to an ocean view room.  The hotel is easily within walking distance of the small village of Laguna & in the center of PCH1 strip of restaurants/galleries, etc...
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to welcome you to Laguna Beach! Thank you for staying with us, and for sharing your compliments‚ÄîMadison will be so happy to hear from you again. Laguna is beautiful all year round, so come back and see us next time you need to get away!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The service we received at this hotel for our anniversary weekend (memorial day weekend) was exceptional. We got a surprise upgrade, complimentary proseco, chips, and salsa. Our ocean view balcony was lovely and he view was spectacular. Great weekend.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to help you celebrate this happy occasion! Thank you for sharing your kind words, Carrie Lynn. We'd love to have you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: 1.	I want to start by saying that my husband and I have spent our anniversary at Pacific Edge for years and look forward to our stay year after year. We also bring our family down to stay occasionally too. We have always enjoyed the ocean front rooms and staff and had never experienced any problems.  2.	Unfortunately our feedback and service was extremely disappointing this year. We had our annual reservations for Feb. 22-24 and made them a good month prior to that date, however we received an email stating our reservations had to be canceled due to weather and construction that was put behind because of the poor weather. Obviously, we were extremely disappointed when we received the notification, however, certainly understood that the hotel could not control mother nature.
Manager Response: We completely understand your disappointment, and we want to offer our sincere apologies once again. It is quite disconcerting that we have yet to resolve this for you, but we are truly grateful that you have taken the time to voice your concerns.  We have looked up the information provided and were unable to validate the situation presented in the review. We want to remedy this immediately for you and speak with you right away so please give us a call at (949) 281-5701 so we may discuss this in depth as this is the first that we have heard of it.   All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Stayed in an ocean front roof in the Reef building. Room was bright and colorful, looks newly remodeled, nice bedding, large TV, satellite. Bathroom is tiny, but does the job. Tiny fridge, no microwave. Being in front of the water is amazing. Hotel staff was friendly, allowed me to check in early (based on availability), and stay late. Free wifi. Walking distance to Ralph's market and tons of boutique shops, other restaurants. The Deck (their own ocean front restaurant is closed for remodel 5.24.13) but the Beach House next door gives 10% off for guests staying here and is right on the water too, also has a stunning garden patio under trees. The beach is nice and water pretty clear for the Pacific. Definitely recommend a stay here, but do spend the extra money for ocean front
Manager Response: It's hard to beat that ocean view, especially when you just want to lounge around on the balcony! We're delighted that you loved it as much as we do. Come back and see us again soon‚Äîthere's nothing like Laguna Beach in the summertime!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed just right on the beach. The ocean view room was spectacular! It was my Birthday and relaxing gateway with my hubby... Great location and close to restaurants, surf shops, gift shops, main beach, park...We had more than 2 bottles of wine through our few days stay just at our patio and it was so relaxing to watch the sunsets, surfers, ocean, puddle boarders (couldn`t see any dolphins?). All staff was very nice starting from receptionist (we got full info upon check-in and many brochures), valet, housekeeping (always got new towels etc.). Especially thanks to the guys who took care of us every time we were sunbathing and they did great job! They set up our lounges, towels, umbrellas (make sure you tip them, they work hard!), they also asked us where we would like to be
Manager Response: Wow! It was so rewarding to read your kind words. We're delighted to hear how much you enjoyed yourself, and we'd love to have you back next time you need to get away!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This was the perfect location for a weekend on the beach. We happened to luck out and stay in one of the renovated beachfront rooms. Others in our party were less fortunate. The hotel staff were exceptional and went out of their way to be helpful. Our room was clean and very comfortable. If you are going to stay, you MUST, ask for the newly renovated rooms.
Manager Response: Sounds like a fabulous beach weekend! Thanks for taking the time to sing our praises, Roger. We can't wait to have you back again!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We (me, hubby, 4 yr old child) took a 3 day breather from the daily grind down to Laguna Beach and this was the perfect place to be. Ocean front, walking distance to everything, enough amenities to make stay great. It's NOT a luxury hotel, but they don't charge luxury hotel prices anyway, so it's OK.  We were pleasantly surprised that we got an adjoining room with 2 double beds in it, so our child who got a fever right when we got there, could sleep comfortably and her constant coughing didn't wake me and hubby up at night. Instead the sounds of the waves crashing lulled us to sleep :) There were a couple of glitches (staff was mostly friendly but for 1, the bathroom in the pool area was disgusting but it was not the hotel's fault-someone just went nuts with the t.p., and the
Manager Response: Glad we could help you unwind! It sounds like you and your family had a fabulous time here in Laguna Beach, but we're sorry that your little one was feeling a bit under the weather. We'd also like to apologize for the state of our restroom, and we will make sure to remind our team to be more vigilant. Thank you for bringing this to our attention, and for the lovely review. We hope to welcome all of you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location- right on the beach
Summary: This hotel is located within walking distance of downtown Laguna, and right on the beach. The pool & jacuzzi area is nice to have as well. The hotel was updated a couple years ago, so it's in nice condition. The rooms are basic, but nice. You have chairs and umbrellas available for you on the beach too. If you're looking for a place to stay in the heart of Laguna and not planning on spending your days in the hotel room, this is a great option.
Manager Response: We're in the perfect place to soak up the sun! We're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay, Kirsten, and we're happy to report that we are currently in the midst of renovating our rooms. Hopefully your next visit will prove to be even better! Until then, thank you for your kind words. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Location is perfect, but rooms are lacking
Summary: This was my second stay at Pacific Edge, and I hoped that the rooms had been brought up to par along with the rates, but not so much.  Stayed in a beach front king in the Reef building, and the view from the deck was great, but not so much the rest of the room. Bed, linens and towels are good quailty, but the rest of the room, from the furniture to the bath to the TV, were not. Walls are thin, and you'll hear everyone on the decks next to yours.  Before you stay here, make sure you understand exactly where your room is located (end rooms on the beach are a bit more private), and make sure it's in an updated building. Not all buildings have elevators, and the worn, rotted carpets, rusted fittings, and general lack of attention to detail can be disappointing on the way to your
Manager Response: Although we're thrilled that you enjoyed being steps away from the beach, we wish that your room had left you with a more positive impression. Your comments are concerning, but we are glad to report that we are currently in the midst of making the necessary upgrades for our guests. We hope to have another opportunity to wow you with one of our newly remodeled rooms, but until then, we will certainly keep your words in mind as we work to better ourselves. Thank you.   Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Romantic get away or great family vacation
Summary: My wife and I have been coming to Laguna Beach at least twice per year for over twenty years and, when we don't rent a house, we usually stay at this old favorite. This trip it was just the two of us to celebrate my birthday. We stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms in the surf wing. I can recall staying in this exact room when it was done up in bright/loud beach colors (big bird yellow and bright sky blue). They have mercifully dialed it back to earth tones and it makes a big difference. Very tasteful. The location is unequaled for proximity to the beach and downtown. The only thing I can even come close to complaining about is the $24 per day parking charge. When we come here we never get back in our car until check out and the parking used to be included. My sore neck
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear how much you enjoyed our new look‚Äîit definitely offers a more relaxing experience for our guests. That said, we're sorry that you woke up feeling a bit stiff. We'll certainly look into this as we continue making the necessary upgrades for our guests. Still, it sounds like you had a fabulous time! Thanks for allowing us to be a part of your celebration, Kevin. We'd love to welcome you and your wife back again soon!   Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We were very happy with both the location of the hotel to all the shops and restaurants (in walking distance) as well as the fact that it sits right on the beach, all you do is bring your bathing suit and they supply towels and beach chairs.  Great value.
Manager Response: There's no better place to soak up the sunshine! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your stay. Thanks for the kind words, and let us know if there's anything we can do to show you a five-star experience!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Stayed a week and the location is very good. Walking distance to Ralph's grocery and restaurants and shops. Scenery along the coast was fabulous.Parking is awful and a tight squeeze no matter where you park. Staff is friendly and helpful, very courteous.I saw dolphins and surfers from the balcony every day. Beach was a bit too busy for my taste, but you never know until you get to a destination whether the beach is secluded or crowded.
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear that our beach was a bit too busy for your liking‚Äîwith the warmer weather, we do see a bit more congestion! Still, we're delighted that you were able to watch the dolphins playing in the surf from your balcony, and that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you! We'd love to welcome you back again soon.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty lobby, but a dumpy hotel.
Summary: Although the location is great, there are better choices in the same price range. The rooms have considerable deferred maintenance and are not cleaned well. Cheap (temporary?) fixtures and patio doors literally falling off their hinges. This is not a quaint  hotel like many older beach hotels can be; this is a dumpy hotel with a pretty lobby. This was true of all the rooms that we saw (we were here for a multi family event).  Also, the free wifi does not work unless the lobby puts you through to their "IT" department to connect. You will have to call them everyday for each device. The interior alley were the valet sets up is an echo chamber of conversations all day/night so all you hear is chatter and not the waves. Very limited privacy so this would be a terrible romantic get
Manager Response: It's disappointing that you left with such a poor impression. While we do want our lobby to wow our guests, we want them to feel the same way about their rooms. We apologize, but we know that we can do better. We will certainly keep your words in mind as we move forward.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Stayed one night at the Pacific Edge in April. We chose it simply for the beachfront location and balcony. We were hoping for one of the newly renovated rooms but instead got an older beachfront in the Reef wing. The location was exceptional: open the balcony door and it was all right there: dolphins, sand, sea, surf. I can't say how nice the view was - perfect!   The room, however, was pretty weather-beaten. I know all that salt water plays havoc with everything, but this room was in serious need of an overhaul with rusting and corroded pipes and chrome finishes. The TV would only get local channels with somewhat distorted sound until my boyfriend being the mechanical genius rewired everything and poof! we had cable and clear sound. We never could get the wifi to work but
Manager Response: Wow! It must have been so exciting to see the dolphins from your bedroom. Although we're glad that you were able to observe the wildlife, we wish that your room had left you with a better impression. We are in the midst of remodeling, and we would have been happy to move you to another room that better suited your needs. That said, we look forward to making the necessary updates for our guests, and we hope that you and your boyfriend will give us another opportunity to offer you a fabulous getaway. Until then, thank you for your feedback.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Laguna Beach is easy to understand, you are paying for ocean sounds, but don't expect anything but tired, old properties.  Stay as close to the ocean and surf and sand as you can afford. I stayed in the Reef Tower, front suite, top floor, and as a regular at this property, I did not expect much from the room and was not disappointed.  PROS: Outstanding bed and pillows, Ocean Sounds, Super TV and mounting, Ocean Sounds, Linens-Luxurious, Ocean Sounds. CONS: Dangerous, Old, Tired, Noisy, Slow Elevator. Sofa, greasy & stained. Toiletries, small and you only get one set for your whole stay. Toilet Paper, only one roll per stay, conserve. Dim lighting with burned out bulbs.Aggravating Refrigerator, left side of kitchen with a right hung door(could be easily changed)Curtain too close
Manager Response: Although we're pleased that you found our beds to be so comfortable, we wish that we had been able to offer you a 5 star experience. That said, we are currently undergoing renovations, and we will certainly keep your words in mind as we work to become better for our guests. Thank you for taking the time to review us, Jim. We hope to have another opportunity to impress you in the near future.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I checked into this hotel last weekend and my stay was awesome from the beginning.  JP Ferguson set my reservation up and ensured I had a great weekend.  The front desk was warm and inviting.  The room was awesome with a great view of the beach.  Each encounter with staff through out the weekend was always met with a smile and willingness to assist me in whatever way possible.  Easy access to the beach, awesome staff, awesome room, and located near lots of nice restaurants and shops.  Definitely will return in the future.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had an excellent vacation! It was our pleasure to help you enjoy your time away. Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words. We hope to have you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I enjoyed an amazing Ocean-front room!  My balcony was directly over the sand (and high tide at night)!  I was able to sleep with the doors open and the crashing waves below were like a lullaby!  The staff was awesome and check in and check out were smooth and quick! You can walk to absolutely everything from here!  Downtown Laguna Beach was a great place to hang out!  You can also walk (easily) to the local grocery store.  "The Deck" is a great place to eat...food was delish!   I am heading back this summer!  I cannot wait!
Manager Response: RaeAnn,  It's so relaxing to fall asleep to the ocean's lullaby! Thank you for staying with us, and for taking the time to share your story‚Äîyour review made us feel instantly relaxed. Come back and see us next time you're looking to get away!  Regards Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My kids and I, 13 & 15 stayed after x-mas for just one night. Had a room directly on the beach.  Beautiful sunset. Yes the property is a little tired, but I think a lot of that is due to the salty air. Check in was smooth, and my preferred complimentary bottle of white wine was waiting in the room. I noticed that that the track lighting wasn't working. Called maintenance and they worked on it, still trying to fix when we left for dinner. Upon arriving back at the room, the track lighting had been undone and replaced with a dome light.This was fine as otherwise the room would of only had the one bedside lamp.   I noticed that in the wine bucket another bottle of wine, with a note from management apologizing for the inconvience. Very classy.   Within walking distance to shops and
Manager Response: We are sorry that we were unable to repair your track lighting prior to your arrival, but we are thrilled to hear how impressed you were with our service! It was a pleasure to welcome you to Laguna Beach, Diana. Thank you for staying with us!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Our family has been going to Laguna Beach for almost 20 years every Easter Break, infact all 20 years have been at the same hotel. This year was no different. The experience we had on this visit though, was different. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to make our visit comfortable. Special Kudos to JP Ferguson, Office Manager, and Jessica at the front counter. Even the valet guys were actually cordial, not the cockiness we've experienced from previous years. Wish we had been able to stay a little longer, but we will do it again next year. The Pacific Edge is highly recommended for a vacation stay !!
Manager Response: We wish you could have stayed longer, too! Still, we couldn't be more pleased to hear how much you enjoyed your stay, especially considering how long you've been with us. On behalf of our entire staff, thank you for your continued support. We look forward to welcoming you back again next year‚Äîor sooner!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The reviews here are accurate. If you are paying more than $200 for one of these rooms you are going to be upset.    The room was not as luxurious as it appears on the website (just as others have mentioned).  Had I not read the reviews first, I would have been very disappointed but I was prepared, thank goodness.  We stayed in the Reef building. The walls have been painted and a flat screen TV added (but no HD).   The room came equipped with a microwave, small fridge, and Keurig coffee maker.  But it's obvious that a full renovation was not done here.  The bathtub had to be at least 20 years old.  There was rust all over the shower bar. The little wall heater in the room was covered with crud.  The stairs going to the room were old and the railings needed paint.
Manager Response: There is nothing more relaxing than being lulled to sleep by the sound of crashing waves. Although we are beyond thrilled to hear how pleased you were with our location, we wish that these good feelings had extended to the rest of your stay. We are indeed in the midst of completing the necessary renovations for our guests, but we do have several months worth of work to complete. We apologize for any frustration we may have caused, and we want to make this right. If you would like to continue the conversation, please don't hesitate to reach out.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what we thought we were going to get for what we paid for, but not terrible.
Summary: We stayed for a reasonable rate for the location, however, the hotel was nothing like the website pictures. They are much older buildings that have had paint slapped on and a few cool accents to the rooms. The room smelled really old and musty. The shower was almost too small for one person. The TV was 20 years old and only had a few clear channels. The remote would only change channels going up. Nothing else.   Other than that, the front desk had awesome service. The valet service was amazing. They seem to be doing the best they can to convert old to new, with the exception of a few things. The location was excellent. It's right in the middle of the main beach.   Overall, the stay was definitely not amazing, but you'll have to weigh location to hotel comfortableness.  I enjoyed
Manager Response: We're sorry to hear about this. While we are happy that you were impressed with our staff and our location, we wish that your room had left you with the same feeling. That said, we are currently in the midst of making the necessary updates for our guests, and we hope to address most of your concerns in the coming months. Until then, we apologize, and we wish we had been able to move you to another room. That said, we want to make this right for you, so don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this further.   All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice, will be better, find room to match your needs
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in an Ocean View room the Surf Wing.  From our balcony we had as good a view as anyone can ask for or expect.  We were told the room were renovated and available just a week prior to our visit, and they look nice.  Hotel is great at what it is, a nice place in a great location.  They are not trying to be something they aren't.  We had two problems- 1) The Surf Wing is newly renovated so the TVs do not have the interactive options available.  Thus, no movie options, although the TV has all the channels asking you to "hit select", you can't actually do it.  We were not told of this in advance, and usually it doesn't matter for us, but we wanted to stay in, enjoy the view, and catch a movie.  This seems so standard these days I didn't think to ask
Manager Response: Everyone should be able to enjoy their vacation as they see fit, so it is very disappointing to learn of your time with us. We apologize for the malfunctioning television sets, and for the lively guests in the adjacent cabanas. While we are unable to regulate our guests' choice of music, we did everything we can to keep the noise at a more manageable level. Still, we wish that you had alerted us of your discomfort‚Äîwe would have been happy to move you to another room. Still, thank you for your bringing this to our attention. Your words will be of great aid as we move forward.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Rooms don't look like the pics on website!
Summary: I recommended this hotel after finding a deal on expedia. My friend stayed here over spring break and when I came to pick her up I was disappointed in the room. It didn't look at all like the pics they have on expedia or on their website. Apparently the pics they have are of the oceanview remodeled units and not the village ones that are shown for 129 a night on the web. The village rooms are pretty bare, white walls, old furmiture, tiny bathroom. The pool was tiny with no sun. The beach by the hotel was nice though. Too bad it was too cold to enjoy. The location is good, walking distance to dining and shops. I wouldn't recommend this hotel again though. Next time I'll recommend the Inn at Laguna beach. Much nicer and only about $25 more a night for village view!
Manager Response: We are sorry to learn of your disappointment, Lisa. We would never want our guests to feel as though our website was an inaccurate reflection of our hotel, so we will do our best to ensure that there is no future confusion. That said, we are currently in the midst of making the necessary repairs for our guests, and we will certainly keep your comments in mind as we move forward. Thank you for your feedback.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, not so good service
Summary: I booked this hotel for 2 nights of my 5 night stay. I arrived very late, close to midnight. I was traveling with my 5 and 6 yr olds and we were exhausted. I'd originally booked a queen oceanview room and when checking in, I asked the clerk if he by chance had any larger rooms he could put is in. He replied by saying he could put me in a corner unit which would have a bit more room for us. A few days later I noticed a charge on my credit card for $112 and when I called to inquire about this charge, I was told by the manager that it was the upgrade fee. I was never told about a fee and had I known , I would've just kept my original room as we were hardly in it except to sleep. I have yet to receive a refund from this hotel. $100 is no big deal but it's the principle. The manager
Manager Response: Although it seems like you enjoyed your stay, we must apologize for the confusion surrounding your charges. We should have been more clear about the resulting fee for this upgrade, and we will definitely be more straightforward with our future guests. We want to make this right for you, so please don't hesitate to reach out if we have not yet resolved this issue. We hope to hear from you again soon.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We had an emergency stay in the Pacific Edge due to a mishap with another hotel.  This hotel appears to be a number of old apartment buildings being converted into a hotel complex.  Not all blocks have been renovated yet which is the only issue I had.  We had to pay $300+tax a night or pay $700+ for a renovated ocean front room when we booked on the last minute.  We ended up with a 2 BR suite but it was in the unrenovated part of the property and in reality we ended up in an old run down 2BR apartment.  It was big, clean (for the most part) and had a kitchen.  JDV has put in nice beds with comfortable bedding, nice bath products but the rest is just lipstick on the pig so to speak.  The kitchen was very old and beaten up.  The couches were stained and worn out.  The room itself
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Although it seems like you truly enjoyed your time in Laguna Beach, we wish that your room and our service had left you with a better impression.   As you mentioned, we are indeed in the process of completing the necessary updates for our guests, but unfortunately your room has not yet been upgraded. We apologize for not making this more clear, and we wish that we had been able to move you to a different room during your stay.   Your experience with our staff is also very disappointing. We work hard to make sure that everyone feels welcome, but it seems that we had a scheduling conflict that forced us to push back attending to your room. Once again, we apologize, and we can assure you that instances like these are very rare.  That said, we are grateful that you would still be willing to return once our renovations are complete. That means a lot to us, especially after learning of your visit. Thank you for that, and for your detailed feedback. We hope to have you back very soon.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: It's a special experience. PAcific Edge is a "surfer hotel" with the real feeling that you are on the beach and even some "antique" furnishings and equipments. Antique meaning that they are really worn out as well. If you accept it and like the feeling, then you get a really flair place to stay...  Our room was "village family suite" and was HUGE. It had two bedrooms, spacious living room and a real kitchen (some tableware missing though). Funny electric ceiling heating - slow warming up, but than staying hot long and hard to manipulate since the theromstats are not working. Even if it was "village" room (meaning in the second row of buildings), we still had some partial ocean view and plenty of sunlight. We have also seen that the beachfront rooms are being upgraded and the
Manager Response: Yes, we certainly do have a unique vibe! It sounds like you had a wonderful time in our Village Family Suite. We're so happy to hear that. Thank you for the kind words. We hope to have you back again soon!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge for 5  nights and were very pleased with our stay.  Being the "baller-on-a-budget" that I am, we did not stay in an ocean view room - but our room was very nice despite being on the rather busy street, so somewhat noisy.  However, if you can afford to get an ocean view you should do it.  The staff were incredibly friendly, everyone said hello and smiled at us.  This hotel is pet-friendly, a big bonus.  There are so many restaurants and shops nearby you can walk to everything.  Check out Costa Azul surf shop, Laguna Beach Cyclery, and Taco Loco.
Manager Response: We're proud to offer our guests a fabulous beach side getaway, no matter their budget! Thank you for staying with us, and for sharing your kind words. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I stayed just for a night while I was in town but my stay with the Pacific Edge was wonderful.  I had an ocean view room and it wasn't just ocean view...I was above the ocean.  The staff was very friendly.  The bed was comfortable and the room itself was nice.  There was a large flat screen tv.  The only thing that wasn't great is the lack of storage area on the bathroom. I had to keep my makeup on the floor which was not ideal.   I will be sure to stay here each year on my annual visit to Laguna Beach, CA.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us, Bree! Between our friendly staff and your beautiful ocean view, it sounds like you had a wonderful vacation. We couldn't be happier to hear that‚Äîthank you! We'll see you next year‚Äîor sooner! :)  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights,we paid top dollar and on one hand it's worth the money as you get a large modern room which overlooks the pacific ocean complete with dolphins,but basically the owners of this place are living off the view,all other aspects of the hotel are poor. We are smokers and thought great we have a balcony so we don't have to go mooching around for a place to smoke,but we were informed by the cleaner that smoking not allowed on balcony,she said if we get caught we will get a fine,funny really as everyone was going out for a crafty smoke.we went down to the hotel restaurant for breakfast, it was far from clean,the bar in the evening was quite nice but when we went out for a smoke we got hassled by a man who made me feel very uncomfortable,none of us are wimps
Manager Response: As a hotel intent on offering outstanding service, your comments are quite concerning. On behalf of the entire staff, we want to extend our sincere and humble apologies. We would like to continue discussing your experience in detail. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you would like to continue the conversation. We want to make this right.  Best wishes, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I had read all of the review, recent and old. I decided to trust the recent review stating that the rooms had been renovated and the service was great. We had also had a great experience with the Joie de vivre chain before. We had booked a partial ocean view room. The room looked like it had been attempted to be renovated however there were still holes in the walls and rust in the showers and toilet barely flushed, the phone did not work, the temperature control did not work, the tv was not angled right to watch tv while in bed and the layout of the room was terrible! We paid for a partial ocean view which was beautiful be you could only see it from the side of the room that the bed was not on. Who does that? I would have loved to push the bed over to the other side of the room
Manager Response: Although we've very happy to hear that you were pleased with our comfortable bed and our beach side location, your description of your stay is disappointing. However, we truly appreciate your feedback‚Äîyou left a very descriptive account of the layout of your room, and we will certainly utilize those insights as we continue to make the necessary updates for our guests. Thank you for your candor. We hope to have another opportunity to impress you in the near future.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for two nights in March 2013. The hotel is old and renovation is done poorly, at least in one of the rooms that we had. The first night we had a room at the road side which was EXTREMELY loud, the room had a bad smell and the bathroom was clean but old and very small. We had asked if there is any way to upgrade the room and get a room at the beach side. It would be an additional $75 per night which was not an option for us.  The village rooms are not located at the beach directly but at a side street and some low rise buildings are completely blocking the view of the rooms in level 1 &2. You have to walk through a small passageway to get to the beach. After we couldn't sleep most of the first night we decided to go for a room that is at the other side of the
Manager Response: While it seems that we were able to find a room that better suited your needs, we are sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay. We were very surprised to learn of the odd smell you encountered in your first room. Although we have yet to receive any similar reports, we will certainly investigate this further. That said, we are currently in the midst of making the necessary updates for our guests, and we apologize if we had not yet begun work on your suite. It seems that we still have work to do, and we will certainly keep that in mind as we move forward. Thank you for your feedback, Mariam.   Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: It's safe to say that I'm a pretty stressed person. It's not easy for me to "let go" and enjoy relaxation time, but it took NO EFFORT to do that at Pacific Edge Hotel! My boyfriend and I visited Laguna Beach for the weekend, for his birthday. I'm so glad we did. We both had such a great time. We rented a "beach front room," at a pretty affordable price. It was definitely worth every penny! The front desk staff was super friendly and accommodating too. They seemed to remember all of the guests, so it wasn't like you had to "start over" every time you walked up there. There's a taco bell right next door, and a ralphs right across the street, so you don't have to feel obligated to spend a bunch of money on "Laguna Beach" food. They do, however, offer fine dining options, and GREAT
Manager Response: Kristen,  With all the stresses of modern life, it's not hard to see why most folks have trouble unwinding. However, we are absolutely thrilled to hear that you and your boyfriend were able to find some much needed relaxation and peace of mind here in Laguna Beach! Thank you for staying with us, and for the wonderful review. Come back and see us next time you need to get away! :)  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Newly designed rooms, super friendly staff, gorgeous views! Be sure to ask questions when booking your room and you won't be disappointed. It's not the ritz but who needs to spend so much time in their room when you are in paradise?!?! Think beachy chic ;) be sure to bring your own drinks (aka alcohol) to the room... They don't provide room service for drinks. Though there is a bar next door... Just sometimes it would be nice to enjoy a drink in your room or on your balcony without the crowds ;)
Manager Response: Beachy chic‚Äîthat's exactly what we were going for! It sounds like you had a wonderful time enjoying the sun and surf of Laguna Beach. Thank you for staying with us, Jen, and for leaving such excellent tips for fellow travelers. We hope to welcome you back again next year!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Just what we were looking for!!! Guest services were all so pleasant and accommodating. We were able to check in early. Valet parking has in and out privileges which was great. Getting an ocean front view is a must.. The sunset from the balcony is amazing. Lots of shops and great food near by, I'd recommend Tommy Bahama for dinner!
Manager Response: You're absolutely right! Watching the sun set over the Pacific is beyond gorgeous. We're so happy to that you were able to get away and unwind with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words. We hope to welcome you back again soon‚ÄîLaguna is even better in the summertime!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I live in New England where the winters can be a magical place of sparkling snows, glistening ice cycles and dazzling contrasts of light and dark!  In reality - it's mostly dark - and gets that way very early and stays that way WAY too long, the snow is a pain to maneuver through and the cold and dampness get 'old' after the first 'glow of the first snow'! So we leave all this New England 'loveliness' and head to Laguna Beach for a 9 day respite.  Many hours of research later, we make reservations at The Pacific Edge Hotel on So. Coast Highway smack in the middle of the town and even more desirable - steps to the beach! From the minute we made the reservation on line, the correspondences from the hotel were immediate and sincere, w/continual email updates and requests for any
Manager Response: Dark, damp and way too cold‚Äîwe completely understand why you'd have the urge to get away every now and then! We're so glad that you were able to soak up the sun with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words: Our staff works hard to make our guests feel at home, and they'll be thrilled to hear how comfortable they made you. We can't wait to welcome you back!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This location is amazing. We have stayed here 3 times and each time is as good or better. The property sits on pacific coast hwy and goes from buildings street side down to ocean front rooms. I've stayed in a king room, balcony over looking the Launa Beach and bay area which is a beautiful as places I've stayed in Hawaii. Up till Oct the water is warm enough to swim without a wet suit and is clear and blue. Always sea life to see, dolphins etc. The King room was very large with a full size refrigerator. The bed was high end for sure, slept like a baby and also brought an air mattress and slept on the balcony, nothing like hearing the ocean to lull you to sleep. There are staff that work the beach with towels and chairs and lounge chairs that are just great. All kinds of beach
Manager Response: "Nothing like hearing the ocean to lull you to sleep." We couldn't agree more! We're delighted that you've enjoyed your time in Laguna Beach, and that you've been able to spot a few dolphins as well. What a treat! Thank you for choosing to spend your time away with us, and for the wonderful review. We look forward to your next visit!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: hotel is about five buildings that are joint management. 3 buildings on beach and two face street.location is only 200m from Main laguna beach.  we had two bed room which was very nice in Size and good kitchen. Ralphs was just beside us. so we bought what ver we needed.   valet service parking was super.   beach was two steps down. it will need 3 minutes to get to beach side. only issue children cant be monitired from our room.
Manager Response: With a two-minute walk from the shore, you just can't beat our location! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach. Thank you! We hope to welcome you back again next year.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Sleep on the beach in style!
Summary: It is true.....it's all about location, location, location! Surprise birthday weekend for my husband combined with a romantic getaway for two! We live very near Laguna Beach (about 20 minutes inland) and Laguna Beach is still one of my favorite spots in So. Calif. Stayed at Pacific Edge Feb. 9 and 10 and had one of the most relaxing weekends of my life. Booked an oceanfront corner suite and loved it! Stayed in room 109 in the Reef Tower (on the beach). We hit great weather too! Arrived at 4 Pm, checked in and headed to our suite. Now, if you expecting to drive up to the front door, valet your car and have you bags taken to your room, walk 100 feet, get into an elevator and quickly be dropped at the door to your room....stay somewhere else. This is not Vegas people...but it is
Manager Response: You're right‚ÄîLaguna Beach is one of the most beautiful spots in California, and we're honored to be here! Between the beautiful beach and stunning sunsets from your balcony, it sounds like you and your husband had a fabulous birthday/romantic getaway. Thank you for making us a part of it‚Äîit was a pleasure to host, and lovely to read your kind words. We hope to welcome both of you and back again soon!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Beach Hotel without the Laguna Prices
Summary: I'm giving this hotel a 5 star rating for being exactly what it says it is. I recently spent a 4 day weekend in Laguna Beach, and was a little concerned about staying here after reading some other reviews. Have the right expectation and you will have the time of your life! Its an old hotel which means its not gonna be the Ritz or perfect. But it is extremely clean and comfortable. The linens and bed were so comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The pools were clean and heated warm. I visited in February so the air was chilly, but the pool felt amazing. The location cannot be beat. You can walk anywhere you need to go. The beach is right there...amazing! I even stopped into the Deck beach bar. It was fun with a great sunset view! I will be back!
Manager Response: While we would never want our laid-back vibe to appear lackadaisical, we're thrilled that you felt right at home, especially given your initial hesitation. Thank you for staying with us, and for taking the time to leave such a fantastic review on both Yelp and TripAdvisor, Abby. We hope to welcome you back again soon‚Äîthe beach is just as beautiful during the summer months!   Best wishes, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My boyfriend and I just wanted to relax and enjoy the beach scene for a weekend. We decided to stay at the Pacific Edge for 1 night. The Hotel staff was very professional and accommodating. The valet guys were awesome too. Pacific edge has a guy setting up chairs and umbrellas on the beach for the hotel guest, which I thought was great because we didn‚Äôt have to haul chairs to the beach. The room felt old but remodeled. The furniture was dated. The balcony was great. Everything in downtown Laguna is dated so it fits right in with the surroundings. The hotel location is awesome and I would return to this hotel.
Manager Response: Sounds like a fabulous weekend getaway! While we're delighted that you were so pleased with our staff and our gorgeous beach-side location, we are a bit curious about your rating. Did your room bring it to 3 stars? We are in the midst of making the necessary upgrades for our guests, so we hope that your next visit proves to be a five-star experience. Until then, thank you for staying with us, and for your excellent feedback. We hope to have you back again soon.  Best wishes, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: What a great surprise this was.  Traveling with my mother and made reservations not knowing what to expect.  When we walked into the room and opened the door to the balcony we heard the sound of the ocean.  Top floor and warm weather watching sunsets was great.  Kurig coffee makers and fridge in rooms.  Comfortable beds.  Right on the beach too.  We are planning another vacation there.  Cant wait.
Manager Response: We might be a bit biased, but we've always felt that nothing compares to being lulled to sleep by the sound of waves crashing on the shore. What's more relaxing than that? :) We're delighted that you and your mother enjoyed your time with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We were very disappointed in the quality of the hotel for the cost. It would have been tolerable for $100 less per night. The ocean front view and sunset were lovely. Our room was just above the bar and the noise level was a bit much at happy hour but quieted down later. The room was very dated and shabby. It felt like an old apartment. Old bathroom fixtures and appliances in the kitchenette. We were on the 3rd floor and the elevator didn't work. No one offered to carry our bags up/no bellman. We have stayed at the JdV Vitale hotel in San Francisco and expected at least close to the same type of quality facility.  Fortunately, we were only there for one night on our trip.We spent the next night at the posh Beverly Hilton in LA for LESS $ per night!! What a drastic difference.
Manager Response: Though we truly appreciate your comments regarding our staff, we wish that the rest of your time with us had left you with a more favorable impression. As a proud member of the Joie de Vivre family, we do our best to ensure that every room meets the same standards of the hotels that have come before us. However, we must emphasize that we are indeed in the midst of making the necessary upgrades for our guests, and we are always open to suggestions. We will certainly take your feedback into consideration as we work to better ourselves. Thank you for leaving it, Carl.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The best decisions this hotel has made is in their staffing.  I was impressed with the level of service that the Pacific Edge Hotel (PEH) provided from the valet, front desk, and management.  Madison, Javid, and Rafael were all extremely helpful through the medley of complaints and requests that we had for our reservation of 4 rooms.  The staff had 4 star service for a 2 star hotel.  We have stayed at Joie de Vivre hotels in the past.  The service at PEH met JDV's standards.  The building and rooms did not.  I understand that the PEH is undergoing construction.  And as a result of the improvements being made and intended to be made in the next year it may one day be considered a "hotel" in our eyes.  On the inside and outside the PEH appears old and a bit run down.    -The
Manager Response: Although we're pleased that you were so impressed with our team's customer service, we wish that we could have prevented these issues in the first place. As a proud member of the Joie de Vivre family, we do our best to ensure that every room meets the same standards of the hotels that have come before us. As you mentioned, we are in the process of making the necessary upgrades for our guests, but it is unfortunate that this work disturbed you during your stay. We apologize for that, and for not being more attentive with the glass. We will be sure to discuss your comments with our team to discover new methods for being prompt and courteous at all times. Thank you for your feedback. We hope to offer you a 5 star experience should you choose to return.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is a great value in Laguna Beach located right on the water. The location to restaurants and shopping is the best!! There are several room locations to fit into any budget. We booked a very inexpensive room on the street side which was nice but then asked for an upgrade and for a small fee they gave us a wonderful room with an ocean view. We will definitely be back!!
Manager Response: Laguna Beach doesn't get any better than this! We're so happy that you were able to enjoy the ocean breezes right from your room. Thank you for staying with us, and for the wonderful review. We hope to welcome you back next year, John!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We had a corner room with our own private balcony deck. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The views from here were spectacular. The bed was very comfortable with nice bedding. But, the room itself is a bit worn around the edges. It definitely did not match the price bracket we paid to stay here. Hopefully, this room is on the list to be renovated soon. It could be very special.
Manager Response: Yes, we are in the midst of making the necessary updates for our guests. That said, we're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay, and that spectacular view! We look forward to welcoming you back!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We checked in Saturday for a quick getaway in Laguna Beach. The property is right on PCH....just a bit south of the downtown touristy area. Javid checked us in, and...after a room upgrade (very nice), went ahead and sent a bottle of wine to our room. Followed by a SECOND bottle an hour or so later....even a different label! The room (102), was one room off the beach....with a beach view from the window, and the sound of the surf in the air. The room was a bit dated...Joie de Vivre purchases older properties, and updates them. They have started on another wing, but not this one yet. However, it was clean....good bed. Dated cart type tv. The property has no parking, you share valet with the Beachouse resaurant, 20 bucks a night. Typical Laguna Beach...there is no parking anywhere
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us! While it sounds like you enjoyed our beautiful ocean views, we feel that you may have been a bit disappointed with your room. As you mentioned, we are in the midst of renovations to our waterfront rooms, and we hope to complete them soon. Hopefully your next visit will prove to be a 5-star experience! Until then, thank you for taking the time to review us. We would love to welcome you back again soon.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This hotel's website is very deceptive! The rooms are less then Motel 6 quality, there was a slope to the floor, ripped carpet, it smelled like mildew, had water damage on the ceiling, a view of construction, and what appeared to be a full size bed for two adults. I had to pay an upgrade charge just to have a room I was willing to sleep in for one night. I didn't want to loose my money but felt like leaving and going home. The towels are the size of wash cloths and are rough, I found hair in the bathroom. I want my money back! They dont even have central air and heat so we were freezing the whole time. The staff was pleasant but the hotel is so run down, not clean, and old it doesn't matter if the service is good.
Manager Response: It's very disappointing to hear about this. We would never want our guests to feel as though they were forced to stay in an unfinished room, and I apologize if you did. Your description of your room is not only embarrassing, but unacceptable. It seems that this particular room was overlooked, so I will speak to our team about this immediately. In the meantime, don't hesitate to call if you'd like to continue this conversation. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.   Best wishes, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Can't beat the VIEW but.....very disappointing inside!
Summary: By the looks of the photos on their website the Laguna Beach Pacific Edge Hotel seems like it would be fresh, trendy and a nice ocean-front accommodation.  We have stayed in Laguna Beach many times but this was our first time staying at the Pacific Edge Hotel.  When we arrived we immediately noticed the property and the pools seemed very old "motel-ish" feeling.  When we got inside our deluxe ocean front room with adjoining room for the kids, we were very disappointed in the condition.  The view from the King bedroom balcony was spectacular, however, our room which was the closest to their bar/restaurant was extremely noisy and lacked any type of privacy as guests eating outside seemed as if they were right with us on our balcony.  There was also a bar stereo speaker attached to
Manager Response: As proud residents of Laguna Beach, we take great strides to ensure that all of our guests feel welcome and comfortable at all times. We're sorry to learn of your disappointment, especially since you were so looking forward to your stay.   We wish that we had been able to find you an available room to your liking. However, we find it prudent to mention that we are currently in the midst of making the necessary updates for our guests. This is an ongoing project, so we would be happy to hear any further suggestions you may have in regard to improving our suites.   We want all of our gets to feel at home, even our four-legged friends. While we can certainly understand your frustration, we have no influence on the care-taking styles of our visiting pet owners on public beaches. Still, we will see what steps we can take to make sure that all of our rules are communicated clearly to create a relaxing environment for everyone. Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns. We hope to have another opportunity to earn your business next time you're looking to get away.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The grounds are clean and very well kept. This hotel has rooms and suites right on the beach or gardenview/partial views that are steps away from the beach. We stayed in the Beachfront King (room #124) for 2 nights and it was so beautiful. The view from the balcony is breathtaking. I will stay here again and will recommend it to everyone I know!
Manager Response: Yes, our ocean view is absolutely breathtaking! We're so happy that you enjoyed your stay, and that you took the time to share your kind words. Thank you, Natasha! We look forward to your next visit.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We didn't sleep here, but enjoyed one of their beachfront surf cabanas for the day. This was a spectacular experience. You get a private beachfront room and deck with easy beach access, your own server, a beach helper, and everything the hotel has to offer. Great place to have a girlfriend's getaway, baby or bridal shower, or entertain friends for a day at the beach. Walk to downtown Laguna Beach in just minutes from this amazing location!
Manager Response: Whether you're staying several nights or just for a quick day at the beach, we're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your time with us! Thanks for the wonderful review. We'd love to welcome you and the girls back next time you're looking to get away!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We had a package deal for two nights. Overall the staff and location are best part of this property.  The reception staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are old and small but I liked the beachy and retro vibe it had going on.  The location on a small, intimate part of the beach is outstanding - makes up for the old rooms. I mean come on, you're right on the beach, get your booty outside!  When you want a break from the ocean (tide can get a bit rough) the pool and hot tub are a nice touch. Complimentary lounge chairs, umbrellas and beach towels for guest use - yes!  We dined next door at the Beach House for an early breakfast - the setting, server and breakfast dishes were divine.  Hopefully as the property gains its footing they can reinvest some of the profit in
Manager Response: Laguna Beach is the ultimate place to let loose! Between our beautiful beach, relaxing pool and mellow vibe, we're thrilled that you enjoyed your stay. Thanks for leaving such great feedback about our interiors‚Äîwe are working to make the necessary updates, so we'll be sure to remember your words as we renovate! We'd love to welcome you back again soon, Sandra. Until then, thank you once again!  Best wishes, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel.  Pros: - Location! Right on a beautiful beach with umbrellas and chairs. - Location! Walk to most everything in Laguna. - Super friendly, awesome staff. Javid was always so nice and helpful. - Cute rooms, nice Lather brand products, fun vibe. - Really reasonable price for our stay during a sale. - Pet-friendly for no fee  Cons: - You get some traffic noise in rooms on street (village view) - No balcony or patio in our room. - Older hotel - Very small pools - Our first room stunk of cigarette smoke but they moved us quickly and apologetically.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a blast! Whether it's good or bad, we are always happy to hear our guests feedback. It's candor like yours that allows us to become even better! Thank you for taking the time to share your story. We hope to have you back again soon!  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The Pacific Edge is a comfortable, older hotel that is a bit funky, but you can't beat the location. The ocean front rooms have an amazing view of the Pacific Ocean and the staff are very friendly. The walk to town along the water is beautiful!
Manager Response: You really can't beat our location, or our ocean views! Thanks for singing our praises, Lauran. We look forward to your next visit!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised to see our oceanfront room. It was 70's, beachy themed, with a cute little equipped kitchen. The view was stunning and the hotel was clean and the employees were very attentive and polite. The restaurants onsite are wonderful with stunning views. If you don't get an oceanfront room, the have sun cabanas right above the sand with a furnished stocked room to relax. I loved staying in this hotel, I would definitely come back with the family.
Manager Response: Yes! Our beach-side cabanas are the perfect place to soak up the sun. We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay in Laguna Beach‚Äîthank you for taking the time to share your kind words! We'd love to welcome you back again soon.  All the best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: When you get there, the front lobby is nice.  The resort is old and the rooms show this, however, the rooms are clean and maintained.  The staff are friendly and greet you with smiles.  On the most part the front desk staff could answer most questions, they do need to be more familiar with surrounding areas and towns.  We took advantage of the two pools and hot tub/spa.  They were clean, heated and maintained.  Unfortunately for us the hot tub was out of order the last two nights we were there.  Our room had a nice kitchenette, but no microwave or pots and pans to use.  This should be changed, eating out can get expensive.  Could hear the ocean from our room and very little street noise.  Our room faced an alley.   Would stay again, but would want an ocean view room and perhaps
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. While we're delighted that you enjoyed your time in Laguna Beach, it appears that your room left you with mixed feelings. We're sorry about this, but we would like to point out that we are in the midst of making the necessary upgrades for our guests. As such, we will certainly keep your feedback in mind as we move forward. Thank you for leaving it. We hope to show you a 5-star experience should you decide to return.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Its sort of still Vacation Village, but you cant beat the view!
Summary: The furnishings are a bit dowdy for such an amazing location. But then again, you cant beat the view and the location. The kitchenettes are great; fully equipped, very useful. Bathrooms small.  But the VIEW!! THE VIEW!!!  The ice that came with my room probably liked the view too.  I loved my patio, loved the restaurant, which is a Laguna Beach legend with good food and a great bar.  I could have done without the mice, along with the so-so valet parking staff and the eh! front end staff, but every tried.  The manager didnt believe me about the mice until I showed him A LOT of evidence, and then he was sort of decent about it, but this is NOT a Ritz Carlton staff.  What you get at the PAcific Edge is GREAT VALUE, relatively comfortable and clean furnishings and GREAT VIEW!
Manager Response: Yes! You just can't beat a view like ours. While we're delighted that you enjoyed gazing out at the ocean, we wish that your room had left you with a better impression. However, we are currently in the process of revamping our suites, and we look forward to making the necessary updates.  I am curious about your comments regarding mice. We have not received any reports of pests, and we take feedback like this very seriously. Where did you spot them? Please reach out to me if you'd like to discuss this further‚Äîwe want to resolve that immediately. Until then, thank you for your review, Amy. We hope to welcome you back again next year.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The most welcoming staff. We were upgraded for an affordable fee and they sent up a bottle of wine. Will stay here again. Get an oceanside room it is worth it! I can relax on my private patio and take a very short walk to the adjacent bar/restaurant.
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to offer you an upgrade! Thank you for the fantastic review, Kacie. We hope to see you back again next year!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here several times -- most recently a few nights ago. The views are stunning.  The rooms are spotless. The service is so friendly and responsive.  I love this hotel. I also love that I can bring my dog!  It's not 5 star, but it's clean and comfy and the ocean is outside your door. The variable is who your neighbors are and how crowded it is.  Mid-week in the winter, this place cannot be beat. I go there to get some work done in peace and quiet, to be on the ocean (the only way to be closer to the water would be to be on a boat!), and to restore my soul. There is nothing like watching the sunset from the balcony and falling asleep to the sound of the surf. My first time there I watched a pod of dolphins from my balcony and I was hooked.  My experience in the summer
Manager Response: There's something beautiful about being near the ocean in the wintertime‚Äîthe sea has a very different character during this time of year. We're glad that you've taken advantage of this lovely season, and that you were able to witness our dolphin pod from your balcony! Thank you for the fantastic review, and for making us a part of your special vacation memories. We'd love to welcome you back soon!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I just returned from a three-night ocean-front stay at this hotel/motel.  I've read a couple of tough reviews about this hotel which didn't square with my experience.  The young, front-desk staff was always courteous and eager to help (regardless of shift) and the housekeeping was generally good (although management could have been more generous about the size of the bath soap and the housekeeper more attentive to the replacement of shampoo).  Like at any hotel, I sought the less expensive, nearby restaurant alternative for small meals (the front-desk helpfully pointed me to the Orange Inn, a half block away), and the beach bar had a good selection of fairly priced, good-quality wines.  I'd go again. stuho
Manager Response: We'd love to welcome you back again, Stuart! Thank you for taking the time to review us ‚Äî it's very gratifying to hear that you were pleased with your stay. You can't beat our views, so we'd love to have you back during the summer months!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We love Laguna Beach and this hotel is a favorite.  It is  a moderately-priced, stylishly decorated, remodel of a "vintage" property.  The layout is confusing, a labyrinth of connected walkways, but to us that's a minor inconvenience when compared to the quality of service and freshness of the rooms.  Very cheerful and modern, many rooms with amazing oceanfront rooms and easy walking distance to the beaches and heart of Laguna Beach Village.  Not deluxe luxury, but very pleasing and relatively budget-friendly.  Nice meals at the Beach House next door along with light meals and appetizers in the ocean-front patio.  Cannot say enough about the attentive service.  Valet parking is available and highly recommended.  A great romantic get-away at an affordable price.
Manager Response: Yes, our layout can be a bit of a maze, but we're glad to see that you've grown to love it as much as we do. Thank you for making us your Laguna Beach headquarters‚Äîit's so rewarding to hear such kind words from a guest like you! We look forward to welcoming you back next time you're searching for a romantic getaway. :)  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I came here one night as part of our California honeymoon and this was definitely the best hotel we stayed in along the way. We upgraded to an ocean view room and it was probably the best decision we made during our entire trip! It was absolutely gorgeous sitting on the balcony overlooking the main beach and the ocean. We could easily access the beach and go for nice long walks, we were just a few minute walk from the central part of Laguna Beach, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and our sleep was amazing listening to the waves crashing all night long. The hotel was definitely a little bit old but the bed was extremely comfortable and the place was clean. We are from Cananda but we WILL be back!
Manager Response: It was our pleasure to help you make the most of your honeymoon! We are absolutely delighted that you enjoyed our beautiful ocean views, and that our staff was so helpful. Thank you for allowing us to share in such a happy occasion. We would love to welcome you back to celebrate your first anniversary! Until then, thank you for fabulous the review. Congratulations!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We organized a kind of small vacation with my friends from overseas and booked a couple of rooms with ocean front view. It was really great - staff was very helpful and arranged rooms on the same floor close to each other. We were sitting on the balcony, enjoying the view, talking and relaxing. Room service is fast and good. Two things that are bad - furniture in rooms is rather old and broken, I had to call a maintenance man to fix the balcony door - it did not open. They close the pool at 10PM - and we could not get to jacuzzi...
Manager Response: You certainly can't beat our view! It was a pleasure to be a part of you and your friends' special memories. Thank you for taking the time to sing our praises on TripAdvisor. We would love to welcome you back next time you're looking to get away!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Although the price was a bit steep (350.00), it was worth if for the view alone. We were on the top floor facing the ocean with a balcony. Our room was actually very private because it extended out from the building more than any of the other rooms - we would have to look back towards the building to see other rooms with their balconies (if this makes sense). The decor is sparse; this is not a luxury hotel, but watching the sun set over the water was truly stunning. There is an ocean view restaurant on the premises, too, making it convenient for having breakfast. It's great just to walk down a couple of flights of stairs and be right on the beach!
Manager Response: We feel so fortunate to be able to see the sun set over the water every evening. We're happy that you could witness this stunning sight as well! Thanks for making us a part of your Laguna Beach get away, Marie. We hope to welcome you back next time you're looking for some time away!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I was in Laguna Beach for the day and booked a room at the Pacific Edge on a whim using the HotelTonight app. Pros: Great deal, central location, pleasant daytime staff, lobby decorated/maintained well, clean linens. Cons: Run-down room, threadbare towels, broken toilet paper holder, musty smell in room that lasted thoughout the entire stay. Upon return to the room at the end of my night out the key did not work, so I went to the the front desk for assistance. The night clerk said I was never checked in (which has to be incorrect since I had already been able to access the room and drop off my stuff), demanded my credit card (even though I had paid for the room in full through the app and already provided my card for incidentals upon check in), and took about 20 minutes to get
Manager Response: It was truly disheartening to learn of this incident. We should have been more gracious when you had trouble with your key, and I apologize. I will discuss this with our staff immediately. Thank you for taking the time to share your story. Your candid feedback will be of great aid as we continue to improve for our guests.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Amazing views at this dog-friendly resort a short drive from LA
Summary: My wife & I just had a quick 1-night stay at the Pacific Edge on a Sunday night (10/21/12). The property is made of 4-5 separate buildings on a private strip of beach. The buildings on the street side are split by a private alley from the beachfront buildings.   AMENITIES & SERVICE We had limited interaction with the staff, since we only stayed one-night, but everyone was very helpful and welcoming at check-in. They were very accommodating to our 2 dogs (boxer & beagle mix). Our room was located on the 2nd floor on the beach. We originally booked a non-Oceanfront room, but received a call for a discounted $50 upgrade to beachfront on our way there, and took them up. It was definitely worth the price, and will not hesitate to pay for the upgrade the next time we stay there. We
Manager Response: We enjoy reading all of our guests' comments, but we are extremely grateful to receive detailed accounts like yours! From our amenities to your experience with your dogs, you've left some fantastic feedback for future travelers. Thank you very much for taking the time to share this. We're not too far away ‚Äî come back and see us soon! :)  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Pacific Edge is such a fun and unique hotel, it was perfect for my week-long vacation with my husband - literally on the beach!  The Endless Summer theme is really cute, bright colors, fun patterns in the rooms and the lobby.  Insanely clean, even though the hotel itself is not brand spanking new. Has a lot of character!  Hotel staff were super nice and helpful too.  The Deck restaurant bar is awesome t - it's pricey, but worth it.  Drinks are awesome and food was delicious ... we ate there a lot!  Would highly recommend for a fun beach trip.
Manager Response: Surfer chic, indeed! We are beyond delighted to hear how much you and your husband enjoyed your time on the beach. Thank you for staying with us, and for the kind words. We'd love to welcome you back soon.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Wonderful service paired with a fantastic location can't be beat! Once you pull into the hotel a bellman will help you with your things. After that pull into the back and I suggest valet your car. Parking is touch in Laguna Beach.  This hotel is great. We stayed in a king- oceanfront. Jessica K did a magnificent job. So welcoming. Thank you for a great stay!!!
Manager Response: There's nothing more soothing than an ocean view! Thank you very much for taking the time to review us, Val. I know Jessica will be thrilled to hear from you again!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We are back at the Pacific Edge for the second time in a month.  We looked at other hotels that were charging more than double (some more $500/night more) for a room.  Our room is literally on the beach.  If you drop an ice cube off the balcony it lands in the sand.  The complimentary beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, and even sand toys for the kids are a bonus because you don't have to haul a bunch of things down to the beach.  The staff and especially housekeeping are incredibly polite, professional and accomodating.  You can park your car and never take it out because it is within walking distance of dozens of wonderful restaurants and even a grocery store.  They provided a microwave and pack and play for the kid, and we were greeted with a complimentary bottle of decent red
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a lovely trip! It was our pleasure to help you enjoy your time away, and to give you a little more to celebrate. :) Thanks for the kind words. We'd love to welcome you back next year!  Cheers, Bill Tremper, General Manager
