Summary: Had a great stay upgraded my room to a 2 bedroom apartment style room. Was great lots of room for whole family. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The view eating breakfast each morning at the beach house resturaunt was amazing we will be back
Manager Response: From your beautiful room to our unforgettable ocean views, it sounds like you and your family had a fabulous beach vacation! We would love to welcome you back next year. Until then, thank you for your kind words!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: When we arrived we had just missed a complimentary wine tasting.   I said my wife could do with a glass of wine after the appalling traffic on the I405/I73.   The receptionist promptly gave us a bottle of white wine.   That was a splendid gesture.   They also gave us a discount token for some of the local shops and restaurants The hotel operates a car parking valet service although you could park on the road providing you move it before 08:00. The room lay out was more motel than hotel and are due for refurbishment. Breakfast was at the Beach House, about 100m away, that had a wonderful coast view.
Manager Response: After the stubborn traffic you experienced, it was our pleasure to help you unwind with a bottle of wine! Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and for taking the time to leave such kind words. We'd love to welcome you back next year!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Just returned from long driving trip west coast/Arizona/Nevada.  All hotels good and of similar standard, however, the pacific edge was dire.  . The Hotel  info' looks good,  but our room was tiny, dark, threadbare carpet, faced brick wall.   we were offered upgrade for $100 !!  as we were there for one night only, we didnt bother,      We found it odd that the room given was so poor compared to all of the others booked by the same agent, within the same price range between  Palm springs, san Diego and all the way up the coast to San Francisco.   also uninterested unhelpful morose staff at desk,
Manager Response: We take great measures to ensure that all of our guests feel welcome and comfortable. After reviewing your comments, it appears that we have fallen short of our high standards. This does not sound like us at all, and we'd like to know more about this so we may make the necessary updates as soon as possible. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to share which room you stayed in and the date of your arrival. Until then, thank you for your candid feedback.   Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Things have changed and not for the better!
Summary: We've been staying at this hotel for over 30 years.   We always stay in the oceanview rooms.  The cleaning staff could not be more accommodating.  The front office and recent valet parking are annoying.  The price for October was staggering.  We paid almost $350 for room + valet parking.  This for basically the same room we've had for years. Agree the place needs a remodel, particularlly the showers and toilets, exactly as they've always been.  Sadly we are looking at other options.  Will never find a better ocean view, I'll miss that.  Sigh.
Manager Response: Your recent displeasure is truly disheartening, especially since you have been with us for over 30 years. However, you have left some detailed feedback that is invaluable as we work to make the necessary improvements in a timely manner. Thank you for taking the time to share your story. We hope to better represent ourselves should you decide to return.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This hotel has a great location, but it is in desperate need of a remodel and a better cleaning staff. After walking around in our room for 5 minutes in bare feet,  the bottoms of our feet were black. Carpeting was old, damaged, and dirty. My son was finding random items on the floor, like old makeup brushes. Even the inside of the dresser drawers were dirty. Most of the furniture was beat up, and looked about 30 years old. The staff tried to help us and were very nice, but they didn't have much to work with in that there were not quality accommodations to offer.
Manager Response: Our guests' comfort is our first priority, so it's terribly unfortunate to learn of your disappointment. Our maintenance and housekeeping teams take great strides to ensure that each room meets our standards, and I believe that we failed you in this manner. Please accept our sincere apologies for any frustration this may have caused. That said, what you've described is completely out of the ordinary, and we'd like to make this right. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this in detail. Until then, thank you for bringing this to my attention.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Rooms are OK, but who cares they are right on the beach
Summary: This hotel is right on the beach and you can walk to a lot of places in and around laguna beach. They also have two pools and a hot tub. Staff was cortueous and they will give you towels, cabanas and chairs to sit on the bueatiful pacific ocean and watch the sunset, surf or just hang around. Rooms are OK and have beach effect, but they are spacious and clean. Also, cost is reasonable. Note- the cost for beach facing rooms are higher and there is a $20 charge per day to valet park.
Manager Response: There is no better place to enjoy the sounds and smells of the fresh ocean air. We're proud to offer you a relaxing destination for you to lounge, swim and surf. Thank you for staying with us. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location, rooms could use an update but I will be returning.
Summary: You can't go wrong with the location of the hotel but if you can book a room with a balcony/ ocean view room you will be happiest. The reason is because the rooms could use alittle updating but a room with a balcony makes up for it.  My husband and I were on the balcony the entire time enjoying the gorgeous view; if we weren't out at "the Deck" getting a drink & some food or one of the many other delicious restaurants along pch in walking distance to the hotel.     Even though the rooms could use some updating,  the beds are extremely comfortable and they give you plenty of pillows. :)   I will be coming back to enjoy this beautiful location.
Manager Response: It's so refreshing to smell the fresh ocean air as soon as you wake up. We're glad that you and your husband made such excellent use of our balcony! Thank you for staying with us, and for your feedback. We are currently in the process of making the necessary updates for our guests, and we hope to earn another star when you return.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This is a great hotel for family vacation.  Great beach front location with private beach area for guests.  Pool and spa area is adequate.  Rooms were "beachy" and well maintained.  Hotel staff was very attentive and hospitable.
Manager Response: Soaking up the sun on our private beach is the perfect way to unwind! We're so glad that you enjoyed your time with us, and we can't wait to welcome you back! Until then, thank you for the kind words.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Ocean wonderful, room needs big over haul.
Summary: Loved the sound and beauty being right on the ocean but the room needs a lot of work.  Carpet dirty and shabby, dogs were barking next door wouldn't recommend to anyone expecting better accommodations at the price paid here.
Manager Response: The soothing sounds of the crashing waves are sure to melt away any tensions you may have carried with you. However, we wish that you had a better impression of your room. While we are pet-friendly, we do not want other guests to be disturbed by their neighbors' animals. Please don't hesitate to alert us if outside noise becomes problematic. Thank you for your honest feedback. We understand that there is always room for improvement, and your candor will certainly aid us as we continue to make the necessary updates for our guests.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I have already posted a review on Pacific Edge after my stay here last year, because I was once again blown away by the customer service. This hotel may not offer the best rooms. I stayed in a room facing the pool area, and the room was very small and there was obviously no view. However, the customer service is five-star quality. I've been to many five-star hotels whose customer service does not even match that at Pacific Edge. For example, I informed them that the trip was my mother's birthday gift, and on her birthday, they delivered a charming gift basket with candy and popcorn to our room with a lovely hand-written note. As I mentioned before, the location is excellent, as well, and the hotel occurs free lounge chairs and towels on the beach. I look forward to returning
Manager Response: Nicole,  There is nothing better than hearing from a happy guest like you! It is truly a pleasure to help our guests enjoy the special moments, and we take great strides to achieve that Joie de Vivre philosophy in everything that we do. Thank you for choosing to celebrate your mother's birthday with us ‚Äî it was our pleasure to help you make the most of it! Thank you very much for the kind words. We look forward to your next visit!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: A disappointing end to a perfect honeymoon. However, I don't want to be too negative about this hotel so just like our honeymoon I'll start on a high.  Here come the positives.  The staff, the friendly and approachable front desk staff who gave us a wine basket and a lovely hand written card and the grounds staff who always said hello.   In between the road noise, you could hear the ocean.   You could see some of the ocean from the balcony. The TV, and wi-fi worked.   The lobby is nicely decorated. Good location for browsing the various shops nearby and you can get a discount at some of the shops if you flash your room card at the till. The quality of the food at 'The Deck' is fantastic, although a bit pricey.  There is a 'happy hour' drink and food menu. Once you get your head
Manager Response: From the moment you walk in to the time you check out, we want all of our guests to enjoy their time with us. I am sorry to learn that you did not leave with a better impression, especially since you were so looking forward to ending your honeymoon in Laguna Beach. We are happy to move our guests to a room that better suits their needs, so please don't hesitate to ask next time. That said, your comments are invaluable as we move forward. Thank you for taking the time to leave such a detailed account of your experience.   Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Steps to sand, great value and dog friendly!
Summary: Highly recommend this hotel, really good value , we stayed in an oceanfront room that was steps to the sand. It is clean and nicely decorated, rennovated older hotel so don't expect the montage, but for the price it is an amazing value and really a great location  Beautiful low key and relaxing, we had our dog which at the time of year was welcome on the beach.  Check with the hotel, summer months dogs are not allowed on beach, but all other times allowed. Enjoy!
Manager Response: Our beachfront location certainly can't be beat! We're delighted that you so enjoyed your time with us. We would be happy to host you and your four-legged friend next year, so don't hesitate to give us a call if there's anything we can do to enhance your next stay!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: nice location, nice sized rooms, needs some updating and staff is not responsive
Summary: The hotel is in a great location and is moderate value.  The rooms are spacious but are a little dated.    The main concern, I have is that we left the room at 9 am to go to the beach and returned at 1pm.  The room was not cleaned and I called to have it cleaned.  We left again and returned at 3:45 and it was still not cleaned.  This is really unsatisfactory service.  Additionally, the beach hours are listed 8am to 8pm and no one was at the beach so we did not have access to chairs.  i did locate someone and he got us chairs but no towels.  The beach side options of chairs and towels was a selling feature and the fact that we could not access these at 9:30 am was disappointing.
Manager Response: Our guests' satisfaction is our first priority, so it is disheartening to learn of your recent experience. The service that you described falls far beneath our standards, and I will certainly discuss your points with both our housekeeping team and beach staff. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. Your honest feedback is invaluable as we continue to make improvements for our guests.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We got a deal on LivingSocial for a 1 night, oceanfront room for $209.  A great deal for a great location. The staff was nice, the room was nice and the view was amazing.....right on the water.  Had happy hour at the Deck, which is right on the beach. Good prices and food too!  Not sure I would go back and pay the full price, but would definitely consider a good deal and stay there again.
Manager Response: Sonia,  Thanks for giving us a try! I'm happy to hear that everyone made you feel so comfortable during your stay. The Deck is a fantastic restaurant ‚Äî and the views are not to be missed! Thanks for the wonderful review. We hope to welcome you back next time you're looking to get away!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: This place could be so much more‚Ä¶.
Summary: Well, you can't beat the beautiful ocean view but it isn't worth the price. The parking is horrendous and you are forced to use their valet service which can be over burdened at a time you are likely to need your car. Parking near your room for convenience is out of the question. Although we were permitted to briefly park near our building to unload our luggage, it seemed to be a problem and we were cautioned to be quick about it!  The buildings don't have elevators so you must carry all luggage you bring up concrete stairs. The staff could use some customer service lessons. Despite claims to be a non-smoking facility there were different three guests smoking all around us on their balconies. None of this would be a huge problem if it weren't for the exorbitant room prices.
Manager Response: Helen,  We are proud to offer a relaxing beach retreat, so I'm sorry to hear that your experience did not leave you with a better impression. It seems that the majority of your comments stem from service. All of our guests should feel welcome and well cared for, and it troubles me that you did not. I will speak with our staff about this immediately. Thank you for your candor. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this further.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Truly great room location overlooking the water. We were 4 floors up with a wrap around balcony jr suite. Hotel is tired, needs some upgrading and maintenance however price was good and couldn't beat the view and is close to town for shopping and eating. Valet parking was chaotic but worked. Check in and out very efficient and hospitable. The Deck Bar was busy but service and food/drinks good.  Kitchenette is seviceable with large fridge, microwave and Keurig coffee maker. Small table with two chairs, pull out sofa and large chair. Bed was comfortable. Deck had two adirondack chairs and a table. Needs a few more chairs, deck space wasted. Also wasted space in room in kitchen eating area layout.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Our location really can't be beat ‚Äî there's no better place to enjoy the sights and sounds of the beach while still being close to town. Still, it sounds like you were a bit disappointed with our accommodations. We are currently in the process of making the necessary updates for our guests, but I'm curious to hear what you felt should take priority. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to share your thoughts. We're always open to suggestions! Until then, thank you for the fantastic review. We hope to welcome you back again soon.   Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: If this hotel was rated based on all 3 important factors in real estate (location, location, location) it would've received a smashing 5/5. Located right on the beach, provides beach towels, umbrellas and lounge chairs to guests for free and paddle boards for $$$.   However, the rating goes down to average if we add the price, a bit steep @ $280/night on sunday through thursday night stay.   Recommendation: definitely get an ocean view room, you won't regret it! Even if it's overlooking The Deck (a trendy nice beach-side, live-music restaurant attached to the hotel), they promptly stop the music @10pm.
Manager Response: We really are in the ideal location to enjoy the signs and sounds of the beach! Although we're delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us, I'm sorry that you were disappointed with our pricing. We have always felt that our amenities were well worth it, but as you know, different times of year warrant different fees. Next time you're looking to get away, give us a call ‚Äî I'm sure we can find something that will work for you! Thank you for the kind words. We hope to see you next year!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The good: - Beautiful view - great location - kitchens in rooms  The bad: - there were two adults and one teenager and we were booked into a room with 1 king bed. Staff blamed it on travel agent and wouldn't move us.  Front desk wouldnt take any accountability or try to resolve it.  We eventually got a cot after multiple requests - we received 2 towels a day despite requesting additional ones for the week - air conditioner was broken but they did repair it quickly - refrigerator froze our food and ruined it despite being on a low setting - didn't receive the daily newspaper promised to us for being a joie de vivre member - I received an email from the front desk manager after replying to the email feedback request, apologizing and asking for my address so he could send me a
Manager Response: Robin,  I am deeply sorry that I have not been able to attend to this issue in a more timely manner. I would like to speak with you as soon as possible. What is the best way to reach you? Please don't hesitate to reach out. Thank you for your honesty. I hope we can come to a resolution soon.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel, recommended by out travel agent, for 4 nights at the end of a 2 and half week holiday in various parts of the USA. It was meant to be a relaxing few days on the beach in the sun. We had checked trip advisor reviews and found them to be mixed. I now know why. The hotel is in several buildings.The front ocean view rooms appeared to be elegant and roomy, the rooms at the back (village view!!!) actually overlook the pacific coast highway, and whilst adequate are basically motel rooms.  Unfortunately whilst we had booked ocean view rooms, our agent had made a booking error, and we ended up in the village view rooms, not the best end to a great holiday! The hotel did its best but we certainly did not end up with what we expected. One positive- comfy beds! The
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us a try. I am sorry to learn of the error with your reservation, and we will do our very best to prevent this on our end. We want everyone to feel welcome and well cared for here, so it's disappointing that you felt mixed emotions regarding our staff. I will be sure to discuss this with them, so thank you for your feedback. We hope to welcome you back during your next visit to Laguna Beach.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: I travel a lot and this was a big surprise
Summary: After having a terrible nite sleep with a hotel/ motel the nite before we decided to head home , but Hated to leave with a bad taste in our rooms . We drove up and down pacific coast highway looking for an Ocean view room that is pet friendly. We went to about 10 different places with the same thing" sorry sir , no rooms for tonite it's labor day weekend"( like I didn't know).this is sort of like going up and down Commercial Street in Provincetown looking for a room. In any event, we came across a place called the Pacific Edge. The room was great, it was sort of like an Fireland or Southhampton room, feeling slightly rustic, beachy with the sounds and smells Of the Ocean.a wrap around balcony, comfortable Bed, refrigerator/ microwave .GREAT, didn't want to leave but on the
Manager Response: We're glad we were able to help you end your trip on a more pleasant note, and get you a great night's sleep! It's lovely to hear such kind words, especially given your recent experience when searching for a place to stay. Thank you for giving us a try. We hope to welcome you back next year!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Pacific Edge for one night of luxury after a camping tour of California!! It was just what was needed. We arrived early, parked and enquired whether we could check-in early. The staff at the front desk were great and found a room that was ready- fab! We then headed to the beach were the staff found us sunbeds right at the front with towels!   We chilled out and then returned to the room to find that the Staff had noticed it was my birthday the following day and had left a hamper with tortilla chips, locally made salsa and locally made kettle corn- (how did they know me so well?!!)   Rooms were clean, had two comfortable double beds and we had a view of the sea! Lovely!!The rooms aren't 5* but with a location like this who would want to spend time in the room??
Manager Response: Bethan,  We're so happy we could give you a day of much-needed relaxation! It sounds like you had a fabulous time soaking in the sun and the sounds of the beach. Thanks for taking the time to share your story. We hope to welcome you back when you return to California!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Basically the hotel is made up of a bunch of buildings that were likely old apartments.  Some are on PCH and their "view" is of the back alley while others are on the ocean side but most do not have views.  The buildings are old and weathered and it looks as though they literally just slapped on a coat of colored paint inside.  The room I was in was basically a studio apartment with the same appliances that were installed probably in the 50s.  The beds are small and not comfortable.  The linens and pillows feel like the kids you would get in a two star property.  I was lucky enough to crash in someone's room on a cot .... that sagged and was also probably from the 50s.  I am surprised that people pay this price to stay here - the ONLY good thing is the location.  Disappointing.
Manager Response: I am sorry to see that you walked away disappointed. However, I am glad that you took the time to bring your concerns to my attention, as it gives me the opportunity to address them.  We take pride in maintaining a relaxing, chic beach getaway for all of our guests, no matter what building they are staying in. As we are near the waterfront, it is not uncommon for the weather to adversely affect the exterior of these edifices. However, it is our priority to see that these facades are quickly repaired and weatherproofed, so I am surprised to hear about this. Which building did you stay in? I would like to know so we might send our maintenance crew to take a look.  We want all of our guests to have a restful night's sleep. Part of this is providing luxurious linens and mattresses. Let me assure you how rare these types of complaints are ‚Äî most of our guests find the sound of the ways lulls them to sleep quickly. I'm sorry that you didn't have a similar experience. Again, please let me know which room you were staying in. We'll take a look right away.   That being said, we are always happy to move you to a room that will better suit your needs. Did you alert anyone of your dissatisfaction? Please don't hesitate to do so next time. We appreciate your feedback, and we hope you'll give us another chance to impress you during your next visit to Laguna Beach.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel for 5 nights as the first destination on our whistle-stop honeymoon tour of the USA. This was the chilled part of our honeymoon before heading off to LA, Las Vegas and New York. We chose this hotel due to the pictures on their site and on this website. We were not disappointed. This is a great hotel. We had a ocean view room on the 4th floor. It was spectacular. Imagine going to sleep and waking up to the sound of the Pacific Ocean, watching the sun go down from your bedroom balcony, or waking up with an ocean view. If that is what you are looking for then this is the place for you. However, word of warning, not all rooms have ocean views and you have to ask for and pay a premium price for such luxury. I can imagine if you think you are going to get an ocean
Manager Response: Ian,  We're thrilled that we could be a part of such a momentous occasion! Laguna Beach is the ultimate destination for relaxation ‚Äî which is well deserved after the stress of planning a wedding! Your review truly captured the essence of what we love most about our hotel; namely, beginning and ending your day with the soothing sounds of the beach. Thank you for the lovely review. We hope to welcome you back for your one year anniversary!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Great location with friendly helpful staff. We had booked the penthouse suite with an ocean view and were not disappointed. Our room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and a great kitchen with large fridge. Housekeeping was excellent with plenty of towels. We were a few minutes walk to the centre of Laguna Beach and close to the excellent free trolley bus service. We ate in both of the restaurants, The Beach Hut and The Deck and we're delighted with our ocean view tables and the quality of the food, wine and service. We have a great stay at this hotel and look forward to our next visit.
Manager Response: Peter,  I'm thrilled to hear that you had such a fabulous time with us! The Penthouse Suite has the ultimate view of our gorgeous beach. Thank you for taking the time to share your story. We look forward to welcoming you back, too!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We are currently staying at Pacific Edge due to construction in our house making it unlivable. I grew up in Laguna Beach and still live 5 minuts away. I know the hotels in the area well. Pacific Edge has a fantastic location right near town, a great beach right in front of it, a happening restaurant (The Deck) where we are able to sit and watch the amazing sunset, (all of which I knew before I was a guest at the hotel), and now I can say they have an amazing and very helpful staff. We are very pleased with the hotel, the staff and the all around experience and our nights out of our house have turned into a fun little vacation for us. I would highly reccommend it. It is more reasonably priced and has a way better location than the fancier hotels in the area (Montage, Surf and
Manager Response: Shenanae,  We understand how tiring renovations can be. It's our pleasure to offer you a quiet retreat from the nuisance of construction. Nothing melts away the stress of home improvement like enjoying the sights and sounds of the beach! Thank you for taking the time to review us. Please let us know if there's anything else we can do to further enhance your mini vacation!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a resort but just a good hotel
Summary: We were a bit worried after reading the negative info on trip advisor but there was no need for worry. We stayed in the reef building with the see right under our balcony. What a great vieuw. The room was clean, it lookef a bit  like a good standard Best Western hotelroom. It is just one stairs down to the beach were you can get free umbrella's and beds. Within 20 meters you are in the middle of the nice shopping streets, restaurants etc. We think this hotel is a great place on a very good and beautifull spot. Its not a luxury resort but a comfortable hotel in a pittoresque village
Manager Response: Thanks for giving us a try! I'm thrilled to hear that you were so impressed with our accommodations. You're right about the Reef Building ‚Äî it has a fabulous view of the waves, while still being in the perfect location to access all the unique shops in town. Thank you for the wonderful review. We would love to welcome you back again next year!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: "The proximity to the beach is simply perfect!"
Summary: Our family has been staying at the Pacific Edge (formerly Vacation Village) for over 25 years and it has truly become our favorite family beach vacation. Many of the rooms are less than 40 steps to an ideal beachfront location, steps away from the surf.  The beach attendants set up chairs, lounge chairs, umbrellas, towels, etc. which all helps to create a carefree day at the beach.  Our family and friends spend many hours body surfing in the ocean, pool hopping between the two pools, hot tubing, playing games in the game room, and of course, napping in between all of the fun filled activities.  We love walking along the several miles of beach at sunset and taking some of the best family photos we have.  After a sun kissed day on the beautiful beaches of Laguna, everyone is happy
Manager Response: Elizabeth,  As you have seen, taking the time to slow down and enjoy each other's company is one of the best ways to rekindle these priceless connections. We are thrilled that we could be a part of these special family memories. Thank you so much for taking the time to review us. Your kind words truly did warm our hearts! Please don't hesitate to let us know if there's anything we can do to make your next stay even better.  Warm regards,  Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Just stayed in an ocean front room here with our two dogs and it was amazing. Great location- crashing waves to sleep to-- the Deck bar is great also. My only minus is the a/c didn't work so well but again the view trumps that--- Great service too. Can't wait to go back.
Manager Response: Sounds like you had a fabulous time here in Laguna Beach! I'm so glad that everyone enjoyed their stay ‚Äî including your pups! Thanks for the kind words. We'd love to welcome you back again soon.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: I am reluctant to write this, having stayed here every year for several decades, but the old "Vacation Village" in Laguna is now the "Pacific Edge" and there have only been "improvements" for the sake of wringing the last possible dime out of this property.  The lower part of the surf wing are now "cabanas" that can be rented by the day.  The beautiful next door property is now a non-stop bar and grill, loud until late evening hours.  Even the Wi-Fi, an expected upgrade in the 21st century is spotty (we could connect in the back of the Surf Wing, but not in the front ocean-view rooms.  Aside from some of the old staff, nothing about this change has been an upgrade.  Fewer kitchens, spotty service, billious rooms.  What's to like?
Manager Response: It's disappointing to hear about this, especially since you have been with us for so long. In order to maintain this property, we have needed to make several repairs and upgrades. We feel that we have only improved with time, and our customer service remains just as friendly and helpful as it has always been. Still, I will certainly discuss your review with our entire staff. We wouldn't want to lose you over this. I hope you'll afford us another opportunity to impress you in the future.   Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Surprised my husband... he kissed me like I hadn't been kissed in years!
Summary: I'll go back again and again.  The hotel staff was extremely helpful in surprising my husband while I was 8 months pregnant with child #3 for our FIRST time away from our 2 children.  I was a wreck.  The bad reviews made me so nervous, but everything was perfect!  I communicated with the desk & the lovely girl who helped hooked us up:)  My husband upon walking into that room went straight to the balcony and then turned to me and kissed me like I hadn't been kissed in years!  lol
Manager Response: We're thrilled that we could be a part of such a lovely surprise! With two little ones and one on the way, both of you deserved some time to yourselves. Thank you for the fantastic review. We hope to see both of you again soon!  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Dreadful, shabby motel, a total rip off
Summary: We spent a week at this "hotel", hoping for some rest and relaxation.  Unfortunately the Pacific Edge failed in every way to live up to the hype and expectation from the website.  We stayed in a room in the 'Reef' building, overlooking the lovely beach. The room was tired, the bathroom terrible, small and smelly.  We had spent 3 weeks in the US, and stayed in around 8 hotels and this was by far the worst bathroom we had been given, really dreadful.   We were expecting a decent swimming pool, this tiny pool was awful and located in what seemed like a motel car park.  The beach bar/restaurant was awful: noisy, dirty and overpriced - the staff couldn't be bothered - level of service was dreadful.  We had lunch the day we arrived but never went back - what a waste - had it been
Manager Response: We are known for our fantastic customer service, so I am surprised to hear about this. I would like to know more about your stay so that we can make this right. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this further. Thank your for your feedback.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Dont believe what you see on the internet this place is a dump!
Summary: We spent 5 hours killing time in Laguna (mostly sitting in a restaurant because of my girlfriends foot injury) because the room wasnt ready and were finally able to get into our room around 4pm. In order for us to even get to our room we had to exit the hotel to the outside elevator, walk down an alleyway to another alley then proceed across the alley to another building to our 4th floor room. Upon entering our room the carpet in front of the door to the bed was squishy wet. We told the front desk and they said they would send someone up to take a look. No one ever showed up so we left for dinner. No manager or front desk personnel followed up with us about the wet floor. We woke up Sat am to a bellow of cigarette smoke coming in our room. We were assured this was a NON-smoking
Manager Response: Elizabeth,  Our staff goes above and beyond to ensure that every room is in perfect condition, so I‚Äôm very surprised to hear about this. On behalf of the entire staff, please accept our sincere apologies. I want to make this right for you. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out if you‚Äôd like to discuss this further.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Old and shabby hotel with a view
Summary: We arrived early as I was attending a wedding at the Ritz Carlton in Laguna Niguel.  We waited until the room was ready.  The lobby was clean and nicely decorated and staff was helpful.  My husband was not feeling well but I thought that once in the room he would feel better.  What a shock when we got to our room.  It was small, very old and in need of renovation.  The carpet was very thin, the moulding on the front door dragged on the floor and the bathroom was so small.  No room to put any toiletries or clothes for after shower anywhere but on the toilet seat.  We paid $356.00 per night plus $20.00 valet parking as there is no self parking.  This plus taxes came to $419.00!!!  The balcony view facing the ocean was great but the cost was certainly not worth it.   Could have
Manager Response: Lee,  I'm sorry to hear about this. We are constantly making the necessary updates to ensure that all of our rooms are in perfect condition. I'm sorry to hear that we fell short. Please rest assured that we will take your comments into consideration. Thank you for your honesty. I hope you'll give us another opportunity to impress you in the near future.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Hotel staff were accommodating and helpful.  our room was not available upon check in so they put is another room overlooking valet at a lower rate for night 1.  Night 2 was in an oceanfront room but there was no blackout curtain which made it hard to sleep.  Nights 3-5 were in another oceanfront room w blackout curtains.  View was amazing and rest of our stay went well.  If you go, make sure you go w oceanfront!
Manager Response: You're right ‚Äî there's nothing better than an oceanfront view. There is no better way to connect with nature and relax. Thank you for staying with us, and for taking the time to share your story. We hope to see you next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We thought last year was great. This year was outstanding. The rooms were very neat and clean as expected anywhere. It's the service and staff that makes it an exceptional experience. They are friendly as at other places, but they are definatley sincere. They bend over backwards to please you and go out of their way to make you welcome and comfortable. This goes for all the staff members, not just the front desk staff, I mean even the janitorial/house keeping folks were great. Last time I complimented the Valet group, and I will again. These guys are absolutely awesome. They don't stop, they don't walk, they run. They can't get your car fast enough for you. Yes, you might need to wait for maybe 4 - 5 minutes at the max, only because there are 10 - 20 others ahead of you, DUH,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write yet another fantastic review! It's our pleasure to make you feel welcome and comfortable. I'm thrilled to see how impressed you were with our staff. Thank you again. We hope to see you soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The reception area is attractive, but the rooms are shabby. The room we booked was village side. We disrupted the soccer game going on in the hallway, and when we reached our room, we noticed several large liquor bottles through the open door of the neighboring room. The young and gregarious neighbors were already drinking at 3pm. We asked for a different room, and were directed to the fifth floor of the tower. Looking from the inside out was preferable to looking outside in. Great view of the beach, but a grubby, noisy room. When we returned to our hotel later that night, the non-functioning elevator required a five-story walk to our room. Staff seemed indifferent to the problem.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. I'm sorry that you were disappointed with both of your rooms. I'd like to know a bit more about this, so don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss it further. Unfortunately, we were having difficulty with our elevator while you visited. We attempted to remedy the problem as quickly as possible, but I apologize for the inconvenience.  You left some interesting feedback that we will certainly take into consideration. Thank you for your candor. I hope you will allow us another opportunity to impress you next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This was our first trip to Laguna Beach. Our room was facing the pool and the Friday night pool party was in full swing. We went out for a late dinner and by the time we arrived back, all was quiet. Our room was a cool and vibrant Carribean decor. Everything was clean and in perfect working order. We asked for extra towels, which were brought up immediately. We slept with the windows open and the sounds of the waves made for a very peaceful sleep. The bed was comfy and I love the amenities (shampoo, etc). The kuerig coffee machine is a great touch. But the best part was the few steps down the side of the building and onto the beach! It was clean, safe, and so much fun. We are planning another trip and will stay with you again! Thank you for a wonderful experience.
Manager Response: Wow! What a fantastic review! From being lulled to sleep by the sound of the waves to our vibrant pool scene, you truly captured what makes us special. Thank you for taking the time to review us. Your kind words mean so much to us! We hope to see you next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Motel like, noisy, old, and unfriendly staff
Summary: The pacific edge is old and feels like a motel. In a village room you can hear ever motorcycle, bus, and emergency vehicle that drives past. If you stay in a village room then bring ear plugs or crank up the air conditioning to drown out the noisy street otherwise you will not have a relaxing sleep. The rooms are poorly insulated so you can also hear the tv and talking from adjacent rooms. The bathroom is small and the shower, toilet, and tap have very poor pressure. Also make sure that the doors connecting adjacent rooms are locked as we had another guest come into our room through a connecting door. The receptionist told us we could check out whenver if we were not satisfied with our room. The staff members were not interested in our satisfaction. The only pluses of this hotel
Manager Response: We take pride in offering a comfortable, relaxing space for our guests to enjoy their time away, so I'm surprised to hear this. However, you have left some interesting feedback, and I will definitely discuss it with the whole team. We understand that there is always room for improvement, and we will continue to make the necessary repairs to ensure that we are presenting our best selves.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My family and I have been vacationing on and off at this hotel for the past 20+ years. It has changed ownership several times and our last visit was not the best, the place needed a lot of updating and up keeping but I am happy to say the new ownership has definitely done a great job at renovating this wonderful beach property.   We visited over this past Memorial Day weekend  and was pleasantly surprised to see the place had been completely renovated. The once  dated rooms have been nicely updated. The lobby is warm and welcoming. The pool areas have been updated as well but my favorite renovation was the rooms that used to be on the first level of the beach front, they are now nicely arranged cabanas offering a great food and beverage selection as well as a nice party
Manager Response: Wow! From the beach chairs to the new surf Cabanas, you truly captured what makes us unique. Thank you so much for the kind words. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I normally stay at The Inn at Laguna Beach but decided to try this because we could only stay for 1 night and I@LB has a 2 night minimum.  This hotel is in a great location but it is in horrible disrepair.  The bellman told us they were trying to sell it.  The pool is in terrible condition.  I had an updated, new room and thought it was really sub-par for a new, updated room.  JC Penney drapes (not kidding), no soap dishes in the shower and you couldn't get the shampoo, body wash or conditioner out of their little bottles without a massive fight...just weird stuff.  The bar and restaurant are a local hotspot but very noisy until 10:30 at night so if you want a beachfront room and want that sound of the surf, you have to take the loud party going below you.  Lastly, I was very
Manager Response: Don,  Thank you for giving us a try. I am sorry to hear that you were disappointed. I must say that our maintenance staff is prompt in making all the necessary repairs, so I'd like to know more about this. Still, you have left some honest feedback that we will certainly take into consideration. Thank you for taking the time to review us.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Still a great Laguna Beach value
Summary: We and various extended family members have stayed in this hotel many times over the years.  It used to be the best-kept secret for oceanfront lodging in Laguna, although it was definitely old-school with regards to some upkeep.  The new owners have upped the prices (and maintenance), but it's not for someone expecting a 5-star experience.  What you will get is an eclectic selection of rooms and building locations with many different views and amenities, and still a good value for its location in Laguna.  A family wedding in town recently had three different family groups staying here.  The two-bedroom suite that two families stayed in faced Coast Hwy. on one side, but had an ocean view from the back--looking over the Beach House restaurant to the water.  There was a kitchen and
Manager Response: We are indeed an eclectic spot to enjoy gorgeous beach views. I'm glad to hear that you all have come back to us time and time again. Thanks for the fantastic review. We hope to see you soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our trip around Southern California. I thought I knew what to expect having read previous reviews of the hotel, but arriving on an overcast evening after a great stay at the Mondrian in LA, we were all overcome with culture shock. We had an oceanfront room in The Reef building, but the whole place is a dump. Rusty taps, really grim motel-like doors and corridors etc. Admittedly, we felt a lot better when the sun came out. The view of the ocean from our balcony was stunning, but this really isn't a pleasant place to stay. It felt grimey and rather sordid. We have now moved on to the Canary Hotel in Santa Barbara which makes the contrast even more stark.  It's daylight robbery that the room at Pacific Edge cost more per night than either the
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you feel this way. Like all JDV hotels, we take pride in our service and our unique, care-free attitude. Of course, there is always room for improvement, and we are constantly working to make our hotel even better. I will certainly take your comments into consideration. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I hope you'll afford us another opportunity to wow you in the future. I'm sure you wont be disappointed!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Pacific Edge Hotel, Laguna Beach Extremely DISAPPOINTING!
Summary: Sincerely and sadly disappointed at this choice. After a looong journey from France we arrived in anticipation of a nice stay in Laguna Beach. Unfortunately we had to leave this Hotel immediately. The room was in terrible condition. As below, we have sent this letter to the manager in hopes that other families will not have to turn around and leave as we had to do. Hope this will help them consider providing the product and services of which they advertise. Perhaps other rooms are better, but for the price of $368.00 a night it most certainly should not be in this condition. --------------------------------- Dear Mr. Tremper,  My name is Tiffany Schultz. We arrived yesterday from an International flight from Europe looking forward to a pleasant stay in Laguna Beach, and the
Manager Response: Once again, let me take the time to apologize for this experience. JDV holds a very high standard for each of their hotels, and I'm sorry if your room fell short. I know that we are better than this, and I want to make this right. Please don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to discuss this further.   Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome on-the-beach location, fun room & amenities, great service
Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here June 24-26 in an ocean-view room overlooking the beautiful Laguna Beach, and we can't wait to go back!   PROS: 1) Location, location, location! The hotel is RIGHT on the beach and if you're in an ocean view room like we were, you can literally hear the waves from your room. You're also within walking distance of restaurants & bars, the grocery store, shops and art galleries so you can park and relax. 2) Cool amenities such as daily activities they do on and off the beach, free umbrellas/towels/chairs for use on the beach, on-site rentals for paddle boards and other ‚Äútoys‚Äù 3) On-site restaurant (The Beach House) and bar (The Deck) 4) FREE in-room wi-fi (despite what the last user posted) that also worked at their beach and restaurants. The Business
Manager Response: Melissa,  There's nothing better than hearing the waves from your room! Thanks for staying with us. It sounds like you all had a lovely time. I'm sorry to hear about your time at The Beach House. However, our management is unaffiliated with those restaurants. Still, I'll be sure to pass your comments on to their team. You left some fantastic tips for fellow travelers. Thank you! We hope to see you again next time you need to get away.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay right in the ocean.
Summary: We spent a very nice night in Laguna Beach at the Pacific Edge.     Pros.   1.   LOCATION On the ocean with their own beach and 2 pools and a restaurant and bar on site.  2.   Clean room and courteous staff.  Cons  1.   Valet parking - $20 per day, mandatory.  2.   Wifi charge in room and business center.  3.   Room was a little dated, but not too bad.  We will stay at this hotel the next time we are out to CA.  We had small issues which were overshadowed by the location.  I would recommend.!
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us! It sounds like you had a wonderful time. Thanks for pointing out those few areas that could use a little work. Just so you know the we do have complimentary Wi-Fi but you can chose to pay for the high speed upgrade. Our business center does offer the first 20 minutes complimentary to all guests as well. We know that there's always room for improvement, so it's great to hear constructive criticism like yours. Thanks for the review. We hope you'll come back and see us next time you need to get away.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Think upscale motel with a beach attached. Rooms just ok but beach amenities fantastic - beach attendants took care of chairs, towels and activities. The Deck, great beachfront bar w/ excellent food and drinks - lunch and dinner. We were barely in the room and spent most of our time on the sand. We scored a 'village vIew room for $99 on hotels.com- $99 for a clean room, downtown laguna w excellent amenities.  Impossible to beat. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Just dont expect much from the room and take full advantage of the beach. Ps No safes in the room so leave valuables at home.
Manager Response: Sounds like a great time! I'm glad you were so impressed with our fabulous beach and all the summer fun that comes with it. However, I'm sorry you weren't as happy with your room. We'll definitely be making some updates soon. Thanks for taking the time to review us. We hope to see you again soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: There are many great places to stay in Laguna Beach, if I had a choice, Pacific Edge would not be one of them...
Summary: Old outdated  Very small motel rooms Toilet tank did not refill had to repair myself, not time to wait for staff.  Requested extra chairs waiting an hour then staff brought extra towels.... After another 20-30 minutes finally received chairs  Terrible RV reception
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about this. Our maintenance team is usually quite prompt with situations like this. I apologize if we fell short. I will be sure to discuss this with them for some further insight. Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I hope you will give us another chance to impress you in the future.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The view was great. It was nice to open the slider door to listen to the ocean. the bathroom could use some updating and for some reason there was a $4 charge on my credit card. Not positive if they thought we had a water or took something. To minimal for the agirvation. We went paddle boarding with the shop next store (very conveniently located in the center of town). Starbucks is a walking distance away and they offer a discount to their dining options. Overall a good experience only staid one night. I would probably stay again.
Manager Response: There's nothing better than being lulled to sleep by the sounds of the ocean. I'm glad you were able to explore Laguna Beach, even if it was just for a weekend. Thanks for the wonderful review. We hope to see you next time you're looking to get away!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Laguna Gem but could be better!
Summary: Our room was on the street side (19) w a balcony view of the ocean. You also see the roof line of the home between the property & the alley way below w the very busy Valet area.  This didn't bother me but it might bother other people.  Also, I mention it because it is a busy and noisy  section of the hotel as cars are coming and going from early AM to very late at night. This also includes trash trucks!  If you want a more peaceful experience, upgrade to the buildings that are on the sand directly.  The staff was friendly, highly attentive, especially the valet boys & the beachside staff that assisted in securing charis, umbrellas, etc.  The rooms were bright, cheerful, w/ comfortable beds & linens but the big miss for our room was the way too small bathroom that doesn't look
Manager Response: Sounds like a great time! You're right ‚Äî our beach really is gorgeous. I'm sorry you weren't as happy with your room, though. We would have been happy to move you if you found it to be too noisy. Please don't hesitate to ask next time! We're always making improvements, so thanks for pointing out a few areas you'd like us to work on. I hope you'll come back and see us again soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Location Location Location and great beach front
Summary: Location Location Location and great beach front.   This is what you are paying for here. The hotel is a bit old and can use some work. Nothing major just a face lift. Might be time to change the pipes and update the TV's.  Not a fan of the valet for $20 a night but this is Laguna Beach.  Customer service was great.   Would not mind staying again.
Manager Response: Tim,  Thanks for staying with us. You're right ‚Äî we're in the perfect location to hang out at the beach! We know that there is always room for improvement, and we will certainly take your thoughts into consideration. Thanks for taking the time to review us, both here and on Yelp. I hope you will come back and see how we've improved next time you're in Laguna, and we welcome your feedback when you do!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Our first beach front experience, we stayed in the jr suite and it was amazing!! Looking to book again soon!
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! I'm thrilled that you such a wonderful time with us. We can't wait to see you again!  Take care, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: More like a Motel than a Resort
Summary: My son and I stayed 4 nights as this hotel, we had the"best room"in the house with our own private balcony.  The view was great.  However, the room smelled.  The sofa sleeper was dirty and torn.  We were afraid to sit on it, at alone sleep on it.  The carpet was all stained up.  We paid for a private balcony and had other guest walking through the balcony here and there.  In the pictures, the beach looks nice and clean.  However, the beach was dirty, lots of seaweed and bugs.  Not much entertainment in the area.  The staff was okay, nothing special.  The walls are paper thin, so you hear everything.  We ate at the Beach House and the Deck only to find out they have the exact same menu.  All the food is served out of the Beach House kitchen.  The bathroom had water damage/mold.
Manager Response: Danielle,  We take pride in maintaining a pristine, welcoming hotel. I apologize if this was not your experience. What you've described is unacceptable, and I will be sure to discuss it with our team. I want to make this right for you. Please don't hesitate to call me at (949) 281-5709 if you'd like to discuss this further.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value for a servicable room and fantastic location
Summary: My best friend and I stayed at Pacific Edge for four nights in January. Our goals: get some sun, relax a lot, and do a little exploring. The hotel was perfect for our needs.   Our room (the cheapest available) was nothing fancy, just your standard double bed motel room, but the decor was a step up from your standard bland interior and the sheets were wonderfully soft. The only window was a sliding glass door to a public outdoor walkway, which was a bit of a bummer -- we would've loved to keep a window open for airflow and the sound of the waves -- but then again, we got a good deal on the room and weren't expecting anything beyond a comfortable place to sleep.  When I'm on vacation in an urban area, I like to take a vacation from driving as well, and Pacific Edge is great for
Manager Response: We're thrilled that we could help you and your friend get a little sun back in January! It's wonderful to hear how impressed you were with our staff, and the easy access of our location. Thank you for taking the time to review us. We hope to see you again soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We were able to stay one night at this hotel.  It was refreshing, cute and quiet.  It is an older one that they have tried to refresh.  We did not have a beach view, but we had an ocean view!  With the balcony it made it extra special.  We could smell the great food from the upscale restaurant on the property.  The private beach area was smaller but nice and there were boys to help you get towel and chairs.  It seems that dogs were allowed there.  Didn't bother us, just entertainment.  Nice office staff!
Manager Response: Lisa,  There's nothing better than an ocean view! Glad we could help you get away for a little R&R. Thanks for the lovely review. We hope to see you again soon!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I really wanted to like this hotel and I must say the staff was very nice, but......the rooms very very motel quality.  It was more expensive than Las Brisas for so much less.  My biggest problem was the morning noise.  We booked last minute, so we were given the room next to housekeeping, who were  loudly talking at 7 am on SUNDAY.   Casa or Las Brisas are much better choices for Laguna in the $200 range!
Manager Response: While I'm happy that our staff made you feel welcome, I'm sorry to hear that you were disappointed with the rest of your stay. I understand how frustrating it must have been to be awakened by our cleaning staff in the morning. Did you request a different room? Even though your reservation was last-minute, we would have been happy to find you another room if any were available. I'm sorry about this, but I hope you'll give us another opportunity to impress you next time you're in Laguna Beach. Thank you for your feedback.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: If you ask me, this spot is the bomb dot com.
Summary: I have stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel probably 8 times, all while working in the OC area. I choose to stay here because the location is great, as I have travel to Newport, Costa Mesa, SJC, etc, and it is very easy to get to all of these places. I could stay in some corporate hotel in Santa Ana or Anaheim, but I stick with this Hotel for a number of reasons.   It's a great value. Even the cheapest room is 50 steps from the beach and you can generally afford them on a work budget. I work all day then spend some time on the beach in the complimentary lounge chairs, or getting some of the great food at the Beach House or the Deck. Around half the times I go, I have gotten an upgrade just for asking.   The staff is great. I have gotten to know the front desk staff well enough by
Manager Response: Jeff,  It's wonderful to hear that we've helped you make the most of your work trips. I'm proud to see how impressed you've been with our staff. Everyone really does want to make sure that you have a great stay, and I'm glad they've been able to hook you up. I'll be sure to share this with everyone ‚Äî I know they'll be happy to hear from you! Thanks for the kind words. They mean so much to us. I'm sure we'll be seeing you again soon!  Take care, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Great price.. but needs some updating
Summary: The location is amazing. We lived in Laguna when we first got married and its a hard location to beat.  Pros:  Super cheap.. best price was on website AAA rate Literally on the Ocean Comfortable beds (minus hard pillows but thats preference) Right in the middle of downtown.. walk to everything Friendly Staff Friendly Valet Service The Deck restaurant has an insanely amazing view.. happy hour is well worth it.  Cons: Itty Bitty Room about 4 feet on each side of the bed and thats it.  Bathroom could really use some remodeling..  Not the thickest of walls
Manager Response: I'm so happy that we could help you reminisce about your time as newlyweds in Laguna. It sounds like you both had a fabulous time! Of course, this is easy to accomplish with a beautiful beach view like ours.  I'm sorry that you were a bit disappointed with your room. Some of our rooms are on the smaller side, but all of the fixtures should be up-to-date. What room were you staying in? There's always room for improvement, so I'm happy to go back and take a look at what needs to be updated.   Thanks so much for your honest feedback. It's a great way to show us the areas in which we need a little work. We're proud that everyone made you feel so comfortable. Thank you again. We hope to see you next time you're in town.   Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I would like to comment on my stay there for one night on May 13th in room 125. Yes, the property could use some updating but overall, everyone there was accommodating and gracious, rooms spacious, clean and comfortable, the ocean front view was incredible and the location is right in near the middle of town close to shops and restaurants. Also, the price was half of what other ocean front rooms were in Laguna that weekend. I loved this place and would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Glad you enjoyed your stay! There's nothing better than waking up to a beautiful view of the beach. Thanks for taking the time to review us. We're looking forward to seeing you again next time you're in town.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: The hotel was clean and manageable but not up to the standard of other JDV Hotels or worth the price. The hotel seemed to spend their money in the wrong places. The hotel welcomed us with a hand written card and bottle of wine, but this couldn't cover up for the fact that the hotel needed some serious TLC and updating. The walls are paper thin and doors and cabinets very old thin wood. The hotel was painted in cheery colors but pillows and beds were lumpy. They promoted the hotel as having a full kitchen but had no plates, dinnerware, microwave, or toaster.  If you are coming here and have no where else to stay, this place will work. But looking for a great vacation spot.... I vote no.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you were disappointed. We take pride in making each guest feel comfortable, so it's upsetting that you felt your room was not up to par.   It is unfortunate we did not inform you, but we do have kitchen kits avaliable upon request. Furthermore, your bed should not have been lumpy. I will make sure that every bed is in perfect condition.   There is always room for improvement, and your review inspires us to do better. Thanks for bringing these concerns to my attention. I hope you'll give us another opportunity to impress you next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Too much to mention I stayed in room 208 great location for beach access and shopping and restaurants service was impeccable nothing bad to say can't wait to go back parking is 22 bucks a night but hey it's laguna and parking is all paid parking everyone should give this hotel a try you will not be sorry
Manager Response: There's nothing better than relaxing on the beach! Thanks for taking the time to review us. We hope to see you again soon!  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in a perfect location! Front Desk was extremely friendly and accomodating with my requests. The deck had an amazing menu! The warm pita bread with a delicous hummus and olive mixture that even my boyfriend, who dispises ALL olives, couldn't keep his hands off of and the calamari was very fresh and serve with an amazing jalapeno tartar (to die for)! I'm a huge bloody mary fan on mornings when I am planning on relaxing for the day and I have sincerely not had a spicy bloody mary that was perfectly made in months! The deck's spicy bloody mary was soooo good and definitely perfectly made. Juan the bartender was ON IT and managed to bartend the entire restaurant but still engage just enough in conversation with us to let us know we were on his priority list at all
Manager Response: Jamie,  Sounds like an excellent getaway! I'm so glad we could help you and your boyfriend relax on the beach. Of course, a bloody mary never hurts! Thank you for the wonderful review. We hope to see you next time you're in Laguna Beach!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This place is great for a weekend get away at the beach.  A little older than expected from the photos but rooms decorated nicely and fit the beach atmosphere!  Get the ocean front, it is a must and you can see everything from your balcony and leave it open at night to hear the crashing waives.  The Deck had awesome food and drinks...try the lemon basil martini...YUM! The beach house restaurant was great for a nice dinner.  The beach staff was so nice and pointed out whales, dolphins and a seal.  Dont be dissapointed when you drive up, as others have said it looks like an old motel, and it is, however, nicely repainted and perfect spot on the beach.  Having the fridge in the room was great.  There is a place a block away called the Orange Cafe that has the best breakfasts!!  The
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review! I'm so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. And it's great that you were able to spot some wildlife with the help of our staff ‚Äî that must have been an amazing sight! It sounds like you had a lovely stay. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to make your time with us that much better! We'll see you next time you're in Laguna.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We regularly frequent JDV hotels. We are members and watch for deals from JDV and/or Hotels.com.  The hotels are relatively pricey, but worth it. For reference, our other favorite chain is Kimpton. We discovered Pacific Edge after we stayed at the Huntington Beach sister property Shorebreak.  We like Pacific Edge because it is pet friendly, Laguna is a vacation paradise and the beach front rooms are literally on the beach. You don't get many rooms where you could throw a stone into the water from your balcony. We love to bring our two terriers and enjoy the pet friendly beaches. For other dog owners,it is such a relief to take a vacation where you can bring your dogs and it is comfortable.  They can sit on the beach with you, eat at awesome restaurants like Sundried Tomato Cafe
Manager Response: You're right ‚Äî there is something for everyone in Laguna, and we try to mirror that in our hotel. It is lovely to hear from you, especially since you've come back to us time and time again! I'm glad that you and your dogs enjoyed your stay. Of course, let us know if there is anything we can do to make your time with us that much better! We'll see you next time you're in Laguna.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: Pulling up to the hotel it doesn't look like much, decorating the front lobby again and exterior would help as it feels like a motel at first, don't expect a resort. But dont let that impression fool you, it only gets better from there if you have an oceanfront room awaiting you. It is located in a very convenient location, very easy to walk down the street to visit all the shops and restaurants of Laguna beach. Ralphs is a block away. The hotel is separated into several buildings and separated by an alley. We requested early check in and a quieter room, upper floor for the oceanfront king we booked. We were given room 705 in the Surf bldg which was beautiful, very large, top floor, kitchenette, 180 degree views, literally hanging over the shoreline. Stunning, great people
Manager Response: We always love hearing such thoughtful, thorough comments from our guests. Thanks so much for taking the time to review us. It sounds like you had a fantastic stay! The oceanfront view truly can't be beat. I'm thrilled that you were so impressed with our staff. They really will go above and beyond to make sure that your time with us is fabulous. Thank you again for the review. We'll see you next time you're in Laguna.  Warm regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't waste your time or money here.
Summary: From the beginning there is no place to park for check in, but after finding a parking meter on the street and checked in we were directed to return to our car and drive around the block to valet parking. Maybe they don't understand the meaning of valet parking which turns out to be in the middle of the street with traffic passing through from both directions. No real system of organization here. After checking in our car comes the really confused part. With our luggage in hand we find our way into the smallest elevator I have ever been in. When we get to what we think is our floor, we realize we can't get to our room (#20). So we take the elevator back down to lobby level where we started. (Why didn't I unload luggage here in the first place?) So now I have to climb a flight of
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about this. It is disappointing that you were unhappy with your room. Did you ask to move? We're always happy to accommodate those requests whenever other rooms are available. It is also unfortunate that you were unable to find the pools. However, I can assure you that we do indeed have two pools on our property, as well as a jacuzzi. Remember that we are always happy to help, so don't hesitate to reach out if you need assistance locating anything in the surrounding area.   The experience you described does not meet our standards, and I apologize. I appreciate your honest feedback, and I will share your review with our hotel staff as well as The Deck's staff to see what we can do to improve. I know we can do better. I want to make this right for you. Please call me at (949) 494-8566 if you'd like to discuss this further.   Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Service is the star of this resort
Summary: I stayed here recently for a few days while visiting with a friend from abroad. The Service was friendly, helpfull and attentive.. sadly the rooms are a little worse for ware.  I had resonable expectations from the Pacific Edge Resort, however even though we upgraded to a partial Oceanview room I was disappointed. The room was painted recently but it looks as if they just painted over old wallpaper and any old colors and cracks in the paint. the look they are trying to achieve is visible but instead of relaxed beachy and a little bit weathered it comes across as a patch job that was rushed through just to cover up what as there before.   Normally I wouldn't be bothered by a little age or even sometimes a little dirt (it's close the beach so it would be understandable) in this
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback. I'm sorry to hear that you were a bit disappointed with your room. We have an excellent cleaning staff to make sure that each room is in tip-top shape, and I will discuss your review with them in hopes of eliminating any lingering odors. It's also unfortunate to hear about your experience with the paint chips on the balcony. I will have our maintenance team take a look at this. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.   I'm glad that our staff made you feel welcome, and that you found your room so well appointed. We really appreciate reading thoughtful, thorough reviews like yours. It is constructive criticism like this that inspires us to do better. Thank you again. We hope you'll give us another chance to wow you next time you're in Laguna Beach.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel, formerly Vacation Village for over 20 years.  The new management has made a number of improvements, mostly cosmetic.  The main improvement for me is that the beds are so much more comfortable and there is the convenience of room service.  The best thing about this hotel is the closeness to the ocean.  Oceanfront rooms practically overhang the waves.  I would not stay here if I could not have an oceanfront room.
Manager Response: It's great to hear from you. We truly appreciate the kind words, especially since you've been staying at this property for over 20 years. I'm glad to hear how impressed you are with our recent improvements. Our comfortable beds really do guarantee a restful night's sleep! Thank you for the wonderful review. We'll see you next time you're in town.  Best, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: This is a great place!! It is prim location. You can walk on the beach , or walk the shops. You can walk 5 minutes up to the beautiful center of Laguna. Everything is there or in 5 minute walking distance, movie theater, Art museum, shops, and restaurants. This resort is ON the beach!! However, this is only if you get the right rooms. If you are not in the building I mention then this place is not on the beach and I don't feel worth it. The Reef rooms are all on and facing the beach. We really liked being on the first floor. The first floor is is a balcony room and We loved sitting them and watching the waves crash. Rooms 134,128,122,116. Are the least desirable. Very close to next tower. Rooms 139,133. 127, 121 are on the end with a great view. All have wonderful balconies with
Manager Response: Kimberly,  You're right! We are in the perfect location to access the beautiful city of Laguna and, of course, the beach. I appreciate that you took the time to leave the tips regarding the rooms. We like to provide several different layouts and views so that there is something to accommodate each of our guests. I'm delighted to hear that you were so impressed with both the Beach House and The Deck. They're excellent places to enjoy the freshest seafood with a gorgeous view. Thank you for the wonderful review. We hope to see you next time you're in Laguna Beach!  Sincerely,  Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and cannot wait to return!
Summary: Our trip to Laguna Beach was a memorable one. We absolutely loved staying at The Pacific Edge Hotel!  The staff was over the top friendly and our room was to die for!  I highly suggest staying in an ocean front room!  We stayed in a 1st level ocean front room.  We slept with the balcony door open listening to the waves that would come up right below our balcony!  Unbelievable and unforgettable stay!! We will be back!!  A+++++
Manager Response: I'm thrilled that you had such a fabulous vacation! It's great to hear that everyone made you feel so welcome. I'm glad you were able to sleep with your balcony doors open. Hearing waves crash on the shore is the perfect way to be lulled into a restful sleep! Thank you for the kind words. We're looking forward to seeing you next time you're in Laguna.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a standard double.  For the price, we could not complain.  It was small and lacked a couple items such as a clock and a safe.  The bathroom was small, shower only with little counter space.  The room also was short on electrical outlets, at least convenient ones if you have laptops etc.  The TV was an older model.  You have to put down $50 a day on your CC for incidentals such as movies in your room.  Our remote was universal and did not have the proper button to watch movies.  I guess that is a good way to not run up your CC :)  Standard cable, very few channels but enough to find something.  They do have channels that tell you about the area that gives great info, worth sitting through.  Note:  You do pay for parking daily which is taken out of your incidentals on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. It sounds like you had a wonderful stay! You left some great tips ‚Äî especially about the binoculars for spotting whales! I'm glad everyone made you feel so welcome, and that we could help you relax in between visiting your grandchild. Thanks again for the review. We hope to see you next time you're in Laguna Beach!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: PacEdge is a very nice hotel, I've stayed here a few times.  A good value-for-price hotel, especially if you get the upper ocean view with a balcony. I'd recommend it to all families, couples, and large groups. The hotel staff is friendly and prompt, discreet which is nice in a multi-building hotel. Being a part of JDV is a tremendous perk too, and it gives a beautiful beach city to their collection.
Manager Response: Happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. It's our pleasure to make you feel comfortable and help you see the best  that Laguna Beach has to offer! Thanks for the wonderful review. We'll see you next time you're in town!  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: My husband and I picked this hotel for our 14th anniversary. Right when we walked in the room and looked out the balcony, it was BREATHTAKING! It was so beautiful words can't explain. We sat on the balcony for hours enjoying the view and the weather. We slept with the balcony door open to enjoy the waves at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a romantic getaway!
Manager Response: Jessica,  I'm thrilled that we could be a part of such a wonderful occasion! Laguna Beach is a breathtaking backdrop for any celebration. I'm so glad to hear that you were able to sleep with your door open and let the waves lull you to sleep. There's really nothing more relaxing than that. Thanks for the review. We hope to see you again soon.  Regards, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary Heading: Pacific Edge Hotel, by far,  the best hotel in the OC!
Summary: I highly recommend this hotel! The front desk was very friendly and helpful , room service was prompt, within walking distance to shopping and  restaurants, spectacular views .....can't wait to go back!
