Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review! I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us and found the staff helpful and efficient. We would love to welcome you back again any time--it's hard to beat that view!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We are staying at Pacific Edge for two nights. I wish it were longer! We originally booked a non-ocean view room, but since the hotel is not full, they upgraded us very cheaply to a super ocean view room! I think it's easier to upgrade if you book directly on the hotel's website. We are lucky to have some great weather as well as the upgrade.  We are on the bottom floor, and the ocean is so close it feels like we are on a boat. I could not have expected more for our 2-day holiday! We also brought our dog and I appreciate how accommodating they are towards families with dogs. Little things I like: great single cup coffee brewer with tasty coffee (though we used our own milk), cute decorations, nice beds and bedding.  I little annoying (but not enough to take a star away): pillows
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your great review! I'm glad you have enjoyed staying with us--we've loved having you. We appreciate your kind comments and would love to welcome you back again any time.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: My wife and I had our anniversary at The Deck, and the experience wsa outstanding.  We are familar with this property, and have followed it as it's transitioned from a nice but dated family hotel to a hip, fun, perfecty located, well run and upscale property.  When they opened The Deck restaurant at the water's edge, we were among the first customers.  The food is great and the location is probaby the best in Orange County, right on the water, with a big outdoor patio, a great bar, several large cabanas with private sun decks and beach access, and live music on Sundays.  Just a well executed property that's already become one of the hippest spots in town, perhaps supplanting The Rooftop at Casa Del Camino in this category.  When we were at The Deck for our anniversary we rented
Manager Response: I'm so glad you enjoyed your meal at the Deck. The Deck is actually a separate entity from Pacific Edge on Laguna Beach and I'm sure they would appreciate your comments. If you are ever looking for a hotel to stay in, we'd love to have you.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: This was our first trip to the Pacific Edge hotel , we stayed in the penthouse suite overlooking Sleepy Hollow Road and the sea beyond.We were surprised to find that we had a lounge and kitchen/ dining area.The furniture in the apartment was a bit tired and dated , but it did look as if it had recently been decorated and the bed was very comfortable with spotless bed linen.We saw dolphins swimming in the sea from our balcony which was an amazing sight to behold. The beach was a very short walk away and sunbeds/umbrellas and towels were all provided free of charge. We had breakfast at the Beach House Restaurant nearby which has lovely unspoilt views across the sea.We had one evening meal there also which was delicious , but the lighting was so poor we had trouble reading the menu
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us! I'm glad you enjoyed staying with us in one of our ocean view rooms. We appreciate your comments as they allow us to assess and improve our service. In regards to the pool towels, we are happy to provide towels for you if you speak to the front desk. We are also required to have a valet due to the presence of the restaurant The Deck on the property though we apologize if that policy was not explained more clearly to you. I hope you'll come back and stay with us again; we'd love to have you!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Stay was OK but the room was very small and the bathroom had no room to put toiletries out. There were 5 or 6 old buildings spread across the property, although it looks like they are trying to update. It is quite a trek around stairs, hallways and other buildings to get down to the oceanfront beach. Pictures on website are a little deceiving because all of property is old and rooms are quite dated. Valet parking is required at $20/night. Hotel rates are a little high for the condition of the property. Lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Staff was very courteous and friendly.
Manager Response: I'm sorry that you weren't more impressed when you recently stayed with us. We have many unique room types and are constantly working to improve the quality of our guests' stay; we would have been happy to move you into a room that might have been more to your taste. We are also required to have valet parking due to the presence of the restaurants on the premises, though I apologize if our staff did not explain this more clearly to you. I do hope you'll afford us another opportunity to impress you in the future; I know we can show you a great stay.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: My 4th visit...& I already miss this hotel!
Summary: My children and I ONLY stay at Pacific Edge Hotel when visiting Laguna Beach. I just returned home from my 4th visit to this property (stayed Apr. 2 thru Apr 6) and I booked the same beachfront room with 2 beds. This hotel keeps getting better & better each time we stay here! The rooms are clean & well maintained, the location is ideal, and price point remains a great value for a hotel on Laguna Beach.  In addition to these attributes, the STAFF is what sets this hotel apart from the competition. Korhan is sincere and a true professional while Craig was so helpful with an advance request. These guys really make you feel at home.  And I don't know what I would have done without J.P upon arrival; assisting my mother the way he did. Above & beyond is the only way to describe the
Manager Response: Haley,  I'm so glad to hear from you. We always appreciate receiving comments from our loyal guests. It's wonderful that you find the rooms clean and comfortable and that you find the staff friendly and accommodating. We would love to welcome you back again any time!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Run down, old and horribly setup.
Summary: The only pro is the location and the views. The con's are many. Every time our upstairs neighbor took a shower we got all his water in our bath tub, we complained they brought someone immediately who couldn't figure out how to get the cap off the clean out, so they pretended for a couple of hours and never did anything. Showers was a fast trickle and your could either take it boiling hot or freezing cold, cause for some reason you could not get a mix that didn't melt skin.  The valet is the most ridiculous thing you have ever experienced. You have to take your car to the valet and then walk back to your hotel room. WTF? So if you are staying in any other rooms than the ones on top of the restaurant you have to walk back up the hill to your room, only for the valet to park your
Manager Response: I'm sincerely sorry to hear that you were not more impressed with your stay. I wanted to take this opportunity to address a few of your concerns. The situation with your room is regrettable and our staff should have moved you to a different room. I will speak with them about your feedback so we can improve in the future. In regards to the valet, our parking space is utilized for our hotel guests as well as the restaurant patrons of both our restaurants, thus Valet parking is required due to the unique lay-out of our property. I apologize if our front desk staff did not explain its necessity better. I do hope you'll afford us another opportunity to impress you; I know we can show you a great time.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Pacific Edge for 4 nights over spring break.  There were several issues with loud hotel patrons and screaming and yelling through the night.  This was not conductive to a relaxing good night sleep.  The walls are thin and you are able to hear conversations in the adjoining rooms whether you want to or not.   The hotel clerk, Korhan, was extremely helpful and very nice which was quickly noticed as the other clerks were the exact opposite.   Our room was along the PCH and was very loud with traffic noises, even through the night.  If you stay here, make sure that you are not in the buildings along the PCH.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your experience with other guests; I will pass your feedback along to our security staff. I'm glad you found Korhan accommodating and helpful and I hope you'll afford us another opportunity to impress you. When you book, be sure to request a room in the Reef building if you weren't a fan of the PCH.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, not the greatest price
Summary: The location of this hotel was amazing. We had a room in the Reef building and the view was great. The bed was very comfortable and so were the pillows. I loved the color and decoration of the room. There were some things I didn't like. Our valet was payed for since we stayed for 5 nights, but it would have been much more convienent if we could have just parked ourselves. The lighting fixtures were cheap plastic and one fell on us one night. The paint at the bottom of the bathroom door was warped. The shower rod was rusty and the door going to the balcony didn't fit the frame right and if you wanted to keep the door open, it made a lot of noise. Liked the hotel since we didn't spend much time in there but would possibly stay again if it was less expensive and the valet rules
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review! I'm so glad you enjoyed staying with us in one of our Reef building rooms. We're lucky to have such a beautiful view. In regards to the valet, our parking space is utilized for our hotel guests as well as the restaurant patrons of both our restaurants, thus Valet parking is required due to the unique lay-out of our property. I apologize if our front desk staff did not explain its necessity better. We would love to welcome you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: This is where u should stay in Laguna
Summary: It is a great location actually laguna beach you are very close to the ocean there are multiple room options . There was a huge storm when we were there they helped us a lot changed our room so the service is also great! I would definitely suggest to stay there also you would have a 20% off in the. Next restaurant where you can have a ocean view breakfast. Actually they have several discounts in town. I definitely suggest.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your great review. I'm happy to hear that our staff was able to accommodate your needs during that storm. We would love to welcome you back again any time!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: My two daughters and I stayed one night to enjoy the ocean.  We were in an ocean view room that was larger than most standard rooms with 2 queen beds.  The decor was bright, cheery and "beachy".  The room was very clean and the beds & linens were very comfortable.  The in-room mini fridge was convenient.  The balcony was a nice size and we watched the beautiful Pacific Ocean sunset from it.   We slept with the balcony door open so we could hear the sound of the ocean all night.  We ate at the fancier of the 2 restaurants on the property and the food was delicious.  I was very impressed with the staff at the hotel.  The front desk employees were happy to help with anything and were knowledgable about the area.  We were within walking distance of everything in Laguna.  I hope to
Manager Response: Kris,  It's wonderful to read your review. I'm glad you and your daughters enjoyed your stay with us and found the atmosphere cheerful and beachy. I'm also thrilled to hear that you found the staff impressive; they will be so happy to hear from you. We would love to welcome you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We stayed here four nights in March. The property and rooms are a bit dated but you really can't beat the views in the ocean front rooms; you are so close to the beach that you can literally hear the ocean the entire time you are in your room, unless you are in a room next to the Deck, then all you can hear is loud, thumping music in the evening. We were checked into room 501 and were so happy when we walked in our room and saw the incredible view. We'd had a long travel day and were dealing with the time zone change so we were going to call it an early night. At about 8:00 pm, the music started and it was so loud that I could sing along with every song. I called the front desk and they said the music would be over at 11:00. I ended up going to the front desk to see about
Manager Response: So lovely to read your review! We truly appreciate your comments. I do apologize about the problem with room 501; while I'm glad the staff was able to accommodate your needs it's an issue we'll have to address. I'm also sorry that I didn't respond to your message; I'll be sure to get in touch soon. I do hope you enjoyed your trip overall; we would love to welcome you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Stayed two nights - first one in an ocean view room. And what a view - Beautiful sunset with dolphins and whale included - amazing and the best feature of the hotel. Second night in a village room which was large but felt more like a motel then a hotel. We had only a paper thin door between us and the neighbours with a yapping dog which they left behind in the morning...!   Otherwise nice retro style - perhaps a little worn out considering what they charge. We stayed in another joie de vivre in San Fransisco which also had great style but was a bit more upkept. The pool was closed when we were there and the smaller pool was in the shade by the road so not great. They do put out sun loungers for you on the beach which is nice. Conveniently located right next to the beach House.
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely review. I'm glad you enjoyed our ocean view room--it's certainly a beautiful view and we're fortunate to see it every day. We truly appreciate your feedback about the rooms. We would love to welcome you back again any time!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Clean room, a little dated.  Hot tub--not hot, just warm.
Manager Response: Thanks for your great review! I'm glad you enjoyed the view and found the room clean and comfortable. I do apologize if your hot tub was not hot enough. Of course, our front desk staff would be more than happy to address such concerns if you alert them. We would love to welcome you back again any time.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: The location can't be beat and the character of the hotel is exactly what we were looking for..laid back surfer style centrally located with a view and beach! The decor was very California surfer cute and not stuffy. The staff was friendly and helpful and the bed was very comfortable. The fridge in the room was a bonus too. This was our first trip to Laguna Beach and are going back again. Highly recommend if you want a low-key relaxing beach getaway, a departure from traditional hotels.
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We truly appreciate your kind words. I'm glad you enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel and found the rooms comfortable. We would love to welcome you back again the next time you're in Laguna Beach!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: A nice "relax" hotel on the beach
Summary: I stayed at the Pacific Edge hotel recently and it was a nice experience. I have stayed at the Joie de Vivre hotel in Sacramento and San Francisco before so i decided to book the one in Laguna. This was a different experience, not bad at all, just different.   First you need to book a room with view on the beach, no other type of accommodation. You will open your window and feel you are on the beach. loved it (even if you are very close to all the neighbour, you can see what they are doing too, kind of fun too). Second the room are spacious and comfortable with kitchenette, small bathroom (well you will spend your time on the balcony or beach so not a problem).  This is a nice relax, casual hotel, good value in the 300$ range max. The staff is very friendly, make me feel i was
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review us. We're happy to have made your trip a great one ‚Äî those beach views will make anyone feel relaxed! You seem to have had a wonderful stay with us. If you have any further feedback on how we could have raised your rating from 3 stars I'd love to discuss your particular stay with you.  Take care, Bill Tremper, General Manager

Summary: I wont say this hotel is the best that Ive stayed at its a little dated they have done a great job with updating the decor in the room very cute surfer style but I will say for the price it is worth it and more the room was clean the front desk staff were very friendly and helpful the bed was very comfortable and Im picky when it comes to my beds the view was the best part my husband and I thought it was the best location on the beach as far as hotels at this price. One day we order lunch in our room and sat right on our little patio and had the best view ever it was so relaxing the food was good and was delivered with in 20 mins we had the best weekend ever we will return for the summer and are looking forward to it.
Manager Response: Angela,  Thank you very much for your kind review. I'm glad you enjoyed the updated rooms and beautiful ocean views. We're fortunate to live somewhere as beautiful as Laguna Beach! We'd love to welcome you back again any time.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: This hotel is located right on the beach.  Although the property is a little old, it is kept in very nice shape.  The room I was in was adequately spacious, furnished nicely and had a nice Balcony.  The room number is 139, which has, without a doubt, the best Balcony view of any of the rooms.  The surf was breaking 50 feet from the building, sometimes closer.  The Balcony is slightly crowded. It provided two wooden Adirondack type chairs which had good paint and were very comfortable.  A nice two tier wooden table was positioned between them.  The Balcony‚Äôs access is through a sliding glass door which was very hard to operate and definitely needed some maintenance.  I found it to be off its track on the bottom, I put it back on its track and found it was not any easier to
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. I'm so glad you enjoyed staying with us and that you found the room comfortable and the area inviting. In regards to the parking, we host not only hotel guest, but restaurant patrons from The Deck & BeachHouse. I apologize if it was at all inconvenient. We would love to welcome you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Three Great Days at Laguna Beach
Summary: Last month my partner and I stayed at Pacific Edge for three days. A stunning view of the room included some magnificent sunsets. The room was fine with a full size fridge - a great thrill compared to the Four Star Hotel  we came from in San Diego. And a surfboard in the room as well! Perfect location for beach lovers and everything else in Laguna is withing walking distance. Very friendly and helpful staff.
Manager Response: Greg,  Thank you so much for your great review. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your stay in Laguna. We are very fortunate to be in a great location. I'm glad you enjoyed your room as well as your visit and we would love to welcome you back again any time.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a top floor oceanfront room, well worth the $$$. Laguna hotels are pricey but we received 20% off for booking a 4-day stay. Also received free valet parking( you can only park valet here) so saved $20 a day there. Rooms are on the small side but with a nice sized balcony with deck chairs and table, and always that incredible view and the crashing waves, which manage to block most ambient noise, even of the clunking room doors. Our room had a few bumps and dings around but was VERY clean. Bed and linens were nice. Good quality shampoo/lotion/soap. Had to call twice to have ice delivered(you can't pick it up yourself). I usually don't stay where they allow pets but there was no smell or pet noise here. Free chairs and umbrella set up for you on the beach.Plan an extra
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us in one of our ocean view rooms and that you found it clean and comfortable. There's nothing quite like the sound of those ocean waves! I'm also happy to hear you got to explore Laguna Beach; it's a wonderful town. We would love to welcome you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We got a great group deal on this hotel, so we didn't get the best room with best location, but great hotel right on the beach.  Next time I would upgrade to a view room.  And our room was a little small fit two double beds but not much extra space.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us--even if you didn't have a view this time! We'd love to welcome you back again soon. Request for a room in the Reef Building!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Just returned from another wonderful visit to Laguna Beach, this time staying at the Pacific Edge Hotel in a ocean-front room (Reef Building).   Check-in was friendly & seamless - front desk was very helpful. The room was truly right on the beach - at high tide the waves literally were crashing under my deck!  The bed was super comfy & the spacious room had everything I needed for my four-day stay (with the possible exception of a microwave but no big deal really).  I arrived the evening of a pacific storm, which had the waves churning. During the night the skies cleared to display a perfectly full moon over the pacific, probably one of the most stunning hotel views of my experience. I stayed awake just listening and watching.  I'll be hard pressed to stay anywhere else on my
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your kind review! I'm so happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are very fortunate to have such a beautiful view of the ocean from our Reef building and I'm thrilled that you liked your room. We would love to welcome you back again the next time you're in Laguna.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here many times back when it was Vacation Village.  There are some things that I wished would have stayed the same (self parking), but there are also nice changes (fresh updated rooms).  I really enjoyed our beach front junior suite which is a corner unit (with kitchenette) with full windows on both sides to enjoy the awesome view, weather and sunsets.  It was the first week of June and the weather was just stunning and perfect.  The housekeeping staff were excellent.  Everyone went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and it was appreciated.  The only downside is the mandatory valet parking.  it was just purely inconvenient and a waste of time.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. We're always happy to hear from our loyal guests and it's great to hear you still enjoy visiting us in Laguna Beach. It's nice to hear that you like our updated rooms and that housekeeping did a good job of keeping everything fresh and clean. We'd love to welcome you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Go For the Location and Views
Summary: We just got back a couple weeks ago from a wonderful three-night stay at the Pacific Edge on Laguna Beach and are happy to give it two thumbs up, mainly for location, location, location.    We stayed in The Reef building on the top floor (fourth, I believe).  Though it sounds a little high, we only had to navigate one set of stairs to our room as the parking is on the third level (please note, there is no elevator in this building).  While the room was immaculate, and even spacious, it was pretty dated and very sparse, with just the basics.  Of course, if your main purpose is to spend time sightseeing, walking the beach, or just sitting on your 'private' deck that overlooks the ocean, what more do you need than a comfortable bed, towels, soap, and a table on which to put your
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. I'm so glad you enjoyed exploring Laguna Beach and staying with us during your visit. We truly appreciate your recommendation. I wanted to address your concern about the parking as well. Since the restaurant associated with the hotel (The Deck) was built, the city has required that we use valet parking. I do apologize if you found it inconvenient. We'd love to welcome you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I have stayed here twice and I LOVE this hotel.  The most recent time I came was to surprise my girlfriend by proposing to her on the beach behind the hotel.  The hotel staff were very friendly, very helpful, and very excited for us.  The room was magnificent!  The rooms have a very relaxed, surfer, beach house feel, it's just perfect for Laguna Beach.  The beach behind the Hotel is clean, spacious, and beautiful.  I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place.  They are my favorite! P.S. She said Yes
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review. We were very excited and touched to be a part of your very special proposal--and we're thrilled that she said yes, of course! We truly appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back again soon--maybe for the honeymoon? We'll see!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We love it here. The staff is wonderful and truly knows the meaning of great customer service. It's clean, comfortably decorated and the pricing is excellent. We stayed in September then brought friends in November and will be returning in February, again with friends. See you soon!
Manager Response: Bonni,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I'm so glad you have enjoyed your visits with us. We truly appreciate your feedback and it's great to hear that you keep coming back--with friends! We look forward to seeing you again this month.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: An older motel, it's true, but it was cute, and one of the least spendy options in Laguna Beach, with fun pastel paint in calm blues and celadon contributing to its retro vibe.  Reception was able to upgrade us to a two-bed suite for a nominal charge, pretty sweet.  Didn't face the ocean, but that was fine with us, didn't really hear the noise from PCH.  The biggest complaint I have is the lighting which was inadequate and depressive in an otherwise cheery, spacious suite. You do have to ask for whatever you might need in the kitchen, in our case a pot for boiling water.  When we checked in receptionist asked one of the workers to bring a can opener to another room.  Is it so difficult/expensive to keep common items in the kitchens? Tip: The renovated rooms are the ones facing
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. We truly appreciate hearing from our guests as it is our best opportunity to improve our service in the future. In regards to the kitchen utensils, we have found that it is more difficult to maintain the cleanliness and quality of the utensils when we provide them for guests who do not request them. If you make us aware ahead of time that you need utensils in your room we are more than happy to provide them prior to your arrival. I'm also sorry if you found the lighting inadequate; we appreciate your feedback and will look into how to improve it in the future. I'm also sincerely sorry if you were served food on a dirty tray; that quality of service is completely unacceptable and I will be looking into it. I also want to let you know that we will be continuing our renovations in the coming months so the rest of our suites will match our ocean-facing rooms.  I am glad you enjoyed the Deck; we are proud of our seafood dishes and I'm glad your toddler enjoyed the salmon! I hope you'll afford us another opportunity to welcome you back again; I know we can provide a wonderful and relaxing stay.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Stayed in November and have been meaning to write a quick review.  Location is great and Laguna is a great place to visit.  I would certainly return to Laguna, but would be equally certain not to stay here again.  The staff were friendly and the location perfect, but this is an old motel type property that has had a quick makeover with fresh paint and not much else.   Walls are paper thin and we could here almost every word our neighbours spoke, plus we were woken late at night by people walking past the room door returning to their own rooms.  Not necessarily making a lot of noise, but sound proofing to the outside is non-existent and the large gaps around the doors don‚Äôt exactly help.  We were lucky enough to be moved from our initial room before even unpacking and pity anyone
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. I'm glad you enjoyed Laguna Beach though I am sorry to hear that you wouldn't return to Pacific Edge. While we have been making small improvements in the rooms we are also continuing to improve our facilities. I also wanted to address your concern about the valet parking. In the past we have not had valet parking, but since the opening of The Deck resturant the city has mandated that we use valet parking only. I do apologize if it was inconvenient for you. I hope you'll afford us another opportunity to welcome you back; I know we can show you a great time.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I wanted to let all of you know; if you want to see the ocean and hear the waves, the Pacific Edge is a really nice place to stay. My room was kinda art decco style, clean and comftorble. Small kitchen, stove, microwave, two sided patio and the water was only feet away.   The staff was friendly, polite, and very helpful. I believe there are a few swimming pools, and jacuzzi's. The jacuzzi I used was very large and did the job. I stayed for 4 days, and plan to stay again for a week.   I recommed getting the ocean front room. I believe corner units have a two sided patio.   The Pacific Edge will not disapoint you.   Dave
Manager Response: Dave,  Thank you for your thorough review. I'm so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. There's nothing quite like falling asleep with the sounds of the waves in the background! We look forward to welcoming you back again for your next visit.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: My husband and I took an overnight trip here in late December. It is easy to get to on PCH. The room itself is okay, but being on the beach with waves lapping all the time is incredible. There is a balcony with Adirondack chairs. Even in December with a blanket around me, I enjoyed watching the early morning fishing boats and sunset the night before. We walked on the beach and had a great time. The staff was very eager to please.
Manager Response: Thanks so much for your review! I'm glad you enjoyed the view from the room, we think it's pretty special too. I'm also happy to hear that the staff was welcoming and friendly; it's one of our goals every day to provide the best possible service to our guests. I hope you'll come back and visit us again!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I wanted to take my (then 15month old) son to the beach for the first time and thought Laguna Beach would be a good start.  I chose this little hotel mainly because of convenience.  It's located adjacent to the shore.  Due to a recent health issues, I decided to book a room that is simply steps away from the ocean.  I originally booked a first floor oceanfront king room but was somewhat disappointed when we were given a 2nd floor oceanfront king room.  I didn't want to ruin our mini vacation so we kept the spirit up.  Upon entering our room, I was again somewhat disappointed, the room and the building felt a bit like a motel than anything.  But our room was clean, spacious with a medium size refridgerator and a little kitchen sink.  No microwave, apparently that cost extra.  Our
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a thorough review. I'm glad you and your young son enjoyed your first visit to Laguna Beach. I do apologize if you were not thrilled with your room; of course, you can always address concerns about your room to the front desk staff and we would be happy to make things right for you. We are also undergoing some exciting renovations that will address many of your concerns about the age of the building. We would love to welcome you back again!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We just returned from spending Christmas weekend in Laguna Beach @ the Pacific Edge. We have stayed in several Joie de Vivre properties in the last year. So far, so good. Each location has it's own special feeling. Anyways, the Pacific Edge met and exceeded our expectations. We had a 2 rooms on the oceanfront side and were literally on the ocean! The sounds of the waves crashing on the shore was priceless. The rooms themselves were very comfortable and had all the necessary amenities, including a refrigerator,microwave(upon request), flat screen tv, and even a pillow menu(you choose from 4 or 5 types of pillows that they will bring you). We brought the whole family including our dog(no extra charge)! With our 3 day package valet parking was included and we also got a discount in
Manager Response: Charley,  Thank you very much for your thoughtful review. We truly appreciate hearing from our guests and I'm happy to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. We'd love to welcome you, the family, and the family dog back any time!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We had an oceanfront junior suite.  The most amazing view, a great big room with kitchenette and living area and best of all, a wrap-around deck with adirondacks right on the beach.   The staff was super friendly and was very helpful.  They brought out deck chairs and umbrellas to the beach when we asked.  The pool - I liked it because it didn't get a lot of sunshine, which I try to avoid.The 2 restaurants were wonderful.   The hotel is centrally located.   We'll be back soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us! I'm so glad you enjoyed our beachfront suite. We love being so close to the views and the action on the beach itself! We'd love to welcome you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I am in town on business about 4 times per year and more often than not, I end up staying in the Irvine spectrum area.  I had already booked a two night stay in that area and ended up having to add a day to my trip on the front end.  I love to use Priceline where I can and it's tough sometimes to get a decent price for a one night stay anywhere around.  I was having a particularly difficult time and decided to add Laguna Beach to my search area where I discovered this gem of a hotel.  I arrived around 4:45 p.m. and had to rush to my room to participate in a conference call.  I had enough time though to totally enjoy the front desk staff and the main lobby.  The staff are incredible!  The lobby nicely appointed very "Laguna-ish".  Loved it.  I knew I did not have an ocean view
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review. I'm glad you chose to stay with us for the extra day on your trip! I'm also happy to hear that you enjoyed your visit. We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: The room is great and the bathroom looks really cool. The wall heater is okay but you may have to get up a few times to adjust the temp.  After 12:00am all of the party goers seemed to walk by my room with thier volume on high. I suggest avoid rooms anywhere near the valet lot.
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to review us. I‚Äôm sorry to hear that some other guests were a little loud for your taste. If you address such concerns to the front desk staff, they‚Äôd be more than happy to try to resolve the issue for you. We also have many other rooms to choose from; on your next visit we‚Äôd love to impress you more. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I was a bit worried to stay here based off some of the reviews that I read about Pacific Edge but I noticed that most of the good reviews were from people who stayed in the Ocean View rooms. I made sure to to get an ocean view room so I requested to stay in the Reef building.   The entire property does look a bit old but I didn't mind it since the room I stayed in was great. It was clean and the view from the balcony was gorgeous. We had waves crashing below us and slept to the sound of waves all night long. The person who check us in knew that it was my wedding anniversary so she had a bottle of champagne sent up to us. Free champagne? That's never a bad thing :)  FYI, valet parking is 20 bucks a day. I saw a lot of people park their cars outside in the streets in metered
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us! I‚Äôm happy to hear you enjoyed one of our ocean view rooms. Is there anything better in the world than falling asleep to crashing waves? I can‚Äôt think of one. I‚Äôm also glad you enjoyed the champagne. We love celebrating special events with our guests. We‚Äôd love to have you back again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: As all the other reviewers mentioned these are converted apartments.  They have recieved a bare bone makeover...repainted cabinets and indoor/outdoor carpet.  The hotel is clean, bed nice, and furninture is Ikea. Rooms that aren't on the water are noisey - street and ally noise.  My only real complaint is they charged me a $20 upgrade from two doubles to a queen. Really?!? one bed cost more than two?  one less set of sheets to wash?  Also, this is a pet friendly hotel so if you are allergic you might want to first ask if they have any pet free rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. Our village rooms with 1 queen or 2 double beds are the same price, perhaps we were sold out of the 2 doubles that night and you were upgrading to one larger rooms with 2 queen beds by chance? In regards to the pet-friendly rooms, if you notify the front desk at check-in they would be more than happy to accommodate you. We'd love to have you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed at this property for one night.  Our room was booked through a third party at a discounted rate.  Clearly the hotel has different rooms for discount and full price customers. There is free wifi, valet parking $20 and no complimentary  breakfast.    All that said I loved the location. I spent very little time in the room so it wasn't that muchh of an issue.  The front desk staff were very helpful and even let us check in early as we had driven from Phoenix. We would definifitely love to come back again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great review. I'm glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We always want to provide a clean, comfortable, and relaxing stay for each of our guests. While I'm glad you found the room satisfactory, I'm even happier to hear that you had a good stay exploring beautiful Laguna Beach. We'd love to have you back again soon.  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: When I get a room at a hotel it is all about the comfort of the bed and the cleanliness of the bathroom. This room passed my critic with flying colors. The room overall is wonderful. Some dated pieces like the bathroom vanity and cheap lamps. I stayed in an oceanfront room in the Reef section of the hotel.  This room is truly oceanfront. The patio/deck had two yellow adirondack chairs and lots of space to get around. My view from the patio was of the whole crescent beach of Laguna! Beautiful during the day and at night. I fell asleep and woke up to the sound and smells of the ocean! The room also has a Keurig coffee maker with good coffee to drink in the morning. I wish all hotels had a Keurig. One very big disappointment...came back after our day in Laguna, to find that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review us. I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We always want to make sure each guest feels comfortable and relaxed during their visits, so I'm happy to hear you liked your room. I do apologize for the wait on your towels. That does not sound like a typical occurrence for us. I will look into this issue and use it to improve in the future. We'd love to have you back again soon for another visit-in any month you'd like!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: After seeing some 2.5 and 3 star reviews, I was anticipating how my stay at Pacific Edge would compare to them.  I was very pleasantly surprised find out that everything about my visit would exceed those older reviews.  The lobby was clean, modern, and the staff were very well trained in customer service.  The room was updated with modern colors, bathroom features, and art.  It was a safe and comfortable stay.  I would recommend staying at Pacific Edge if travelling to the Laguna Beach area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your lovely review! I‚Äôm so glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We strive to give every guest the best possible experience, and I‚Äôm thrilled that your stay with us exceeded your expectations. Our staff would be happy to welcome you back again soon, so I hope you‚Äôll think of us when planning your next trip to Laguna Beach.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I was hopeing for a fabulous stay for my birthday.  I was extremely disappointed, especially for the price.  The entire facility is in need of major maintenance.  Our room overlooked the ocean which is a positive and the bed was nice.  Those are all the positives I can report. The carpet in our room was dingy, the sliding door was corroded and difficult to use.  The light trim over the sink area was falling off the ceiling.  The bathroom was tiny with not nearly enough room for toiletries.  The outlet in the bathroom was loose and required us to blow dry our hair in the hall.  The paint and wall texture was poorly executed There is no mirror other than the small one over the sink in the entire room.  The hall ways and elevator are beyond dingy.  We ordered breakfast from room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We appreciate hearing customer feedback; it gives us the opportunity both to respond and improve! I sincerely apologize if you found your room unsatisfactory, please accept our apologies for your less than perfect experience.  It is through feedback such as yours that we are able to improve our level of satisfaction.  I am also sorry that you did not enjoy the room service. I will use your feedback to improve in the future. The Pacific Edge will be undergoing renovations soon, and we would be thrilled to welcome you back to see them!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: After reading the prior reviews of the hotel I was worried about my upcoming stay. Well I was pleasantly relieved to find not a rundown, dilapidated hotel, but a up and coming work in progress.   My room originally was to be the "Priceline Special" because our visit was literally planned the day before we left. Upon arriving the front desk happily upgraded me to a room in the Reef building which they call an Ocean View room.    The outside building was as to be expected for an older hotel, literally right on the beach.  The halls were damp and musty. The building did show some typical salt air damage but nothing I found out of the ordinary for a Pacific beach hotel.   Upon entering my room I found a quite nice open and brightly colored accommodation. The bedroom and bath were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a lovely, detailed review! I‚Äôm so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay in one of our ocean view rooms and appreciated our pillow menu and updated appliances. We will be undergoing some renovations soon, so the exterior will be getting an upgrade, but one thing that will never change is our dedication to customer service! Thanks for staying with us, and we hope to see you again soon!  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: The rooms here are so variable, that it's hit-or-miss on what you get. This time, our room faced toward the ocean, although we couldn't see or hear it. We were closer to the driveway lane in between the front and back structures. To our relief, we couldn't hear the noise from Pacific Coast Highway, and we slept well.  On-site parking is valet only, so we parked on PCH, and had to feed the meter $1 per hour after 8 AM.  The good news is that our room looked refurbished. It had a kitchenette, but no pots, cutlery, plates, etc. There were 2 small fridges(!) but one was locked shut. The furniture was freshly repainted, and some of it was new, even. The carpet seemed fairly new.  The bathroom had been re-tiled, and the porcelain re-surfaced. All was clean. The bed was comfortable,
Manager Response: Thanks for the great review! We‚Äôre glad you enjoyed our clean, refurbished rooms and newly painted furniture. Our ocean facing rooms are definitely popular, and we‚Äôre glad you got a good night‚Äôs sleep in our luxurious beds. We are sorry that there was a snafu with the prepayment at the front desk, though, and hopefully your next visit will go more smoothly! Come back again soon for more delicious fresh fruit and the beachy atmosphere.   Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Our room was one in from the beach. If we stood on the balcony we had a water view. It really was a large studio apartment with a huge vintage-50s kitchen (see photo attached). The owners of the hotel have a good idea and a vision but probably not the deep pockets to execute it well. This could be one of the coolest stays on PCH. Its a series of old hotels and apartment bldgs all clustered together around a central pool and various alleys and parking areas. You can walk to all the commercial areas of Laguna which we did happily. And best of all, you can take a midnight skinny dip in the Pacific or a silent meditative beach stroll at dawn. You are just steps from toes in warm sand.  Back to the room. I love rooms with kitchens or kitchenettes and was delighted to have a real
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Considerate, Helpful staff. Nice, affordable accomodtations
Summary: My wife and I came here for our honeymoon. I was slightly worried about some of the negative reviews, but we wanted to spend the week in Laguna on the beach. We didn't even rent a car because we wanted pure relaxation, and the location of this hotel is impossible to beat. Everything you want in Laguna - shops, bars, restaurants, supermarket, etc is within walking distance, and in the summer months a free trolley picks up outside the front door and will take you up to 2 miles in either direction on the PCH.  The beach is private, towels, chairs, umbrellas are free and provided by beach staff. Beach rentals are also available (not free, of course.) The on-site restaurants are both good, great drinks on the Deck overlooking the ocean. There's a really good happy hour during the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was placed here after bidding on Priceline and didn't know what to expect.  Front desk was nicer than most 5 stars i've stayed at.  The property seems to be a converted motel but it's done well, with beachy touches.  The beds were very comfy and they've updated the rooms quite a bit from what they must have been back in the day.  Inviting and comfortable.  I arrived late enough that I could street park at the meters, which are free until 8am.  The beach is the backyards, and it's a nice stretch.  Will definitely return for an LA getaway. Free internet is a bonus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before deciding to stay at the Pacific Edge last November. I decided to ignore all the negative comments and judge for myself. I'm so glad I did. My husband, daughter, dog and I enjoyed our stay so much, in fact, we are returning over the Thanksgiving weekend this year.     I have been visiting Laguna Beach for many years. I love the beachy funkiness, the surprise ocean views around so many corners, the tidepools, the outdoor restaurants, the surfers. Yes, there are some big expensive hotels with spas south of town, but Pacific Edge captures the essence of Laguna Beach.     It is funky, fun, retro and has a true beach vibe. It is right on the beach and right in the center of town. Because I love waking up and looking at the ocean, I choose to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Run down overpriced motel in need of total overhaul
Summary: Total state of disrepair, stained carpets, musty smell in rooms, paper thin walls, rust everywhere, room started to shake when other rooms opended/closed their doors .  I will keep this short on arrival first room was totally unacceptable moved to 2nd room no better but as it was late had no choice but to take it as basicly this was the best they had to offer.  I would like to point out this is their supposed best rooms facing ocean with balcony  (nothing like pictures, totally misselling). We where booked in for 5 days cancelled after first day but could not find a place in Lagunal to change to so unfortunately had to stay a second night.  My husband and I sat outside on the balcony to look at the lovely view of the ocean the light above fell and just missed us, it was soo
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to my attention. I‚Äôm very sorry your recent stay was not more enjoyable. This is certainly not the experience we wish our guests to have. We are currently undergoing some exciting renovations that will address many of these concerns. We would love to have you visit us again so we can show you a better time, and a quality experience.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: We went in October last year and we did not stay because we were unhappy with our room. (it faced the highway)  The staff was friendly and did not hassle us when we said we wanted to move to a different hotel.  I had stayed here once before when it was Vacation Village and we had a larger room with a view of the ocean.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this feedback with us. I apologize the location of your room was not more to your liking. If you prefer one of our beautiful oceanview rooms, we‚Äôre always more than happy to upgrade you. I hope you had a wonderful trip, and if you visit the area again, we would love to show you our amazing views and excellent amenities.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Caution!  There is probably considerable variation in rooms
Summary: We arrived as guests of a wedding party and given a very small room facing the street.  The carpet had some small tears and was significantly stained.  There were only two lights in the room and the small in-wall airconditioning unit required you to get on your knees to use the controls.  The walls were also in need of painting.  The bed, however, was comfortable.  We asked to see another room with more space and hopefully in better condition.  The next room also facing the street was a little larger but notably in the same condition.  Again asking if there was any other option, we were told that they were all booked but did have a small two story cottage between the building facing the street and and the beachfront property.  The carpet was not as badly stained but the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Laguna Beach. I hope you enjoyed your wedding ‚Äì that‚Äôs very exciting! In regards to your room, I would like to apologize it wasn‚Äôt up to our usual standard. While our oceanview rooms offer amazing views, we make every effort possible to maintain every room just the same. We are currently working on some great new improvements to update many of our rooms. I hope you‚Äôll be able to return and check out our exciting new changes!  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Best, Affordable Hotel on the Beach
Summary: My mother and I were looking to be close to downtown Laguna Beach, while still being able to enjoy the beach. And we found a great deal online with Pacific Edge. From the moment we arrived, the front desk was incredibly helpful. We arrived at 11 am, FIVE hours before check-in, and the front desk not only made an effort to find us a room, but offered to call us when our room was ready. The hotel was a bit hard to traverse with it's pathways and stairs, and the valet wasn't helpful, but the coast was otherwise easily accessible with friendly staff helping you set up beach chairs and towels. I must mention that the beach was not at all the "private" beach that the website claims. It is especially traversed by locals on the weekends. However, it is still very pleasant, and perfect
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us, and taking the time to write a review. I‚Äôm delighted you and your mother had a wonderful visit. We have a great team behind us, and I‚Äôll be sure to share your feedback with them. I‚Äôm sorry if you noticed some imperfections with your room. Our maintenance crew works extremely hard at keeping the property updated. It‚Äôs great to hear you enjoyed our convenient location and great bar area. We hope you‚Äôll come see us again and check out some of our other great amenities.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Great beachfront location, very nice laid-back vibe
Summary: Sure, the elevator is a bit musty and rusty, but this is a beachfront hotel. And the views from the King beachfront rooms are simply glorious!  We got a bloomspot deal and stayed on Sunday and Monday this past week, and couldn't have been happier. The room was clean, the bed very comfy, and the adirondack chairs facing the ocean from our balcony just sublime! There's a full fridge in the room--we didn't use it for the three days so we pulled out the plug to save energy (and because it was humming much too loudly).  I'm not sure what people expect when they write terrible reviews. I can't say anything bad about the staff--they were really nice and very helpful. The rooms are lovely--do you really spend your vacation looking at the hotel building? Yes, the parking is a bit
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us, and providing this feedback. I‚Äôm so happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and found the accommodations to your liking. Our focus is on offering wonderful service, exclusive amenities, and a laid-back atmosphere. We‚Äôre all about the experience here at Pacific Edge, and we always love to hear from our guests. If you get the chance to stay with us again, we hope to provide you with more great memories!  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: This is not the Ritz Carlton....it is a sprawling collection of several buildings, all rather old, operating as a single hotel.  Pool small, but if you have little kids it might be fine, never ventured.  We has a great room - plain, but comfy.  Balcony hanging over the surf.  Amazing sunsets, waking to surfers in the morning, beach just outside (towel and chair service was good).  Orange Hut for breakfast nearby, great places to eat around and down in the town.  A bit pricey if you do it on decor, but on views and beach access, it was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this feedback. I‚Äôm glad you enjoyed your accommodations, and beautiful views. We are fortunate to have such a wonderful location. I‚Äôm sorry if you found the pool to be smaller than you had hoped. We actually have two heated pools as well as Jacuzzi for your enjoyment. I appreciate your comments, and if there is anything we can do to make your next stay even better, I would love to hear your suggestions!  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Dont stay here unless you are used to staying in very cheap MOTELS.
Summary: I hate to write a bad review that is why i did not do this until i stayed here a second time thinking the first time was a fluke. What a mistake I made. Here is the best way to describe this place, nice small lobby with ugly run down rooms. I have stayed in motels in vegas ( not on purpose) that would make this place look bad. To be 100% honest the place is horrible, dirty, and loud. our room had silverfish (bugs similar to roaches) in the sinks, stained carpets and urine stained sheets. Do not stay here even if its free. I would not recomend this hotel to you unless you somehow deserve to be punished. I do not have an issue with the staff or any personal vendetta, just simply a run down place that is in need of demolition and rebuilding. It should never be classified as a hotel
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for your frustration. We make every effort possible to ensure you have a comfortable, carefree stay with us. I‚Äôm sorry if you felt your room was not properly cleaned. Our staff works extremely hard to keep the hotel well-maintained. If you are ever unhappy with your room, you are always welcome to let us know, and we would be more than happy to relocate you to a new room. Your happiness is very important to us, and we‚Äôll work harder to show our suburb quality moving forward.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: On our recent trip to Laguna Beach, we booked a stay at this hotel through hotels.com. Although the facility was certainly a decent place to stay, the room was somewhat small and the beach was nothing to write home about. What really put us off was the valet parking only at $20 per night that we learned about AFTER we got there. I think next year we will run up the coast to Huntington to have a nice vacation and a better value.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during your recent trip to Laguna Beach. I‚Äôm sorry if the valet parking charge upset you. We will do our best to communicate this better for future guests. As a boutique style hotel, some of our rooms are smaller than others, but we focus on the quality and uniqueness of your accommodations. We also have many great amenities to make your stay memorable. I appreciate your feedback, and if you are able to visit us again, we‚Äôll make a strong effort to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Pacific Edge is in a great location, right and on beach and within walking distance of great restaurants and shops. Our two bed apartment was very spacious and we had a nice view of the sea. That is where the positive ends. The hotel itself is no better than an up market motel. Our room was pretty shabby and had a musty odour. The people in the room next to us had a dog that  barked day and night!!! As if that wasn't bad enough they had a party in their room one next night until the early hours. We complained to reception and eventually the party was stopped but I had already missed a few hours sleep by this point. When we checked out the next day my husband asked if we could leave our car in the parking lot until we needed to set off for the airport. We were told that we could
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us. I‚Äôm sorry we did not meet your expectations. I would like to apologize for the disturbance regarding the noise level. We want to make your visit as relaxing as possible, and we‚Äôre always happy to move you to a new room upon your request. I appreciate you letting me know where we could be doing better. It‚Äôs always incredibly helpful to hear about our guests‚Äô experiences. I will share your comments with the rest of the team and we‚Äôll work to monitor the noise level more closely.   Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: I hope to write a very fair review. I booked a room, then read some of these reviews and almost canceled our rooms.  I give it overall between a 3 and 4. This place is in the midst of being upgraded. It's old. It's by the salty beach. Things fall apart. If you have ever been in an original 60s building on the beach in California, you know what I mean. They are in the process of renovating things.  Staff: they were great, we had three people simultaneously helping us at the front counter when we checked in, several hours early! ANYTHING we ordered was delivered within moments - a cot, shampoo, towels, a new key.  And this was a packed holiday weekend. I give them a 5. Room: we got a king ocean facing room. Bed was great and I loved the design. Room needs some work - tub needs to
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us, and taking the time to write a review. We are certainly in the process of adding some wonderful renovations and we‚Äôre really excited for what‚Äôs to come. I appreciate your kind words regarding our staff. They are a very hard-working group and will be thrilled to hear your comments. I‚Äôm sorry if you were disappointed by your room and the hotel grounds. Our focus has always been on providing an unmatched experience with first-class amenities and a laid-back vibe. As you pointed out, we have been making some great changes to our buildings that will add to your experience, and make your next visit even more enjoyable.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Great place for the kids and the beach.  And the Deck is great
Manager Response: I am delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay. It was a pleasure to make your stay a memorable one. I‚Äôm glad you and your kids enjoyed the beach area and the Deck. We are lucky to have such a great location with wonderful views. Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: Ok,  this might be the most enjoyable stay at a hotel I've ever had! (...And I've been around the world yet even some of the most fancy schmancy places haven't figured the keys to a great stay like the Pacific Edge has.)  Happy and accomodating staff, warm and contemporary finishings, majorly comfortable bed - oh, and a bada$$ location right on the water in LB.    I really felt so cozy in my oceanfront room, I think I got a week's worth of relaxation in 3 days time.  I had considered the ultra premium competitors in LB (with ultra premium prices) but I think the pomp and circumstance would have just annoyed me and I would have missed out on the laid back beach feel which Pacific Edge hits on the mark.    I loved being right on the beach, in walking distance of everything, loved
Manager Response: Thank you for your gratifying feedback. I am thrilled you had a wonderful and comfortable stay. Thank you for recognizing our accommodating staff. They all work so hard and will be happy to hear about your visit. Our goal is to make sure you feel at home with us and we‚Äôre always ready to show you a unique experience, characteristic of the laid-back vibe on Laguna Beach. We hope you‚Äôll visit us again in the future!  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Right on the Ocean but property needs work
Summary: I feel exactly the way most visitors have said in prior reviews. This place has the ocean going for it. We stayed in the Reef section of the hotel which is right over the ocean. Amazing views and to hear the ocean waves is incredible. The room itself is a nicely redecorated former motel room with small fridge but nothing has been changed structurally so bathroom is basic fare, stairs of the property and hallways had a musty smell. Paid Over $350 and it was not worth it for that price. Free healthy continental breakfast by the pool or cabana area would have added value to the stay. Valet parking $20 was expensive. Why not assign numbered parking to each room and make it inclusive of price?
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting us and providing this feedback. I‚Äôm delighted you enjoyed our picturesque views and convenient location. We‚Äôre always looking for areas of improvement, and I greatly value your suggestions regarding the parking situation and poolside breakfast. As we focus on creating a unique, unparalleled experience, we will absolutely take these ideas into consideration. It was a pleasure to welcome you to the hotel, and we look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: This hotel is charming and right on the beach.  I loved the beachy, lovely feel of my room, but it was very basic and not in a very good location - I was near the pool but kind of felt like I was in the basement next to a parking lot.  Service was acceptable but nothing to write home about.  I would stay here again, but definitely would request a different room location.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your experience. I‚Äôm happy to hear you enjoyed the laid-back, beach vibe representative of the Laguna Beach lifestyle. I‚Äôm sorry you weren‚Äôt pleased with the location of the room. We have many room locations, and if you are ever unhappy with your accommodations, we‚Äôre always ready to make things right for you. We also have beautiful beach front rooms that may be more to your style. Thanks again for visiting us, and we hope to see you again.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: Right on the Ocean, but not very nice
Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge for a family weekend and like the place, but it was not worth the money.  We did get an ocean front room.  It was clean, but seemed dated and needed some upkeep.    The beach is great, the surf is great, and close.    Would I go back to Laguna, yes, would I go back to this hotel, not for the price.
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to have you and your family stay with us. I‚Äôm glad you enjoyed the cleanliness of your room, and the excellent location. I‚Äôm sorry if you weren‚Äôt happy with the price and upkeep of the room. We offer many quality amenities and a unique experience to set ourselves apart. Our goal is always to ensure you feel comfortable during your stay. I appreciate your feedback and hope you‚Äôll give us another chance to show you why our experience is unmatched.  Sincerely, Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary Heading: We found our new home in Laguna!
Summary: I must admit...I was VERY nervous about staying at this hotel. The revews on Trip Advisor lead me to believe that I would be staying at an over priced, run down property with less than acceptable service. I had no choice - I had pre-payed for the entire 6-day stay July 30 thru Aug 4th in order to take advantage of the (non-refundable) "advance purchase" promotion. Well, I am beyond THRILLED to report that my children & I had the most amazing experience; far more than I could have hoped for: 1) As far as the reports that it's over priced, check out the other beah front properties; Hotel Laguna, etc...They are all a bit pricey. It's Laguna Beach! Pacific Edge room rates are right on par with its neighbors. 2) As far as the service - the staff went above and beyond to make sure
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked a room online and immediately realized that we had made a mistake with the date.  Called within one minute to cancel, was told that no rooms were available for the date that we wanted, and that we would be charged the full room rate of $323 + tax for the canceled night, since we were canceling within less than 72 hours, even though we had made the reservations only a minute before.  In total we spent over an hour trying to resolve this on the phone, and ended up disputing the charge with our card company since we got nowhere with the hotel.  We travel to Laguna Beach several times per year for weekend getaways.  Considering the cost of making a booking error, the inflexibility of  the hotel policies, and the willingness of the hotel to impose such an onerous "gotcha" fee,
Manager Response: So sorry to hear of your frustration - we have followed up with the Online Travel Agent you booked your reservation and they have completed the refund for cancel the reservation - We would welcome an opportunity to have you come to the property and experience it for yourself.  Please dont hesitate to let me know if I can help in any other way  Bill Tremper

Summary: Been staying here ever since I was a young girl some thirty years ago.  Won't be using this hotel any longer though.  It's simply too run down.  A recent makeover occured changing the name and rates.  I had been very hopeful that serious improvements would have been made to the facilty, however all that occured was a facelift...paint, new linens and some new art.  The views are unbeatable.  If you are simply looking for a place to sleep and be literally feet from the beach then this is your place....it simply can't be beat.....if you also want a room to feel relaxed in and that is clean and well maintained then this isn't your place.  It's disappointing that a place that has been part of our lives for over thirty years is now going to be a thing of the past.
Manager Response: I was so sorry to hear that you did not find our rooms appealing as you had in the past. We are constantly working to improve our facility and find many of our current guests love our facilities as well as our spectacular location and great service. We would welcome you back in the future to give us another chance - please let me know if I can help  Bill Tremper

Summary: We absolutely loved our stay. This property is the old Vacation Village which had location, location, location, but had become shabby and dated. Pacific Edge had been beautifully redone in a hip and relaxing classic surf motif. Get a room ON the ocean and listen to the waves all night!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Business Trip Turned Family Junket in Laguna Beach.  Great location.
Summary: I had to go to Orange County on business and when traveling in the OC we've almost always stayed in Newport Beach.  But I had some meetings further south and we'd always wanted to stay in Laguna Beach so this was a perfect time to do it.  The hotel is a short walk down the 1 to the main area of Laguna Beach.  There are two great pools, a game room, and the biggest hot-tub I've ever seen.  We have a full review of the hotel up at our family travel blog FamilyTrek.org which you can check out at http://www.familytrek.org/hotel-review-pacific-edge-hotel-on-laguna-beach/  We'd stay there again, which is always the ultimate measure, right?  We had an older room near the front of the property which was small with our 2 kids and wet bathing suits everywhere.  But for the price it was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Right on the Pacific Ocean Botique Hotel- THE BEST
Summary: I love Pacific Edge, there is nothing better than falling asleep with the sliding door open hearing the waves all night long. The management staff is very helpful and accomading. The hotel is walking distance to the main public beach in Laguna and there are plenty of great shops along the walk. I love the thought of trying something or somewhere new each vacation but when it's this good... why would we! Thank you Pacific Edge!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed at this hotel with family for several nights.  Overall, our experience was just average.  There's nothing major to complain about, but nothing to really rave about either.   We arrived around 1:30 and were told our room wasn't ready yet since check in isn't until 4 pm (even though the information book in the room says 3 pm) and that the front desk could call our cell phones when it was ready.  We returned about an hour later and it was finally ready, even though we never received a phone call. (After returning home at the end of the week, we had a message on the home phone that our room was ready.  Being across the country, this obviously wasn't helpful in any way.)  We had one of the village rooms facing the street.  It was nicely decorated and you could tell
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel, recently taken over by the Joy of LIfe Hotel Corporation,  is a re-make of the old Vacation Village Hotel in Laguna Beach.  The location is great, just a couple blocks from the center of town.  Unfortunately, the renovation did not meet our expectations for this company.  While the check-in was smooth, the rooms appear to be "painted over old  paint".  For a steep price, we had room number 604 overlooking the beach.  While the view was spectacular, the amenities in the room did not measure up.  The bathroom fixtures seem to be the original ones;  noisy and poor drainage.  We did not avail ourselves of the pools or the restaurant, though both seemed to be quite busy.  For families who can afford it, the beach location is perfect if you don't mind that the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was a BIG DUMP! HIGH RATES, FILTHY ROOMS, and BAD SERVICE. Booked my room months in advance, and asked for a ocean front room. I did get ocean front, but I opened my curtain to overlook of the resturant one floor below me, and the gaze of its customers back at me. My kids adjoining room's sliding glass door overlooked the pool, which was also one floor below. I complained, and moved rooms. All they could suffice was a horrid room witha great view of the parking lot. It had gross dirty carpet flooring, an old bathroom with a scary looking ceiling fan and grotesque pink tiles, and a kitchenette with absolutely NO utensils and a sink with a broken water faucet. Shame on you Joie de Vivre to say you remodeled your rooms. My son called your place the "Bates Motel !" Never,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I traveled down from hollywood to extend our family vacation for a couple days on the beach and this hotel provided the worst experience ever and I wanted to go home.  If I didn't prepay I would have canceled and gone back to LA.  The room was small, it smelled musty, and faced the street.  I was not aware all the bldgs are separate from each other.  You have to walk across an alley to get to the pool/hot tub and beach access and restaurants.  Towels were never in stock.  The only good thing to say is the guys on the beach were attentive to your requests for chairs/umbrella or whatever you needed.  The beach must be close to a sewer drain cause it constantly smelled like sewer. The room had fresh paint but I felt like I needed to keep my shoes on, the rug looked and felt gross.
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience, our beach front property is indeed older and we are continually making property improvements.  We hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary: This is an old Hotel that has been recently updated with a great beach. It is just far enough away from the crowds of Main Beach and close enough to walk to everything. You can book a stay and for a little more you may bring your pet (but you can not leave it unattended in the room). Staff was very friendly and always helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your sincere remarks about the Pacific Edge Hotel!  We appreciate the reviews and I hope that you will return for another visit soon!

Summary: This is an old property that has been remodeled but that just means new paint and bedding.  The room itself is very small and cramped.  If you don't get an ocean front room, the only window was the sliding glass door which opens onto the walkway, so if you open your curtain for light you will have no privacy as everyone walks by to get to their rooms.  The only draw for this hotel is that it is on the beach, and for that reason they charge High Premium Prices - $250+ per night, PLUS $20 Parking.  With taxes, you'll walk out spending $300 for your night's stay.  Problem is, Check In time is 4 PM and Check Out time is 11 AM, so although you're right on the beach, there is no time to GO to the beach within your stay.  AND if you decide to stay on the beach after you've checked out,
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Pacific Edge. I want to apologize for your disappointment. We have been upgrading both the facilities and the service in our effort to create an experience that is unique to Laguna Beach and to Joie de Vivre Hospitality. We still have some last touches to do but I'm convinced that we will have the same great location you have always enjoyed, but with the added comfort of friendly service and great beach amenities.

Summary: My wife and I travel often and I will say that we will never return to the Pacific Edge Hotel. We've stayed at several JDV properties and am not sure we will be considering them in the future.. Our stay started on the weekend of the 4th of July; we were there visiting my family that lives in Laguna Beach.  Upon our arrival we found out that the room they had booked us in had a conference table in the middle in the living room..I will say that the front desk people were helpful and responsive..having the table removed and a couple chairs in it's place. The hotel itself was not bad, everything was clean, nice pool and great beach in front..  Now this is where our stay went sideways. We were in the process of packing up when my wife asked if I had moved the car, which I hadn‚Äôt.  I
Manager Response: We are so sorry for any inconvenience caused by the towing of your car, certianly we do not make this a common practice and if we had just known who the owner of the car was we would not have removed it from our valet drive. We had blocked the car in with cones and left notes for two days but becuase this area is a fire lane we were ultimately forced to have the car removed as we thought it was abandoned.  Your interactions with our staff as described are not what most recieve and I must apologize as it is certainly not the way we want anyone to experience as a guest of our hotel. As you can tell from our other reviews this is not the norm as we strive to be a very friendly hotel.   It appears as though aside from the car incident that the rest of your stay was positive and that you truly enjoyed our location and our staff as a whole. Hopefully you will be able to see this as an isolated incident and will give us another chance in the future.   I am happy to discuss furhter with you at your convinience.  Regards  Bill Tremper General Manager

Summary: This was a family reunion from the Grandparents to our kids and grandkids. We had very comfortable rooms, well furnished and more than adejuate. Location, right on the beach, balconies, swimming pool and spa, play room for kids 4 - 18, and the usual other amenities. What really was outstanding was the service. I've never experienced such over all service of this calibur from an entire staff. Yes there are always one or two that stand out, but everyone, I mean everyone was exremely professional, knowledgeable and practically bending over backwards to please you. Not just at check-in, but, house keeping, room service, the guys handling the beach towels, chairs and umbrellas and especially the Valet guys. They never stopped running and couldn't get your car fast enough for you or
Manager Response: Thank you so much for  your kind remarks about the Pacific Edge!  It is great to hear that you enjoyed your stay and it is much appreciated.  I hope that you come visit us again soon!

Summary: Can't beat the location, but staff could have been a little more responsive. We reserved and paid for a room for two adults and two children.
