We also reserved and paid for a room with a kitchen. Why did we have only two bath towels and no plates, utensils, or kitchenware of any kind? Other than a coffee pot, absolutely bare. When we called the front desk to send us plates, pots, forks, etc. we were told that we were supposed to ask for this in advance!! I thought when you ask for a kitchen you shouldn't have to ask for plates or a glass to drink water out of. We finally got some basic stuff, just go to the Ralph's market for cleaning utensils and paper towels.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments.  I have to apologize for the service you received during your stay.  We are continually doing upgrades to not only our property, but also our service as well.  I hope that this stay has not tarnished your view of our property as a whole and if you do return to Laguna Beach, you give us another try!

Summary Heading: First Time here and will definitely come back!
Summary: Me and my husband wanted a few days of relaxation, so we brought our books for peace and quiet.  Yes the buildings look little dated and obviously they are in the process of renovating.  We checked in and the staff was cheerful and customer service oriented.  Valet service is $20 per day, which was okay, since manuevering a car in the spaces would be a little much for us.  We didn't need our car as we stayed put the entire time.  We reserved an ocean front room, were we wowed by the pounding surf. We dined at the beach house, which we enjoyed, especially with the view of the ocean.  We went to the Orange Inn in the am for espresso and received a 10% discount for showing our room key.  Same at Thai Bros restaurant, which was great too. We enjoyed food at the Taco Loco across the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your amazing comments about our property!  It is great to hear that you had a fabulous time with us and that you will be returning again.  We will be continuing our efforts to enhance every guests' experience with room upgrades and renovations throughout the years to our 60 year old property.  I hope to see you again soon!

Summary: I had booked a Beachfront King room, but upon arrival, I was informed there was broken glass in the room allocated to me and I was downgraded. To the credit of the hotel, they offered a 50% discount on the room rate and complimentary dinner or breakfast. It was disappointing to say the least as I had planned well ahead to make this a romantic beach getaway for me & my girlfriend. There was little use in complaining as there was nothing that could be done about it, but my plans & hopes had been destroyed which made for a very disappointing stay. The room itself gave an aura of 1950s surfie style studio apartment (think pastel pink electric stove & pastel paintwork) that had been poorly converted into a hotel room. It was more miss than hit, although the bed was relatively
Manager Response: Thank you for commenting on our Trip Advisor site.  I do apologize for the inconvenience.  It is definitely not a common occurrence at our property, but special circumstances and maintenance issues do arise that force us to place guests in different accommodations.  We try to assist each and every guest to the best of our ability.  I hope that this past stay has not tarnished  your view of the hotel as a whole and I hope that if you do return to Laguna Beach, you give us another try!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding we were in town for.  We were excited to be close to the beach and the pictures on the website looked veyr nice.  Knowing what we know about the Joie de Vivre Hotel Group, we thought we were due for a fantastic experience.   This hotel is terribly overpriced for what it offers.  The rooms are terribly outdated and painted in horrible pastel colors.  The lighting is inconsistent. The ocean view is of seaweed (could be the time of year we were there, not sure) and the beach space for the hotel is tiny and therefore cramped.  They also charge $25 a day to keep a car on the property.  When it is time to check out, they send hotel security around to make sure you are vacating your room at the specified time.  The rooms are just terribly
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Pacific Edge. I want to apologize for your disappointment. We have been upgrading both the facilities and the service in our effort to create an experience that is unique to Laguna Beach and to Joie de Vivre Hospitality. We still have some last touches to do but I'm convinced that we will have the same great location you have always enjoyed, but with the added comfort of friendly service and great beach amenities.

Summary: Location is all they have going. Over priced. Poor service.  I have never seen so many complaints and requests for pool towels.  If you don't want to provide towels just tell guests before they come so we can bring out own, but for. 300.00 a night on the beach own would expect plenty of room/pool/ocean towels.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments.  I do understand your frustration with the unavailability of towels in the pool/beach area.  We are doing what we can to ensure that all of our guests have all these amenities available to them.  I am convinced that we will be able to accommodate all our guests on your next visit to Laguna.

Summary Heading: We stay when the rates are reasonable
Summary: One of our primary reasons for comming to SoCal is to enjoy the sound of the waves, so we like the ocean-front rooms at this hotel when the price is right.  New ownership put up new paint (nice), new flat-screens (not really necessary - old t.v.'s were just as good and did not take up needed or useful space in the rooms), some new surf-oriented decor (nice), and, sadly, changed parking to valet.  We know, there was a problem with non-guests parking in the lot prior, but still kind of annoying to give car to valet to have him park it right behind your room while you walk down the alley behind him.  We just make sure we bring a second set of keys to avoid the need to walk to the valet stand to get items from the car.  Unfortunately, it does not appear that new ownership did much
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your wonderful sincere comments about your previous stay!  Joie de Vivre Hospitality prides themselves on establishing lasting relationships with all of our guests.  We will continue to do upgrades to our 60 year old property and I hope on your next stay with us in September that it will be that much more enjoyable!

Summary Heading: Definitely NOT DOG FRIENDLY, not going back
Summary: We booked this hotel  for a couple of nights and we decided to bring our dog thinking this hotel was pet friendly like ShoreBreak in Huntington. The first night we booked the Village Room which was like a motel 6 room with a strange odor, horrible!, also we requested ice but it was never brought to the room. The second night we decided to upgrade to a partial ocean view, a little better but still very old and with the same odor. On their web they say they are pet friendly but once you check in they make you sign a paper regarding their pet policy not where to be found on their web. We couldn't leave our dog in the bedroom while we were not in and unfortunately you couldnt take pur dog to any restaurant, shop etc... so we ended up carrying around the dog in the car all day long.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments.  Pacific Edge, as Shorebreak is completely pet-friendly, but there are restrictions to having pets in the room.  Pets do have to be placed in a kennel if left alone in the room for the safety of the pet as well as the owner.  I apologize for the inconveniences you encountered during your stay.  We are making continual upgrades to not only our property, but also our services.  I am convinced that if you do decide to stay with us again, the experience will be much more enjoyable.

Summary: My husband and I just came home from Laguna Beach.  The Pacific Edge Hotel was fantastic!  We stayed in a beach front room.  There is nothing like waking up and falling asleep to the sound of the waves crashing right outside your door.  The room was clean and very comfortable.  The Beach House Restaurant was also great...try the granola crusted french toast!  I heard the parking was a little on the expensive side, but the majority of the restaurants and shopping are within walking distance.  We will definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great comments!  We appreciate your thoughts and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: We had a great one night stay here.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Here's the quick negative:  The pool area blows.  It does not have a ocean view.  It doesn't have an ocean anything.  It's LOUD as it's below street level and it acts like a wind tunnel, maginifying the noise incredibly.  Okay, the good.  We got a junior suite in the Reef Tower.  More expensive, sure, but wow...perfect view.  We looked out at the ocean, slept to the sounds of waves crasing below. Not looking over a parking lot, over a pool to the ocean. Right to the ocean.  It was amazing.  We chilled at the breach.  Ordered room service and ate it on the huge balcony.    Make sure you get " beach front rooms" - then ask for the Reef Tower.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great comments!  We appreciate your thoughts and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: The first thing I noticed when checking in was that they were selling copies of the iconic surf film "Endless Summer" in the lobby. And that is the vibe this casual-friendly hotel creates. The location could not be better--right in the middle of town, but on the beach side of Pacific Coast Highway. Once you park your car, you can walk everywhere you need to go from the hotel or take once of Laguna's local shuttle buses.   We were enjoying their special (that is good through the end of 2011) of $100 credit to use on your room rate or other hotel services if you book your room the week of your birthday (you have to show your ID at check-in). So that helped make our stay extra affordable.  The room we had was spacious and comfortable, simply decorated with sunny colors and a
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments!  It is great to hear that you enjoyed our casual surf culture and understand what the Joie de Vivre brand represents!  We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: We absolutely enjoyed our stay at Pacific Edge and will definitely be back!
Summary: My husband and I enjoyed our 1st wedding anniversary at Pacific Edge and the ocean view from our deck was absolutely breathtaking!  The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful!  The hotel is centrally located to all the shops and restaurants in the area and there is valet parking readily available 24 hours a day for your convenience.   We are already planning our second trip to Pacific Edge!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your great comments!  We appreciate your thoughts and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: This hotel is way overpriced. Their website doesn't let you know that many of the more affordable rooms are right beside the noisy Pacific Coast Highway.  The rooms overlooking the ocean are in a good location, but are not worth the hundreds of dollars more per night that the hotel charges for them. I think the scam the hotel hopes for is that guests book the cheaper rooms (not knowing in advance that the rooms are beside the Highway) and then feel compelled to pay the additional $100 per night charge to change to a room with a decent location.  Add on the costs of the compulsory valet parking and this place starts to become way pricier than the quality of the rooms warrant.   There was no tea service in the rooms. This is a pretty major oversight. Almost every other hotel,
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience, our beach front property is indeed older and we are continually making property improvements.  We hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary Heading: Big mistake... had to leave in less than 1 hour.
Summary: The web site has some nice pictures, the pictures very well trimmed they are making it seem much nicer than it is...     we couldn't believe so we brought them up on the computer while standing in the room.  But, the carpet smelled, the deck was right above rocks, no hot water, parts of the plumbing coming out of the wall.  Pool was not situated well.  It is a well painted over mortar brick old syle building that is has parts physically separated with an alley in between.  It was too much for us, so we decided to leave in about 30-45 minutes and stayed at our usual place near Fashion Island.  Still had to pay over $100 for leaving in less than 1 hour.
Manager Response: I apologize for your experience, our beach front property is indeed older and we are continually making property improvements.  We hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary Heading: If you want a tranquil room, skip this hotel
Summary: Knowing how expensive Laguna is, I wasn't expecting a lot but an Econolodge trumps this place. The walls were painted in the most vivid colors...wild turquoise and screaming chartreuse in the bedroom which did not lead to relaxation and an even brighter yellow in the bathroom. The night stand had crumbs on it and the room hadn't been vacuumed however because of this I did get a nice bottle of perfume that was left under the bedskirt. We were not advised of the $20/day mandatory valet charge and the "garden view" was looking at an alley.  The "kitchenette" was a small frig in the closet.  On a positive note it was a good location within walking distance of downtown and right on the beach. Nice breakfast next door at The Beach House and did get a discount because of our stay at
Manager Response: none

Summary: My opinion,  book this hotel and pop for an ocean front room. No charge for pets and Laguna Beach is open to dogs on the beach all day from sept- june 15. After that there are limitations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My friends and I just spent the weekend here and had an overall great time. I was a bit disappointed that the rooms and hotel didn't quite match up to what the website photos portrayed, but the beds were comfy, the shower worked just fine, and there is a small fridge in the room which was convenient for our needs. Our first room did have a bad odor in it, but the Front Desk kindly moved us to another, which had no smell and was just fine.  It was facing PCH so while it was fun to people watch, the traffic makes it a bit noisy. And when the club across the street closes around 2am, there is quite a bit of noise from drunksters. This is no issue if you're planning to be at the club or out late, but if you're a light sleeper, request a room away from the street. The best part of
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel's website is fabulous - we could not wait to get there to check in based on how it looked.  Once we did, immediate disappointment.  First of all, it was more of a "motor lodge" type of place.  Even though the proximity to the beach was fabulous - it was kind of a dumpy hotel.  It tried, but really missed the mark in almost every facet.    The first room we were given was horrible, like a prison cell that was decorated.  It had an old sliding glass door next to the bed that opened to the main walkway to the other rooms -scary.  We immediately complained for something else, at which time we were told it was oversold.  But, they happened to have a partial ocean view we could pay to upgrade to - so we did.  It was much nicer, but still - underwhelmed , especially for the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good location, hotel rundown and tacky
Summary: Read the reviews and this hotel sounded nice. No so nice in realtiy.  The hallway to our room was very smelly, old outdoor carpeting.  The room has fresh paint but that's about all.  Doors slamming in the hallway shook the room. Old windows rattled and light covers in the ceiling were loose and rattled.  If we could have gotten a refund, we would have left immediately.  Yuck!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our first trip to the hotel.  We were right on the beach and the view was spectacular.  The peacefulness of the room/hotel made for a tranquil weekend.  The private beach was ideal.  The boutique resort offered superb service and the quaint atmosphere was ideal.  We walked to dinner and had breakfast/coffee at the bungalow next door.  They offer a special to the local gym which made for the complete getaway for us..not that the run on beach could be beat.  We highly recommend the hotel - great location, service and ambience all rolled into one!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the 2nd Year we decided to get together as a family and celebrate Mother's Day. The Pacific Edge rooms come with kitchens (which is why we choose it) but you need to request all the kitchen supplies, microwave...etc Our major complaint is the "new valet" parking. You must valet your car; unload all your vacation baggage, beach toys, food, drinks etc at the valet parking area and carry it all to your room. It is a small area and with every one checking In and Out there was not enough help me with all I brought. It was frustrating and a total inconvenience. I do not mind the daily 20.00 charge but why can‚Äôt we park our car by our room and unload our stuff and why do we have to valet every time we leave the hotel, put a daily sticker on the car. It is crazy and a hassle;
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just went to check out this hotel. The check in area was ok. The rooms were absolutely horrible. The Junior Suite with the Ocean View room was dirty and old looking. The pics on their website are deceiving. It looked like a motel. The entire hotel smelled like cat pee and I'm not sure why anyone stays in this hotel.   I cancelled my reservation and decided to stick with The Inn at the Laguna. I've been there twice and it is definitely a much better place to stay in Laguna. It's clean, great service and wonderful view.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Pacific Edge. I am so sorry about your disappointment. We have been upgrading both the facilities and the service in our effort to create an experience that is unique to Laguna Beach. We continue to add touches to enhance guests experiences but am truly sorry that we did not meet your expectations.   We are checking on the condition of the room you stayed in and assure you that its condition is not consistent with all of the rooms here at the Pacific Edge and I assure you that the smell you may have encountered was an isolated incident.

Summary: Long time guest but was so very disappointed.  Stayed on the front deck and it was filled with other guests when in the past it has been private.  The kitchen was removed and there was not even a sink at the bar area.  Used bathtub to get water.  Only six small drawers for front and back bedrooms.  Deck was taken over by guests from the back rooms who paid so much less but wanted the daytime and sunset ocean view. No medicine cabinet in bathroom.  Such a far cry from the paradise rooms they used to be.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you stay here, upgrade to a room with an ocean view. Nothing better than waking up to the sound of the ocean. Very colorful, comfortable room. Clean.  Friendly staff and valet guys are very accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic View of the Ocean & Beautiful Sunsets in a Cool & Casual Setting
Summary: Stayed here for a weekend getaway and had a very nice relaxing time.  Our room faced the ocean and the sound of the water was just so relaxing.  Staff was friendly and casual which fit the setting.  Had lots of interactions with valet drivers who were always very pleasant.  On arrival the room was missing towels and the phone didn't work.  Then the next day we called for an iron and board and was told they are standard in the room, yet ther was none.  Other than those small issues everything was wonderful.  Hotel is close to town and within walking distance which is great at night.  Recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a toughie because I perhaps expected more than I should have. Driving up to the place it had a great vibe and look, and the staff was really pleasant.  The fact is that if you dont get the oceanfront room, the room themselves are sort of small and overlook an alley or the street with maybe a slight hint of an ocean view between trees and buildings.  I think negative reviews are based because of expectations.  I do have to say walking up the room, there was a funky smell that even my teenage kids mentioned and they are pretty laid back.  The room had the same sort of smell. musty maybe?  The room decor was pretty cool I have to say with a newish surf vibe.  The airconditioner really didnt do much but the evenings were cool so an open balcony door did the trick.  The rooms
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This hotel is not black-hispanic friendly
Summary: Wedding party of 10 we reserved 1 room for 2 days we arrived early on thursday, the bride was given the room numbers for the guest so we could all be grouped together we arrived early on thursday & we requested the surfside & we were told "OH NO YOU CANT HAVE THAT ROOM" they are all booked...after the bride was given the rooms we could have. Well we were put as close to the street as possible it was like slepping under the freeway..terrible... well the ceremony came & time for dinner & one of the server REFUSED TO SERVE MY HUSBAND, because he's black i was shocked, of course she didnt say that but the fact when it was time to serve him she served the person behind him & then she put the utensils down & turned her face to ignore him, of course he did not move until finaly
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is more like a motel. There was only air in the living room, and so the rooms were so hot and stuffy. The floors were very dirty, and the maid came kept stopping by to clean. Even though we said we had late check out. The location and beach deck are the only good things I can say about this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Pacific Edge.  We appreciate your business and your feedback.  The hotel has a lot of history in Laguna Beach.  Keeping with the original design, we continue to enhance the amenities and service to create unique Laguna Beach experiences.

Summary: I have lived in Southern California for 40 years and never have explored Laguna Beach. My wife, myself, and two girls ages 15 and 9 stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel. We just randomly chose this hotel. To our delight the hotel was Killer. It is right on the beach. We stayed in room a double room on the main floor that had a king bed in one room and two kings in the back room ( the girls room ) both rooms had TV's. The staff was the most friendliest hotel staff I have ever dealt with. We needed more towels and I swear it only took 2 minutes MAX to get them. There is a restaraunt next door that delivers room service, they make a good breakfast for around 7 bucks delivered to your room. The beds in this hotel were without a doubt the best hotel beds I have ever slept in. Our bed had
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Pacific Edge and sharing your positive comments.  As we approach the summer season we look forward to accommodating lots more families and know they will also enjoy the experience.

Summary: My husband and I spent the weekend at Pacific Edge for our anniversary.  We got the ocean view room in the Reef Building and we were not disappointed with the choice.  They put a little cake in our room and made us feel very welcome.  The front desk was extremely attentive and even called to ensure we liked our room.  We made our reservations the same day for the Beach House restaurant (next door) and we had an amazing dinner with stellar wine and service.  I loved how close we were to the village and shopping.  Oh by the way, beware the fritatta for breakfast room service...ugh.    For the room we paid $170/night using a coupon code, that being said, I don't know that I would be as impressed if we had paid full price.  There were certain things about the room I was willing to
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Pacific Edge and for sharing your comments.  I'm so glad you enjoyed the view and that our staff was attentive and friendly.  We continue to upgrade our rooms and enhance our services.  Each time your return, I'm sure you will experience and even greater stay and a great value.

Summary: This little 3 star secret jewel of a hotel needs to be re-discovered by everyone. After going extensive renovation, I personally give it a 3 1/2 stars. The beach is rocky, but we saw many, many surfers taking advantage of the waves  and other people of all ages swimming. We even saw a couple of wedding parties on the beach taking pictures, the view is stunning. The hotel is pet friendly and dogs are allowed on the beach, except in the summer time. I saw 7-8 dolphins from my balcony one early morning‚Ä¶.a sight that is not unusual from what  I heard. The service by the front desk staff is friendly and easy.  The rooms are vibrant and cheerful, the beds are very comfortable that even I, with my back problems had 2 solid good nights of sleep.   I highly recommend a corner ocean front
Manager Response: none

Summary: The front desk staff was great.  We upgraded to an oceanfront room and it was incredible.  The waves came right up under the balcony and it was like you were in the middle of the water.  So peaceful and nice.  I can't brag enough about this place and can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: You made my day!  I am so glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your return.

Summary: Place was very nice.  If it had been a warmer evening I would have used the pool & spa.  It was just steps away from the beach.  A little noisy though.  Could here people walking down the halls above our room.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Pacific Edge.  We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Can't get any closer to the beach!
Summary: We chose the Pac Edge because it was the most reasonably priced beachfront hotel. We were not disappointed.  We were in the building called "The Reef", which is so close to the ocean that the water reaches the building at high tide. It is certainly not a new building, but our room was decorated beautifully (my husband said it looked like something on HGTV) and was quite comfortable.  It would have been nice to have a real closet, but if we had to choose between the ocean and the closet, we'll take the ocean.  We spent a lot of time on our balcony just listening to the waves and watching the sea.  And the welcome bottle of wine - - nice touch.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Pacific Edge and for sharing your comments.  We appreciate your business and are so pleased you enjoyed the experience.  Each day we work hard to balance great friendly service, comfortable accommodations, and an excellent location.  It sounds like you truly had a unique Laguna Beach experience and we can't wait for your return.

Summary Heading: Love the location, new owners need to realize their limitations.
Summary: Stayed at the Pacific Edge for the second time in two trips to Laguna Beach since 2008 and I did notice some changes with the new ownership.  First they have brightened up the place with a good paint job, nice color scheme. Second they have implemented Valet only parking which I do not care for.  They charged 12 dollars a day in 2008 but you parked your own car.  In 2011 they now charge 20 dollars a day with Valet. I generally come and go quite a bit and I feel pressure to tip every time which makes the parking amount per day expensive in my opinion.  I also do not need help with every bag from the store I am young enough to still be able to easily take care of myself and while i am able I like to do so.  Third  You now have to call the front desk to get ice brought to you.  we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The recent re-model makes it all the more beautiful and fun!
Summary: Wonderful room right over the waves! Friendly staff! Quiet and clean -- a great get away for a romantic weekend! Ask for anything - they are more than happy to oblige to your every whim..
Manager Response: I am so glad you enjoyed the remodeled rooms ... more importantly ... I'm ever greatful for your comments about our team ... they do make a difference!  Erik

Summary Heading: Awesome experience at a great hotel
Summary: This is a really cool beach / surf hotel.  The rooms are cool, hip and much nicer than one might expect when you are literally feet away from the ocean.  The staff was exceptional as well.  I would come back here in a second.
Manager Response: Thank you!  I'll share your great comments with our team!  We look forward to your return.

Summary: This place wasn't cheap, but it was so worth it! Got an oceanfront room on the top floor of the hotel - asked for an end room so we wouldn't share many walls with other rooms, and got it. Balcony with a couple of lounge chairs were wonderful for watching the sunrise and set. Free wifi in room, kitchenette with sink and fridge, bed very comfy and big. Free gym use at a gym a few blocks away, nice outdoor pool and hot-tub on site. Parking is all valet and around $20. Overall, well worth the splurge - was an amazing spot to stay in Laguna!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My fiance' and I stayed at the Pacific Edge Hotel for Valentine's Day this year, let me say it was nothing but amazing from start to finish.  We arrived early in Laguna about two hours before check-in so we decided that we would walk on the beach for a while. We decided to ask the hotel if we would be able to park our car in their valet parking, even though we were early so we wouldn't have to pay the meters ever hour, they were more then happy to accept our car, the valet staff were so friendly, and FAST! After my fiance and I enjoyed a long walk on the beach, we went up to check in to the hotel.  The staff at the front desk was just incredible. Not only was she very friendly, but she actually gave us an option of what room we wanted, we got to choose the side of the hotel and
Manager Response: Thanks for your wonderful comments and for staying at the Pacific Edge ... I'm pleased the team created such a memorable experience.  Congrats to you and your fiance ... we look forward to you spending many anniversaries at the Pacific Edge.

Summary Heading: Exceeded my expectations...absolutely a great place to stay and eat!
Summary: Room was perfect. Very large and with the mini kitchen, desk,  dressing room, perfect bed, three pillows and very nice bath. Could not believe they had a Keurig coffee maker and the exact Donut Shop coffee I drink at home every morning. Ocean view was wonderful and people were very nice everywhere in the whole complex. The food presentation and taste was without question everything I could have asked for! I was a little worried about how the Valet parking would work but it was very esay the way they had a single pickup and dropoff location. Very private and I felt very safe at this Hotel and in the entire complex. The beach view room had an awesome wood deck and very nice outdoor furniture too.  I mean you are just feet away from the ocean. Beautiful sunsets! Would go here over
Manager Response: Thank you!  I'm so excited that we exceeded your expectations and our new services and amenities worked well for you.  We keep on looking for ways to enhance the experience yet ... keep it local and personal.    We look forward to your return.

Summary: My wife and I stayed in oceanfront room and had an outstanding experience. The front office staff provides first class service; the rooms are very clean, the ocean view is spectacular, the location is excellent, just walking distance to shops and restaurants. This is our second time staying at Pacific Edge Hotel, already planning third trip. Highly recommend, you will not be disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and for staying at the Pacific Edge.  We know the importance of service and I'm glad our team met your expectations.  Combined with a great location, we are striving to create the ultimate Laguna Beach experience.  We look forward to your 3rd return.

Summary: We arrived on Tues Morning and we were able to go to our room upon arrival.  The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable! But, what we enjoyed the most was the view! We were right on the Beach! If we were any closer we would have gotten wet. The dolphins were jumping when we arrived and the lights of the city were shining at night time. We were able to bring our little dog and walk on the beach at any time. All of the restaurants and shop are within a few blocks. We highly recommend this hotel and will return!
Manager Response: Thanks for staying at the Pacific Edge ... Perfect timing to see the dolphins.  We are pleased to have you as our guests and look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Perfect venue for a business meeting while mixing in some fun.
Summary: Our entire group of 12 people had ocean front rooms with balconies right above the sand. Views were amazing and the rooms we were in were recently updated. The food from the Beach House next door was very good throughout our 3 days of meetings. Very close to town, literally on the beach and the service from the manager to the staff was great. I plan to return with the family.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: the great location is the only thing good we found
Summary: unless you get a waterfront room i would give this a miss. the hotel is dated and lacking facilities athough the reception staff were very friendy and helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was lucky enought to spend a few nights at this newly remodeled hotel. The staff was friendly , helpful and knowledgable. My room was the ocean front with kitchenette. Just perfect for relaxing and falling asleep to the sound of the waves. Bed was so comfortable, they even have a pillow menu! I almost didn't need to leave the room, the balcony had chairs to watch the beautiful coast.  Very convienent to a grocery store and lots of dining options. You even get a discount at many of the local businesses when you show your room card. I could go on and on, I will definiatly plan a 5-7 night stay this year.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Pacific Edge and for sharing the positive comments ... I'm so glad you enjoyed your stay and can't wait for your return.

Summary: The hotel was kind of a like an average Best Western right on the beach. Although the real Best Western across the street from us looked nicer from the outside. My friend booked a 2 bedroom apartment with a kitchen. We got there around 5 and it still wasn't ready so we moved to an ocean front room at the same rate with one bedroom with no kitchen, although the woman at the front desk told us it would have a kitchen Because of this discrepancy they took $150 off the price and sent us a free breakfast. Only then the room was worth it. The room was decorated with IKEA furniture and they left the tags on so that is how I know. I don't mind IKEA but I have that stuff at home. If I am going to pay over 300 a night for a room I want nicer stuff. Also the stopper in the sink kept
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Pacific Edge and for sharing your comments.  Your positive comments about are location are appreciated but I must apologize that your preferred room type was not available upon arrival.  In addition, I am sharing your concern about special requests with our team ... it's important that our service compliments the location.  This was definitely not our standard.  We look forward to your next arrival and to giving you the level of service we pride ourselves on.

Summary: It's 7:40 pm and we just finished dinner at 230 forest and it was exceptional. My wife and I have been on our honeymoon in California for a week now and have been enjoying every minute.   We are sitting on the balcony of our reef wing balcony and are in heaven. The location of this hotel is it's best asset. The rooms are very clean and I have no complaints but if it were 30$ more a night and was more modern it would be a 10/10. I love the surf theme an surf statue outside our room. The staff are very very nice and I appreciate it very much. Laguna beach is my favorite stop so far and when I return, it will most surely be here.
Manager Response: Congratulations on your marriage!  Thank you for chosing the Pacific Edge as your honeymoon spot.  We're so excited you are enjoying your stay and hope you will return on your anniversary.

Summary Heading: Great little place to stay, unbeatable ocean views!
Summary: I made a reservation for an ocean view room for New Year's Eve prior to reading the reviews on TripAdvisor.  Once I did read some of these reviews, I started to get super nervous and was rethinking my decision to stay here.  But my experience at this hotel was awesome and I felt compelled to write a review, which I have never done before.   I found the staff to be really friendly and helpful.  I had called ahead of time to request the Reef building which I had read was the quietest since it was the furthest away from the pool.  They were more than happy to switch my room and put me in the Reef building.  At check-in they were really helpful in giving directions for the surrounding area.  Even the valet was really friendly.    Our room was completely amazing, especially the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments.  Above and beyond our location and facilities, we are most proud of our service team ... thank you for highlighting their efforts.  We look forward to your return in the summer.

Summary: We spent a long weekend at Pacific Edge for my mom's 65th birthday and my son's 14th.  We got two ocean view rooms that were spectacular.  You cannot beat the location and view here.  You are literally right on the beach.   We saw dolphins from our balcony and fell asleep to the waves crashing at night.  The staff at the Pacific Edge are wonderful.  They surprised us with flowers & other treats since they knew we were celebrating two birthdays, and whenever we called for ice it arrived prompty and with a smile.  I have not stayed in any other room categories, so I cannot comment on them, but if you pay the extra for an oceanfront room, you will not be disappointed!  Thank you Pacific Edge and staff for a memorable birthday weekend!
Manager Response: Happy Birthday to your Mom and Son.  Thank you for celebrating at the Pacific Edge.  We're pleased to have made it special.

Summary: when we first pulled up i was a little nervous because the front of the hotel has no curb appeal whatsoever. But we were given a suite with ocean views and as soon as we walked in it took my breath away. the room has a boutique feel to it- nicely decorated but its the ocean view that takes center stage. (if i didn't have an ocean facing room i wouldn't recommend this hotel). when you are laying in bed with the shades open you feel like your on a cruise because all you see is ocean around you. my kids loved the beach as well as the pool. we all loved sitting on the balcony watching the sunset. it was overall a great stay.
Manager Response: We are so pleased you and your family had an enjoyable stay.  Having a hotel right on the beach ensures all guests can enjoy beach access no matter which way their room is facing ... we hope to see you return soon.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel on a trip from San Fransisco, having stayed at several hotels on the way, some more expensive some less. This hotel was appalling, we upgraded our room to look at the sea rather than road and carpark, we were refunded this cost. We were also refunded some of the cost of the stay, but in my mind it wasn't enough. The carpets were filthy, there was rust everywhere, we had to carry suitcases down 2 flights of broken concrete steps. The wardrobe was a rail over the fridge. I could go on and on .....
Manager Response: Great news ... we are upgrading ... Thank you for your feedback.  I'm sorry you were dissapointed but can assure you that future guests will enjoy an enhanced experience.  Combining our great location, friendly service and new look, we are working hard to create the unique Laguna Beach experience.  We hope you will come back in the future to re-experience the Pacific Edge.

Summary Heading: Saddened by the decline of Pacific Edge
Summary: First let me say that I have been staying at Pacific Edge for many years going back to when it was Vacation Village. The last time that I was there in October I was so saddened and disappointed to see how run down the property had become. 1. Bugs in the first room that I was given.  2. Elevators did not work and no one seem to care. 3. Ice machines unavailbale you had to call the front desk to have ice delivered. 3. Mandatory valet parking and fee PLUS TAX. 4. The old furniture was painted and the new stuff was IKEA. They raised the rates and the quality and cleanliness went downhill.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay at the Pacific Edge.  I am so sorry about your dissapointment.  We have been upgrading both the facilities and the service in our effort to create an experience that is unique to Laguna Beach.  We still have some last touches to do but I'm convinced upon your return that the same great location you have always enjoyed will be complimened by friendly service and great beach amenities.

Summary: We hadn't made reservations here, because we were unsure of our arrival date. The website looked great, though, so we took a chance and just dropped by to see if they had availability.    Wow! Am I glad we didn't make a reservation. The two rooms we were shown were not made up, but they were disgusting anyway. They looked like 50's motel rooms that hadn't ever been upgraded.  Seriously, we were taken aback, given the photos on the website. One of the rooms had a "kitchenette", but it didn't have a single plate or utensil. Very useful. We walked in and walked out and never looked back! We would never never stay at this place! By the way, we found another hotel just a block or two away...on the beach. We were given a beautiful suite with kitchen, fully and thoughtfully furnished
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback ... I'm so sorry we did not have a chance to host your stay and to have you experience the most friendly service in all of Laguna Beach.  Should you be returning, I hope you will have a chance to stop by and see our upgraded facilities.

Summary Heading: Wish I could have stayed longer
Summary: It's been over a year since staying at the Pacific Edge.  Upon my return it was great to see the fresh colors, new pool furniture, and deck.  The new valet parking added convenience and it was great to have the food and beverage option of the Beach House.   What hasn't changed are the incredible location, smiles, can-do attitude, and the instant feeling of being relaxed from the moment we arrived.  We stayed in the building next to the lobby.  We had a glimpse of the Pacific Ocean which was nice but there was no need to sit in our rooms.  The beach is right there!  With perfect weather, we arranged for Paddle Board lessons through Costa Azul.  The shop is right next door to the hotel and Rod the owner took great care in teaching my sons and me.  We also had a chance to enjoy
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Pacific Edge last Saturday night, and thought it was way beyond what we expected for the price.  $149.00 for an ocean view room, with an VERY comfortable king size bed.  It's not a Four Seasons, but the view and cleanliness make up for it.   The staff was great and we were within walking distance of several great restaurants.  We really enjoyed it and will return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments, we are happy that you enjoyed your visit!

Summary: The only good thing about the hotel is the view. The service was like in a third world country. Had to call for service over two hours for a response. Everything in the room was old and dilapidated.
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Pacific Edge I want to thank you for taking the time to complete the customer satisfaction survey. I wanted to follow up with you personally, as you are a most valued client and I appreciate receiving your feedback.  First of all, I would like to apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your visit. Please accept my sincere apologies  At Joie de Vivre Hospitality we pride ourselves in providing unique hospitality experiences and superior service. Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. It is important to us that we take the feedback given to us by our guests as a tool to improve so that we continue to exceed your expectations.  Please feel free to call me directly at kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com if I can ever be of assistance.  Warm Regards,  Kurt Bjorkman

Summary Heading: Good location, Okay if you keep your expectations low, "Lipstick on a pig"
Summary: My wife and I were in Laguna from L.A. to attend a wedding at Pacific Edge. We only live an hour away but decided to get a room for the night to relax and make it a mini vacation at the beach.  I was skeptical when I first saw the outside but I gained some confidence when I saw the brightly renovated lobby. I was quickly disappointed again as we walked to our room. The pool/hot tub area was dated and looked like it belonged in a cheap L.A. apartment complex. A mismatched and rusted staircase took us up to our room which was a "Village View". The tiny room was freshly painted, had new carpet, and was fairly clean, but it was hot and stuffy. The air conditioner was a noisy old wall-mounted unit that had trouble keeping up with demand. A battered sliding glass door stepped directly
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments here on TA. We have spent the last year making improvements to our hotel and will continue to improve our amazing beachside hotel.   I do ask that you reach out to us in the future, with many continuing improvements we are sure you will find us a great place to stay in Laguna Beach.

Summary: i love the hotel ,it does need some NEW CARPRT though,and the ICE machine in theREEF building is broke and has been for sometime,the PARKING does bite to you have to pay 20 dollars a day and valet expect a tip everytime they go get your car. THATis B S.
Manager Response: Thanks for the nice comments. I wanted to let you know that we replaced all of the carpets in the Reef building this week and will be finished replacing all of the carpets in our remaining ocean front rooms by the end of December. We look forward to seeing you again - and Happy Anniversary!!

Summary: Booked this on the strength of hotel by the sea and member of the Joie de Vivre Chain as part of our family road tip from SF to Dan Diego. Were given room near the pool Though this sounds idylic the area around the pool is desperate need of modernisation. The room was not ready on arrival (6pm)  The non smoking room smelt of smoke, had only a thin door between it and an ajoining  room., was tiny and not clean. Everyone in the pool and walking past could see straight in so we had to keep closing the curtains . The room was not worth  one tenth of what we paid for it and in a nutshell NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE. My wife went to complain and said that the room was of  poor standard  and the girl on reception actually agreed with her and said it was one of the "grotty rooms" I went and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We absolutely loved this hotel. It is simple, but it is right on the Beach. The waves were crashing against the building in the morning.  We were able to walk to all kinds of restaurants, shops etc.  Our Favorite restaurant was the Beach House, just a couple doors down. We look forward to going again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been to this hotel many times and have enjoyed my stay most of the time. I just went this last weekend so Oct 1-4th and i was really really disappointed. They changed management a couple of years ago (it used to be called vacation village) and i noticed A LOT of changes and not for the better. They charge A LOT for there room and it is not what i expected. We stayed in a 2 bedroom room and only the "master bedroom" and living room had air conditioning, so the 2nd bedroom was extremely hot and stuffy. In this room there is a full size kitchen but if you actually want to use it you have to pay $20 a day for cooking utensils. Theres no microwave you have to call for that as well, or a sponge to clean your dishes you have to call for that. The room was old and run down and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  I am sorry the room did not meet your expectations.  We are working on adding ac to the other bedrooms, normally our weather is not hot enough to warrant ac, that particular weekend was record breaking here in Laguna.  As for the trucks outside your room -- I am very sorry.  This should not have happened.  We instruct all of our vendors not to park in this location to avoid the very situation you found yourself in - we have again discussed this with these vendors.  Thanks again -

Summary Heading: Very disappointing....photos are nothing like the hotel!!
Summary: During our holiday in California, we were based in Palm Springs and, as a suprise, my husband booked two nights at the Pacific Edge Hotel in Laguna Beach, some months before.  We stayed in the sister hotel "Hotel Maya" on Long beach,  the night before coming to Laguna Beach and we were very impressed with this beautiful hotel.  So, as you can imagine, our expectations were high, as we assumed that the hotels would be of similar quality. How wrong we were!  Upon our arrival, we mentioned to the receptionist that we had stayed in the Hotel Maya the night before, her face said it all!!  We went into our "ocean view" room.....well, you could just about see the ocean over the buildings in front of us.  The room was, in a word, SHABBY!  Horrible nasty yellow painted walls, the plug
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to post your comments here at TA.    We take your comments very seriously and use them to improve our services and products.  We are working hard to improve our 40 year old beachside hotel and continue to make changes along the way.  We are about to launch a new website that will show more detail of our many different room types - even with 360 degree views so you can really see what we are all about.  The yellow paint is part of our new color scheme, I am sorry that you were not pleased with that color - the room also has avacado and azure blue.  I admit that while most really like this bright and cheery approach, it is not for everyone.  Thank you again for staying with us.  I hope you can try us out again in the future as we continue to make improvements.

Summary: The Ocean view upgrade is worth the money because its RIGHT on the ocean. Beautiful views. Didnt get in the car to drive anywhere, great restaurants and stores all around. No, its not the fanciest hotel but the location is perfect and is worth the money if you come for the views. Beach chairs provided, away from most tourist infested parts of the beach
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting our beachside hotel here in Laguna Beach!  We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: we were looking for a reasonable place to stay for our annual family rounds from San Diego to Orange County.  We originally booked a Village View but impulsively upgraded to an Ocean Front room . . . then stayed two nights, instead of one.  We read the reviews and understood that it was somewhat worn down.  The carpet and upholstery was, in fact, stained but seemingly clean, but that was minor compared to our overall experience there.  The staff was accommodating, friendly and efficient; the view spectacular; the room spacious, and our entire stay was perfect for us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at several JDV properties and have always enjoyed them.    When I found a special rate through Travelzoo for this property, I didn't hesitate to make reservations.  A few days later, I read the reviews on TA and send an email to the hotel with a copy of my confirmation.  I stated that I was concerned about my upcoming stay due to the negative reviews.  I told them that I did not believe all of the negative reviews and would like to make up my own mind.  I asked them to confirm that I would receive a clean, ,quiet, comfortable room with an ocean view as reserved.  I stated that if they could not guarantee such a room, it would be best to cancel my reservation and I would try them again in a year or so, giving them time to complete the change over to JDV's standards.
Manager Response: I am sorry that your online request to cancel your visit was not answered.  Please let me know what email address you used and I will personally follow up to make sure we have our systems in place.  I would also like to invite you to contact me directly to make a reservation.  I will do my best to make sure you have an amazing stay (as will my entire awesome team).  Please contact me at kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com.  Thanks and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: It's not as if Laguna is very far from Los Angeles, but seriously- what a difference 90 minutes makes. I am in love with this property. I felt like I had retired to my happy home on the ocean. After checking in I ran across the street to the grocery store for a bottle of champagne and toasted the sunset from the private oceanfront balcony. What a treat! The only downfall- the crazy amount of kids in the hot tub. What kind of kids likes hot tubs? In any case, that's not Pac Edge's fault. I went back to my room and fell asleep listening to the ocean. LOVED exploring the tide pools during low tide too! Thank you, Pac Edge, for a great stay. Can't wait to come back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room was clean and comfortable, but elements of the room (nightstands, rug) were worn and needed to be replaced. Old TV. Great location, though, and the hotel's deck is right on the ocean. I would probably recommend this to friends, but would tell them not to expect too much.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us!  We are working on several improvements to our property.  New carpets in our ocean front rooms this fall and new TV's in our non-ocean front rooms next year.  Thanks again for stayin with us, please continue to check back to see what changes have been made - hopefully we can see you again in the near future!

Summary Heading: Cute, fun, clean, and laid-back place to stay in Laguna Beach.
Summary: To be honest, I've never felt compelled enough by a place to actually write a review upon my return home. But after reading the absolutely scathing reviews posted about the Pacific Edge Hotel, I felt it necessary to defend the "little hotel that could".  My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Edge for two days recently for a wedding that was being held there. To pass the time during the drive down from LA, I read a good 50% of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I was terrified that we had booked a room in a loud, dingy, moldy, bug-infested, flop house based on the most recent traveler accounts, and braced myself for the worse. We pull up to the hotel which looks no better or worse than any of the others located on this strip. Upon entering the sunny white-tiled lobby we are greeted by
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write such a wonderful review.  I am really happy that you enjoyed your stay and I will be sharing your comments with the team!  Best,  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary: This place is a complete dump, complete with cracks in exterior walls that are large enough that daylight peeks through.  I cannot even begin to imagine how 60% of travelers would recommend this property.  Everything is falling apart and crumbling.  Do yourself a giant favor and don't even consider staying at The Pacific Edge, even if that means you have to book a property that is not directly on the beach.  I have paid 20% of the price I paid for this hotel at an America's Best Value Inn or Motel 6 and have actually had a far superior room that is actually clean.  If the thought of bugs crawling on you while you sleep doesn't bother you or hinder your slumber, stay at Pacific Edge.  You have been warned!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment about your recent stay.  I appologize for your experience, our beach front property is indeed older and we are continually making property improvements.   We recently made a significant investment in many improvements around the hotel, mostly focusing on interior areas.  We have new carpets arriving to our ocean front rooms this fall.  We hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary: we stayed at this hotel as a mini-getaway for out anniversary.  the pictures online looked great but it was a huge letdown.  the rooms, although painted brightly, were shabby.  our balcony had carpet which was torn in places an worn out.  the light fixture was hanging exposed.  our a/c was broken and the unit had to be removed and changed.  the bath tub filled up and took forever to drain during a shower.  on the bright side, maintenance was prompt and proficient.  overall, it was a disappointment but was a centrally located disappointment.
Manager Response: I want to appologize for your recent experience here at Pacific Edge. We are continuing to make improvements to our decades old seaside property and hope you will return in the future to see our progress.

Summary: I have copied the response I made to the General Manager's email welcoming any feedback following our stay. I sent this email 4 weeks ago but have not receiced any acknowledgement or response.  Dear Mr Bjorkman,   My family and I recently stayed at the Pacific Edge arriving on 26th July and departing on 28th July (we had originally booked through until depature on July 31st) and I thought you would be interested in our feedback.    After a certain amount of research on the internet, I booked our rooms by telephone. This was to be an extended stop on a tour of California, a chance to visit family in Irvine and to recharge our batteries during our busy schedule.   First, the positives: -The booking process by telephone was smooth and the staff I spoke to were very helpful. -The
Manager Response: Dear Hobson Family,  I trust you did receive my email response- appologies for the delay.  If not, please email me directly at kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com as I would like to discuss your experience with you.  Warmest Regards

Summary Heading: Very rough not up to joy de vies standard
Summary: What a huge disappointment   Shabby. Worn  out. Just slapping on a few bright colors does not make a tired old hotel hip and fun. Service was ok but the beach house restaurant was mediocre at best. We planned to stay 3 nights and checked out after one. Never again.     Neighborhood was shabby and very loud.  Ac units drowned out the sound of the wAves
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your comments here on TA.  We do take your comments seriously and have been working hard to make continued improvements to this older seaside hotel.    The city of Laguna Beach is known for it's unique style and artistic palate, we are sorry that you were not satisfied with the surrounding areas.

Summary Heading: This is NOT a $230/night type of place
Summary: Okay, so this was on the beach, but I had to lean over a cement wall to see the water. Our room did not have closet doors, small table or a chair to sit on. And our nightstands had peeling paint on the top. This is a very dated place, the elevator is rugid, and I wasn't sure it would go up the 4 flights.    I would not recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments here on TA.  Our ownership is committed to making improvements to this decades old seaside hotel.    Over the past year we have made many improvements and continue to add services and property improvements, overall this hotel has come a long way since just a few years ago.  We are replacing all the carpet in our ocean front buildings this fall and have more plans for 2011.  Thanks again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Not up to Joie de Vivre Standards....yet
Summary: I have stayed in many Joie De Vivre hotels in Northern California, and was excited to spend a night at this property in So.Cal.  Joie de Vivre has done a GREAT job at many of its properties by taking old hotels and converting them into fun and funky destinations.  This property let me down.  The staff, from the front desk to the valet parking attendants seemed cold.  The rooms were not as updated or clean as I would have come to expect from Joie de Vivre.  Towels "provided" to you on the beach were always inshort supply (had to run across the street and buy some at the supermarket.)  Save your money, stay across the street at the Holiday Inn for a cleaner room at and save some money, there is easy beach access across the street.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a change for the better!
Summary: I visited friends staying at this hotel.  The decor, staff, all services were great!  We had room service also, which was a surprise!  I want to come back as stay myself!  I have stayed here before the hotel was sold and I am so impressed with what management has done to bring it up to date!  T
Manager Response: Thank you!  We look forward to seeing you again very soon.

Summary Heading: Dark, Disgusting & Mold - Checked In & Immediately Checked Out
Summary: I had such high hopes for the Pacific Edge Hotel as I had read a review in the LA Times Travel section about the hotel being renovated & refurbished. We were going to spend the weekend at the hotel for my husband's birthday as our other favorite hotel in Laguna, Hotel Seven4One didn't have availability for Sunday night. Check-in was easy, and we were in queen sized deluxe "ocean view" room in the Reef building.  We were given room 105. First of all, the elevator in the tower has graffiti in it, I'm not kidding. Not a great first impression. We opened the door to our room and were overwhelmed by the smell of mildew. It didn't take long for us to find the mold and mildew around the windows, GROSS!!!! EW! Remember, this hotel has just completed the renovation! SHAME ON Joie de
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Would go again amazing room/balcony and view, loved it!
Summary: Our mini vacation was incredible. Was a 10 year friendship anniversary, met a mom on Oprah on line. Life coach Cheryl Richardson's was Oprah's guest speaker at the time. Oprah online was to connect with other ladies and assist in life changing events. We did and have been amazing friends for the past 10 years. This was the first time we met. Contacted Aloha Surfing: Jaymo for surfing lessons, was my friends passion and goal to experience surfing. Her dream came true and she will be pursuing the adventure from this amazing trip and experience. We plan on meeting again next year and Kurt and Jaymo were instrumental on making this vacation fantastic.. thank you so very much Kurt and Jaymo. We had a ocean front 4th floor room. View was breath taking. Has micro. and fridge..bought
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disappointed for the price - view was nice but it ends there
Summary: First the good...the hotel reception was very nice and helpful.  The view was very nice.   The bad...it was difficult to carry our luggage up and down 2 flights of stairs.  The rooms were just okay - no safe which I feel is pretty standard these days.  They had a coffee maker with coffee and no sugar/creamer etc. booked it for 4 people room had enough towels etc for 2.  All things that can be fixed but at this price a little extra thought is nice.  When we left our room it was a bit of a tricky walk a few big steps some rocks and then you walk over to the beach area and it is on a slant...I think it would be just as nice if not nicer to stay off of the beach but close to main beach .....and just walk across the street.  I wasn't crazy about the valet parking...everytime you need
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good beach -- Good Location -- Marginal Hotel
Summary: The room was very cramped, worn out and not real clean.  The entire hotel was a little tired looking.  We expected a much nicer hotel based on their web site.  The beach was great, access was good and we liked that they provided longe chairs, towels and toys.  We also liked the nice walk to town and the staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: There isn't a better place to stay... they LOVE their guests!
Summary: I was very familiar with this property, but had never stayed as a guest.  I made what was supposed to be a trip with my husband, alone, with him joining me for the last 2 nights.  My first night was not pleasant (due to unruly and defiant guests in the room next to mine).  When I spoke with the front desk supervisor the next morning, he was very attentive to my issues, informed me the guests next to me would be checking out that day, but that due to full occupancy, he wouldn't be able to change my room.  2 hours later he called me, and made arrangements to change my room from and oceanview queen to the most beautiful oceanFRONT king!!  I was away from the hotel for the entire day, so housekeeping had to make the change; they did it professionally and efficiently.  Everything
Manager Response: none

Summary: love Laguna and the Art Festival. we've been coming to this hotel for over 20 years.  the change in management/ownership is positive
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect trip from beginning to end. Can't wait to go back every summer!
Summary: From the moment we stepped into the lobby we were taken care of. Great staff, beautiful views, and clean rooms. Room service was incredible and the entire staff made me feel special.  My family will make this a yearly vacation stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Why didn't I listen to Trip Advisor !
Summary: Take a run down Motel 6, plop it on the beach, and you have The Pacific Edge ! I did read all the reviews before we made reservations but I couldn't believe it could be that bad !  Well it was...but they were the only "Pet Friendly" hotel available on the beach.  The room was the worst we have ever stayed in and we have been all over the globe. Some room attributes you can look forward to are old dirty carpet, small fuzzy TV, run down kitchenette with no cooking supplies, tiny bathroom with minimal towels, a window air conditioner in the main room but nothing in the bedroom which got hot and stuffy and pathetic decor.  Let me tell you why you will need that air conditioner !  The hotel has a self contained "villa" on site that is used for weddings and parties (every night we
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear about what sounds like a simply horid stay with us.  Indeed you were here when we had several mechanical issues, including hot water in the Bahia building and un-planned construction.  I want to personally appologize and let you know that your comments are being used to make changes to that these types of experiences do not happen in the future.  Please feel free to contact me directly a kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com.  Regards,  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary: First, let me start positive.  The hotel staff are very decent people that go out of their way to help.  Five star service.   The reality, we decided to go to Laguna on short notice (all other hotels were booked).   You pull up to what looks like a crack motel on the outside.  You step inside to a couple of very cheerful helpful young ladies.  They tell me my room faces an alley and a parking lot.  I explain this is unacceptable,  we must have a room that faces the beach.  They eventually put is in what they call the "penthouse".  Penthouse, hardly.  But very large and my kids thought it was a fun big room with full kitchen and a big closet we turned into my daughter's room.    My parents went to the regular room that looked like a bad motel 6.  We opened the fridge and I almost
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear about your negative experience. Please contact me directly so that we can discuss further.  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com

Summary Heading: Used to be great, now is a mess
Summary: I've been to this hotel 5-6 times in the last 10 years but won't be back. The front desk is always too busy with a wedding to help with room concerns. My internet didn't work, and the cable was fuzzy. My room didn't get made up until 5 pm many days. They advertise full kitchens, but will charge an extra $20 to get a set of dishes. Don't expect any kitchen utensils, or even dish soap to be available. The umbrellas at the beach look like they have been through a hurricane, and you better be in line at 7 am to get a decent chair. They never had enough towels for all the guests at the beach, and no towels are available at the pool. We had a problem with the bill checking out, and no manager was on site to deal with it. Ten days after checking out, and countless phone messages later,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments here on Tripadvisor.  I want to appologize for the issues you had at the beach, we have since addressed our equipment process.  Please contact our Front Office Manager at the following email address if we have not already corrected your billing issue.  cfitzgerald@jdvhotels.com.  Again, thank you for taking the time to reach out to us and let us know about your visit.  Warmest regards

Summary Heading: My mistake for not checking Trip Advisor BEFORE we checked in.
Summary: Stayed for one night at this hotel, in town for a wedding. Hubby booked the hotel, so I had little info as we showed up. THE GOOD: Can't beat the location. Beautiful ocean view, which we really enjoyed from our balcony with a cup of coffee in the morning. Discovered the Orange Inn, a very short walk away, which had delicious coffee and muffins. THE BAD: I was disappointed with the seventies-motel style appearance. The room had a colorful paint job, but was not an improvement over the exterior. I had the worst night sleep than any in recent memory - the noise of the fellow hotel guests coming and going until 2:30 am, then was awakened at 5am to the sound of delivery trucks. Despite being in the mid 70's that day, the room was very hot and stuffy. After the air conditioner chugged
Manager Response: none

Summary: No frills hotel - you are paying for location. We had a oceanfront room - cool colors. Hallway sometimes smelled of sewage, but I think that is because it is so close to the beach. Location is great - close to beach and downtown. Kids really enjoyed the two swimming pools. Didn't like - small bathroom and carpets. Overall a good clean hotel and staff was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Suspicious wet stain on the carpet....and that is the good news!
Summary: I checked into the Pacific Edge on July 20 for just 1 night. The motel looked so-so from the exterior but the photos on Travelocity, etc. of the rooms convinced me to spend a night there. Dirty room, cracked sink in bathroom, carpet stains, noisy, and overall shabby-ness are what I got for a "deluxe" ocean view room at $290/nt plus the rip-off $20 valet scam. And then the evening got even better. The little girl at the front desk reccomended a "great" sushi place across the street. I walked across to the restaurant and sat at the sushi bar. A small group of middle aged surfer types were drinking sake shots at the bar and got louder and louder in the space of maybe 20 minutes. All of a sudden one of the fools smashed 2 of the glass refridgerated cases on the sushi bar and blood
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience.  We appologize for your negative experiences.  As a side note we are addressing the carpets and have a complete carpet replacement for our ocean front rooms taking place in October.  While this does not take away your experience with us, I wanted to let you know that we are addressing this issue.  With valet parking I would like to know your comments about this service in more detail.  Thank you for letting us know about your experience at the Sushi restaurant.  I have called the owner to address what happened.  We have never had a complaint about this restaurant in the past so we take this very seriously.  Again, thank you for your comments.

Summary: Pacific Edge is not a five star hotel and does not pretend to be one. It is right for the price, and if the boutique rooms are a bit tight, there is a whole beach outside your door with ample space. The staff are five star. The hotel is affiliated ( somewhat), with a restaurant next to it, that has a manager who is less than courteous and hospitable to questions. My friend and I asked about bar service on the beach and were literally scolded. Maybe he was having a bad day.
Manager Response: We are happy that you had a nice time while staying with us and for taking the time to write this review.  I will be contacting the manager at the Beach House and addressing your comments directly, I appologize on their behalf as we send a lot of customers there and take your experience very seriously.  Thanks again and we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: The hotel looked great on the web site but was a huge disappointment! We reserved a one bedroom apartment on the web for 5 people and learned upon arrival that it had only a queen bed in a room without a door and a pull out couch.  They were willing to comp us the extra cot but it was not satisfactory. We also received emails prior to check in about suite and ocean front upgrades for as little as $30 a night but none were available.  The front desk said they were full but the email goes out antway.  We viewed several room options and we observed others doing the same so I suspect this is a common problem.  We settled on two adjoining rooms but had to pay $50 a night more!  The kitchenette was not equipped.  You had to pay extra for dishes.  If you do not have an ocean front room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your experiences here on Trip Advisor.  Our upgrade program can work out great at times.  With that being said we do fill up during the summer, especially on weekends.  The upgrades usually become available if someone cancels which is very rare in the summer.    Our parking is noted on our website as valet parking only and the price is mentioned in the terms and conditions when you make your reservation.  I will see if there is a way for us to make this a more obvious note on our website.  Thanks again for staying with us.

Summary: We have been staying at this property for many years and have told many people of how wonderful it is to stay at the edge of the Pacific Ocean!  We recently had our annual visit here.  I received an email from the ‚ÄúGeneral Manager‚Äù, when I checked in and when checked out.  I would have thought that he would have responded to email I sent to him regarding my recent stay.  I also see that he responds to post here!  So, It has been 2 wks and no response from him!   We stayed in the Bahia, since all of the oceanfront rooms were reserved.   We enjoy these rooms for the size and if your room is high enough you can see the water.  Valet Parking was directly under our room balcony and the noise level was extreme at times.  The main disruption and discomfort was the wedding party that
Manager Response: Than you for taking the time to post your reviews on Trip Advisor and thanks for your continued support over all of these years.  We have, as you experienced, made changes to the hotel and will continue to make improvements along the way.  I appologize for the noise issue that was outside your patio doors.  While we attempt to control what happens on Sleepy Hollow Lane (a public street) as much as possible sometimes we end up with a situation like the one that had such a negative affect on your stay.    We again thank you for taking the time to post your experiences here on Trip Advisor and appologize for your experiences on your recent visit.

Summary Heading: They worked to make our vacation wonderful!
Summary: We arrived with our 3 high school kids and the room, which I booked, was 2 queen beds, but still too small.  I asked at the front desk and Desarae was amazing.  She found us a 1  bedroom for only 30 dollars more.  We moved that moment and stayed in that room for 1 week.  The rooms were clean and large with a nice balcony.  Everyone that worked there from the office to the valets, to the beach boys, to the housekeeping were extremely accomodating.  They have beach toys for the kids and unlimited number of beach chairs, which they are more than happy to set up and take down for you. This is a big hotel right on the beach with a small hotel feeling.   I can't wait to go back!!!!
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your visit with us and look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Summary: NIGHTMARE!!!  We attempted to cancel and get a refund with-in a 30 minutes. The website is far from accurate when describing this hotel/ shanty.  The 20 dollar valet, (That still had the 4 dollar sign up), was unable to tell us were our car would be parked.  We didnt even unpack because the room next to us was so noisy. The neighbors had 4 adults, 2 children and one screaming baby into a room that small. We switched rooms because we could not get money back. Disregarded dishes outside the hotel rooms were sitting 14 hours. The beach entrance from the hotel was shut down for repair. The Hotel is under construction, The front appearance is a tourist trap. After that is becomes a third world country.  The wake-up call is at 6:30, it is hammering 8ft from you wall. RUN
Manager Response: I am so sorry about your recent experience.   Our construction is officially over (As of July 2nd).  I know that the noise was a signifcant issue during your stay with us and for that I appologize.  Room service  dishes certainly should have been removed, I have met with the restaurant and our housekeeping team and addressed this specifically.  Thank you for taking the time to post your experience here on Trip Advisor, we take your comments and experiences seriously.

Summary Heading: Doesn't get your trip off to the best start.
Summary: Stayed here from 28 June to 1 July.  After a 15 hour flight we were looking forward to getting to our hotel and relaxing.  Our first (joint) impression was "can we tell them it's not suitable", we can then book out and move elsewhere.  Unfortunately it had all been paid for in advance.  First impression was that we had got the wrong building, it didn't look much like a hotel or motel, more a ramshackled number of buildings.  Reception were very helpful and told us that the room had just been decorated which I was pleased to hear.  However, bright yellow and bright blue walls are not very relaxing.
