It all looks a bit old and run down, in need of a good overhaul.  The view was excellent with a little balcony overlooking the ocean. The bed was exceptionally comfortable which did
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Avoid at all costs if you want a pleasant Laguna Beach experience
Summary: We selected the Pacific Edge based on previous experience with the Joy of Life Club hotels. It was my birthday, and we looked forward to an enjoyable evening in lovely Laguna Beach. I had reserved through an Internet special, so the price was right. Upon confirmation of my reservation, I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to a "suite" (for an additional $20 or $30)  if it was available upon check-in. I selected yes. My initial impression on check-in was not positive. Our wing of the hotel was right on the street, and looked like a 50's cheap apartment building (which I suspect was what it had once been). When the check-in clerk issued me my room key and showed me the room location on the map, I told her that I feared the room would be noisy as it was right on the Pacific Coast
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: PU A complete rip-off Don't be fooled the pictures !!
Summary: Having recently returned from a month long vacation in Europe with my husband I stayed in many hotels, and as you know the cleanliness in Europe isn't always up to American standards... well neither is this hotel.  My sister needed a few days away so we booked a suite with a direct ocean view for what would normally get you a 4 star or better hotel room, we arrived and had to ask for a bellman and were told by the valet attendant that valet parking was behind the hotel so we would have to drive down the block and turn left into an alley and another half block down would be our  the valet parking. I was a bit surprised by this but blew it off thinking I might be a little spoiled after having stayed at the St. Regis in Rome and The Westin Europa in Venice recently. We checked in
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just love this place (call it a motel at best).  Highly overated, sub-standard, sometimes dirty, a grossly overpriced motel that is still simply fabulous.  THE PRO'S:  Location!  Location!  Location!  No attitude or pretencious Orange County lifestyle or attitude.  A staff to die for!  They excel in customer service (hello Stacie...can you come home with us?)  Restaurants and shopping abound.  The sound of the surf every night is so wonderful.  Very FAMILY in a great way.  We came with zero kids but so welcomed their sounds every morning beachside.  THE CONS:  'FORCED' valet parking at $20.00 a day plus tips in/out.  Insane!  Annoying!  Slow!  No options to self-park; even with a fee.   The very worst feature of this property was FORCED valet...  Dirty, older rooms.  Minimal
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of our best vacations ever!!! Our week at the Pacific Edge Hotel left us wishing for more time there.  The staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and comfortable. We love the casual, retro atmosphere of this hotel, and you just can't get any closer to the ocean than this! The balcony to our room just about hung out over the ocean and we had a great view all the way up and down the coast. The beds and linens are plush and comfy. We were able to walk everywhere--restaurants, shopping, art galleries, etc. For us it is the perfect vacation spot!! Yes, there was construction going on at the time but we really could not hear it at all from our room location. If what you want in a hotel is formal and elegant then we recommend the Ritz Carlton in Dana Point. But we
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Pacific Edge Hotel, I want to thank you for taking the time to complete the customer satisfaction survey. I wanted to follow up with you personally, as you are a most valued client and I appreciated receiving your feedback.  Thank you very much for your positive comments about the hotel. I will share your kind words with the entire team here at Pacific Edge. At Joie de Vivre Hospitality, we pride ourselves in providing unique hospitality experiences and superior service. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know that we have exceeded your expectations during your visit with us.  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary Heading: Any closer, you'd be in the Pacific Ocean
Summary: Incredible location in Laguna Beach, spectacular view from the ocean front suite, you'll even have your own balcony beach access.  We had a great time, perfect place for family and friends to gather, the suite is spacious and the kitchenette is useful.  Very good service.   A few minor suggestions for the property: Windows, especially the glass railing needs to be clean regularly, it'll make a world of difference - from a 2 star to a 4 star property instantly!  All the buildings could use a better color of paint on the outside, and please bring in more plants to make the property more inviting.
Manager Response: On behalf of all of us at the Pacific Edge Hotel, I want to thank you for taking the time to complete the customer satisfaction survey. I wanted to follow up with you personally, as you are a most valued client and I appreciated receiving your feedback.  Thank you very much for your positive comments about the hotel. I will share your kind words with the entire team at Pacific Edge.   At Joie de Vivre Hospitality, we pride ourselves in providing unique hospitality experiences and superior service. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know that we have exceeded your expectations during your visit with us.  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent loaction, perfect beach, outstanding service
Summary: Is perfectly located about 2-3 blocks north of the main beach.  We were easily able to walk to all shops and restaurants.  Perfect for morning runs along the coast in both directions.  The hotel offers free lounge and beach chairs, umbrellas, towels, and other accessories on the beach.  The valet parking is quick and easy.  The entire staff was very friendly and helpful.    Not all rooms are on the ocean so be sure to ask.  Our room was not but that didn‚Äôt matter to us.  We did not spend a lot of time in the room.  We stayed June 10-19.  There was some construction that started at 7:30am that would have affected us if we were late sleepers. But we were always up by 7:00am.  Be sure to ask about this if staying during the summer of 2010.
Manager Response: We are happy that you enjoyed your visit and look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Incredible View, Amazing Location, Ask About Construction
Summary: Just returned from the property. The hotel is the former Vacation Village and has an amazing location, just a short walk from downtown Laguna. There is a lot of construction taking place at the Pacific Edge and our first room (501) was a few feet away from jack hammers and buzz saws. Even though we were right on the ocean, the sound of pounding surf definitely had competition. We asked for a room change and were immediately granted one on a higher floor. Much better. Breathtaking views of the ocean from not-so-private patios were the highlight. Room was so-so. Could use some storage areas, like bathroom shelves or even a luggage holder. The hotel is very accommodating with friendly staff and gave us a 50% discount when we checked out because I mentioned the construction. I would
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked the hotel over the website from Hotwire in february 2010. I paid 59 $ per night and I want to stay 6 days in this hotel. & Days before arriving at the Pacific Edge, the Hotel cancelled my reservation. They told me I calles them 3 weeks before because of a cancellation for my room, but I never called the Hotel. I had the chance to book a new room at the Pacific Edge, for 119 $!!!! What a shame for a hotel to cancel a old reservation to earn more money with new and higher prices!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We loved our stay in Laguna @ Pacific Edge!!!
Summary: From Stacie at the front desk to Kurt the GM, the service was excellent and location stunning. We did not have to use our car during our three day stay since it's close to everthing. Looking forward to future stays at the Pacific Edge.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This trip had been planned for three months. A family member even toured the property and found the staff very helpful and accomidating.   I got a large ocean front suite with patio access to the beach.  I spoke with the staff several times over that period to esure there were no issues. (even two days before and the  morning of check in)  To my dismay when checking in, I was informed that we'd  been moved to another room and that the entire lower level has been closed due to construction.  They took me to the new room were it was smelly, the carpets were old, the fridge looked like it was from the 1940's, the hallway stank and the construction noise was deafening and scheduled to go on the entire week of my stay.  We choose not to stay and found other accomidations though the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience at Pacific Edge. I appologize for the experience you had with us, it appears we failed to deliver on just about everything!  Our construction has been a combination of planned and not planned work,  we too were surprised at our wake up calls and we are all so very sorry that this happened when you tried to make us your temporary home for a few days.  We are in the process of renovating many aspects of the property, including carpets.  Overall however that does not erase the negative experience you had with us and we again appologize.    Please contact me at 949-281-5701, I would like to discuss your experience further.  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary Heading: Pacific surf hotel which is 20ft from the Pacific, quirky and very friendly
Summary: .Easy to find on the South Coast Highway. On arrival the staff were very helpful and friendly. Check in took minutes and parking was just as easy. we had a newly decorated ocean view room with balcony (room 703) very clean, comfortable bed, fluffy towels and clean fresh bathroom. After watching a perfect sunset from our balcony we went to sleep that night with the sounds of the waves gently lapping at the shore. The only niggle we had was some building work that started on the morning we left. It was very loud (and early, 8am) and by the looks of all the other guests surprised faces nobody were told by the hotel that it was going to happen when we/they booked/checked in.  Might be worth checking to see if its still going on. When we mentioned this at check out they very kindly
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been traveling around the world at least 4 times a year for the past 10 years, and i have to say we had the most unpleasent experience with this hotel.  The location is great and the view is great (that's why we still chose it after reading some negative reviews about it), however the oceanfront room we got was pretty small, carpet was damp, furniture got holes, patio looked old, sliding doors rust, and the bathtub can hardly hold one person, even the walkway out of the room was slimy.  We later learnt that some other oceanfront rooms are bigger and much newer. But with the same price, $260 per night, the hotel shouldn't leave customers try their luck at all!!     And the staff, especially some ladies we talked with at the front dest, were polite but cold, seemed like
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment about the Pacific Edge, we take all feedback seriously and apprecate the opportunity to address any issues you had during your stay.  First of all I want to alologize for the experience you had while staying with us.  We take pride in our customer service and it is one of the areas we have always recieved great comments.  I would like to discuss your experience so I can go over it with the team.  We are in the process of making improvements to the hotel, including many of the issues you mentioned in your review.    It is important to us that we use the feedback given to us by our guests as a tool to improve so that we continue to exceed your expectations.  Please email me directly so we can discsuss your experience in more detail.  Warmest Regards,  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com

Summary: I spent a night with my BFF, and my sister and cousin from Chicago on May 15th to celebrate my big 5-0.  I live locally, but wanted to have a special night away from home near the beach.  I had checked out the hotel prior to our stay and was very excited to confirm the hotel was steps from the water.  I had invited a few friends to celebrate with us, thinking we would be on the beach, but the staff was so accomodating, setting up tables, chairs and even an outdoor couch for our group on the beautiful deck overlooking the ocean.  The beds were super comfy and even though I read some reviews about the color scheme, I liked it.  Falling asleep to the sound of crashing waves was sublime. This property is not the Montage or St. Regis, but has a totally cool, Laguna vibe - not stuffy,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised after reading so many bad reviews! The hotel is steps from it's own private beach.. And you are provided a lounge chair,towels, and umbrellas.. I'd recommend stopping by Ralphs... The store that is walking distance across the street to pick up any alcohol for your cooler. There are nice restaurants walking distance away.. I liked cliffs and the one on the property beaches restaurant which both have nice ocean views. bring an iPod... There was construction going on and I could hear the jAckhammer while on the beach... Other than that great stay for the money... Hit the jacuzzi at night... It wasn't crowded at all!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed at the Pacific Edge for my sisters wedding.  My parents had recommended this hotel for it's great location but told us not to expect too much from the hotel itself. They were right.  While the staff are very friendly and the service is good, the hotel is so very tired.  Considering the high prices they charge to stay at this hotel I am utterly amazed at how they have let the hotel become this run down.  To their credit, management is currently updating their rooms with new paint, flat screen t'v's, bedding, and other accessories.  However, the hotel is in need of SO much more!  That being said, I would actually consider staying at this hotel again but I would only do so if I could get a reasonable rate through hotwire, et al.  I just find that the prices they
Manager Response: Dear Guest -  First let me thank you for traveling so far to stay with us in Laguna Beach!  I know our team was happy to have you as our guest.  I am glad you noticed the changes we are making around the hotel,  we are committed to improving the overall guest experience when it comes to the actual product.  After the summer we are placing all new carpet in our Ocean Front Rooms.    We really do have two different type of room experiences here - our ocean front rooms speak for themselves - our other rooms are the smaller non-view rooms you mentioned.  Many people choose these rooms and take advantage of being close to the Village of Laguna Beach while having very close acess to the sand & waves.  Please contact me directly about your room charges - if we made an error we would like to fix it right away - my email is kbjorkman@jdvhotels.com.  Also keep my email for future reservations.  I can match any rate you might find out on the internet and will make sure you have a tremendous experience.  Thank you again for staying with us and taking the time to let us know how your stay was.  We look forward to hearing from you soon!  Best,  Kurt Bjorkman General Manager

Summary Heading: I would not recommend this hotel
Summary: The bathroom is so small you can barely use the toilet.  The room is just plain awful.  I would not stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us during your time in Laguna Beach.  I am sorry that your experience was not what you expected.  We do have many different room types (eight buildings!) and I am sure we have a room that will meet or exceed your expectations.  I would like to disuss your stay further in person.  Please email me at fdeanda@jdvhotels.com.  At your service,  Francisco De Anda Director of Rooms

Summary: The Pacific Edge was a nice enough place, the room was very small and I'd expect there to be somewhere (anywhere) to hang a towel or swimsuit for a beach hotel.  There was also a paper thin "door" separating the room behind us from ours which very quiet conversation could be heard through. But that's really no big deal, the room was clean and the beach was right there.   It was also VERY conveniently located to downtown Laguna Beach.   We stayed in the front building, probably why it was such an inexpensive stay.   Thursday night was quiet, Friday night a little louder, Saturday night was ridiculously loud.  Not really loud enough to wake me up, but loud enough to make me look out the door after I did.  It was a bar across the street and it was outrageously loud with screaming
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Still A Tired Olde Property-Shame on you Pacific Edge
Summary: Special occasion was 38th anniversary.  I booked a front, reef tower suite, way in advance, to celebrate my 38th wedding anniversary.  Upon arrival I was informed that construction was ongoing and this building was not available.  Was further informed I was booked into another room with oceanfront.  I was given a load of BS that they had tried to contact me several times to inform me of the construction.  This I knew was a outright lie as the hotel had all my information on file including phone numbers and email address.  I was now over a barrel and they knew it.  I agreed to the alternate room site unseen.  After getting the run around for 2 more hours supposedly by housekeeping, I entered the alternate room (705).  Oh My G__!!!!! The room had 3 walls painted Guacomolie green
Manager Response: We obviously owe you a serious appology and would love to talk to you in person about your stay.  We cant do anyting about our new colors - but the rest of the comments regarding your stay are very important to us.  We will be reaching out to you shortly.

Summary: We stayed here for six nights.  Our children loved the oceanfront view.  We stayed in a Reef Room which you cannot get any closer to the beach.  Our kids ran down one flight of stairs and played in the surf.  It was wonderful.  We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not fancy.  They were updating it when we were there..  It was clean, and the beds were super comfy. Nice towels and nice sheets.  They even have nice beach towels which must of been a recent upgrade for past reviews said they were thin.   This is not the case now.  The staff was friendly.  They initially overcharged us but they were quick to fix it and very apologetic.  I would definately stay here again.  Since we are from MT having the beach so accessible was a real treat.  The view is truly wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice comments.  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: This was our first time staying at the Pacific Edge.  We had an ocean front King and it was very nice.  This is an older hotel, but the room was up to date.  The bed was comfortable and with the sound of the waves right outside we slept well.  I don't thing you can get much closer to the ocean then right out side the room.  Hotel staff were polite and helpfull.  The location is right downtown.  We were within waking distance to stores and resturants.  The Beach House next door and wonderful meals, and you can use the Edge card to get a discount.  We were here in off season, but the hotel was full, but not noisy.  For the price, I don't thing I could have found a better location!  The view was perfect!  We could see the beach, hear the waves and watch the dolphins in the water.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how your stay went.  I am happy that you enjoyed your time here in Laguna Beach.  Look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: "The Pacific Edge is the definition of ocean front vacationing."
Summary: When you go to the beach you want the beach.  Out of all the hotels on the beach in Laguna, CA, Pacific Edge Hotel is the only one ON the waterfront, unobstructed views, and best of all - when you go outside YOUR FEET ARE IN THE SAND and the TOWN IS AT YOUR DOORSTEP.  The staff is relaxed, friendly and there to spoil you.  This hotel is not New York City pomp; if you want the beach you can ONLY want PACIFIC EDGE HOTEL on Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice comments!  We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: The hotel staff was very accomodating, great location, great value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had an amazing time at Laguna Beach and the stay at our hotel helped make that possible.. everyone was so accommodating and friendly, any time we needed anything.. no questions asked they just sent it to our room for us... Front desk was awesome, you could talk to them forever.. If and when I return to Laguna I will def. be staying here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You Don't Get What You Paid For if You Paid More Then $125.00!
Summary: I was seriously disappointed in my stay! Was not alerted when I made the reservation via phone that construction was occurring during my stay or of the $20 per night parking fee.  The initial oceanfront rm was in one of the buildings that was under construction.  I could hear the workers cussing, breaking things, etc.The sliding glass windows were dirty, there was paint on the glass windows, and neither the phone nor the heater worked.(My cell didn't work which is why I noticed the phone not working)  I was furious.  As a business provider myself,I was stunned that this rm was even an option for a customer. They offered me another oceanfront room and waved the parking fee due to the inconvenience.  This rm at least had a refrigerator however, no heat.  We asked for a room heater
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay.  We obviously dropped the ball on several fronts.  I appologize, as does the entire team here at PacEdge.  Please give us a call, ask for Francisco - we would love to talk to you about your stay.  Thanks again.

Summary: I hotwired and got this hotel at a great price.  Upon seeing the location, I upgraded to an ocean front.  It was beautiful - the crashing waves, watching the dogs run on the beach, watching everyone walk and surf and enjoy the ocean.  It was a picture of everything that is great about an ocean front property.  You can walk to everywhere and parking is available ($20 per night parking fee).  As a travelling women concerned about safety - I felt extremely secure and felt employees were aware and watching out for guests. This is an older hotel so the rooms are not elegant,but very clean and comfortable.  The bed was outstanding to sleep on with a selection of different  pillows to choose from. The best part of this stay - the people!  Incredibly nice employees - every employee I
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: The Pacific Edge Hotel is set in a perfect location. It is right on Pacific Coast 1 where all the shops are and faces the Ocean. Our Ocean front room was breath taking. The sunsets are incredibly romantic off your balcony and the waves crash into the rocks and lull you to sleep at night. Every morning I would go on the balcony and just look out at the ocean and beach, the morning sun feels so good on your face. You can walk down the beach for exercise or leisure. The entrance is very accessible from the rooms.  The hotel staff is very efficient and accommodating.  I've also stayed in a courtyard room with a big living room, 2 bed rooms, 3 beds and a kitchen. This room is great for bigger groups and families that need to cook or bring groceries.  I love this hotel and would
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Website photos are deceiving and inaccurate
Summary: We booked this hotel for our office "retreat".  When we arrived we were very disappointed to say the least.  This is not a hotel, it's a motel and everything looks tired.  The website shows modern, updated rooms; instead everything seems done as a band-aid to attempt to make it nicer.  My husband and I were upgraded to a "deluxe" room; the only difference is it had a sink and small, old refrigerator in what was an attempt to make a kitchenette.  Instead It looked ridiculous.  The whole place looks and feels old and not in a good way.  My husband checked everyone out immediately and moved us down the street to the Surf and Sand.  More money but it was a lesson learned, we should have driven down beforehand and checked it out in person.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to comment on your stay in Feb.  I want to appologize for your experience. We are making changes to our property, addressing many of the points you brought up in your email. Our goal is to remain an affordable 2.5 to 3 star Laguna Beach experience - an alternative to the luxury properties (like the amazing Surf and Sand) for many people. Please contact us and let us know if we can discuss a future stay with here at Pacific Edge once our renovations are complete.

Summary: My girlfriend and I went to Laguna Beach for three days over Valentine's weekend. We enjoyed Pacific Edge hotel. Our room was basic, but clean and I was impressed that the bedding is pure white linens, so no old dirty comforters to worry about. Our room was also near one of the pools and faced Pacific Coast Highway, so we could walk into town or the beach in a couple minutes. Kelly at the desk was very pleasant and helpful during our stay. Starting at $125 per night, I think it is a deal. We also chose this hotel because we have a dog and they are pet-friendly. Many restaurants and businesses offer 10-20% discounts to those staying here, so we took advantage of this as well. Francisco, who helped us check-out, was also very good with customer service. We were very happy with our
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments- we are happy that you had a great Valentines Day.  Let us know when you want to return!  Cheers!

Summary: I'm definitely not a fan of this hotel. We stayed in a "Village Junior Suite," and not only were we nowhere near  or even in sight of the Pacific edge, we heard nothing but the people above us, traffic and construction the entire time we were here - certainly not ocean waves crashing on the beach! We had a kitchenette, but there was very little in the way of amenities - we had basic silverware, some wine glasses and coffee mugs - and that was it.   Sparse is a nice way of describing the room. Other than a new paint job and some new curtains (and, I must admit, really nice, big, cushy bath towels), it was clear that nothing had been updated in the room since the '80s. The bathroom floor was covered in disgusting, old linoleum which was chipped and pockmarked, and on the second
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The Pacific Edge Hotel takes the edge off your nerves.
Summary: We chose to stay at the Pacific Edge and not the hotel where we were attending a convention for three days.  Waking up to a beautiful morning and going for a run on the beach where gulls, cranes and various other sea birds frolicked in the blue Pacific waves prepared us for a busy, intense and long day.   After the day was over we relaxed in a bed, dare I say, more comfortable than ours at home, or perhaps it was the sound of the waves that lulled us into a deep and restful sleep.   We are looking forward to coming back to the Pacific Edge - no conventions - just to enjoy the hotel, which is more like a 'home away from home,' where you are attended by very competent, amiable and caring staff. Summary Heading: Awesome room, friendly staff, warm pool, gorgeous beach!

Everything was great, the front desk was very helpful, and when I needed more coffee cups they were delivered within minutes!  I also loved that this resort supports the local Pacific Marine Mammal Center, and has a cute sea lion stuffed animal in each room, and if you buy it the proceeds all go to the rescue center.  The pool was so fabulously warm -- so often a hotel says they have a heated pool, but it's barely warm.  This one was amazing!  The beach there is great, and it is all within walking distance of everything!  We loved our Christmas weekend there and are already planning a summer stay!

Manager Response: Valued Guests of Vacation Village Hotel:  I feel it is necessary to respond to the number of negative reviews that have been posted on the internet blogs in reference to our hotel. Yes, the ownership did change hands in June of 2006, from a family run 2 ¬Ω -star hotel to a private ownership, who hired a professional management company to run the operations. We value our long-term repeat guests at Vacation Village and hope to keep you as our guests in the future as we continue to improve the property, guest rooms, service, and amenities.  Vacation Village prior to the change in ownership had not raised rates in over 5 years, even though demand for hotels in Laguna increased over that same time period, and other comparable properties continued to raise their rates. There was a large amount of deferred maintenance and deep cleaning that needed to be completed. The d√©cor was outdated in all the rooms and the wear and tear in the rooms over the years was showing. The location was and still is what drives business to Laguna Beach, and the ‚Äòvalue‚Äô of the rooms, given their condition, made Vacation Village all that more attractive.   Parking is and will always be in demand in Laguna Beach. Vacation Village Hotel had never charged for parking overnight, however, 95% off all other properties in Laguna Beach do charge for parking. With demand growing and parking an issue, we felt it necessary to implement an overnight parking charge to remain competitive in the market.   Yes, the rates have increased since the new ownership took over last June; however, we are still priced under other comparable 2 ¬Ω-Star properties in Laguna Beach. I realize the rate increases seem dramatic to some of our past guests, however we are making improvements at the property daily. The ownership has invested over $260,000 in upgrades to the guest rooms since January 2007. Some of these recent upgrades include new Suite Plus Pillow-top mattresses in the Ocean Front rooms, new pillows throughout the hotel, new linens, towels, duvet covers, bed skirts, throw pillows, draperies, lighting, artwork, re-painting in all the guest rooms, shower curtains, shower heads, new mirrors in the bathrooms, and we have added the luxury brand RUSK bath amenities in our Ocean Front rooms. We will soon change to the RUSK amenities in all of our guest rooms. We have also purchased new balcony furniture for the Ocean Front rooms.  We have added numerous staff at our hotel as well, and have been providing on-going service training to them. We have also upgraded their benefits package, provided new uniforms, and implemented reward and incentive programs for outstanding service. New computers and printers to replace outdated equipment have been purchased so they can perform their job more efficiently and continue to provide our guests with outstanding service.   Our end goal is to provide our guests with a clean and well maintained guest room, an inviting, clean and well maintained property, and outstanding service at every point of contact.   We hope you will continue to choose Vacation Village Hotel as your vacation destination, and will be as excited as I am about the changes we have made, and are making at Vacation Village.   Warm Regards,  Kevin Johnson General Manager

Summary Heading: Oceanfront views at a high price
Summary: Vacation village has been a favorite for many CA and AZ families for many years. Nowhere else could you get ocean view rooms, with a private beach and walking distance to downtown Laguna Beach. All at an affordable price. The rooms are dated, appliances work, and onsite parking, and right on the beach. However, in May they changed ownership. The new owners seem to be very concerned about getting a return on their investment, room prices have gone up 15%. Also they instituted a $12.00 per day parking fee, without informing guests. I made my reservation on Tuesday 27th June for a two night stay in a premium oceanfront room ($$$) and was very specific about any extra fees, resort fees, parking fees, beach chair fees, and was told that the only extra charge would be a 12% room tax.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We almost booked this one online but I had an intuition to actually wait until we got there first.  I'm glad we did!  They showed us the available rooms and it was like a budget motel.  First of all the smell was unbearable - even my 6 year old asked what the weird smell was.  Also the rooms were very outdated, the beds flat and hard as a rock and I wouldn't trust the linens to be very clean.  The location was probably good but I would recommend staying at a fresh clean hotel and going to the beach each day by car or walking.  This place is a dive.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: dont' give them your visa number!
Summary: My family didn't even end up staying at Vacation Village after we found out they took $245 off our Visa before we even got there, and without any notice.
Manager Response: Vacation Village Hotel has a policy of a first night prepayment in order to secure a reservation. This is the protocol / standard for ALL hotels worldwide. This person made a reservation and gave us their visa, of course the deposit was taken at that time their reservation was made; prior to their arrival at the hotel.  This person stated they did not stay at Vacation Village. at the time they cancelled their reservation, they recieved a credit to their charge card.  Christine Haneline Vacation Village Hotel Laguna Beach

Summary: My cousin, her husband and two kids stayed here last summer. I visited them there and they were totally grossed out! They rooms were dirty, so was the bedding, and it smelled bad. They were so grossed out that they made their kids play on a small mat to avoid touching anything.  They were not allowed off of the mat because they thought everything else in the room would be too dirty. They were referred by a friend to go there and were totally horrified! However,there was a large deck out in the back of the hotel and the waves were close-by it was nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disappointed - maybe I didn't ask for the right room
Summary: I visited Vacation Village based upon a friend's recommendation and after checking the comments here at TripAdvisor.  My friend and her husband stayed in an oceanfront room (suite?) at Vacation Village just a month or so before I did.  Because I was going as a single, I decided to forego the "fancy" suite situation with the high price tag and opted for a less expensive one.  My room was located next to the Pacific Coast Highway with extensive traffic noise.  They were not able to find a different room for me when I asked unless I wanted to upgrade to the Suite level.  So, I stayed hoping to make the best of it.  Then came the scratchy towels and a broken phone so that I couldn't call for service.  It rained on one of the days I was there, so getting help would have meant a trek
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Vacation Village Rocks Laguna!! unbeatable location and price
Summary: Vacation Village is my childrens favorite. They enjoy the pools and the beach. It is walking distance to all of the food and the toy store. If you have a family with kids, why stay at the Montage anyhow, unless you have money to toss away! They have rooms with and without kitchens, we stay in the suite. in the summer there is a beach boy in the off season all I had to do is dial 0 and they brought me chairs. The carpet in my room was fine, brand new, not filthy like the other trip advisor comments, those commentaries must be a plug for Holiday inn!!! If you want location at a unbeatable price, go to vacation village...If you want Montage or Holiday inn at a vacation Villge price, you are out of luck!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the Montage, but it's the same beach!
Summary: I'm from Irvine (7 miles from Laguna), but my friend from San Diegoo and I run away from our kids once a year.  September, 2004, we stayed here.  Everyone's right about it not being nice and new.  DEFINITELY not the Montage, but you can't beat the beach access.  Nice chairs and umbrellas.  We had to search for someone to help us get chairs, though.  We had no beach view from our room, but we did have a full fridge and a kitchenette...kinda handy.  Studio room with a very old bathroom and the carpet had seen much better days...we might stay here again just for the beach access and the proximity to our favorite place for margaritas; Javier's!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm from So. Cal and visit as often as possible.  We always stay at the Vacation Village when we bring our kids (we have 5) and it's great.  Adjoining rooms, 4 beds, kitchen, two bathrooms.  The rooms are very dated and the beds aren't very comfortable but it's alway clean.  The price is unbeatable, especially considering its beachfront!  Grocery store across the street and close to everything, we almost never use our rental car. If you are in Laguna for a special occasion, I'd definitely recommend the Inn at Laguna, we stay when we are in Laguna without kids.  Gorgeous, lush, very expensive but worth it for a romantic weekend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Average 5 trips a year to this hotel
Summary: Vacation Village is a small hotel.  The staff is friendly and efficient.  Once you park your car you can walk the entire village w/o moving it again.  The balconies of the Reef wing over look the Pacific Ocean.  Waves break right below you.    If you want opulence go down Pacific Coast HWY a few more miles. If you want location, basic amenities, ocean views and access for an affordable price, still, you want VV.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and staff,but really needs cleaning!!
Summary: We booked Vacation Village for a family get-away,and after arriving and seeing our rooms,we wanted to get as far away as possible!It's a shame to have such a wonderful location and staff and then ruin the whole experiance becouse the carpets and furniture are SO FILTHY!How the managment could ignore such a problem is beyond me!!You could stay across the street at the Holiday Inn and walk to the beach in a minute or two,thats what I will do in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was shocked when we saw our room.  It was dirty, depressing...I couldn't get out of there fast enough.  It felt very unsafe, poor lock, no deadbolt, broken fire alarm with ear splitting sound, weird guy in the next room.  No elevator to our room.  Loud refrigerator, dripping water in bathroom.  I RAN next door to the Holiday Inn and literally begged in tears to find space for us.  Their broom closet would have been better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checked out pronto the next morning so as not to loose deposit. Built in 1968; appears hasn't been remodeled since 1968. The basic king room was small; dirty, stained carpets, bathroom smelled of mold & mildew. Elevator had cat urine in it; heavily sprayed w/carpet cleaner to disguise odor. Couldn't get outta this dump fast enough!!! Only positives - ocean side & friendly staff. Checked in across the street @ the Holiday Inn Laguna Beach (wonderful place).
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Its not the Ritz its just a wonderful family atmosphere
Summary: I can't believe any of these bad reviews.  Look, Vacation Village isn't the Ritz, its just your basic family resort.  ITS the only hotel in Laguna that is affordable to your "average Joe".  ITS CLEAN, ITS ON THE OCEAN, caters to families with kids and is in the "heart" of the Laguna Village.  They have FREE air hockey, fuseball, and pig pong for the kids.  They've got great beach service that provides chairs, umbrellas, and towel service.  Our family has come every year for the past 15 years and we've only experienced nothing less than wonderful. If  want fancy pay your $500 fee at the Montage.
Manager Response: none
